title: Fact Check: Hunter Biden had no experience in Ukraine or in the energy sector when he joined...
text:

A: No. Hunter bidens previous career history does not include work for energy company's.

title: Fact Check: Donald Trump delivered the largest tax cuts in American history.
text:
Claim: Donald Trump delivered the largest tax cuts in American history.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Three tax bills have been larger than that of Donald Trump

Evidence:

Q: Did the 2017 tax bill deliver the largest tax cuts in American history?
A: This tax cut is the 8th largest as a percent of Gross Domestic Product (GDP) since 1918 and the 4th largest in inflation-adjusted dollars.. 

Q: Has there been larger tax bills than the 2017 tax bill?
A: Three tax bills have been larger: American Taxpayer Relief Act of 2012 (enacted in 2013); 
Tax Relief, Unemployment Insurance Reauthorization, and Job Creation Act of 2010 and
Economic Recovery Tax Act of 1981.

title: Fact Check: In Nigeria … in terms of revenue share, 20% goes to the local government.
text:
Claim: In Nigeria … in terms of revenue share, 20% goes to the local government.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: The answer and source shows that the claim is supported as the percentage to local government is the same.

Evidence:

Q: Kenya’s ex-prime minister Odinga mangles his numbers on government revenue share in Nigeria?
A: After months of an often fractious stalemate, in September 2020 Kenya’s senate hammered out a deal on how revenue would be shared  between the country’s two levels of government.

In August, at the height of the deadlock, former prime minister Odinga returned to a familiar talking point to argue for establishing a third tier of government.

Building on this in an interview with Citizen TV, Odinga, who is also an African Union envoy, said Kenya could solve the recurring battle over how to share revenue if it looked to Nigeria for lessons.

Nigeria, he said, had a local, state and federal system of government. “In terms of revenue share, 20% of the revenue goes to the local, 35% goes to the state and 45% goes to the federal governments ... and it works perfectly well,” Odinga said..

title: Fact Check: Biden has pledged to stop border wall construction and give amnesty and health c...
text:
Claim: Biden has pledged to stop border wall construction and give amnesty and health care to all illegal immigrants.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: This claim should have been split into two parts, as it is quite confusing. As for the first part, the label is supported as he did say that he would not build more of the wall. As for the 2nd part, it is more tricky, as he would allow health care access to immigrants, but it does not necessarily mean they'd get access to healthcare. Therefore, the claim is supproted

Evidence:

Q: When Joe Biden participated in an interview with the National Association of Black Journalists and the National Association of Hispanic Journalists, on August 6, 2020 did he say he would tear down the border wall, if he became president?
A: No, there will not be another foot of wall constructed on my administration...  I’m going to make sure that we have border protection, but it’s going to be based on making sure that we use high-tech capacity to deal with it and at the ports of entry.. 

Q: If Joe Biden became president, what is his intention regarding health care for illegal immigrants?
A: According to PolitiFact Fact Checker, a task force recommended that Biden extend Affordable Care Act coverage to immigrants illegally in the country who are protected from deportation under the Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals program and allowing additional immigrants illegally in the country to also buy health insurance, unsubsidized.
So the task force recommends allowing immigrants here illegally to get access to health care, including Affordable Care Act coverage. But being able to buy health insurance doesn’t amount to getting welfare.. 

Q: What is the common reference for amnesty in modern U.S. politics?
A: The Immigration Reform and Control Act of 1986, signed by President Ronald Reagan is the law which paved the way for immigrants who were in the country illegally to become lawful permanent residents if they met certain requirements..

title: Fact Check: After the police shooting of Jacob Blake, Gov. Tony Evers & Lt. Gov. Mandela Bar...
text:
Claim: After the police shooting of Jacob Blake, Gov. Tony Evers & Lt. Gov. Mandela Barnes did not call for peace or encourage calm.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Governor Evers did call for peace in a video statement on planned protests. 

Evidence:

Q: Did Governor Evers not call for peace after Jacob Blake was shot ?
A: Inn a video statement posted the next day, Evers urged people planning to protest to  peacefully.
In a news release later that day, Evers said "Tonight, and in the days ahead, if you are going to protest, please do so peacefully and safely. Please do not allow the actions of a few distract us from the work we must do together to demand justice, equity, and accountability." 
This proves that the claim made by Senator Howard Marklein is incorrect that the Gov. did not ask for peace..

title: Fact Check: The Common Law Admission Test (CLAT) 2020 will not be conducted on September 7, ...
text:
Claim: The Common Law Admission Test (CLAT) 2020 will not be conducted on September 7, 2020, as planned

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The answer and credible source show that the claim was a hoax and so the claim is refuted.

Evidence:

Q: Was the The Common Law Admission Test (CLAT) 2020 postponed?
A: No it was a fake notification and an official announcement was made saying:

"Sub: Fake Notification Regarding Postponement of the CLAT 2020 Examination
1. It has come to the attention of the Consortium of National Universities (the
“Consortium”) that a document purporting to be a Notification issued by the
Consortium and announcing the postponement of the CLAT 2020 from its scheduled
date of September 7, 2020 is being circulated on the internet (the “Fake
Notification”).
2. The Consortium hereby categorically states that the Fake Notification has not been
issued by the Consortium. The date of the CLAT 2020 examination, and all other
particulars, in relation to the CLAT 2020 examination remain unaltered.
3. Official Notifications from the Consortium are available at
https://consortiumofnlus.ac.in/
4. You may confirm or clarify any information by writing to
clat@consortiumofnlus.ac.in".

title: Fact Check: 35% of revenue goes to states. (In Nigeria)
text:
Claim: 35% of revenue goes to states. (In Nigeria)

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The answer shows that 26.72% goes to states so the claim is refuted.

Evidence:

Q: What percentage of Nigeria's revenue goes to states
A: Revenue is shared in accordance with the vertical formula, as determined by RMAFC and approved by the National Assembly. The formula allocates 52.68%, 26.72% and 20.60% to the Federal, State and Local Governments respectively.

title: Fact Check: Margaret Sanger was a racist who believed in eugenics. Her goal when founding Pl...
text:
Claim: Margaret Sanger was a racist who believed in eugenics. Her goal when founding Planned Parenthood was to eradicate minorities.

Verdict: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

Justification: Evidence is conflicting with Margaret Sanger, as she was a progressive who believed in racial integration. She voted for Norman Thomas. She worked with progressive Black people—W.E.B. Du Bois, for example, who, along with Mary McCleod Bethune and Adam Clayton Powell Sr., served on the board of the Negro Project, a network of birth control and maternal health clinics Sanger established in Harlem and the South, etc. However, it does seem that Sanger believed in eugenics and thought people, especially poor people, often had too many kids to care for properly and that too many of those kids were born physically disabled (or, in the language of the day, "feeble-minded"). She did not oppose forced sterilization.

Evidence:

Q: What is eugenics?
A: Eugenics is the practice or advocacy of improving the human species by selectively mating people with specific desirable hereditary traits. It aims to reduce human suffering by “breeding out” disease, disabilities and so-called undesirable characteristics from the human population. 

Q: What were Sangers views on eugenics?
A: I think the greatest sin in the world is bringing children into the world -- that have disease from their parents, that have no chance in the world to be a human being practically. Delinquents, prisoners, all sorts of things just marked when they're born. That to me is the greatest sin -- that people can -- can commit. 

Q: Was Sanger a racist?
A: As her biographer Ellen Chesler told me, she was a progressive who believed in racial integration. She voted for Norman Thomas. She worked with progressive Black people—W.E.B. Du Bois, for example, who along with Mary McCleod Bethune and Adam Clayton Powell Sr. served on the board of the Negro Project, a network of birth control and maternal health clinics Sanger established in Harlem and the South. In 1966, Martin Luther King accepted Planned Parenthood’s first Margaret Sanger Award, and in his statement offered a vigorous endorsement of voluntary birth control..

title: Fact Check: Joe Biden voted for the Iraq War and he supported wars in Serbia, Syria, and Lib...
text:
Claim: Joe Biden voted for the Iraq War and he supported wars in Serbia, Syria, and Libya.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: Q&A's 1, 3, 5 and 6 show that Yes as claimed Joe Biden did vote for wars in Iraq, Serbia, Syria, and Libya.

Evidence:

Q: Did Joe Biden vote for the Iraq War?
A: Yes. When Joe Biden was a U.S. Senator, he voted in favor of a resolution on Iraq in October 2022.

Q: Did Joe Biden regret his vote for the Iraq War?
A: Yes. In a November 2005 interview on NBC’s "Meet the Press," Biden was asked if his 2002 vote was a mistake.

"It was a mistake," Biden said. "It was a mistake to assume the president would use the authority we gave him properly. … We gave the president the authority to unite the world to isolate Saddam. And the fact of the matter is, we went too soon. We went without sufficient force. And we went without a plan."

Q: Did Joe Biden support war in Serbia?
A: Yes. Joe Biden voted for a 1999 concurrent resolution.

title: Fact Check: In 2019 the US Police were 20.8 times more likely to kill than be killed by a cr...
text:
Claim: In 2019 the US Police were 20.8 times more likely to kill than be killed by a criminal

Verdict: Supported

Justification: True, FBI statistics and a national database show that checks out: In 2019, police killed 999 people, and 48 officers were killed by a criminal act in the line of duty.
We rate Larson’s claim True. 

Evidence:

Q: How many law enforcement officers died in the line of duty during 2019?
A: According to statistics reported to the FBI, 89 law enforcement officers were killed in line-of-duty incidents in 2019. Of these, 48 officers died as a result of felonious acts, and 41 officers died in accidents. Comprehensive data tables about these incidents and brief narratives describing the fatal attacks are included in Law Enforcement Officers Killed and Assaulted, 2019, released today.. 

Q: In 2019, how many people were shot and killed by police?
A: In 2019, 999 people were shot and killed by police.. 

Q: What is 999 divided by 48?
A: 20.8125..

title: Fact Check: A greater proportion of 16 year olds vote in elections in Scotland, Wales and Au...
text:
Claim: A greater proportion of 16 year olds vote in elections in Scotland, Wales and Austria than 18 and 20 year olds.

Verdict: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

Justification: Only QA 2 confirms the rate of voting was higher for 16-17 year olds in Scotland.
QA 1 says 16-17 year olds in Austria vote more than older first time voters without stating what age the ‘older’ voters are.
QA 3 implies 16-17 year olds in Wales could not vote at the time the claim was made, therefore the claim could not be true for Wales.

Evidence:

Q: In Austria, what is the turnout rate of 16 and 17-year-olds to elections
A: Even though 16- to 17-year-olds exhibit somewhat lower  general  interest  in  politics  and  lower  internal  efficacy,  turnout  is  generally  higher compared to older first-time voters and similar to the electorate’s average, they follow electoral campaigns to the same extent as do other young voters, and  they  exhibit  considerably  high levels of external efficacy and satisfaction with democracy. 

Q: In Scotland in 2017, what percentage of 16 to 17-year-olds voted compared to the 18-24-year-olds
A: 51 per cent of 16- and 17- year-olds claim to have voted, compared with 39 per cent of those aged 18 to 24. 

Q: In Wales, what is the turnout rate of 16 and 17-year-olds to elections?
A: 16 and 17 year olds will be able to vote for the first time at the Senedd Elections in 2021, as part of the biggest changes to the democratic process in Wales in half a century..

A: “This is a key legacy project by the Gov. Godwin Obaseki-led administration to recalibrate the state’s industrial base, birthed through a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU).

“The project, sited at Ologbo in Ikpoba Okha Local Government Area, would produce from its feedstock 50 per cent of diesel (500,000 litres), 25 per cent of naphtha (300,000 litres) and 20 per cent of fuel oil (200,000) litres.

“The crude is to be sourced from the Nigerian Petroleum Development Company’s (NPDC) facility – oil mining lease (OML) 111, near Benin City.. 

Q: Who owns the refinery?
A: The refinery, Edo Refinery and Petrochemical Limited is “fully owned and developed” by AIPCC Energy Limited.

“It is located in Ologbo, Ikpoba Okha LGA of Edo State. The project is executed in two trains of 1,000BPSD; and 5,000BPSD, and will be fully operational by September 2020.”

Speaking on the role of the Edo state government on the project, Frans Ojielu, Global Advisor, Edo Refinery and Petrochemical Limited, said the company “is a beneficiary of the Edo state government policy of attracting investments to the state..

title: Fact Check: Anxiety levels among young teenagers dropped during the coronavirus pandemic, a ...
text:
Claim: Anxiety levels among young teenagers dropped during the coronavirus pandemic, a study has suggested

Verdict: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

Justification: One study shows anxiety dropping amongst young teenagers, but another study shows it depends on age and whether child will be receiving exam results.

Evidence:

Q: What study is this based on?
A: The study was based on a survey of around 1,000 year 9 students in the south west of England. It found that students reported lower levels of anxiety when surveyed in April and May of this year compared to October 2019. 

It also found an increase in wellbeing but “no large change in risk of depression.”. 

Q: Is this study backed up by further research?
A: There’s nothing wrong with this study in terms of its method or what it claims, but it shouldn’t necessarily be taken to represent the experience of all children across the country. 

It can’t rule out the possibility that the mental toll of the pandemic may have been different across different parts of the country, and for people of different ages. 

For example, a study out of the University of Oxford, asked parents and carers to report any changes in behavior of their children during a one-month period in lockdown. It found that while parents and carers reported that the emotional difficulties of adolescents decreased, the emotional difficulties of children aged four to ten increased. 

Also a potential contributor to feelings of anxiety among students during the pandemic has been the uncertainty over exam results, which would have primarily affected students in years 11 and 13, not year 9 (as the study itself notes)..

Further questions are required.

Q: Did Joe Biden refuse to raise taxes on people making less than $400,000 ?
A: There is broad agreement among the five tax models that Biden’s tax increase would fall almost entirely on the very wealthy. For technical reasons, the corporate tax increase is deemed to filter through to almost all income groups, giving the Republicans an opening to misleadingly claim that Biden is raising taxes on most Americans. Those numbers may change in Biden’s favor as updated analyses are completed of all of Biden’s tax proposals.We will leave this unrated. We are not in the habit of giving check marks for campaign promises..

title: Fact Check: Only 31% of South African drink alcohol

Evidence:

Q: Are South Africans heavy drinkers?
A: Overall, approximately 62,300 (95% UI 27,000–103,000) adults died from alcohol-attributable causes in South Africa in 2015, with 60% of deaths occurring in people in the low and 15% in the high SES groups. Age-standardized, alcohol-attributable mortality rates per 100,000 adults were highest for the low SES group (727 deaths, 95% UI 354–1208 deaths) followed by the middle (377 deaths, 95% UI 165–687 deaths) and high SES groups (163 deaths, 95% UI 71–289 deaths). The socioeconomic differences were highest for mortality from infectious diseases..

A: No answer could be found..

title: Fact Check: The interface of the COVID-19 Exposure Notification System, a contact tracing pr...
text:
Claim: The interface of the COVID-19 Exposure Notification System, a contact tracing programme developed by Apple and Google has been secretly inserted onto phones and tracks user’s location.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: It's clear from the Q&A that this claim is not true and has been backed up by statements.

Evidence:

Q: Does the Covid-19 Exposure notification system track users locations?
A: Google explicitly states that Exposure Notification “does not collect or use the location from your device. It uses Bluetooth, which can be used to detect if two devices are near each other — without revealing where the devices are.”

Google adds that “neither Google, Apple, nor other users can see your identity” and that the “technology only works if you decide to opt-in.”.

Q: Is there any requirement that public officials swear in on the Bible, or any other religious book?
A: No. There is no requirement that public officials swear in on the Bible, or any other religious book, per the U.S. Constitution’s Article VI, Clause 3.

title: Fact Check: Democratic VP candidate Kamala Harris called young voters stupid.

title: Fact Check: Children are silent super-spreaders of coronavirus.
text:
Claim: Children are silent super-spreaders of coronavirus.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: children aren't any more super-spreaders than adults. 

Evidence:

Q: What evidence is there to prove that children are super-spreaders of coronavirus
A: Prof Adilia Warris, Professor of Paediatric Infectious Diseases at the University of Exeter, said, “The data presented here does not support the claim that children are silent spreaders of COVID-19.

“The authors do show that children who presented with respiratory symptoms during this pandemic, and who tested positive for SARS-CoV-2, displayed viral loads comparable to adult hospitalized patients, especially in the first two days of symptoms.  Interestingly, of the children presenting with symptoms, only around 28 per cent of children tested positive,  and of these, more than 60 per cent were over the age of 11, 26 per cent were obese (with less than 10 per cent in the non SARS-CoV-2 group), and exposure to the virus was by either mum or dad (77 per cent), supporting a larger role for adults in the transmission of this virus.. 

Q: Are kids able to spread the coronavirus
A: Kids are a possible source of spreading this virus said Alessio Fasano, MD
Director, Mucosal Immunology and Biology Research Center
Massachusetts General Hospital. 

Q: What have experts said about this claim and the study its based on?
A: Dr Simon Clarke, Associate Professor in Cellular Microbiology at the University of Reading, said:

It does not demonstrate, in any way, that children actually spread of the virus to adults or other children.”.

Q: How do you receive Social Security checks in the U.S.?
A: There are two ways you can receive your benefits:

Into an existing bank account via Direct Deposit or
Onto a Direct Express® Debit Mastercard®.

title: Fact Check: US billionaires became $400 billion richer during the COVID-19 pandemic, while m...
text:
Claim: US billionaires became $400 billion richer during the COVID-19 pandemic, while millions lost their $600 a week in extra unemployment.

Verdict: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

Justification: From the evidence, it looks as though 50 top billionaires lost $232 billion between the market’s peak and this Tuesday; there is no mention of them becoming richer. However, nearly 30 million workers did lose $600 in enhanced weekly unemployment benefits.

Evidence:

Q: Did billionaires get richer or poorer during the pandemic?
A: Cumulatively, the top 50 billionaires lost $232 billion between the market’s peak and this Tuesday. If the remaining billionaires on the Forbes list lost wealth at the same roughly 12.5% rate that the top 50 experienced, that’s another $200 billion–plus wiped out.. 

Q: How many people lost their $600 a week in enhanced unemployment benefits?
A: Nearly 30 million workers have lost $600 in enhanced weekly unemployment benefits.

title: Fact Check: Messages in Google Earth show the "Deep States New Home," which shows up on the ...
text:
Claim: Messages in Google Earth show the "Deep States New Home," which shows up on the map as "Setatspeed Emohwen Gardens" near Guantanamo Bay, Cuba.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: QAs provide evidence that names of the 2 ‘Deep state’ locations were searched for and no evidence found of their existence; also that a real location - Guantanamo Bay - does show up as expected on Google Earth.

Evidence:

Q: Does A search on Google Earth show any results for Deepstates New Home?
A: A search on Google Earth does not show results for Deepstates New Home. 

Q: Does a search on Google Earth show results for Emohwen Setatspeed gardens?
A: A search on Google Earth does not show results for Emohwen Setatspeed gardens.. 

Q: Does a search on google earth show any results for Guantanamo Bay, Cuba.?
A: Yes. Guantánamo Bay is a bay in Guantánamo Province at the southeastern end of Cuba

title: Fact Check: USA is the only major industrial economy to have it unemployment rate triple.
text:
Claim: USA is the only major industrial economy to have it unemployment rate triple.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: The figures show that the rate did roughy triple and that only Canada came close. So the claim is true.

Evidence:

Q: What was the rate of unemployment before the pandemic in the US
A: 3.6%. 

Q: What was the rate of unemployment during and after the pandemic
A: 11.1%. 

Q: Did any industrial economy surpass the US in their unemployment rate
A: Only Canada came close.

title: Fact Check: Donald Trump is trying to take away the health care by getting rid of the Afford...
text:
Claim: Donald Trump is trying to take away the health care by getting rid of the Affordable Care Act.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: The answers and sources show that Trump was trying to get rid of the ACA so the claim is supported.

Evidence:

Q: What is the affordable care act?
A: The Affordable Care Act (ACA)will provide one of the largest expansions of mental health and substance use disorder coverage in a generation. Beginning in 2014 under the law, all new small group and individual market plans will be required to cover ten Essential Health Benefit categories. 

Q: Did Donald Trump While President of the U.S want to get rid of the ACA Law?
A: Yes. The claim refers to  a court case pending before the Supreme Court in which the Trump has joined a group of Republican governors in an effort to overturn the Affordable Care Act

title: Fact Check: Mughal Gardens Renamed To Dr. Rajendra Prasad Garden
text:
Claim: Mughal Gardens Renamed To Dr. Rajendra Prasad Garden

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: On the official Mughal gardens website, it is the same name 

Evidence:

Q: What are the Mughal gardens?
A: The Mughal gardens are the few number of gardens built by the Mughals in the Islamic style of architecture in India as well as other countries. Most famous Mughal Gardens of India are the garden of Taj Mahal, the Red Fort garden in Delhi, Agra Fort and Humayun’s Tomb Garden. Other Mughal gardens are Tomb of Safdarjung,Mehtab Bagh,Roshanara Bagh,Khusro Bagh and Ram Bagh.. 

Q: Why is there discussion surrounding renaming the Mughal gardens?
A: New Delhi, Dec 3 (IANS) The Hindu Mahasabha has demanded a change of name and this time around, it wants the iconic Mughal Garden that falls under the President''s Estate, to be renamed as Rajendra Prasad Udyan.

The outfit''s President Swami Chakrapani has said that he intends to meet the Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Home Minister Amit Shah to persuade them for the same.

Speaking to IANS, Chakrapani said: "We all know the mayhem the Mughals created when they ruled. In today''s day and age to have a garden, that too inside the Rashtrapati Bhawan, named after Mughals is unacceptable. That''s why I have proposed to name it after the first President Dr Rajendra Prasad.". 

Q: Have the Mughal Gardens been officially renamed to the Dr. Rajendra Prasad Garden?
A: On the official site of the President of India, the Mughal Gardens are still named the Mughal Gardens. There has been no change..

title: Fact Check: Trumps January 2018 travel ban was unlawful.
text:
Claim: Trumps January 2018 travel ban was unlawful.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Q&A 2 states the actuall law that made it legal for trump to issue a travel ban (§1182(f) to suspend the entry of aliens into the United States. Pp. 9–24.) thus refuting the claim the ban was unlawful.

Evidence:

Q: Under what law can Trump enforce a travel ban
A: It thus vests the President with “ample power” to 
impose entry restrictions in addition to those elsewhere enumerated
in the INA. Sale, 509 U. S., at 187. The Proclamation falls well within this comprehensive delegation. The sole prerequisite set forth in
§1182(f) is that the President “find[ ]” that the entry of the covered aliens “would be detrimental to the interests of the United States.”. 

Q: Was President Trump's January 2018 travel ban lawful?
A: Yes. The President has lawfully exercised the broad discretion granted to him under §1182(f) to suspend the entry of aliens into the United States. Pp. 9–24.

Q: Why was a travel ban placed on these countries?
A: The Proclamation placed entry restrictions
on the nationals of eight foreign states whose systems for managing
and sharing information about their nationals the President deemed
inadequate. Foreign states were selected for inclusion based on a review undertaken pursuant to one of the President’s earlier Executive
Orders. As part of that review, the Department of Homeland Security (DHS), in consultation with the State Department and intelligence
agencies, developed an information and risk assessment “baseline.”
DHS then collected and evaluated data for all foreign governments,
identifying those having deficient information-sharing practices and
presenting national security concerns, as well as other countries “at
risk” of failing to meet the baseline..

title: Fact Check: Raising the US federally required minimum wage to $15 an hour would give 40 mill...
text:
Claim: Raising the US federally required minimum wage to $15 an hour would give 40 million workers a pay raise and push the wage scale up for everyone else.

Verdict: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

Justification: Although millions of workers would receive a pay rise - it would be an estimated A total of 39.7 million workers would benefit. Also a contradiction of "boost the wages of
17 million workers who would otherwise earn less than $15 per hour. 
The wages of many of the 10 million workers
whose wages would be slightly above the new federal minimum would also increase". 

Evidence:

Q: What is the Economic Policy Institute (EPI) in the US?
A: The EPI is an independent, nonprofit think tank that researches the impact of economic trends and policies on working people in the United States.. 

Q: How did the US Economic  Policy Institute analyze the impact of raising the US federal minimum wage to $15 by 2025?
A: A total of 39.7 million workers would benefit, including:

38.6 million adults ages 18 and older
23.8 million full-time workers
23.0 million women
11.2 million parents
5.4 million single parents
The parents of 14.4 million children. 

Q: What is a US Congressional Budget Office (CBO) report?
A: This Congressional Budget Office report was prepared in response to interest expressed by a
number of Members of Congress. In keeping with CBO’s mandate to provide objective, impartial
analysis, the report contains no recommendations..

title: Fact Check: Drinking vodka protects an individual against COVID-19.
text:
Claim: Drinking vodka protects an individual against COVID-19.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Alcohol makes you more likely to get infected.

Evidence:

Q: Does drinking Vodka protect you from viral infections?
A: Alcohol in the body at the time of exposure to a pathogen tends to impair the body’s immediate immune response to the pathogen, making it easier for an infection to develop..

title: Fact Check: BJP MP and former Union Minister Alphons Kannanthanam  sent his mother's dead bo...
text:
Claim: BJP MP and former Union Minister Alphons Kannanthanam  sent his mother's dead body from Delhi to Kerala for the funeral without revealing she died of Covid-19.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The Rajya Sabha MP’s mother did not die due to Covid-19

Evidence:

Q: Did BJP MP and former Union Minister Alphons Kannanthanam send his mother's dead body from Delhi to Kerala for the funeral without revealing she died of Covid-19?
A: The Rajya Sabha MP’s mother did not die due to Covid-19. She was tested negative twice for Covid-19 before her demise at AIIMS, Delhi, due to internal organ damage..

title: Fact Check: Drinking traditional Chinese medicine (TCM) or steroids, along with antibiotics ...
text:
Claim: Drinking traditional Chinese medicine (TCM) or steroids, along with antibiotics at the onset of symptoms cures COVID-19.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Disproved by scientists..

Evidence:

Q: Can traditional Chinese medicine cure Covid-19?
A: No. Scientists around the world are working to find and develop treatments for COVID-19. Home remedies do not cure Covid-19.

Q: Can steroids cure Covid-19?
A: Dexamethasone is a corticosteroid that can help reduce the length of time on a ventilator and save lives of patients with severe and critical illness. Steroids can help treat the symptoms of Covid-19 but they do not cure it.. 

Q: Can Anti-biotics cure Covid-19?
A: Antibiotics do not work against viruses; they only work on bacterial infections. COVID-19 is caused by a virus, so antibiotics do not work. Antibiotics should not be used as a means of prevention or treatment of COVID-19.

In hospitals, physicians will sometimes use antibiotics to prevent or treat secondary bacterial infections which can be a complication of COVID-19 in severely ill patients. They should only be used as directed by a physician to treat a bacterial infection..

title: Fact Check: The Sarang Jeil Church of Jesus took preventative measure against coronavirus bu...
text:
Claim: The Sarang Jeil Church of Jesus took preventative measure against coronavirus but the government spread the virus to prevent Rev. Jeon Kwang-hun attending the anti-government demonstration on August 15th.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: It seems from  rhe 2nd QA that no measures were taken. Therefore the claim  is refuted 

Evidence:

Q: What happened which caused the COVID-19 outbreak?
A: This new burst of patients has been linked to conservative pastor Rev. Jeon Kwang-hun’s Sarang Jeil Church (SJC) after one member was tested positive for the coronavirus on Aug. 12. Three days later the SJC members took part in a mass anti-government demonstration – despite being told by health officials to self-isolate.

More than 30,000 people participated in the protests on Aug. 15, Korea’s Independence Day, to demand that President Moon Jae-In step down. At the rally, the Rev. Jeon expressed doubt regarding the government’s response to the virus in religious communities and suggested there was a government plot to purposefully spread the virus.. 

Q: Did the church take preventative measures to limit the spread of COVID-19?
A: According to media reports, the SJC has not followed government-issued outlines for sermons. The list of churchgoers submitted by the church for case-tracking purposes was found to be faulty, and Rev. Jeon was caught on a video speaking and walking around without a mask.

The city of Seoul filed a lawsuit against the church for violation of disease prevention laws and obstructing quarantine procedures.

Jeon, whose church is not officially recognized, tested positive for the coronavirus two days after the protests. Against regulations, he had taken off his mask on his way to the hospital..

title: Fact Check: In 2016, 33 million Americans voted by mail.
text:
Claim: In 2016, 33 million Americans voted by mail.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: The answer and source show that there were 33 million absentee and mail in ballots in 2016 so the claim is supported.

Evidence:

Q: What was the total  number of votes by mail during the 2016 election
A: Numerically, absentee/mail-in ballots made up roughly 33 million of the 140 million ballots counted in the 2016 general election.

title: Fact Check: In Michigan, US one of the three key states that enabled Donald Trump to win the...
text:
Claim: In Michigan, US one of the three key states that enabled Donald Trump to win the presidential election in 2016, the winning margin averaged out to just over two votes per precinct.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: The fifth answer and source show that the votes per precinct is 2.23 so the claim is supported.

Evidence:

Q: How many voting precincts does Michigan in the U.S have?
A: 4,810. 

Q: How many votes did Donald Trump get in the 2016 U.S election in Michigan?
A: 2,279,543. 

Q: How many votes did Trumps opponent receive in Michigan?
A: Hillary Clinton, with 2,268,839 votes..

title: Fact Check: The Trump administration disbanded the pandemic response team that was given to ...
text:
Claim: The Trump administration disbanded the pandemic response team that was given to them.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: The source shows he left and was not replaced, so the claim stands up. 

Evidence:

Q: Did the trump administration disband the pandemic response team?
A: The top White House official responsible for leading the U.S. response in the event of a deadly pandemic has left the administration, and the global health security team he oversaw has been disbanded under a reorganization by national security adviser John Bolton.

The abrupt departure of Rear Adm. Timothy Ziemer from the National Security Council means no senior administration official is now focused solely on global health security. Ziemer’s departure, along with the breakup of his team, comes at a time when many experts say the country is already underprepared for the increasing risks of a pandemic or bioterrorism attack..

title: Fact Check: Auto workers across Michigan could have lost their jobs if not for Barack Obama ...
text:
Claim: Auto workers across Michigan could have lost their jobs if not for Barack Obama and Joe Biden

Verdict: Supported

Justification: From the 2nd QA it seems that the Obama administration indeed helped the autoworkers, therefore the claim is supported

Evidence:

Q: How did the Obama administration save the jobs of autoworkers according to  the claim?
A: The federal bailout of General Motors Co, Chrysler and parts suppliers in 2009 saved 1.5 million U.S. jobs and preserved $105.3 billion in personal and social insurance tax collections, according to a study released on Monday.

The Bush and Obama administrations loaned the auto industry, including GM and Chrysler, which is now controlled by Italy’s Fiat, $80 billion to avoid the collapse of the industry that they felt would result in the loss of millions of U.S. jobs.. 

Q: What does experts and the public think about the effect of this bail-out on saving Auto jobs in the US?
A: The Center for Automotive Research (CAR) in Ann Arbor, Michigan, estimated in its study that the bailout saved a lot of jobs, even crediting for a rebound of the industry in 2010 after the initial fallout..

title: Fact Check: Vice President Biden and President Obama assembled a pandemic playbook to make s...
text:
Claim: Vice President Biden and President Obama assembled a pandemic playbook to make sure that America was prepared and protected.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: Evidence finds that the Obama administration did prepare a document called the Playbook for Early Response to High-Consequence Emerging Infectious Disease Threats and Biological Incidents. 

Evidence:

Q: Did president Obama's administration make any preparations for a possible pandemic disease?
A: In 2016 the National Security Council prepared a document called the Playbook for Early Response to High-Consequence Emerging Infectious Disease Threats and Biological Incidents..

title: Fact Check: Nigeria is the largest producer of rice in Africa, ranking 14th in the world.
text:
Claim: Nigeria is the largest producer of rice in Africa, ranking 14th in the world.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: Confirmed via list provided as source for question 3.

Evidence:

Q: How much rice does Nigeria produce?
A: 7,937 - (1000 mt). 

Q: Is there an official source of  the figures for rice production in all countries?
A: Yes. It is listed on the United states department of Agriculture.

Q: Who is 14th on the US Department of Agricultures data table?
A: Nigeria are 14th on the list..

title: Fact Check: There are many scientific studies saying masks should be worn only in enclosed s...
text:
Claim: There are many scientific studies saying masks should be worn only in enclosed spaces, such as in elevators and conference rooms, and not outdoors

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Masks are meant to be worn in both enclosed and outdoor spaces as well as public gatherings 

Evidence:

Q: Should masks be worn in outside and indoor spaces to prevent the spread of covid?
A: These include public settings such as grocery stores, at work, social or mass gatherings, closed areas (like schools, churches or mosques), public transportation, and other areas where there is high transmission of the virus, or where at least two meters physical distancing is not possible.. 

Q: Are there studies that state that mask wearing should only be used indoors?
A: No answer could be found..

title: Fact Check: In the US, envelopes used for mail-in ballots in general elections reveal the pa...
text:
Claim: In the US, envelopes used for mail-in ballots in general elections reveal the party affiliation of the voter allowing postal workers to toss votes.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The envelopes do not reveal party affiliations 

Evidence:

Q: Do ballot envelopes in general elections, show who the voter voted for?
A: No. In a general election, ballot envelopes in Florida do not reveal party affiliation, an election official told us. Voting experts told us they aren’t aware of any jurisdiction using such labels in general elections, nor would there be a reason to do so.

Q: When are indications shown on the envelope?
A: The office of the supervisor of elections for Palm Beach County, Florida — where the envelopes in the Facebook posts were sent — confirmed that in a statement to FactCheck.org. In a closed primary, “voters are sent ballots according to their precinct and their party affiliation. The ballots in that video are primary ballots.” The alphanumeric codes on the envelopes shown in the video are used to direct the ballots for counting..

title: Fact Check: In one of the states that determined the outcome" of the 2016 presidential race,...
text:
Claim: In one of the states that determined the outcome" of the 2016 presidential race, "the winning margin averaged out to just two votes per precinct — two votes.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: This claim is supported. According to the QA pair, Michelle Obama stated that the winning margin averaged out to just two votes per precinct. Therefore, this claim is supported.

Evidence:

Q: how many votes per precinct determined the outcome of the 2016 presidential race
A: Michelle Obama in her speech said "In one of the states that determined the outcome, the winning margin averaged out to just two votes per precinct—two votes"..

title: Fact Check: A sharp decline recently in novel coronavirus cases in New York was down to Gov....
text:
Claim: A sharp decline recently in novel coronavirus cases in New York was down to Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo handling of the situation.

Verdict: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

Justification: The evidence supports the decline of coronavirus cases, but blames Gov. Andrew M Como for increasing the number of confirmed cases.

Evidence:

Q: Did Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo delay the shelter-in-place order for New York?
A: Yes. which led to "the number of confirmed cases at 15,000 doubling every three or four days"

Q: Has Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo been criticized on how he has handled the pandemic?
A: Yes. Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo has been criticized for the deaths of 6,200 N.Y. nursing homes as state directive sent thousands of COVID-19 patients into nursing homes.

Q: Has there been a decline in New York cases?
A: Yes. There has been a sharp decline of novel coronavirus cases in New York recently.

title: Fact Check: President Donald Trump threatened to delay the election and suggested that he wi...
text:
Claim: President Donald Trump threatened to delay the election and suggested that he will not leave office if he loses.

Verdict: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

Justification: QA pair confirms he suggested delaying the election in a tweet dated July 30th but in another QA pair he is quoted as saying he never even thought of that and why would he want to delay the election.

It is mentioned in QA pairs he "joked" about staying in office longer than the maximum 2 terms but QA pairs do not make reference to him saying he wont leave if he loses the election.




Evidence:

Q: Did Trump want to delay the election in 2020?
A: "With Universal Mail-In Voting (not Absentee Voting, which is good), 2020 will be the most INACCURATE & FRAUDULENT Election in history. It will be a great embarrassment to the USA. Delay the Election until people can properly, securely and safely vote???" he tweeted July 30.. 

Q: Did Trump threaten to not leave office?
A: Trump’s certainty that he simply cannot lose could have a real impact on this year’s election. Since assuming office in January 2017, Trump has made at least 27 references to staying in office beyond the constitutional limit of two terms. He often follows up with a remark indicating he is “joking,” “kidding,” or saying it to drive the “fake” news media “crazy.” Even if Trump thinks that he’s only “joking,” the comments fit a broader pattern that raises the prospect that Trump may not leave office quietly in the event he’s on the losing end of a very close election. And unfortunately this possibility is only one of a number of potential election meltdowns we may face in November.. 

Q: Who has the power to decide when elections hold
A: Constitution empowers Congress to set the date by which states must choose their presidential electors, according to a March report by the nonpartisan Congressional Research Service..

title: Fact Check: Social Security beneficiaries count on the post office to get their checks
text:
Claim: Social Security beneficiaries count on the post office to get their checks

Verdict: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

Justification: Evidence contains a lot of repeated questions and answers. Regardless, Q&As reveal that some people are still paid by paper cheques; however, many people are paid by direct deposit. Hence, not everyone counts on the post office to get their checks.

Evidence:

Q: How is Social Security paid in the USA?
A: Social Security is paid via paper cheques and direct deposits.. 

Q: How many people are paid social security via Paper Cheque?
A: 557,840. 

Q: How many people are paid social security via direct deposit?
A: 63,668,789.

title: Fact Check: Social Security beneficiaries count on the post office to get their checks.
text:
Claim: Social Security beneficiaries count on the post office to get their checks.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: In 2019 and 2020 99.1% of US Social Security beneficiaries got direct deposits.

Evidence:

Q: Are the Social Security beneficiaries count on the post office to get their checks?
A: Doing the math, there are about 555,000 Americans who still get Social Security checks by mail and about 215,000 who get Supplemental Security Income (SSI) checks by mail. That compares with 61.5 million who receive direct deposit either to the bank or a debit card.

Of course, you still need to rely on the mail to get the debit card. Social Security notices also come through the mail, unless a person opts out. But relatively few people still get checks.. 

Q: Are there US Social Security beneficiaries who count on the post office to get their checks?
A: Yes. In 2019 and 2020 99.1% of US Social Security beneficiaries got direct deposits.
Some beneficiaries still depend on the Post Office.

title: Fact Check: Vice President Biden and President Obama assembled a pandemic playbook to make s...
text:
Claim: Vice President Biden and President Obama assembled a pandemic playbook to make sure that America was prepared and protected. The Trump administration disbanded the pandemic response team that was given to them.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: It seems from the 3rd QA that the group was indeed disbanded therefore the claim is supported 

Evidence:

Q: Did Vice President Biden and President Obama assemble a pandemic playbook to make sure that America was prepared and protected?
A: Yes. Through the Obama administration, the NSC devised the guide — officially called the Playbook for Early Response to High-Consequence Emerging Infectious Disease Threats and Biological Incidents, but known colloquially as "the pandemic playbook" — across 2016. The project was driven by career civil servants as well as political appointees, aware that global leaders had initially fumbled their response to the 2014–2015 spread of Ebola and wanting to be sure that the next response to an epidemic was better handled.

Q: Did President Donald Trump utilize the pandemic playbook?
A: No. The Trump administration was briefed on the playbook’s existence in 2017, said four former officials, but two cautioned that it never went through a full, National Security Council-led interagency process to be approved as Trump administration strategy.

Q: Did President Donald Trump disband the pandemic response team that was given to him?
A: Yes. The document rested with NSC officials who dealt with medical preparedness and biodefense in the global health security directorate, which the Trump administration disbanded in 2018, four former officials said.

title: Fact Check: Sweden, which does not require the wearing of masks in public, has had few death...
text:
Claim: Sweden, which does not require the wearing of masks in public, has had few deaths due to COVID-19

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: QA pairs show it has had the highest rate of deaths.

Evidence:

Q: how many deaths has been recorded due to the covid 19 in Sweden
A: Sweden has the highest mortality rate at 56.23% per 100,000 population. 

Q: Has the requirement to wear face masks been implemented in Sweden?
A: No. ‘We see no point in wearing a face mask,’ Sweden’s top virus expert says

Q: As of August 16, 2020, how many deaths have occurred due to COVID-19 in Sweden?
A: 5 783.

title: Fact Check: Beijing government announced that Chinese people should not travel to the United...
text:
Claim: Beijing government announced that Chinese people should not travel to the United States or buy American-made products.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: No evidence to suggest that the Beijing Government announced these rules and there are no current rules in place regarding this claim. 

Evidence:

Q: Did China's Ministry of Foreign Affairs announce that Chinese people should not travel to the United States or buy American-made products in its daily press briefing on August 13, 2020?
A: No. Transcript of August 13 daily press briefing does not  include a request for Chinese people to avoid American products or avoid travelling to the US.

Q: Did the weekly policy briefing from China’s State Council on August 13, 2020 include a mention of the call for Chinese people to not travel to the United States or buy American-made products?
A: No. China’s State Council weekly policy briefing pages for August 13, 2020 do not mention the US.

Q: Did the Chinese Ministry of Foreign Affairs announce that Chinese people should not travel to the United States or buy American-made products on its Twitter account on or after August 13, 2020?
A: No. A keywords search set between August 13 and August 18 2020 found no claim on the Ministry’s Twitter account.

title: Fact Check: MS Dhoni has exited the cricket team for refusing to campaign for BJP in Jharkha...
text:
Claim: MS Dhoni has exited the cricket team for refusing to campaign for BJP in Jharkhand election.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: It seems from the answer that MS Dhoni left his team because the sport was straining. Therefore, the claim is refuted,

A: "One of India's greatest Test captains under whose leadership India became the No. 1 team in the test rankings, MS Dhoni, has decided to retire from Test cricket citing the strain of playing all formats of cricket," the board said..

title: Fact Check: warm water is effective in curing joint pain
text:
Claim: warm water is effective in curing joint pain

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The answer and credible source show that there is no cure for joint pain so the claim is refuted.

A: There is no cure for osteoarthritis (joint pain).

title: Fact Check: Walmart stores have stopped accepting cash payments.
text:
Claim: Walmart stores have stopped accepting cash payments.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The answer and sources show that the store still accepts cash but would prefer exact amount in coins or payment by card so the claim is refuted.

Evidence:

Q: Why did Walmart ask people to pay with cards and not cash?
A: Like most retailers, we're experiencing the [effects] of the nationwide coin shortage," a Walmart spokesperson told NPR. 

It's coronavirus-related only in that the pandemic has resulted in a surprising shortage of coins in the U.S. money system, which makes it difficult to offer change for cash purchases.. 

Q: Will walmart accept cash?
A: We're asking customers to pay with card or use correct change when possible if they need to pay with cash. Cash is welcome at all of our stores.".

title: Fact Check: warm water is effective in curing asthma
text:
Claim: warm water is effective in curing asthma

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The second answer and source show that there is not a cure for asthma so the claim is refuted.

Evidence:

Q: Can warm water cure asthma?
A: No answer could be found.. 

Q: Is there a cure for asthma?
A: No. There is no cure for asthma, but there are effective treatments available. The best way to manage your asthma is to work with an allergist.

title: Fact Check: Cold drinks are the main cause of heart attacks.
text:
Claim: Cold drinks are the main cause of heart attacks.

Verdict: Not Enough Evidence

Justification: The questions and answers do not look at the part of the claim that says that it is the main cause so there is not enough evidence. I would need to see some evidence of how many heart attacks are caused by cold drinks.

Evidence:

Q: is cold water bad for you?
A: No. Cold water can actually increase metabolism, it isn't bad for you

Q: Can cold water cause heart attacks
A: Yes. The heart and the esophagus are in close proximity. Ingestion of very cold drinks or desserts can trigger paroxysmal atrial fibrillation and probably other arrhythmias. Patients should be notified as to the importance of avoiding such triggers.

title: Fact Check: Facebook deleted a photo of Melania Trump with her sister and mother.
text:
Claim: Facebook deleted a photo of Melania Trump with her sister and mother.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The source information in question 2 is the facebook post referenced in the claim. Whether or not this image shows Melania Trump's Mother or Audrey Gruss, Facebook has labeled the post containing the claim as False information
Checked by independent fact-checkers. Therefore depicting the claim as false and refuted.

Evidence:

Q: Does the photo show Melania with her sister and her mother?
A: it shows Melania, her sister and audrey gruss (not Melanias mother). 

Q: Was this image removed by facebook?
A: No the photo was not removed from Facebook.

title: Fact Check: UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson apologised for colonial rule in India.
text:
Claim: UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson apologised for colonial rule in India.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: From a parody/fake account.

Evidence:

Q: Who made the claim?
A: It was published by an unofficial Unverified twitter handle (@BorisUKJohnson) created in July2020.. 

Q: When was Boris Johnsons official account created?
A: April 2015. 

Q: Did Boris tweet this claim or anything similar?
A: No, nothing found..

title: Fact Check: Cold water affects the internal walls of the stomach. It affects the large intes...
text:
Claim: Cold water affects the internal walls of the stomach. It affects the large intestine and results in cancer

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: This claim is refuted. According to the QA pairs, drinking cold water is safe and there is no way whatsoever it could harm you. The amount of water you drink is what is important. Therefore, this claim is refuted.

Evidence:

Q: Is drinking cold water in any way harmful?
A: No. If temperature is what's been holding you back, cold foods and beverages aren’t known to harm any internal organs, so feel free to enjoy them! Additionally, although drinking cold water has been found to burn slightly more calories than drinking warm water, the difference is so small that it’s not considered significant. That being said, some people may find discomfort in drinking colder beverages if they have trouble swallowing or experience heartburn, but it won't cause harm to the body. Ultimately, it's more critical to drink enough water as the temperature makes minimal difference.

title: Fact Check: Late actor Sushant Singh Rajput developed an app which could detect Covid-19 inf...

The claim also mentions an app which could detect covid being invented by the named person in the claim but the Q&A pair 2 state it found no answer to confirm or deny this so more evidence is needed .

Evidence:

Q: Did Sushant Singh Rajput develop a Covid-19 test app?
A: No answer could be found.. 

Q: How did Sushant die?
A: Alleged suicide.
Sushant Singh Rajput’s father, KK Singh, had filed a police complaint against Chakraborty in Patna, accusing her of abetting his son’s alleged suicide in June. His father has also alleged that Chakraborty illegally transferred Rs 15 crore from his son’s bank account and mentally harassed him..

title: Fact Check: warm water is effective in curing migraine
text:
Claim: warm water is effective in curing migraine

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: There is no cure for migraines 

Evidence:

Q: Can migraines be cured?
A: Migraine is a disorder of the nervous system, something that appears to be genetically predisposed, with environmental and biological factors that may increase or decrease the sensitivity of the nervous system to the attacks we call “migraine.” It is not like an infection that can be eradicated by taking antibiotics, nor like a tumor that can be surgically removed.  Migraines can be controlled in the sense that there are treatments to reduce the frequency and severity of the attacks, and medications to take when an attack occurs. In general, migraines tend to become much less frequent as people age, beyond 60 years.. 

Q: Can warm water cure migraines?
A: There's currently no cure for migraines, although a number of treatments are available to help ease the symptoms..

Q: What was the death rate in Italy as a result of COVID-19?
A: 58.27 deaths per 100,000 inhabitants..

title: Fact Check: Vitamin D prevents COVID-19 infection and reduces severity.
text:
Claim: Vitamin D prevents COVID-19 infection and reduces severity.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The sources all show that vitamin D would not prevent getting covid-19. The source is a reputable website.

Evidence:

Q: Can Vitamin D prevent infection from Covid-19?
A: We found no clinical evidence on vitamin D in COVID-19. There was no evidence related to vitamin D deficiency predisposing to COVID-19, nor were there studies of supplementation for preventing or treating COVID-19 (Search date upto 4th of April 2020, clinicaltrials.gov searched upto on 23rd April)..

Presently he is haemodynamically stable and on a ventilator,” a statement from the hospital said.

title: Fact Check: Kamala Harris called Joe Biden 'A Racist And A Rapist'

Evidence:

Q: Did Kamala Harris call Joe Biden 'A Racist And A Rapist' ?
A: Based on our research, the claim that Harris called Biden a racist and said she believed sexual harassment allegations — or called him a "rapist" — is PARTLY FALSE. Harris never called Biden a racist. She said she believed women who said that unwanted touching from Biden made them uncomfortable. But she never said she believed a sexual assault accusation from Tara Reade, or any allegations of rape, and did not call him a rapist..

title: Fact Check: Russia has successfully developed a vaccine for Covid-19 and it has passed all c...
text:
Claim: Russia has successfully developed a vaccine for Covid-19 and it has passed all checks.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: It seems from the 4th and 5th QAs that the vaccine has not passed the safety checks. Therefore, the claim is refuted

Evidence:

Q: Who has developed this vaccine?
A: ‘Sputnik V’ has been developed by Moscow-based Gamaleya Research Institute of Epidemiology and Microbiology.. 

Q: When was it first registered?
A: It was registered by the Russian health ministry on August 11 as the first registered Covid-19 vaccine in the market but The certificate mentions that “the vaccine cannot be used widely until 1 January 2021”, presumably after larger clinical trials are completed.. 

Q: What kind of vaccine is it?
A: The Russian vaccine is an “adenovirus vector-based vaccine”.

The idea is to use the weakened common cold virus to stimulate an immune response and trigger the formation of antibodies against Covid-19. These anti-bodies are then ready to fight against Covid-19 in case one catches a coronavirus infection. Even the widely awaited Oxford University vaccine is exploring the same route..

I would say this: if they don't stand for the national anthem I hope they don't open, but other than that I'd love to see them open and we're doing everything possible for getting them open.” which different from what the headline says

title: Fact Check: Russia has developed a new vaccine to fight COVID-19.
text:
Claim: Russia has developed a new vaccine to fight COVID-19.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: Russia did developed  the Sputnik V vaccine.

Evidence:

Q: What is the name of the vaccine Russia has developed to fight COVID-19?
A: Sputnik V. 

Q: Has the COVID-19 vaccine Sputnik V been FDA-approved?
A: Dr. Scott Gottlieb, the former U.S. Food and Drug Administration commissioner, urged caution about Russia’s coronavirus vaccine, telling CNBC on Tuesday that he would “certainly not” take it outside of a clinical trial where patients are closely monitored. 

“They’ve cleared the equivalent, really, of a phase 1 clinical trial in terms of putting it in 100 to maybe as many as 300 patients so it needs to be evaluated in a large-scale clinical trial,” he said on “Squawk Box.” Russia’s vaccine development is “certainly not ahead” of the United States, added Gottlieb, who is a board member of Pfizer, which is developing a potential vaccine.. 

Q: Has the COVID-19 vaccine, Sputnik V, been thoroughly tested?
A: Russian President Vladimir Putin announced Tuesday that the country has approved a coronavirus vaccine despite not having completed crucial clinical trials to determine its efficacy and safety.

Developed at Moscow's Gamaleya Institute, the vaccine, called Sputnik V, has not yet undergone Phase 3 of testing, a key, monthslong trial involving administering a vaccine to a large group of people that can reveal previously unknown side effects.

Russia has not published any scientific data on its vaccine testing, and Sputnik V is not among the eight currently undergoing Phase 3 trials, according to the New York Times coronavirus vaccine tracker..

The ministry clarified that as of August 10, 2020,  no new circular has been issued by Ministry of Railways regarding the extension of cancellation of trains..

title: Fact Check: COVID-19 virus is airborne.
text:
Claim: COVID-19 virus is airborne.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: The answers and credible sources state that covid can be transmitted through the air so the claim is supported.

Evidence:

Q: How is covid-19 primarily transmitted?
A: According to the World Health Organization (WHO) and the United States Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), SARS-CoV-2 is still mainly transmitted through respiratory secretions or droplets that can reach the mouth, nose and eyes of someone who comes in close contact with a COVID-19-infected person.. 

Q: Can COVID-19 be transmitted through airborne transmission?
A: Yes. WHO and the U.S. CDC also acknowledged increasing evidence that SARS-CoV-2 can spread through airborne transmission, but current evidence shows that it only occurs in indoor spaces with poor ventilation. WHO said further studies are needed to establish if airborne transmission may occur in the absence of aerosol-generating procedures.

SARS-CoV-2 can become airborne when tiny droplets called droplet nuclei or aerosols containing it get suspended in the air, according to a global team of public health experts convened by international non-profit media group Meedan. Droplet nuclei are microscopic and much smaller in size than respiratory droplets (almost five to 10 micrometers), according to WHO.

A: There is currently a fraudulent Little Caesars coupon in circulation, stating ‘Little Caesars is rewarding everyone with 3 free large pizza coupon on their 60th anniversary.’ This coupon was not generated or distributed by Little Caesars.

title: Fact Check: Donald Trump's payroll tax deferral could leave American workers liable for thou...
text:
Claim: Donald Trump's payroll tax deferral could leave American workers liable for thousands of dollars during tax season and could potentially leave programs like Social Security and Medicare weakened.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: The tax cut is what helps fund social security and the payroll tax deferral lets the people keep the money instead of sending it to the government to help fund the social security scheme 

Evidence:

Q: What was Trumps tax deferral?
A: Trump issued a memo that told employers they didn’t need to send Washington the 6.2% out of each employee’s paycheck that helps fund Social Security. So, someone making $1,000 a week — the national median pay — could see an extra $62 every week. The tax break applies to people making up to $2,000 a week and would be in place for four months, September through December.. 

Q: Why would the tax deferral potentially cost people money during the tax season?
A: The more a person makes, up to the maximum, the more money they would keep. At the high end, a person could see a tax cut of $1,984 over those 16 weeks.

Trump had the power to defer collecting the tax, but as written, his order provided only temporary relief. At some point, the missed payments would need to be made up or count as foregone revenues to the Social Security trust fund. The memo said the administration will look for a way to let people keep the money, but that decision rests with Congress, not the president..

Q: Did the Choluteca Bridge survive Hurricane Mitch
A: The Choluteca Bridge stood its ground against Hurricane Mitch and survived in near perfect condition.. 

Q: What happened to the river under the Choluteca Bridge after Hurricane Mitch
A: Even though the bridge stood its ground, there was one problem, the storm caused the river to carve a completely new path which no longer ran under the bridge. The Choluteca Bridge no longer stood over the river,.

title: Fact Check: T cells may play a role in the body’s immune response against the virus SARS-CoV...
text:
Claim: T cells may play a role in the body’s immune response against the virus SARS-CoV-2

Verdict: Supported

Justification: This claim is supported. According to the QA pairs, T cells have the ability to aid memory cells when an pathogen enters the body that needs to be destroyed. The more times that pathogen tries to affect the immune system, the memory cells (aided by T cells) respond faster and stronger to kill off the infection. Therefore, T cells do play a role in the body's immune system against COVID-19 as if a person were to catch COVID-19 twice, the T cells help weaken the infection. This claim is supported. 

Evidence:

Q: What are T cells role in clearing viral infections?
A: T cells recognize and kill infected cells. The cells of the adaptive immune system are lymphocytes – B cells and T cells. A key feature of the adaptive immune system is memory. Repeat infections by the same virus are met immediately with a strong and specific response that usually effectively stops the infection with less reliance on the innate system. When we say we are immune to infection with a virus, we are talking about immune memory. Vaccines protect us against infection because of immune memory. The first adaptive response against a virus – called the primary response – often takes days to mature. In contrast, a memory response develops within hours of infection. Memory is maintained by a subset of B and T lymphocytes called memory cells which survive for years in the body. Memory cells remain ready to respond rapidly and efficiently to a subsequent encounter with a pathogen. This so-called secondary response is often stronger than the primary response to infection. Consequently, childhood infections protect adults, and immunity conferred by vaccination can last for years.. 

Q: What does the National Geographic article say that specifically relates to the role of T cells for the SARS-CoV-2 virus?
A: The article references findings by Aleman, a researcher and physician at the Karolinska University in sweden.
Killer T cells, which tell virus-infected human cells to destroy themselves to keep the virus from spreading - In a subset of those who tested positive for COVID-19, Aleman found T cells but no antibodies. Aleman says, one thing is becoming clear: antibodies might not be telling the whole story when it comes to COVID-19 immunity. “We shouldn’t just look blindly at antibody tests." The article also states, Aleman and other virologists and immunologists when turning their attention to COVID-19, they began to study how immunity developed in people who had tested positive for SARS-CoV-2, as well as their close contacts, some of whom were presumably exposed to the virus, even if they didn’t get sick. As expected, hospitalized individuals developed strong antibody and T cell responses to SARS-CoV-2. But two-thirds of the close contacts who were asymptomatic showed a subsequent T cell response, even though tests didn’t detect any antibodies - Study results, released June 29 without peer review via the medical pre-print service medRxiv, didn’t reveal whether these individuals never developed antibodies or whether they rapidly declined to undetectable levels. Regardless, the report immediately raised concerns about a vaccine, since stimulating antibody production is a key strategy by which immunizations protect against disease.

The article also cites recently reported work by immunologist Antonio Bertoletti from Duke-NUS Medical School in Singapore - Patients infected with the original SARS virus still possessed memory T cells that responded to the virus’ proteins 17 years later. These same memory T cells also reacted to SARS-CoV-2. It’s something Bertoletti says bodes well for COVID-19.. 

Q: What reaction did the claim recieve from the scientific community?
A: One study by immunologist Antonio Bertoletti as reference in the National Geographic article - 'SARS-CoV-2-specific T cell immunity in cases of COVID-19 and SARS, and uninfected controls' is cited on 'Nature' 1034 times..

title: Fact Check: According to Harry Roque, even if 10,000 people die, 10 million COVID-19 cases i...

title: Fact Check: The Australian govt is handing out $25,000 to all nursing homes who label covid ...

Q: Who can certify a death in Victoria state, Australia?
A: “The MCCD can ‘only’ be completed by a registered medical practitioner. To ‘certify death’ a registered medical practitioner is required to make a diagnosis of the cause of death which requires specialist knowledge.”. 

Q: Can a nursing home issue a death certificate?
A: No. But this briefing note on the state’s Department of Health & Human Services website explains that in Victoria, only a registered medical practitioner can certify a death or complete a Medical Certificate of Cause of Death (MCCD).

Q: Is C19 study a widely accepted study
A: The "C19study" has not been published in a medical journal or publicly reviewed by virologists or infectious disease experts. 

Q: Is hydroxychloroquine a good treatment for COVID-19
A: Early in the pandemic, the FDA had issued permission in the form of an "Emergency Use Authorization" but on June 15, 2020, revoked it, saying early research showed the risks outweighed the benefits.

title: Fact Check: 82% of the public are wearing face masks on Translink buses and trains.
text:
Claim: 82% of the public are wearing face masks on Translink buses and trains.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: The fourth Q&A shows that around 80% are wearing masks so the claim is supported.

Evidence:

Q: Are face masks mandatory on buses and trains in the UK ?
A: Masks will be made mandatory for anyone in England wanting to use public transport, including the Tube, buses and trains from 15 June onwards.

Travellers will be refused access to public transport if they do not comply with these rules, which have been put in place to reduce the spread of coronavirus, as more people head back to work.

The government has said face coverings should be worn on trains, underground trains, buses, ferries and planes. But people won’t have to wear them inside railway stations or at bus terminals. UK transport secretary Grant Shapps said tonight: “I can announce that as of Monday 15 June, face coverings will become mandatory on public transport.

“The evidence suggests that wearing a face mask offers some, limited protection. It’s a condition of travel. You cannot travel if you are not wearing a face covering.”

However, there will be exemptions for anyone with breathing difficulties and young children.. 

Q: Are there people exempted from the use of face masks face coverings on buses?
A: You do not need to wear a face covering if you have a legitimate reason not to or are exempt on other grounds - these include the following:

    not being able to put on, wear or remove a face covering because of a physical or mental illness or impairment, or disability
    if you have a medical condition that prevents you from wearing a mask such as respiratory illness
    if putting on, wearing or removing a face covering will cause you severe distress
    if you are travelling with or providing assistance to someone who relies on lip reading to communicate
    to avoid harm or injury, or the risk of harm or injury, to yourself or others
    to avoid injury, or to escape a risk of harm, and you do not have a face covering with you
    to eat or drink, but only if you need to and replace your face covering as soon as possible
    to take medication
    if a police officer or other official requests you remove your face covering
    a child who is under the age of 11
    any employee of the operator, or anyone contracted to provide a service on behalf of the operator who is performing their duty - although as mentioned above, reasonable alternative measures should be in place unless not possible to do so.
    a member of the emergency services who are performing their duties

Please remember that there may be people on the list above who are exempt from wearing a face covering. Not all reasons are visible so please be mindful of others who may not be wearing a mask for a legitimate reason. 

Operators such as ourselves have been given discretion on how they enforce the new requirement to wear a face covering with the preferred method being “engage, explain, encourage”. Our drivers are not police officers and so are not there to enforce the law, but by following the Government guidelines, we are trying to engage people to explain the new law and then encourage them to wear face coverings in future.. 

Q: Which area does the claim refer to?
A: Translink buses and trains in Northern Ireland..

Q: Is there evidence that Covid Organics can prevent or cure COVID-19?

“The scientific evidence that this is effective has not been proved. It’s likely that it could actually harm the health of the population, particularly that of children,” said the president of Madagascar’s Academy of Medicine, Marcel Razanamparany, in a statement.

While countries have been careful to engage in diplomacy with Taiwan, this restraint has been assumed to be out of courtesy for China, which considers the island part of China and rejects any claim of Taiwanese independence. Unlike the Communist Party-run mainland, Taiwan is a functioning democracy and has held elections since 1987.

title: Fact Check: The USA has more COVID-19 cases, because they do more tests
text:
Claim: The USA has more COVID-19 cases, because they do more tests

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Seems that the actual infection cases are increasing not just the testing,from the 2nd QA. Therefore the claim is refuted 

Evidence:

Q: When did testing increase in the US?
A: In May 2020, the US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) issued the first Emergency Use Authorization (EUA) for a COVID-19 RAT, the Sofia 2 test manufactured by Quidel and by mid may testing was increasing. 

Rockefeller foundation, called for the nation to get to three million Covid-19 tests a week by July and to 30 million by October.. 

Q: How much did positive covid tests increase beween May to July?
A: May had brought signs of hope that the U.S. had gotten its Covid-19 outbreak under control, with about 20,000 new cases reported per day after April highs closer to 30,000. But by late June, the daily count climbed to about 40,000, and now it’s at about 70,000. 

Q: Can this increase be explained solely by the increase in testing?
A: No. Epidemiologists and infectious disease experts have disputed the White House claims for weeks, citing rising hospitalization numbers and deaths. It’s hard to argue that extremely sick people, let alone dead people, had been obscured by low levels of testing but suddenly revealed by higher levels.

Without a doubt, many cases of Covid-19 in March, April, and May weren’t picked up. In late June, Centers for Disease Control and Prevention Director Robert Redfield told reporters that as many as 90% of cases had been missed; that is, although there were 2.3 million confirmed cases in the U.S. then, some 20 million people had probably been infected. But that reasoning applies today, too: Despite months of government claims to the contrary, not everyone who wants, or should have, a test is getting one. Using data from Covid Tracking, STAT looked at the number of people tested and the number who tested positive for the disease (cases) in every state and Washington, D.C. We did that for three dates: in mid-May, mid-June, and mid-July. (Due to reporting anomalies, the dates selected sometimes differed by a day or two between states.)

For each date, we calculated the number of cases found per 1,000 tests — a measure of the disease’s prevalence. For example, in Florida on May 13, that rate was 32. On June 13 it was 75. On July 13 it was 193. On May 13, Florida tested 15,159 people; on July 13, it tested 65,567. So indeed, the number of tests has increased.

title: Fact Check: France approves the use of HCQ for treatment of Covid 19. After trials proved su...
text:
Claim: France approves the use of HCQ for treatment of Covid 19. After trials proved successful. 800 hospital have commenced using it.

Evidence:

Q: When was this claim made?
A: 03/08/2020. 

Q: Has France approved  hydroxychloroquine as a treatment for Covid-19?
A: No. 27/05/2020
 French government said Wednesday that doctors should no longer prescribe hydroxychloroquine for COVID-19 patients, an unproven and potentially harmful treatment for the disease nonetheless promoted by US President Donald Trump.

The move came after two French advisory bodies and the World Health Organization (WHO) warned this week that the drug, a treatment for rheumatoid arthritis and lupus, had been shown to be dangerous in several studies.

title: Fact Check: At Trump’s Tulsa rally there were 12000 people, not 6000 as reported by Axios an...
