title: Fact Check: There is now a 10-year rule. If you damage a federal property such as courthouse...
text:
Claim: There is now a 10-year rule. If you damage a federal property such as courthouse, you go to jail for 10 years.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: Correct

Evidence:

Q: Which rule was introduced in 2020 to protect federal properties?
A: President Donald Trump signed an executive order Friday directing federal law enforcement agencies to prosecute people who damage federal monuments — and to withhold portions of federal funding to cities that don’t protect statues from demonstrators.. 

Q: What is the punishment for damaging federal properties according to this order?
A: The order directs the Department of Justice to “prosecute to the fullest extent permitted under Federal law” people who damage government monuments, participate in “efforts to incite violence,” or damage religious property. Damaging federal property can be punished by up to 10 years in prison..

title: Fact Check: You can test too much for Covid-19.
text:
Claim: You can test too much for Covid-19.

Verdict: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

Justification: The Q&As sources show positives and negatives for frequent testing for COVID-19.  Therefore the claim label selected is conflicting evidence.

Evidence:

Q: Can you overtest for COVID-19?
A: Frequent testing of the entire population would help identify so-called hidden hidden carriers — individuals infected with SARS-CoV-2, the virus that causes Covid-19, but who have no symptoms of it. They seem to play an important role in the spread of Covid-19. Identifying these silent spreaders could help public health workers be more effective at contract tracing by identifying others who have been exposed and may require quarantine.. 

Q: What are the downsides of overtesting for COVID-19?
A: There are also the harms of Covid-19 testing to consider.

Perhaps the biggest challenge is false negatives — tests signaling no infection in those who are indeed infected. Covid-19 testing is typically performed on samples from behind the nose or in the back of the mouth, and will be positive only if the sample happens to contain the virus. In some people, the virus may be present in high quantities only deep in the lungs. False negatives occur surprisingly often — perhaps as often as one-third of the time — which could lead to a false sense of security among those with such results.

Testing those without symptoms can also lead to false alarms. PCR testing for the virus, which is the best way to identify an active infection, can detect the presence of SARS-CoV-2 — or remnants of it — for weeks, even when the infection is unlikely to be transmitted to others. Testing the entire population would undoubtedly identify a large number of such individuals, unnecessarily sidelining them from work and society.. 

Q: When should you get tested for COVID-19?
A: You should always get tested when you have symptoms for COVID-19.

You should also get tested when you’ve had close contact with someone who has Covid. Test 3 to 5 days after your exposure. Testing earlier to find out if you’re positive is optional.

Also get tested when asked by your school, workplace, doctor, or the Department Public of Health.

Testing is a good idea before and after activities that put you or others at higher risk for Covid, like:

Large gatherings
Crowded indoor settings
Testing is also a good idea when you work somewhere with a higher risk of transmission, like:

Homeless shelters
Jails
Places where you have close contact with the public.

title: Fact Check: Trump did more for the Black community than anybody with the possible exception ...
text:
Claim: Trump did more for the Black community than anybody with the possible exception of Abraham Lincoln.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Although Trump did do some things for the black community, the last questions shows experts disagree. 

Evidence:

Q: What has Trump done for the black community?
A: He earned a Promise Kept for his pledge to ensure funding for historically Black colleges and universities, or HBCUs. 

Trump signed the bipartisan FUTURE Act in 2019 to ensure that the original science, technology, engineering and math funding for HBCUs from President George W. Bush's 2007 College Cost Reduction and Access Act would continue to be awarded.. 

Q: Where do historians rank Trump in relation to his achievements for the black community?
A: While Trump has made this assertion before, historians disagree. Right behind Lincoln, who prosecuted the Civil War and issued the Emancipation Proclamation, would be President Lyndon B. Johnson.

Johnson, a skilled legislator from his years in the Senate, deliberately crafted his agenda and pushed it through Congress with personal persuasion, to a far greater degree than Trump, historians say.

"His accomplishments on behalf of African Americans — the Civil Rights Act, the Voting Rights Act, the Fair Housing Act — were historic," said University of Texas historian H.W. Brands.

Jeffrey A. Engel, director of Southern Methodist University’s Center for Presidential History, sees Johnson and President Harry Truman, who moved to desegregate the military, as being among recent presidents who were ahead of their times.

Even a president like Richard Nixon, who was captured on tape making racist remarks, had a fairly robust legacy on civil rights, advancing the desegregation of schools and affirmative action in employment, said John J. Pitney, Jr., a Claremont McKenna College political scientist..

title: Fact Check: With African Americans, Trump is doing very well. They had the best employment n...
text:
Claim: With African Americans, Trump is doing very well. They had the best employment numbers they’ve ever had. ... They were making more money than they ever made.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: The 1st Q&A pair does agree with the claim that blacks saw income growth under trump, with record employment that was better than previous years. so supported.

Evidence:

Q: Did the unemployment rate decrease during Trump's administration for Black Americans and their median household income increase
A: High employment under Trump led to minorities experiencing the largest income gains. Real median income grew by 7.9% for Blacks in 2019. That outpaced 2018’s income growth of 2.6% and 2017’s income decline of -2.4%. Notably, Black median income growth last year surpassed income growth rates under the Obama administration. There’s still more work to do though. Although Black median income hit a new high, Blacks earned the lowest income level of all groups (just over $45,000 a year).

title: Fact Check: The late Rep. John Lewis, D-Ga., didn't come to Trump's inauguration. He didn't ...

title: Fact Check: California is going to send tens of millions of ballots to California, all over ...

Claim: California is going to send tens of millions of ballots to California, all over the place.

title: Fact Check: Covid deaths are way down from where it was … It spiked, but now it's going down...
text:
Claim: Covid deaths are way down from where it was … It spiked, but now it's going down again. It's going down in Arizona. It's going down in Florida. It's going down in Texas.

Arizona also reported a record increase with 172 fatalities on Thursday, bringing that state’s death toll to 3,626. 
Texas also had one of the biggest one-day spikes in coronavirus fatalities since the pandemic started.

title: Fact Check: Ghislaine Maxwell's boyfriend Jeffrey Epstein died in jail and people are still ...
text:
Claim: Ghislaine Maxwell's boyfriend Jeffrey Epstein died in jail and people are still trying to figure out how did it happened, was it suicide, was he killed.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: The post mortem has been conducted but does not make a definite ruling on cause of death. The autopsy revealed that Epstein had sustained broken bones in his neck, but those injuries may have been caused by hanging or strangulation, so  Epstein may have died by way of suicide or homicide.

Evidence:

Q: What did Epstein's post mortem find?
A: A postmortem autopsy of the body of financier Jeffrey Epstein revealed that he had sustained several broken bones in his neck,. 

Q: How can broken bones in the neck happen?
A: The autopsy does not reveal the precise cause of death, however, it was found that although such broken bones can occur in people who hang themselves, they are more common among victims of homicide by strangulation, the report claimed.. 

Q: What was the report's conclusion?
A: Although the report does not clearly rule whether Epstein hanged himself or was assassinated, it does deepen the mystery surrounding his death as well as the various theories that counter the preliminary report of suicide..

title: Fact Check: COVID-19 has infected fewer people than H1N1 virus, but “media hysteria” has pro...
text:
Claim: COVID-19 has infected fewer people than H1N1 virus, but “media hysteria” has prompted an overblown response.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The evidence suggests that Covid-19 is much more infectious and much more deadly than H1N1, therefore we need to be more aware and cautious about our attitudes to fighting the virus 

Evidence:

Q: What is the H1N1 virus?
A: H1N1 is a new influenza virus causing illness in people.   This new virus was first detected in people in the U.S. in April 2009 and was initially call “swine flu.”   In some respects the H1N1 virus is just like any other influenza virus. It causes a predominantly respiratory illness.. 

Q: Is COVID-19 deadlier than the H1N1 virus?
A: We know that COVID-19 spreads fast, and we know that it is deadly – 10 times deadlier than the 2009 flu pandemic.

We know that the virus can spread more easily in crowded environments like nursing homes. 

We know that early case-finding, testing, isolating caring for every case and tracing every contact is essential for stopping transmission.

We know that in some countries, cases are doubling every 3 to 4 days.. 

Q: Why is it important to treat COVID-19 seriously?
A: The WHO is “deeply concerned both by the alarming levels of spread and severity and by the alarming levels of inaction,” and he called on countries to take action now to contain the virus. “We should double down,” he said. “We should be more aggressive.”.

title: Fact Check: USA has tested more people than any other country.
text:
Claim: USA has tested more people than any other country.

Verdict: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

Justification: Although the United States tested more people, the percentage of the population tested was lower. Hence, cherrypicking claim. 

Evidence:

Q: Has the USA tested more people than any other country?
A: Yes. They have tested more people (although its a smaller % of the population of the country in comparison)

Q: By July 28th 2020, had USA tested more people for Covid-19 than any other country?
A: In terms of quantity of tests, USA had tested more people, but in terms of percentage of population tested, USA were not even in the top 50 countries..

title: Fact Check: Reports that Russia paid bounties or offered to pay bounties to Taliban-linked m...
text:
Claim: Reports that Russia paid bounties or offered to pay bounties to Taliban-linked militants to kill American soldiers) never reached Trump's desk.

Verdict: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

Justification: The two different answers show conflicting evidence. It's not known if Trump was briefed as people have said different things about the situation. 

Evidence:

Q: Was Trump aware of the bounties on the heads of American soldiers by the Russians
A: Top officials in the White House were aware in early 2019 of classified intelligence indicating Russia was secretly offering bounties to the Taliban for the deaths of Americans, a full year earlier than has been previously reported, according to U.S. officials with direct knowledge of the intelligence.. 

Q: Was the report made known to Donald Trump
A: The assessment was included in at least one of President Donald Trump’s written daily intelligence briefings at the time, according to the officials. Then-national security adviser John Bolton also told colleagues he briefed Trump on the intelligence assessment in March 2019..

title: Fact Check: The violence in Portland is getting better since federal agents went in. They've...
text:
Claim: The violence in Portland is getting better since federal agents went in. They've arrested a lot of people.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: According to Mayor Ted Wheeler, federal agents presence actually led to more violence and more vandalism. Although they have made some arrest. 

Evidence:

Q: Why were federal agents sent to Portland U.S in 2020?
A: May 26, 2020, protests in downtown Portland were followed by nightly criminal activity including assaults on law enforcement officers, destruction of property, looting, arson, and vandalism.. 

Q: Did Portland officials ask for federal agents to be sent?
A: Portland's Mayor Wheeler said "They're not wanted here. We haven't asked them here. In fact, we want them to leave,". 

Q: Did federal agents make any arrests during the protests in Portland?
A: Yes. 22 were Arrested, and Facing Federal Charges After Protest at Federal Courthouse in Portland
Charges include assaulting federal officers, failing to obey lawful orders, and operating a drone in restricted airspace

title: Fact Check: Millions of ballots are being mailed, nobody even knows where they’re going.
text:
Claim: Millions of ballots are being mailed, nobody even knows where they’re going.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Q&A 1 shows that only people registered to vote up to the last day before ballots are posted can receive a ballot in the post (which would very likely be in the millions as claimed), with Q&A 2 saying The mail-in ballots are going to the registered voters so yes people do know where the ballots are going not what is claimed that nobody knows.


Evidence:

Q: Millions of ballots are being mailed in California, nobody even knows where they’re going.
A: Yes. Notwithstanding any limitation on the distribution of vote-by-mail
ballots in Elections Code sections 1500 and 4000-4007, or any other
provision of state law, each county elections officials shall transmit
vote-by-mail ballots for the November 3, 2020 General Election to all
voters who are, as of the last day on which vote-by-mail ballots may
be transmitted to voters in connection with that election, registered to
vote in that election. As set forth in this paragraph, every Californian
who is eligible to vote in the November 3, 2020 General Election shall
receive a vote-by-mail ballot.

Q: Where are the mail-in ballots going
A: The mail-in ballots are going to the registered voters, both those in the States and those abroad.

title: Fact Check: South Korea have spikes of Covid cases and nobody knows if they only had 300 dea...
text:
Claim: South Korea have spikes of Covid cases and nobody knows if they only had 300 deaths.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: the answers do not show a spike in cases, beyond the 200 a day during the original spike in feb-march 2020. 

Evidence:

Q: During the pandemic was there a spike in the number of COVID cases in South Korea
A: They had a spike between February 26- March 5 there were more than 200 cases each day. 

Q: Did South Korea have another spike after of more than 200 daily cases after March
A: No. The Chart shows there no record of more than 200 case in a day

Q: How many Covid deaths were recorded in South Korea before July 28, 2020 when Trump was interviewed
A: between Feb. 15 to July 27, South Korea had only 300 deaths.

title: Fact Check: Devender Sharma fabricated false covid-19 positive reports for patients  in orde...
text:
Claim: Devender Sharma fabricated false covid-19 positive reports for patients  in order to get them admitted for kidney harvesting.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: There were no reports of him related to any kidney related or Covid-19 related crimes between 2004 - 2020

Evidence:

Q: During what period was Devender Sharma's alleged involvement in Kidney harvesting related crimes?
A: Delhi Police found out that he had illegally transplanted more than 125 kidneys between 1994 and 2004 with the help of middlemen and other doctors.. 

Q: When were the first recorded cases of Coronavirus?
A: On 31 December 2019, the World Health Organization (WHO) was informed of a cluster of cases of pneumonia of unknown cause detected in Wuhan City, Hubei Province, China. A novel coronavirus (SARS-CoV-2) was subsequently identified from patient samples.. 

Q: Was Devender Sharma involved in any Kidney organ related crimes with reports of a coronavirus connection?
A: On 30th July 2020 The Wire India reported that Devender Sharma had confessed to being the mastermind behind at least 50 murder cases, when he was arrested after jumping parole in January 2020. From 1994 to 2004, he claimed to have carried out more than illegal 125 kidney transplants. There are no reports of any coronavirus connection to his crimes, or instances of Kidney organ related crimes between 2004 and 2020, which includes the period of the coronavirus pandemic..

title: Fact Check: "Depending on which study you look at," he said, "either 68% or 5 out of 6 indiv...
text:
Claim: "Depending on which study you look at," he said, "either 68% or 5 out of 6 individuals ... are making more on unemployment than they did on the job."

Verdict: Supported

Justification: This is claim supported. According to the QA pairs, the CARES Act sent a fixed $600 supplement to all unemployed workers. 68% of unemployed Americans receive benefits that exceed their lost earnings. Therefore, this claim is supported.

Evidence:

Q: What proportion of unemployed Americans receive benefits that exceed their lost earnings?
A: 68%. 

Q: What are unemployed individuals earning that means they are earning more out of work than they would be in work?
A: The Coronavirus Aid, Relief, and Economic Security Act (CARES) Act substantially expanded Unemploy-
ment Insurance (UI) in order to help workers losing jobs as a result of the Covid-19 pandemic. One provision
of the Act creates an additional $600 weekly benefit known as the Federal Pandemic Unemployment Com-
pensation (FPUC). The size of the payment—$600—was designed to replace 100 percent of the mean U.S.
wage when combined with mean state UI benefits.. 

Q: What is the ratio between the unemployment benefits to mean pre-tax wages?
A: As designed, the ratio of mean unemployment benefits to mean pre-tax wages under CARES is roughly
100%. However, this masks substantial heterogeneity. We find that 76% of unemployed workers have a
statutory replacement rate above 100%..

title: Fact Check: US Washington mayor exempted members of Congress from the mandatory 14 day quara...
text:
Claim: US Washington mayor exempted members of Congress from the mandatory 14 day quarantine, after travelling to a coronavirus high risk area to attend the funeral of John Lewis.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: Written nicely 

Evidence:

Q: Who was John Lewis?
A: John Lewis (Democratic Party) was a member of the U.S. House, representing Georgia's 5th Congressional District for 33 years until his death on July 17, 2020. Lewis’s body lay in state at the US Capitol, a rarely-bestowed honor.. 

Q: What were US Washington DC’s mayor's orders for non-essential travel in effect at the time of the funeral of John Lewis in order to curb the spread of COVID-19 ?
A: The order required members of Washington, DC, US and area to self-quarantine for 14 days after traveling for non-essential purposes from COVID-19 high-risk areas to the Washington District.. 

Q: What were US Washington DC’s mayor's orders for essential travel in effect at the time of the funeral of John Lewis in order to curb the spread of COVID-19 ?
A: Those who returned to the US capital after essential travel to a COVID-19 high-risk state needed to monitor themselves for symptoms of COVID-19 for two weeks, but they did not have to self-quarantine..

title: Fact Check: Devender Sharma ran an illegal kidney racket on the pretext of coronavirus.
text:
Claim: Devender Sharma ran an illegal kidney racket on the pretext of coronavirus.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Devender Sharma was already imprisoned by time the Covid pandemic started.

Evidence:

Q: Was Devender Sharma convicted of selling kidney's?
A: Yes. Dr Sharma ran an illegal kidney racket in the early 2000's.

Q: Did Devender Sharma murder over 100 people?
A: The amount of victims is unknown but believed to be over 50.. 

Q: Did Devender Sharma feed crocodiles with the bodies of his murder victims?
A: Sharma and his associates dumped bodies in a canal infested with crocodiles to get rid of evidence. It is unknown whether Sharma himself directly fed victims bodies to crocodiles..

title: Fact Check: The COVID-19 vaccine developed by Bharat Biotech will be available on the market...
text:
Claim: The COVID-19 vaccine developed by Bharat Biotech will be available on the market on August 15, 2020.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Q&A 1 shows a statement made by Principal Scientific Advisor K VijayRaghavan which said , indicating that the ICMR-Bharat Biotech vaccine is unlikely to be out by August 15 for 2020,  with Q&A 2 showing that it was expected fo early 2021 not 2020 at all as claimed.

Evidence:

Q: Will the COVID-19 vaccine developed by Bharat Biotech be available on the market on August 15, 2020?
A: No. India's COVID-19 vaccine candidates will go through a rigorous evaluation process that will not be compromised, the government's Principal Scientific Advisor K VijayRaghavan said on Friday, indicating that the ICMR-Bharat Biotech vaccine is unlikely to be out by August 15.

Q: When will the COVID-19 vaccine developed by Bharat Biotech be potentially approved?
A: August 15 2020. 

Q: Does the Indian government think the COVID-19 vaccine developed by Bharat Biotech will be available on the market on August 15, 2020?
A: India's COVID-19 vaccine candidates will go through a rigorous evaluation process that will not be compromised, the government's Principal Scientific Advisor K VijayRaghavan said on Friday, indicating that the ICMR-Bharat Biotech vaccine is unlikely to be out by August 15..

title: Fact Check: Kenya's judiciary does not get even 1% of the national budget.
text:
Claim: Kenya's judiciary does not get even 1% of the national budget.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: Evidence in the answer suggests that the amount is below 1% and at just 0.44% so the claim seems to be supported.

Evidence:

Q: What percentage of the country's budget does the judiciary in Kenya get?
A: With regards to budgetary allocation, in the year 2015/2016, Kshs. 
14.8B was allocated to the Judiciary, which translated to 0.96% 
of the total national budget. In the year 2016/2017, Kshs. 17.1B 
was allocated, which is 0.99% of the total national budget. In the 
year 2017/2018, the allocation reduced to Kshs. 14.2B translating 
to 0.69% of the total national budget. In the year 2018/2019, the 
allocation was Kshs. 14.5B translating to 0.43% of the total national 
budget. In the current financial year, the allocation stands at 18.8B, 
which is about 0.44% of the budget..

title: Fact Check: In 2018, South African police service officers were accused of 217 cases of tort...
text:
Claim: In 2018, South African police service officers were accused of 217 cases of torture and 3,661 cases of assault

Verdict: Supported

Justification: The second answer matches the number in the claim so the claim is supported.

Evidence:

Q: Who investigates alleged offences committed by SA police?
A: The IPID Act empowers the Department to investigate offences listed hereunder, allegedly committed by the
SAPS and the MPS members.
Section 28 (1) of the IPID Act:
(a) Any death in police custody
(b) Deaths as a result of police actions;
(c) Complaints relating to the discharge of an offi cial fi rearm by any police offi cer;
(d) Rape by a police offi cer, whether the police offi cer is on or off duty;
(e) Rape of any person in police custody;
Annual Report 2018 / 2019
17
(f) Any complaint of torture or assault against a police offi cer in the execution of his or her duties;
(g) Corruption matters within the police initiated by the Executive Director, or after a complaint from a member of
the public or referred to the Department by the Minister, Member of Executive Council (MEC) or the Secretary
for the Police Service;
(h) Any other matter referred to the IPID as a result of a decision by the Executive Director or if so requested by
the Minister, an MEC or the Secretary for the Police Service as the case may be.. 

Q: How many cases of torture and assault were reported o the IPID in 2018?
A: A total of 5 651 cases were reported to the IPID during the reporting period (2017/18) The majority of the cases reported were within
Section 28(1) (a) to (h). Of these, 3 661 were assault cases, 677 were cases of complaints of discharge of an official firearm(s), 436
were cases of deaths as a result of police action followed by 217 cases of torture..

title: Fact Check: A married couple in Florida, Tito and Amanda Watts, was arrested for selling fak...
text:
Claim: A married couple in Florida, Tito and Amanda Watts, was arrested for selling fake golden tickets to heaven to hundreds of people.

Evidence:

Q: Did married couple Tito and Amanda Watts from Florida get arrested for selling fake golden tickets to heaven?
A: No. UPDATE: This story turned out to be an April Fool’s joke, and unfortunately we fell for it. The story, which several other websites also reported as fact, originated on March 31 with the website Stuppid.com, and the photos of the fictional “Tito and Amanda Watts” came from this 2011 collection of bizarre mug shots. We apologize for publishing false information and regret this error.

title: Fact Check: There is a ‘global average’ for the number of judges and magistrates to number o...
text:

A: Yes. No it varies per country, for example: 
1.3 judges or magistrates for every 100,000 people in Kenya in 2014, 3.6 for South Africa in 2015, and 0.8 for the US and 8.7 for China in 2017.

title: Fact Check: Soon Ram Mandir will also have a kitchen and Bhojanalya, where devotees visiting...
text:

Q: Will the Ram Mandir have a kitchen that offers free meals?

The Trust plans to make regular meals and ‘Raghupati’ laddus for devotees in this kitchen. The trust started a community kitchen ‘Sita Rasoi’ in Sitamarhi, the birthplace of Sita where free meals are now being served. In Ayodhya, a similar kitchen will be started near Lord Ram Janambhoomi site, which will be named as ‘Ram Rasoi’.

title: Fact Check: With a population of about 48 million, Kenya has only one judge serving over 300...
text:

A: 47,564,296 according to 2019 census data.. 

Q: How many Judges were there in Kenya in 2019?
A: data from the judiciary shows there were 153 judges as of June 2019.. 

Q: What is 47,564,296/153?
A: 47,564,296/153 = 310877.751634

So rounded up is 310,878 people per judge..

title: Fact Check: an average of 400,000 cases being filed in Kenya's courts every year
text:
Claim: an average of 400,000 cases being filed in Kenya's courts every year

Verdict: Supported

Justification: QA 2 provides evidence of an average of 400k cases being filed every year over 5 years.
NB Linked source in QA 2 appears to be a fact check article (link not opening but address bar shows africacheck.org).

Evidence:

Q: The judiciary dosent even get even 1% of the budget ?
A: Maraga, who assumed office in 2016, asked for more funding as the judiciary does not even get 1% of the national budget. For the judiciary to operate properly  they should get at least 2.5% of the national budget. This claim is correct.. 

Q: Has there been  around 400,000 cases  filed in African courts every year ?
A: The most recent state of the judiciary report covers the 2018/19 financial year. Released in January 2020, it shows that more than two million cases were lodged in all courts between 2014/15 and 2018/19.. 

Q: Are only 300,000 cases disposed every year in Africa ?
A: Discussing the country’s case backlog, Maraga said the judiciary settles about 300,000 cases every year. This number was determined by the number of judges and magistrates and would only continue to pile up..

102,737 officers + 29,573 support staff = 132,310 total employees.

title: Fact Check: The South African Police Service kills three times more people per capita than t...
text:
Claim: The South African Police Service kills three times more people per capita than the United States police force

Verdict: Not Enough Evidence

Justification: Police in South Africa kill 2.8 times more than police in USA but the mapping police  violence project doesn't record instances of “people who were killed by a civilian driver or crashed without being hit directly by police during a police pursuit”. South Africa, on the other hand, records all deaths due to collisions “while being pursued by police”.

Based on the limitations of the available data and the number of deaths that may go unreported in both countries so , it is hard to say these are accurate.

Evidence:

Q: How many people were killed by US police officers in 2018?
A: Its researchers estimated that 1,140 people were killed by US police in 2018 – or 3.5 people per million. South Africa’s rate was 2.8 times larger.. 

Q: How many people were killed by South African police officers in 2018?
A: Clarke said he used Ipid’s 2017/18 figures on the number of people who died as a result of police action (558) and South Africa’s 2018 population estimate. Based on this, there were about 9.7 reported deaths as a result of police action for each million people in South Africa.. 

Q: Are these statistics likely accurate?
A: The Mapping Police Violence project does not record instances of “people who were killed by a civilian driver or crashed without being hit directly by police during a police pursuit”. South Africa, on the other hand, records all deaths due to collisions “while being pursued by police”.

Based on the limitations of the available data and the number of deaths that may go unreported in both countries, it is hard to say these are accurate..

title: Fact Check: face coverings/masks became “mandatory” in shops and indoor public spaces in Nor...

At a time when we would find comfort in embracing one another, love compels us to socially distance.”

Q: Are there any images of the funeral service that show social distancing?
A: Yes. Photo by Alyssa Pointer / POOL / AFP

title: Fact Check: Scores of politicians and others are on a “list” of sex cases from newly unseale...

text:

title: Fact Check: Ghislaine Maxwell tested positive for Covid-19 in jail.
text:
Claim: Ghislaine Maxwell tested positive for Covid-19 in jail.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The answers show that the claim was featured on a satirical website and is not true so the claim is refuted.

Evidence:

Q: Who is Ghislaine Maxwell?
A: Ghislaine Maxwell was, according to her accusers, Jeffrey Epstein’s protector and procurer, his girlfriend and his madam. She was, by all accounts, a soul mate and a mirror image. He grew up in Brooklyn with no money to speak of and never finished college. She is Paris-born, Oxford-educated, a jet-setter who partied with princes and billionaires.

Together, Epstein and Maxwell allegedly built what prosecutors, police and a growing number of women described as a sex-trafficking operation that crisscrossed the nation to provide Epstein with three young girls a day.. 

Q: Where did the article stating that Ghislaine Maxwell has tested positive for Covid-19 in jail occur?
A: The Brown Valley Observer. 

Q: Is the Brown Valley Observer a satirical news source?
A: Yes. This is an entertainment website written to satirize news events, politics, and popular faces and ideas, and to provide commentary on social attitudes and trends.
While familiar names of celebrities and other media figures as well as familiar agencies and organizations are used, all news stories contained within are fictional in nature. Most of the words and actions attributed to these figures are created entirely by the author, who has tiny, feminine hands, and who was once friend-zoned by his own sister.
The purpose of this site is to entertain. Failing that, we’ll settle for “bother” or “annoy”. We’re not a particularly proud publication.
Please do not attempt anything described in any of these articles, except under strict hip-hop supervision.
Similarities between events published here and any actual events involving pretty much anyone would really be a shame.

title: Fact Check: COVID Outbreak Discovered in Oregon Minks
text:
Claim: COVID Outbreak Discovered in Oregon Minks

Verdict: Supported

Justification: Minks tested positive for covid-19 

Evidence:

Q: Can Mink contract Covid_19?
A: Minks were infected following exposure from infected humans. Minks can act as a reservoir of SARS-CoV-2, passing the virus between them, and pose a risk for virus spill-over from mink to humans. People can then transmit this virus within the human population. Additionally, spill-back (human to mink transmission) can occur. It remains a concern when any animal virus spills in to the human population, or when an animal population could contribute to amplifying and spreading a virus affecting humans. As viruses move between human and animal populations, genetic modifications in the virus can occur. These changes can be identified through whole genome sequencing, and when found, experiments can study the possible implications of these changes on the disease in humans.. 

Q: Are minks susceptible to covid_19 ?
A: ink are highly susceptible to SARS-CoV-2, the virus that causes COVID-19. Pair this fact with the crowded, filthy conditions on fur farms, and a disastrous and deadly public health situation is inevitable.. 

Q: Was COVID Outbreak Discovered in Oregon Minks?A
A: Mink on fur farms in Michigan, Oregon, Utah, and Wisconsin have tested positive for COVID-19. Research now shows that infected mink may contract the virus from humans and can transmit SARS-CoV-2 back to humans. This cycle has led to the development of mutated strains of the virus. Wild mink have also tested positive for COVID-19 in Utah..

title: Fact Check: Reports as recent as 2017 reported 92% prevalence of blood lead poisoning in chi...
text:
Claim: Reports as recent as 2017 reported 92% prevalence of blood lead poisoning in children from some villages in the Nigerian state of Zamfara.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: Supported at 92.5% in QA Pair.

Evidence:

Q: Was there high level of child lead poisoning in Zamfara State Nigeria 2017 ?
A: The World Health Organization (WHO), which has been assisting the Government in managing the situation, called for Nigerian authorities to increase their commitment to combat lead poisoning by strengthening its capacity to diagnose, treat and manage it, as well as ensuring that all areas have been de-contaminated.

In a news release, WHO warned that lead poisoning cannot be successfully eliminated without significant changes to mining practices, including the relocation of ore processing activities and storage of ore materials away from villages.

Other necessary measures recommended by WHO include the adoption of processing methods that produce less dust, and hygiene measures such as removing contaminated clothes and washing before returning home.

Lead poisoning damages the nervous system and causes brain and blood disorders. Treatment is time-consuming and expensive as it involves undergoing long-term therapy with chelating agents, which remove heavy metals from the body.

Treatment also involves persuading people to adopt new practices and behaviours, something which requires an ongoing effort from authorities to continuously raise awareness and make sure the population follows preventive measures.

According to WHO, children in seven villages in Zamfara state require chelation therapy. This is in addition to the residents of seven other villages who have already received treatment. In these villages the combined effects of removing children from lead exposure and providing chelation therapy caused the child mortality rate to drop from 43 per cent to 1 per cent in one year.

Since the problem was discovered last year, $1.9 million has been provided by the UN Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF) to WHO and the UN Children’s Fund (UNICEF), which have been used to provide treatment, train doctors, provide quick diagnoses, and raise awareness about the hazards of lead.. 

Q: Was there a 92% prevalence of blood lead poisoning in Zamfara  due to gold mining?
A: No answer could be found.. 

Q: What was the reason behind  high levels of child lead poisoning in Zamfara State Nigeria?
A: Gold rush triggers deadly lead poisoning in Nigeria.

Furthermore, the scientific basis of such technologies is questionable. Oxygen saturation levels obtained from such technologies should not be trusted in the clinical assessment of patients.. 

Q: Can a Smartphone app measure blood pressure by asking you to press your index finger on the camera?

Q: Can a Smartphone app measure heart rate by asking you to press your index finger on the camera?
A: Smartphone manufacturers offer mobile health monitoring technology to their customers, including apps using the built-in camera for heart rate assessment..

title: Fact Check: Too much exposure to 5G, can literally fry the human central nervous system.

Evidence:

A: It is the next generation mobile phone network and it promises much higher connection speeds, lower latency (response times) and to be more reliable than the creaking 4G networks we have now.. 

Q: Can exposure to the 5G signal be bad for health?
A: At this time, there has been very little research showing that the RF waves used in 5G networks are any more (or less) of a concern than the other RF wavelengths used in cellular communication.. 

Q: Can 5G signals penetrate the body?
A: The higher frequency waves used for 5G are less able to penetrate the body than lower frequency waves currently used,  so in theory they might be less likely to have any potential health effects..

title: Fact Check: 5G towers unleash severely damaging level of radiation to DNA
text:
Claim: 5G towers unleash severely damaging level of radiation to DNA

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Answers states no evidence and not known to cause DNA damage.

Evidence:

Q: Do the radio frequency waves from cell towers cause health problems?
A: At this time, there’s no strong evidence that exposure to RF waves from cell phone towers causes any noticeable health effects.. 

Q: What type of radiation do RF waves produce?
A: Like FM radio waves, microwaves, visible light, and heat, they are forms of non-ionizing radiation.. 

Q: Does non-ionizing radiation damage DNA?
A: They do not directly damage the DNA inside cells, which is how stronger (ionizing) types of radiation such as x-rays, gamma rays, and ultraviolet (UV) rays are thought to be able to cause cancer..

title: Fact Check: Those most susceptible to the radiation from 5G technology are fetuses in utero ...
text:
Claim: Those most susceptible to the radiation from 5G technology are fetuses in utero and children.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Q&A 2 states that what is claimed 5G  exposure of foetuses and children is not well studied. However Q&A 3 states the 5g tech uses non-ionising type radiation which is shown to not be dangerous to dna, Also Q&A 4 shows that the WHO says it is safe for children

Evidence:

Q: Are children susceptible to the radiation from 5G technology?
A: Children have smaller heads than adults.  Cell phones and wireless radiation can go deeper into their brains because children have a shorter distance from their skull to their brain center.. 

Q: Are fetuses in utero susceptible to the radiation from 5G technology?
A: Cell-phone use has rapidly increased during the last several decades (1). Cell phones generate radio-frequency electromagnetic fields (RF-EMF), resulting in local exposure of the human body to RF-EMF. Concerns have been raised regarding the potential effects of RF-EMF exposure on human health. Short-term exposure in adults is regarded as safe; however, potential health effects of long-term exposure and exposure of fetuses and children are not well studied (2, 3).

The interpretation of results from epidemiologic studies evaluating health effects of RF-EMF exposure from cell-phone use is challenging. Because of the technical evolution of mobile communication systems, similar levels of cell-phone use do not necessarily induce similar levels of RF-EMF exposure. Users’ exposure to RF-EMF from third-generation (3G) devices is much lower than that from second-generation (2G) devices (4). More recent technologies (4G/5G) also differ from 3G devices, though less, in terms of users’ exposure.. 

Q: Does the radiation from 5G towers damage dna?
A: Like FM radio waves, microwaves, visible light, and heat, they are forms of non-ionizing radiation. This means they do not directly damage the DNA inside cells, which is how stronger (ionizing).

Q: Is there a relationship between male fertility and 5G radiation

A: According to the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) and expert studies, there is nothing to suggest that the 5G mmWave is a significant health risk..

title: Fact Check: APC is luring Abubakar Shekau with Vice Presidential ticket  as an inducement to...
text:
Claim: APC is luring Abubakar Shekau with Vice Presidential ticket  as an inducement to end Boko-Haram War.

Justification: It sees like the APC is not luring Abubakar Shekau with Vice Presidential ticket.  Especially, seeing as Abubakar Shekau is a globally wanted terrorist.  

Evidence:

Q: Is APC trying to lure out  Abubakar Shekau with Vice Presidential ticket as an inducement to end Boko-Haram War?
A: Kabir Adamu Ada, the Managing Director of Beacon Consulting, a security and intelligence outfit told The ICIR that “it will be suicidal if that should happen and I do not think that will happen”.

Kabir further explained that  Shekau is a globally wanted terrorist. He said, “the US has 7 million dollars bounty on his head and that is an internationally recognised bounty given the power of the US..

title: Fact Check: BLM injures 1000 police officers, kills36 people and does $8 billion in damage .
text:
Claim: BLM injures 1000 police officers, kills36 people and does $8 billion in damage .

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Only about 19 people have been confirmed dead as a result of the protests and about 700 police officers nationwide 

Evidence:

Q: Have there been news reports about how many people have been injured?
A: WASHINGTON — More than 700 law enforcement officers have been injured on the job during nationwide protests over the death of George Floyd — with nearly 300 of those among New York’s Finest, according to the Department of Justice and the NYPD.. 

Q: Is there any estimates of how much it has cost in damages?
A: Not an exact amount but estimates are made.

Prior to 2020, the costliest civil disorder event in U.S. was the 1992 Los Angeles riots, according to PCS, the insurance industry's primary source for compiling and reporting insured losses resulting from catastrophes, from hurricanes to wildfires.

That five-day event caused about $1.4 billion in 2020 dollars, according to PCS. Two days of riots following the funeral of Freddie Gray caused $26 million in losses in Baltimore alone.

Protests for police reform, racial injustice continue to spread across the USVideo
But losses stemming from the Floyd protests are likely to far exceed that. In Minneapolis, where some 400 businesses were damaged, owners and insurance experts estimate costs of the damage to exceed $500 million, according to the Minneapolis Star Tribune.. 

Q: How many people have died?
A: Though curfews are lifting and protests remain predominantly peaceful, the death toll from two weeks of demonstrations over the death of George Floyd continues to creep upward, with at least 19 people—a majority of whom are black—now dead..

title: Fact Check: Ghanan government presented inconsistent data about the Free Senior High School ...
text:
Claim: Ghanan government presented inconsistent data about the Free Senior High School programme in the 2020 Mid-year review budget.

Verdict: Supported

Evidence:

Q: Where was the SHS (Senior High School programme) mentioned in the Ghanan government 2020 Mid-year review budget?
A: In pages 45 and 98.. 

Q: What is the common year/form of the SHS that was mentioned in pages 45 and 98 of the report?
A: Form 3 students.. 

Q: How many form 3 SHS students were mentioned in page 45?
A: 362,108.

title: Fact Check: Clint Eastwood endorsed Donald Trump.
text:
Claim: Clint Eastwood endorsed Donald Trump.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: From the answer it seems quite clear that Clint Eastwood might have supported Donald Trump before, but will now not continue doing so. Therefore the claim is refuted

Evidence:

Q: Did Clint Eastwood express support for Donald Trump ?
A: Longtime Republican Clint Eastwood is pulling support from Donald Trump in the 2020 election. In an interview with the Wall Street Journal, the actor-director signaled that he thinks a different candidate would be the better choice.

“The best thing we could do is just get Mike Bloomberg in there,” he said.

After endorsing Mitt Romney and famously delivering a speech at the 2012 Republican National Convention to an empty chair that represented Barack Obama, Eastwood never officially backed Trump. In a 2016 interview, he expressed displeasure with Trump and Hillary Clinton, saying there’s “much funny business on both sides of the aisle.”

He praised Trump at the time because he was “onto something” and “secretly everybody’s getting tired of political correctness, kissing up.”

“We’re really in a p—y generation. Everybody’s walking on eggshells. We see people accusing people of being racist and all kinds of stuff. When I grew up, those things weren’t called racist,” he said.

Now, he’s changed his tune a bit on Trump.

While he approves of “certain things” the president has done, he wishes that he would act “in a more genteel way, without tweeting and calling people names. I would personally like for him to not bring himself to that level,” he said.

Eastwood also touched on the controversy surrounding Olivia Wilde’s character, Kathy Scruggs, in his 2019 film “Richard Jewell.” He showed Scruggs, the real-life reporter who alleged Jewell planted a bomb at the 1996 Olympics, sleeping with an FBI source to get information. Lawyers for the Atlanta Journal-Constitution, the newspaper at which Scruggs worked, called the portrayal “entirely false and malicious, and…extremely defamatory and damaging.” The film was Clintwood’s worst opening in 40 years.

The director defended his right to cinematic freedom and said the newspaper was trying to shroud its “guilt” over a “reckless story.”

“Well, she hung out at a little bar in town, where mostly police officers went,” he said.

title: Fact Check: US drug prices in 2019 went down for the first time in 51 years.
text:
Claim: US drug prices in 2019 went down for the first time in 51 years.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: It's clear that drug prices have gone down several time in the last 51 years, with several peaks and falls. 

Evidence:

Q: During 2019 as the period referenced in the claim, what did official statistics report regarding price reduction for US consumer prescription drug prices?
A: The Bureau of Labor Statistics CPI for All Urban Consumers (CPI-U) shows Prescription drugs in U.S. city average, all urban consumers, seasonally adjusted shows decreased year-over-year figures for several months in 2019. This was the longest sustained drop in the measure since the early 1970s.. 

Q: Prior to 2019 when were price reductions reported for US consumer prescription drugs?
A: The period of sustained year-over-year month drops in prescription drug prices began in December 2018, prior to 2019. Prior to 2019 year-over-year month price drops also include July 2013.. 

Q: Have Drug prices ever decreased in the the 51 years previous of the claim in the USA?
A: They have Decreased several times since the 70s as shown in the troughs and peaks of the source graph attached to this question..

title: Fact Check: PM Modi has not imposed President’s rule even a single time since 2014.
text:
Claim: PM Modi has not imposed President’s rule even a single time since 2014.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Q&A 1 shows President's rule has been imposed several times after 2014.and since Q&A 3 shows Modi has been in power since 2014 then this fully refutes the claim that he has never used the rule.

Evidence:

Q: Is it true that PM Modi has never imposed President rule ?
A: The claim is False. President's rule has been imposed several times after 2014.
It has been imposed in following states -
Andhra Pradesh: March 1, 2014 — June 2, 2014
Maharashtra: September 28, 2014 — October 31, 2014
Jammu And Kashmir: January 9, 2015 — March 1, 2015
Delhi: February 14, 2014 — February 13, 2015

And many more times.. 

Q: What's meant by imposing president's rule?
A: According to Article 356 of the constitution, President’s rule can be imposed in a state “if a situation has arisen in which the government of the state cannot be carried on in accordance with the provisions of the constitution." 
Typically, president’s rule is imposed when a state government loses its majority or in the case of a split within the ruling party or withdrawal of support by a coalition partner. 
President’s rule also comes into effect in the event of a post-poll scenario, where no party or coalition is in a position to form a new government. There are also situations where a chief minister has tendered his resignation for various reasons like disqualification by the courts or in Arvind Kejriwal’s case, failing to pass the Jan Lok Pal bill in February 2014.. 

Q: Since when has been Narendra Modi the prime minister of India?
A: Since May 2014 till now..

title: Fact Check: County governments in Kenya have continued to adhere to the two-thirds gender pr...
text:
Claim: County governments in Kenya have continued to adhere to the two-thirds gender principle. Three counties of Kilifi, Nyeri and Migori have gone higher and have a 50/50 representation of male and female CECs (county executive committee members).

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Some counties did indeed adhere to the two-thirds gender principle but some did not. 

Evidence:

Q: In 2018/2019, did all of Kenya's county governments achieve the two-thirds gender principle that is detailed in the constitution?
A: According to the Kenyan National Statistics Office, 39 county cabinets had adhered to the gender principle. However some counties failed, including Kitui.. 

Q: Did the Kenyan county of Kitui adhere to the gender principle in 2018 and ensure that no more than two-thirds of the elective were of the same gender?
A: No they did not.. 

Q: What is Kenya's two-thirds gender rule?
A: Kenya’s constitution prescribes that “not more than two-thirds of the members of elective or appointive bodies shall be of the same gender”..

title: Fact Check: Sanitation coverage in Kenya is now at 25%, from 16%.
text:
Claim: Sanitation coverage in Kenya is now at 25%, from 16%.

Verdict: Not Enough Evidence

Justification: Additional QAs could be formulated.
What do UNICEF and other funding authorities report about sanitation facilities in Kenya around time of the claim? Is there media reportage on sanitation status in Kenya around the time of the claim. 


Evidence:

Q: What does "sanitation coverage" mean in Kenya?
A: Sewered sanitation coverage refers to the number of people served with flush or pour-flush to
piped sewer systems, as a percentage of the total population within the service area of the
utility. It measures the performance of utilities with sewerage systems in delivering sanitation
services to consumers.. 

Q: What percentage of Kenya's population had sanitation in 2020?
A: No answer could be found.. 

Q: What percentage of Kenya's population had sanitation in 2019?
A: 17%.

title: Fact Check: Federal High Court has restrained Godwin Obaseki, the incumbent Edo state govern...

He also alleged that Obaseki’s defection to the party, a few days to the primary, was unreasonable and aimed at destabilising other aspirants..

A: The court ordered that the PDP and the electoral umpire should not exempt any of the aspirants who have been cleared by the party from participating in the gubernatorial primary slated for the 25th June 2020..

title: Fact Check: [The allocation to agriculture] is an increase of 0.6% from what was reported la...
text:
Claim: [The allocation to agriculture] is an increase of 0.6% from what was reported last year.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: - Q&A 2 shows 6.9% allocated to agriculture in 2020 (time of claim)
- Q&A 2 shows 6.7% allocated the year before which is 0.2% less than 2019  and not the +0.6% increase as claimed

Evidence:

Q: What was the percentage difference in agriculture allocation, compared to last years allocation in Kenya.
A: Counties have made remarkable achievements towards the realization of 100 per cent
food and nutrition security. To achieve this, County Governments have focused on
improving both crop and animal productivity. Some of the key interventions are:
 Empowerment of farmers through mechanization of production systems
evidenced by the purchase of 366 tractors and equipping of 26 Agriculture
mechanization stations offering lease services to rural farmers.
 Distribution of over 2 Million 50-kgs bags of subsidized fertilizer.
 Under the County subsidies arrangements, 1400 greenhouses have also been
purchased and distributed to farmers in the year under review.
 Enhanced uptake of commercialized agriculture through construction of over 140
markets that provided direct access to markets for farmers
 Vaccination of 46 Million Livestock and construction of over 500 cattle dips that
has improved disease control and surveillance.
Provision of over 1 million recorded Artificial Insemination Services to livestock
farmers and purchase of over 300 Milk coolers distributed as input subsidies to
farmer’s co-operatives. In return this has enhanced animal productivity and value
addition on raw products.
 County Governments have allocated on average 6.7 % of their total budgets to the
Agriculture sector. This is just 3% less of the 10% recommended allocation as per
the Comprehensive Africa Agriculture Development Program (CAADP) Malabo
declaration. The achievement of the 10% required or more would be realized if the
devolved monies held at the Ministry of Agriculture, Livestock and Irrigation, are
released to Counties. The Council will continue to pursue reforms in this sector to
ensure the best interest of the farmers in the Counties is achieved.
 On the overall, the performance of the agriculture sector in the year 2018/2019
significantly improved as per the Economic Survey report 2019. Compared to
2017/2018, maize production increased by 26.0 % from 35.4 million bags. 

Q: What was the percentage allocation for agriculture in 2019?
A: County Governments have allocated on average 6.7 % of their total budgets to the
Agriculture sector. This is just 3% less of the 10% recommended allocation as per
the Comprehensive Africa Agriculture Development Program (CAADP) Malabo
declaration.. 

Q: What was the percentage allocation for agriculture in 2020?
A: 6.9%.

title: Fact Check: Water coverage now stands at 63%, up from 57% in Kenya.
text:
Claim: Water coverage now stands at 63%, up from 57% in Kenya.

Verdict: Not Enough Evidence

Justification: there isn't enough data from the year of the claim to confirm if the water coverage has gone up to 63%

Evidence:

Q: What is the definition of Water Coverage?
A: 1.1	Water Coverage	Population with access to water services (either with direct service connection or within reach of a public water point) as a percentage of the /total population under utility’s nominal responsibility. 

Q: Which organisation in Kenya monitors Water Coverage in that country?
A: Water Services Regulatory Board. (WASREB)

Their mandate states their powers and functions include:
'Determine and prescribe national standards for the provision of water services and asset development for water services providers.'. 

Q: At the time of the claim (July 23 2020) what did the Water Services Regulatory Board say about water coverage in Kenya?
A: The Water Services Regulatory Board (WASREB) has released the 12th issue of Impact Report. The report is meant to give feedback to the public on how the water services sector is performing, with a view to holding to account institutions charged with service delivery. The report relies on data collected annually from Water Service Providers (WSPs) through the Water Regulation Information System (WARIS).  The 12th edition covers the period 2018/2019 and analyses the performance of 87 Water Service Providers and 47 Counties..

title: Fact Check: Mandatory vaccinations is in direct violation of the Nuremberg Code.
text:
Claim: Mandatory vaccinations is in direct violation of the Nuremberg Code.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Q&A 2 and 3 show that vaccination is not even mentioned in the Nuremberg  code so makes the main point in the claim Null, as mandatory vaccination cannot be a violation of the code if there in no mention of vaccination at all.

Evidence:

Q: What is the Nuremberg Code?
A: The Nuremberg Code is a 10-point set of rules for the conduct of human experiments articulated in 1947 in the trials of Nazi doctors and bureaucrats convicted of crimes against humanity for their roles in concentration camp experiments.. 

Q: What does the Nuremberg Code say about vaccines and vaccinations?
A: Nothing.. 

Q: So doe's the Nuremburg code have anything to do with Vaccines ?
A: No, it only addresses Human experimentation. Vaccines are not mentioned at any point..

title: Fact Check: Man dies at the R N Cooper Hospital in Mumbai due to medical negligence.

Q: Did the BMC address this claim?
A: Yes. He was bleeding from mouth&was immediately given primary aid. Symptoms of pneumonia were seen. Symptoms of pneumonia&COVID are similar, cause of death was registered as pneumonia&suspected COVID. As per ICMR protocol his body was handed over to Police but family got agitated: BMC
Hospital mgmt did what was prescribed under ICMR guidelines & patient was immediately admitted and was given the required treatment. So this is not true that there was some carelessness by the hospital. Allegations on Hospital and Municipal authorities are unfortunate: BMC

Q: What is the ICMR?
A: ICMR- National Centre for Disease Informatics and Research.

title: Fact Check: Greenhouse gases emitted into the ocean are causing more holes in the ozone laye...
text:
Claim: Greenhouse gases emitted into the ocean are causing more holes in the ozone layer; the ozone layer has holes in it, causing global temperatures to rise.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Greenhouse gas doesn't cause holes in the ozone layer, and holes in the ozone doesn't contribute much to rising global temperatures

Evidence:

Q: What causes holes in the ozone layer?
A: ...bromine gases from human-produced chlorofluorocarbons (CFCs) and halons have destroyed ozone molecules.. 

Q: Are the ozone holes causing the global temperature to rise?
A: Because the ozone layer normally blocks ultraviolet (UV) light, an ozone hole allows more UV light than usual to reach the surface. However, the additional energy added to the Earth system from the ozone hole is so small that it couldn’t be responsible for the warming trend that’s been occurring.. 

Q: What are the main causes of global warming?
A: The main driver of climate change is the greenhouse effect. Some gases in the Earth's atmosphere act a bit like the glass in a greenhouse, trapping the sun's heat and stopping it from leaking back into space and causing global warming.

Many of these greenhouse gases occur naturally, but human activities are increasing the concentrations of some of them in the atmosphere, in particular:

carbon dioxide (CO2)
methane
nitrous oxide
fluorinated gases
CO2 produced by human activities is the largest contributor to global warming. By 2020, its concentration in the atmosphere had risen to 48% above its pre-industrial level (before 1750)..

Masks should be used as part of a comprehensive ‘Do it all!’ approach including physical distancing, avoiding crowded, closed and close-contact settings, good ventilation, cleaning hands, covering sneezes and coughs, and more.

Depending on the type, masks can be used for either protection of healthy persons or to prevent onward transmission..

Q: What is the New England Journal of Medicine's (NEJM) advice concerning the wearing of face masks?

We already know a lot about other viruses in the coronavirus family and most of these types of viruses have an origin in animals. The COVID-19 virus (also called SARS-CoV-2) is a new virus in humans. The possible animal source of COVID-19 has not yet been confirmed but research is ongoing..

A: Several dogs and cats (domestic cats and tigers) in contact with infected humans have tested positive for COVID-19.

A: Areas of focus will be:

    Health
    Jobs/Training/Reskilling/Upskilling
    Support to Small Businesses
    Housing

The programs will be executed through the company’s 90 local U.S. market presidents and non-U.S.. 

Q: Is this money going to the actual organisation "black lives matter"?
A: No. This isn’t true. Bank of America announced it would donate the funds over the next four years to communities of color and minority-owned businesses that have experienced a greater impact from the COVID-19 health crisis.

title: Fact Check: if the Trump administration “had done its job, the virus wouldn’t come” to New Y...
text:
Claim: if the Trump administration “had done its job, the virus wouldn’t come” to New York

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: It seems that there is no mention of the Trump Administration being the cause of New York having Covid-19 cases. It also looks like 51% of Americans say the president is going an excellent/good job - whilst only 48% think he is doing a fair/poor job.

Evidence:

Q: Was Trump administration  to blame for the COVID-19 virus spread in  New York ?
A: Trump receives his most positive ratings for how he is addressing the economic needs of businesses facing financial difficulties. About half of Americans (51%) say the president is doing an excellent or good job addressing the needs of businesses, while 48% say Trump is doing an only fair or poor job.. 

Q: What was Trump administration response to Covid-19 ?
A: Chairman Pallone, Ranking Member Walden and distinguished members of this committee. It is an honor to appear before you today to discuss the Department of Health and Human Services’ ongoing response to the COVID-19 pandemic.  We are grateful for this opportunity to address how each of our agencies and office are harnessing innovation to prevent, diagnose, and treat the novel coronavirus SARs-CoV-2.

COVID-19 is a new disease, caused by a novel (or new) coronavirus that has not previously been seen in humans. This new disease, officially named Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) by the World Health Organization (WHO), is caused by the SARS-CoV-2 virus.  There are many types of human coronaviruses including some that commonly cause mild upper-respiratory tract illnesses. Coronaviruses are a large family of viruses.  Some cause illness in people, and others, such as canine and feline coronaviruses, only infect animals. Rarely, coronaviruses that infect animals have emerged to infect people and can spread between people. This is suspected to have occurred for the virus that causes COVID-19.  Middle East Respiratory Syndrome (MERS) and Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome (SARS) are two other examples of coronaviruses that originated in animals and then spread to people..

title: Fact Check: A motorcycle fatality in Orlando Florida was counted as a COVID death.
text:
Claim: A motorcycle fatality in Orlando Florida was counted as a COVID death.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: It seems that while the fault was made initially form the question and asnwer pairs, it was removed afterwards. Therefore the claim is refuted

Evidence:

Q: What is the nature of the data/tally of Covid-19 deaths
A: Provisional death counts are based on death certificate data received and coded by the National Center for Health Statistics as of March 8, 2021. Death counts are delayed and may differ from other published sources (see Technical Notes). Counts will be updated periodically. 

Q: When was a motorcycle death in Orlando classified as a COVID-19 death
A: A spokesman for the Florida Department of Health in Orange County said it was reviewed and removed, but he didn't know exactly when. 

Q: Is the motorcycle death listed as a COVID death by the Orlando department of Health
A: Kent Donahue, from Dr. Pino's office, said the motorcyclist's death "was reviewed and he was taken off the list for COVID fatalities.

“The 16th of March is the day that I came to this House and said that all unnecessary social contact should cease. That is precisely when the lockdown was started.”.

title: Fact Check: Azerbaijan has threatened to bomb the nuclear power plant in Armenia.
text:
Claim: Azerbaijan has threatened to bomb the nuclear power plant in Armenia.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: The ongoing tensions between the two countries has led to the deaths of many people in recent years, showing no signs of resolution

Evidence:

Q: Has Azerbaijan government threatened to bomb the nuclear plant in Armenia?
A: Yes. "The Armenian side must not forget that our army's state-of-the-art missile systems allow us to strike the Metsamor nuclear plant with precision, which could lead to a great catastrophe for Armenia," Vagif Dargahli, the Azerbaijani Defense Ministry spokesman, said on July 16, hours after hostilities had resumed following a one-day lull.

Q: Why has the Azerbaijan government threatened to bomb the nuclear plant in Armenia?
A: The July 16 warning drew outrage from Yerevan and deepened concerns that the worst violence in four years between Azerbaijan and Armenia, who are technically still in a war begun in the late 1980s, could quickly spiral out of control.

At least 16 Azerbaijanis and Armenians have died in the fighting near a northern section of their internationally recognized border that has included heavy artillery, tank, and drone attacks since it began on July 12.

Yerevan and Baku routinely threaten and accuse the other of provocations that have killed dozens of people in recent years, many of them civilians, with neither side willing to back down publicly for fear of being viewed as weak in the more than 30-year-long standoff.. 

Q: Did U.S celebrity Kim Kardashian tweet about the warning ?
A: Yes. American media personality Kim Kardashian West, whose father has Armenian heritage, posted a message about the fighting on social media.

title: Fact Check: John Hickenlooper, the former Governor of Colorado accepted donations from Anada...
text:
Claim: John Hickenlooper, the former Governor of Colorado accepted donations from Anadarko Petroleum Corp, a oil and gas company involved in a 2017 fatal explosion, in exchange for the company not being penalized.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: the company was fined for violating four rules, there is no evidence that any donations accepted by John Hickenlooper was an exchange for not penalising the company. 

Evidence:

Q: Did John Hickenlooper, the former Governor of Colorado, accept donations from Anadarko Petroleum Corp, an oil and gas company involved in a 2017 fatal explosion?
A: Yes. Among the biggest donors was the former Anadarko Oil and Gas. The company donated $25,000 to the governor’s office in 2017, just days after a deadly explosion in Firestone was tied to a leaking underground pipeline owned by the company. Over the course of four years, it gave the governor’s office more than $330,000, money for which there is little accounting.

Q: Had Anadarko Petroleum Corp donated to Hickenlooper’s administration prior to the Firestone accident?
A: Yes. A Hickenlooper campaign spokesperson told us the company had already contributed nearly $219,000 to Hickenlooper’s administration prior to the Firestone accident.

Q: Is there evidence to suggest that the donated money by  Anadarko Petroleum Corp to Hickenlooper’s administration was a form of pay off?
A: No. The analysis found no evidence that the donations were connected to official action taken by Hickenlooper’s administration.

title: Fact Check: US Businesses that refuse any legal tender can be fined and sued.
text:
Claim: US Businesses that refuse any legal tender can be fined and sued.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: The bill prevents businesses from refusing cash 

Evidence:

Q: Is there any federal law in the United States that says merchants must accept cash?
A: There is no federal law that says merchants must accept cash. But a handful of states and municipalities have passed laws barring businesses from refusing cash.. 

Q: What happens if any United States business refuses to accept any legal tender?
A: The business and or establishments would get levy fines against them if they refuse cash payment.. 

Q: Is there a provision of the law in the US that allows a business to be sued and fined for refusing to accept any legal tender ?
A: This bill will prohibit food-service and retail establishments from
refusing to accept cash as a form of payment. It would also levy fines
against establishments if they refuse cash payment..

A: No. 'It will ensure that 100 percent of returning citizens
have access to transitional housing upon reentry from jail or prison.

title: Fact Check: Betting on online slot machines has increased by 25% during lockdown.
text:

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Slot machine USERS increased by 25% but not in usage. 

Evidence:

Q: How was the 25% increase in slot machine usage during lockdown calculated?
A: The figure was obtained by comparing the number of players involved in slot machine usage in March 2019 (2,095,824) with usage in March 2020 (2,618,165). This was a year on year increase of 25% in users, but not in usage of slot machines, which fell by 2%..

"With no vaccine to protect against influenza infection and no antibiotics to treat secondary bacterial infections that can be associated with influenza infections, control efforts worldwide were limited to non-pharmaceutical interventions such as isolation, quarantine, good personal hygiene, use of disinfectants, and limitations of public gatherings, which were applied unevenly.".

title: Fact Check: Biden plans to "mandate net-zero carbon emissions for homes, offices and all new...
text:

Q: What are Zero energy buildings
A: Zero energy buildings combine energy efficiency and renewable energy generation to consume only as much energy as can be produced onsite through renewable resources over a specified time period. 

Q: Are energy efficient buildings supposed to be windowless
A: No. The energy efficient buildings are meant to use high-performance windows that meet ENERGY STAR v5.0 and v6.0 specifications (depending on climate zone). The required U and solar heat gain coefficient (SHGC) values are shown below, effective 8/22/2016.

title: Fact Check: One of the key elements of the Biden-Sanders Unity Task Force Recommendations (B...
text:
Claim: One of the key elements of the Biden-Sanders Unity Task Force Recommendations (Biden, the presumptive Democratic presidential nominee, and Sanders, the leading voice for the most progressive Democrats Biden-Sanders (Biden, the presumptive US Democratic presidential nominee, and Sanders, the leading voice for the most progressive US Democrats) is that all charter schools will be abolished.

Verdict: Refuted

Evidence:

Q: What was stated in the Biden-Sanders Unity Task Force Recommendations regarding charter schools?
A: ...we will ban for-profit private charter
businesses from receiving federal funding. And we recognize the need for more stringent
guardrails to ensure charter schools are good stewards of federal education funds. We support
measures to increase accountability for charter schools, including by requiring all charter schools
to meet the same standards of transparency as traditional public schools, including with regard to
civil rights protections, racial equity, admissions practices, disciplinary procedures, and school
finances. We will call for conditioning federal funding for new, expanded charter schools or for
charter school renewals on a district’s review of whether the charter will systematically
underserve the neediest students..

title: Fact Check: Biden plans to stop all deportation.
text:
Claim: Biden plans to stop all deportation.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Joe Biden's plan does not permanently stop deportations; instead, it calls for a 100-day moratorium on deportations of people already in the country (not people arriving at the border). The task force recommended that during the pause there be a full-scale review of U.S. deportation practices. Hence, the claim is refuted.

Evidence:

Q: What does Biden's plan say about deportation?
A: The plan doesn’t say to permanently stop deportations. It calls for a 100-day moratorium on deportations of people already in the country (not people arriving at the border). The task force recommended that during the pause, there be a full-scale review of U.S. deportation practices..

title: Fact Check: The US Biden-Sanders unity task force seeks to abolish immigration detention in ...
text:

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The only Q&A pair states that the Biden admin only want to end 'for profit' centres and improve the detention centres overall, not abolish detention centres as is claimed.

Evidence:

Q: What is the intention of the Biden-Sanders unity task force as regards immigration
A: We believe detention should be a last resort, not the default. Democrats will prioritize
investments in more effective and cost-efficient community-based alternatives to detention. We
will end for-profit detention centers and ensure that any facility where migrants are being
detained is held to the highest standards of care and guarantees the safety and dignity of families.
Detention of children should be restricted to the shortest possible time, with their access to
education and proper care ensured..

title: Fact Check: The Democrats want to rejoin the Paris Climate Accord and seek an even higher le...
text:
Claim: The Democrats want to rejoin the Paris Climate Accord and seek an even higher level of restrictions on climate change.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: It seems from the QA that some individuals indeed do want to rejoin the Paris Climate Accord. Therefore, the label is supported

Evidence:

Q: Do the Democrats want to rejoin the Paris Climate Accord and seek an even higher level of restrictions on climate change?
A: Some Democratic candidates have said they will make the goals of the Paris climate agreement more ambitious.

Former Vice President Joe Biden’s climate plan states that he’ll ramp up the targets of the agreement, make the commitments more transparent and enforceable, and, more broadly, integrate climate change into his foreign policy strategy. That includes conditioning trade agreements on partners meeting targets for cutting emissions.

Massachusetts Sen. Elizabeth Warren proposed a plan to address climate change in her approach to national security. She wants the Pentagon to achieve net-zero carbon emissions for its non-combat bases and infrastructure by 2030..

title: Fact Check: Border-wall construction under the Trump administration has replaced already exi...
text:
Claim: Border-wall construction under the Trump administration has replaced already existing barriers.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: Only 3 miles were newly built under Trump, the rest were replacements for already existing walls 

Evidence:

Q: How many miles of wall existed when Trump took office?
A: When Trump took office, 655 miles of the nearly 2,000-mile border between the U.S. and Mexico already had barriers. Most were constructed during the presidencies of Barack Obama and George W. Bush, who in 2006 signed the Secure Fence Act, authorizing “hundreds of miles of additional fencing.”. 

Q: How much of the wall built during Trump's administration, was new wall?
A: According to CNN's fact-checker, Daniel Dale, official figures as of June 19 show that out of the 216 miles built since January 2017, only three miles were new. The rest, according to Dale, replaced old barriers or were secondary barriers..

title: Fact Check: The Biden-Sanders unity platform includes a plan to appoint social justice prose...
text:
Claim: The Biden-Sanders unity platform includes a plan to appoint social justice prosecutors in order to free violent criminals.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Aim is to reduce incarceration time without compromising public safety

Evidence:

Q: What is the Biden-Ssnders unity platform?
A: A 110-page document of policy recommendations is the product of weeks of negotiations between six- and eight-person “Unity Task Forces” appointed by Biden (the presumptive Democratic nominee Joe Biden) and Bernie Sanders, the former vice president’s longest-lasting rival in the Democratic presidential primary. 
The task forces drafted a joint approach to climate change, criminal justice, the economy, education, health care and immigration underscoring the party’s unity less than four months from November’s general election.. 

Q: What does the Biden-Sanders unity platform document state with regard to the appointment of prosecutors?
A: Appointing Prosecutors: Appoint people committed to criminal justice reform to key prosecutorial positions, including AG (Attorney General), DAG (Deputy Attorney General) and U.S. Attorneys.. 

Q: Does the Biden-Sanders unity platform document include a plan to free violent criminals?
A: No. The document includes a plan to support state prosecutors to ensure public safety while reducing incarceration.

title: Fact Check: Abolish immigration detention. No more detention. You come in here illegally, no...

Claim: Abolish immigration detention. No more detention. You come in here illegally, no more detention.

Verdict: Refuted
