title: Fact Check: Donald Trump claimed that Biden's mandate for net zero carbon emissions for home...
text:
Claim: Donald Trump claimed that Biden's mandate for net zero carbon emissions for home, offices and new buildings would mean no windows.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: This claim is refuted. According to the QA pairs, there is quite literally nothing in Biden's mandate that means "no windows" to combat carbon emissions. The mandate explains that emissions need to be reduced by 50% to pre-2005 levels. There was not a single mention of "no windows" anywhere as the claim states. Therefore, this claim is refuted.

Evidence:

Q: What is Joe Biden's net zero carbon emissions plan by 2030?
A: The Biden administration has committed to reduce those emissions 50% by 2030 below 2005 levels. That’s a critical first step of a global energy transition that must achieve net-zero emissions by midcentury to limit warming to 1.5 degrees Celsius (2.7 F) and thereby avert the worst impacts of climate change.. 

Q: What is the specific buildings plan?
A: A net-zero emissions building portfolio by 2045, including a 50 percent emissions reduction by 2032.. 

Q: Does net-zero mean having no windows in buildings?
A: Net-zero really has nothing to say about whether you can have windows or not. As can be seen in the photo above, this important net-zero building has lots of windows..

title: Fact Check: Under Biden’s policy, immigrants in the country illegally "get welfare benefits....
text:
Claim: Under Biden’s policy, immigrants in the country illegally "get welfare benefits. United States citizens don't get what they're looking to give illegal immigrants.

Evidence:

Q: Do illegal immigrants in the USA get welfare benefits ?
A: The task force recommended that Biden extend health care coverage to immigrants illegally in the country by allowing them to purchase insurance through the Affordable Care Act marketplace, and allowing them to have health care coverage during a pandemic. Being allowed to buy health insurance isn’t the same as getting welfare.. 

Q: Can illegal immigrants buy health care?
A: Immigrants illegally in the country currently are not eligible to buy health insurance offered through the Health Insurance Marketplace created under the Affordable Care Act. However, they may be eligible for Emergency Medicaid to cover emergency medical needs..

title: Fact Check: Migrant arrests and expulsions in the US along the southern border are down.
text:
Claim: Migrant arrests and expulsions in the US along the southern border are down.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: True

Evidence:

Q: Was overall migrant movement down in 2020 due to the wall being built?
A: Border Patrol agents apprehended about half as many migrants at the U.S.-Mexico border in fiscal 2020 as they did the year before, according to newly released federal data. The sharp drop in the number of apprehended migrants follows a virtual shutdown of the border and new restrictions in the way asylum cases are handled in response to the coronavirus outbreak.

Following a dramatic rise in fiscal 2019, apprehensions at the U.S.-Mexico border fell by about half in fiscal 2020 as COVID-19 closed borders. There were 400,651 apprehensions in the 2020 fiscal year (October 2019-September 2020), a 53% decrease from the previous fiscal year, when apprehensions soared to their highest level in 12 years.. 

Q: What happened to immigration numbers in 2020
A: After surging in 2019, migrant apprehensions at U.S.-Mexico border fell sharply in fiscal 2020.

title: Fact Check: The Biden-Sanders agenda proposes to end cash bail, releasing dangerous criminal...
text:
Claim: The Biden-Sanders agenda proposes to end cash bail, releasing dangerous criminals onto US streets.

Verdict: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

Justification: The proposal is to end cash bail, unless the person is deemed dangerous or likely to skip court.

Evidence:

Q: Do the Biden-Sanders Unity Task Force recommendations support ending cash bail?
A: Democrats support eliminating the use
of cash bail and believe no one should be imprisoned merely for failing to pay fines or fees.. 

Q: Is the End Cash Bail proposal aimed at dangerous criminals?
A: No. Such concerns led California to make the controversial decision in August 2018 to eliminate cash bail altogether, a move that the bail bond industry blocked pending a 2020 statewide referendum. In the new system, judges would detain defendants pretrial only if they are deemed dangerous or likely to skip court.

Q: Are there states that don't have the authority to determine if someone is dangerous for pre-trial release?
A: Thanks to a 1971 law, New York is the only state in the country where judges don’t have the authority to consider a person’s possible “dangerousness” in determining the conditions of their release before trial. When reform negotiations in the state began and the door was opened to modifying that system, some lawmakers wanted to add dangerousness as a sanctioned factor for pre-trial release, in exchange for the total abolition of bail in the state. Progressive reformers bristled—arguing that too often, judges ascribe dangerousness in ways that amplify the racial discrimination that pervades the justice system. Ultimately, they pursued a compromise that did not add dangerousness but preserved bail only for the most serious crimes..

title: Fact Check: Philippine Depositary Receipts are equal to actual ownership in the Philippines.
text:
Claim: Philippine Depositary Receipts are equal to actual ownership in the Philippines.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: They don't serve as evidence of ownership in the Philippines 

Evidence:

Q: What are PDRs?
A: PDRs are forms of securities that grant holders the right to the delivery of sale of underlying shares.. 

Q: Are they equal to actual ownership?
A: PDRs are forms of securities that grant holders the right to the delivery of sale of underlying shares. They are, however, “not evidences [sic] or statements nor certificates of ownership of a corporation,” according to the Philippine Stock Exchange (PSE)..

title: Fact Check: Clinical trials have been completed for potential Russian COVID-19 vaccine.
text:
Claim: Clinical trials have been completed for potential Russian COVID-19 vaccine.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The vaccine was only at the first phase of the trial when the claim was made 

Evidence:

Q: When was the claim made?
A: July 2020. 

Q: How many stages are there in vaccine trials?
A: There are 4 phases of biomedical clinical trials:

* Phase I studies usually test new drugs for the first time in a small group of people
* Phase II studies test treatments that have been found to be safe in phase I but now need a larger group of human subjects
* Phase III studies are conducted on larger populations and in different regions and countries,
* Phase IV studies take place after country approval and there is a need for further testing in a wide population over a longer timeframe.. 

Q: Did Russia have a potential COVID-19 vaccine in July 2020.
A: No. The vaccine was only in Phase one at this time, It had not completed all clinical trials.

title: Fact Check: The Obama administration stopped testing during the H1N1, Swine Flu, pandemic.
text:
Claim: The Obama administration stopped testing during the H1N1, Swine Flu, pandemic.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: It seems from the last QA that the testing did not stop, it was the reporting that became less frequent, therefore the label is refuted

Evidence:

Q: Did the US stop testing for H1n1?
A: Individual case counts were kept early during the 2009 H1N1 outbreak when the 2009 H1N1 virus first emerged. As the outbreak expanded and became more widespread, individual case counts become increasingly impractical and not representative of the true extent of the outbreak. This isbecause only a small proportion of persons with respiratory illness are actually tested and confirmed for influenza (including 2009 H1N1) so the true benefit of keeping track of these numbers is questionable. In addition, the extensive spread of 2009 H1N1 flu within the United States made it extremely resource-intensive for states to count individual cases. On July 24, 2009, CDC discontinued reporting of individual cases of 2009 H1N1, but continued to track hospitalizations and deaths.. 

Q: What was WHO's stance on H1N1 testing?
A: For all of these reasons, WHO will no longer issue the global tables showing the numbers of confirmed cases for all countries. However, as part of continued efforts to document the global spread of the H1N1 pandemic, regular updates will be provided describing the situation in the newly affected countries. WHO will continue to request that these countries report the first confirmed cases and, as far as feasible, provide weekly aggregated case numbers and descriptive epidemiology of the early cases.. 

Q: Did the Obama administration stopped testing during the H1N1, Swine Flu, pandemic.
A: On July 24, 2009, the Obama administration did not stopped testing during the H1N1, rather CDC discontinued reporting of individual cases of 2009 H1N1, but continued to track hospitalizations and deaths..

title: Fact Check: South Africa has “expertise in the development and trial of a range of vaccines”

title: Fact Check: South Africa has expertise in the development and trial of a range of vaccines.
text:
Claim: South Africa has expertise in the development and trial of a range of vaccines.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: They have a number of clinical trials that are up and running 

Evidence:

Q: Has South Africa developed vaccines?
A: But there is only one locally developed human vaccine, The vaccine, developed by a team mostly from UCT, aimed to protect people against a strain of HIV. .. 

Q: What other experience does South Africa have in vaccine development?
A: They have developed a technology package for the manufacture of Haemophilus influenzae type b (Hib) conjugate vaccine, and the institute is currently developing a vaccine against group b strep, or GBS. This bacterium is usually found in the gut, and can cause pneumonia and meningitis in newborns.

There are currently more than a thousand clinical trials underway in South Africa, according to the South African National Clinical Trial Register..

Surprised to see tweets from this account making it to mainstream news and agency stories. 
@TwitterIndia please take note

A: No. ... the account of ‘Sarah Sachin Pilot’ was not verified.

title: Fact Check: An Indian student finds a Home remedy cure for Covid-19 and it is accepted by WH...

Q: According to the WHO is there a cure for COVID-19
A: While some western, traditional or home remedies may provide comfort and alleviate symptoms of mild COVID-19, there are no medicines that have been shown to prevent or cure the disease. WHO does not recommend self-medication with any medicines, including antibiotics, as a prevention or cure for COVID-19. However, there are several ongoing clinical trials of both western and traditional medicines..

title: Fact Check: South Africans have the right to resist isolation or quarantine if found to hsve...
text:
Claim: South Africans have the right to resist isolation or quarantine if found to hsve the virus

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: It seems from the 4th QA that the people s5ill have to quarantine,  therefore the claim is refuted 

Evidence:

Q: What virus does the claim refer to?
A: Coronavirus Covid 19. 

Q: Do guidelines in South Africa require  isolation or quarantine of Covid infected individuals?
A: Yes. South Africa’s health guidelines for COVID-19 state that an individual can successfully self-quarantine if they have access to a separate room where no one else spends time
“Where these requirements cannot be met, the person should quarantine in a designated facility,” the government advises.

Q: Can a person legally refuse to self isolate or quarantine?
A: According to Regulation 4 of the Disaster Management Act, no one suspected of potentially contracting COVID-19 may refuse a medical examination or admission to a health facility or quarantine site..

title: Fact Check: South Africa “has an established vaccine manufacturing capability”
text:
Claim: South Africa “has an established vaccine manufacturing capability”

Verdict: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

Justification: it's clear that South does develop vaccines, and has the capacity to do some testing, but isn't able to do so start to finish due to cost, so this is conflicting evidence. 

Evidence:

Q: Is South African president Ramaphosa correct about country’s ability to make vaccines?
A: South Africa has a history of producing human vaccines, though since the early 2000s it has not manufactured vaccines start to finish, largely due to cost.
The country has the expertise to develop vaccines, though to date only one locally developed human vaccine has made it to the human-trial stage of testing.
Many clinical trials are run in the country, including one currently for a potential Covid-19 vaccine.. 

Q: does the governemt have the capacity to produce vaccines
A: No. but  is a public-private entity responsible for the government’s human vaccine procurement. It sources and provides vaccines as part of the government’s expanded programme on immunisation.

Mr Ocansey stated on the show on Monday, July 13 that no such interview was conducted, hence the said report should be disregarded and be treated with the contempt that it deserves..

title: Fact Check: In 1920 #Mahashivratri was celebrated at Karachi. It just took 100 years to comp...
text:
Claim: In 1920 #Mahashivratri was celebrated at Karachi. It just took 100 years to completely eradicate the festival. This decades-old Mahashivratri celebration held annually in Karachi was cancelled in 2020.

Verdict: Not Enough Evidence

Justification: Unknown if the festival was actually cancelled in 2020.

Evidence:

Q: What is the Mahashivratri celebration?
A: Maha Shivaratri (IAST: Mahāśivarātri) is a Hindu festival celebrated annually in honour of the god Shiva. The name also refers to the night when Shiva performs the heavenly dance called Tandava.. 

Q: Is there an annual Maha Shivratri (Mahāśivarātri) festival in Karachi?
A: This annual festival in honor of Lord Shiva's marriage to Parvati Devi is still celebrated by the Hindu community in Clifton, near the beach in Karachi. Men and women both fast, wash the icon of Lord Shiva in holy water, and then proceed to the ocean during the pooja where they can break the fast in the early morning. The 2019 festival is scheduled for March 4th. Hindus celebrate Maha Shivratri festival in Karachi - Paper Jewels 2018-22. 

Q: Was the Mahashivratri celebrated in Karachi in 2020?
A: No answer could be found..

title: Fact Check: A graphic from the World Health Organization (WHO) lists the “7 biggest brain da...

A: The Common Travel Area (CTA) is a long-standing arrangement between the UK, the Crown Dependencies (Bailiwick of Jersey, Bailiwick of Guernsey and the Isle of Man) and Ireland that pre-dates both British and Irish membership of the EU and is not dependent on it.. 

Q: when does the quarantine end if you arrived England from an exempt country
A: “If you arrived back in England before 10 July 2020, you should follow the self-isolation rules that applied at the time you arrived.”.

title: Fact Check: Proud to be AMU alumnus, 35-year-old scientist Kushbu Mirza, has been promoted a...
text:

Though it is a big milestone in my career. it's not as big as some of you think. I have seen many news items spreading some false articles about me,” ..

A: No. Kalam was Project director for SLV-III project which was India’s first indigenously designed and produced a satellite launch vehicle. Later he was shifted to the Defence Research and Development Organization (DRDO).

title: Fact Check: The CDC may have to stop calling COVID-19 an ‘epidemic’ due to a remarkably low ...
text:
Claim: The CDC may have to stop calling COVID-19 an ‘epidemic’ due to a remarkably low death rate.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Q&A's state that death rate has no bearing on weather a virus outbreak is called 'epidemic'

Evidence:

Q: Has the novel coronavirus been described as an epidemic by the CDC
A: Health officials and leaders have made several official declarations about the novel coronavirus. But the major ones weren’t about declaring an epidemic, and none were made by the CDC. 

Q: Does low death rate translate to the novel coronavirus not being an epidemic
A: No. The epidemic threshold "refers to the point at which the observed proportion of deaths is significantly higher than would be expected at that time of the year in the absence of substantial influenza, and now COVID-related mortality." Deaths are a lagging indicator of COVID-19, partly because of a delay in the processing of death certificates. Death rates alone don’t "have bearing on whether COVID-19 is still an epidemic," given that the extent of the outbreak is the primary factor.

Q: Is mortality rate alone enough to classify a disease as an epidemic
A: Death rates alone do not define an epidemic.

title: Fact Check: A letter from a consultant at a hospital in Surrey claims that hospitals are emp...

A: These claims have been denied by the National Health Service. 

Q: What are the number of deaths in Surrey according to NHS records
A: 1,100 deaths.

We request the general public to disregard it because it’s FAKE❗️
All job opportunities at WHO are posted on who.int.

title: Fact Check: Peter Navarro said a Covid-19 study “showed an astonishing 50% reduction in the ...
text:
Claim: Peter Navarro said a Covid-19 study “showed an astonishing 50% reduction in the mortality rate for patients taking hydroxychloroquine,”

Verdict: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

Justification: It appears from the Q&As that there is conflicting evidence with regards to the use of Hydroxychloroquine. As some reports have found it works whilst some haven't.

Evidence:

Q: What is hydroxychloroquine?
A: Hydroxychloroquine belongs to the family of medicines called “antimalarials” (AMs), which are also classified as disease-modifying anti-rheumatic drugs, or DMARDs. These drugs were initially used to prevent and to treat malaria but are no longer used for those purposes and are now often used for lupus.. 

Q: Has hydroxychloroquine been used to treat COVID-19?
A: There was some early off-label use of hydroxychloroquine for COVID-19. 

Q: Is there a study showing 50% reduction in the mortality rate for patients taking hydroxychloroquine?
A: Yes. A study from the Henry Ford Health System in Michigan did show a 50% reduction in the risk of death in those who received hydroxychloroquine vs other drugs like azithromycin

title: Fact Check: Scottish Government got £21m from Summer economic update.
text:
Claim: Scottish Government got £21m from Summer economic update.

Verdict: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

Evidence:

Q: Is £21m the maximum Scotland will receive?
A: When asked whether the Scottish Government would receive just £21 million as a result of the Plan for Jobs as the Scottish Finance Minister has claimed, I said that I couldn’t see how you would arrive at such a number given the schemes just mentioned, as well as the stamp duty holiday for England and Northern Ireland. It would get much more..

title: Fact Check: Deaths from COVID-19 are nearing zero in the U.S. in early July 2020.
text:
Claim: Deaths from COVID-19 are nearing zero in the U.S. in early July 2020.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The answer and sources show that there were still deaths from covid at that time and so the claim is refuted.

Evidence:

Q: What date was this claim made?
A: 08/07/2020. 

Q: What were the latest weekly  Coid-19 deaths at 08/07/2020?
A: w/e 4th July 2020 - provisional -181 deaths involving Covid-19.. 

Q: What data is used to report weekly deaths?
A: The provisional counts for coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) deaths are based on a current flow of mortality data in the National Vital Statistics System. National provisional counts include deaths occurring within the 50 states and the District of Columbia that have been received and coded as of the date specified. It is important to note that it can take several weeks for death records to be submitted to National Center for Health Statistics (NCHS), processed, coded, and tabulated. Therefore, the data shown on this page may be incomplete, and will likely not include all deaths that occurred during a given time period, especially for the more recent time periods. Death counts for earlier weeks are continually revised and may increase or decrease as new and updated death certificate data are received from the states by NCHS. COVID-19 death counts shown here may differ from other published sources, as data currently are lagged by an average of 1–2 weeks..

title: Fact Check: People are developing fungal lung infections due to wearing face masks.
text:
Claim: People are developing fungal lung infections due to wearing face masks.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Refuted by doctor in the 2nd QA pair.

Evidence:

Q: What is a fungal lung infection?
A: A variety of fungi can cause deep and systemic infections. People frequently become infected because they come in contact with the environment where a fungus grows, such as infected soil. Lung infections typically start with the inhalation of fungal spores. With lung infections, and with fungal infections that have spread below the surface of the skin, the invading fungi have the potential to disseminate from the original infection location and move to the blood (septicaemia) and/or spread throughout the body – into organs, tissues, bone, and sometimes into the meninges that cover the spinal cord, and into the brain.. 

Q: Can prolonged wearing of a facemask cause a fungal lung infection in the wearer?
A: Wearing a mask does not cause fungal infections in the lungs," said Dr. Ranit Mishori, professor of family medicine at Georgetown University School of Medicine. ".

title: Fact Check: The founder of Ghana's Progressive People’s Party (PPP), Dr Paa Kwasi Nduom twee...

The source refutes the claim.

A: The official Twitter handle of Dr Nduom is @pknduom.. 

Q: What is the handle of  the twitter account which made the claim?
A: The twitter handle of the claim tweet was @paakwasijunior..

title: Fact Check: Herbal drink made of snake grass can cure cancer by killing cancer cells in 24 h...
text:
Claim: Herbal drink made of snake grass can cure cancer by killing cancer cells in 24 hours.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: This claim is not backed up with any evidence or studies 

Evidence:

Q: What is snake grass?
A: snake grass or belalai gajah, Clinacanthus nutans is a Thai herbal folk medicinal plant. It has been used to treat skin rashes, snake bites and herpes simplex virus.. 

Q: Has there been any scientific study on the effects of snake grass on cancer cells?
A: researchers reviewed the pharmacological properties of the tropical plants that were reported to be used for cancer, and they selected seven promising plant species for further investigation. These medicinal plants are Bandicoot Berry (Leea indica), Sabah Snake Grass (Clinacanthus nutans), Fool's Curry Leaf (Clausena lansium), Seven Star Needle (Pereskia bleo), Black Face General (Strobilanthes crispus), South African Leaf (Vernonia amygdalina), and Simpleleaf Chastetree (Vitex trifolia). 

Q: Was snake grass effective at killing cancer cells in a scientific study?
A: the leaf extract of the Snake Grass was not very effective in inhibiting growth of cancer cells..

title: Fact Check: The US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention has said that bubonic plague c...
text:
Claim: The US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention has said that bubonic plague can be spread through cough droplets.

Verdict: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

Justification: Answers show that cough droplets can't spread the bubonic plague, but it can spread pneumonic plague, which is another form of the disease which can develop from untreated bubonic plague. 

Evidence:

Q: What information about the spread of the bubonic plague has the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) released?
A: The bite of an infected flea causes the infection to spread.. 

Q: If left untreated, can the bubonic plague form into another disease?
A: Yes. The pneumonic plague is another form of the disease which can develop from untreated bubonic plague.

Q: How does the pneumonic plague spread?
A: Pneumonic plague may develop from inhaling infectious droplets or may develop from untreated bubonic or septicemic plague after the bacteria spread to the lungs. The pneumonia may cause respiratory failure and shock. Pneumonic plague is the most serious form of the disease and is the only form of plague that can be spread from person to person (by infectious droplets)..

title: Fact Check: International students contributed over $40 billion to the U.S. economy in 2018-...
text:
Claim: International students contributed over $40 billion to the U.S. economy in 2018-19.

Evidence:

title: Fact Check: Over 1 million international students studied at American universities in the 20...
text:
Claim: Over 1 million international students studied at American universities in the 2018-19 school year.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: 1,095,299 international students studied.

Evidence:

Q: What are the official figures for foreign students studying in the USA?
A: WASHINGTON, D.C., November 18, 2019—The number of international students in the United States set an all-time high in the 2018/19 academic year, the fourth consecutive year with more than one million international students. The total number of international students, 1,095,299, is a 0.05 percent increase over last year, according to the 2019 Open Doors Report on International Educational Exchange..

title: Fact Check: Bubonic plague is “airborne” and “can be spread when an infected person coughs.”
text:
Claim: Bubonic plague is “airborne” and “can be spread when an infected person coughs.”

Verdict: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

Justification: Not airborne, but droplets spread by coughing can be a vector for infection.

Evidence:

Q: What is Bubonic plague?
A: Plague is one of the deadliest diseases in human history, 
Bubonic plague is the most common form of the disease that people can get. The name comes from the symptoms it causes - painful, swollen lymph nodes or 'buboes' in the groin or armpit.. 

Q: Is bubonic plague an 'airborne'  infectious disease?
A: No. The pneumonic plague is an airborne plague not the bubonic plague.

Q: Can Bubonic plague be spread by people coughing?
A: It can be spread by Inhaling infected respiratory droplets spread by infected people or animals The infection could also enter the body through a cut in the skin if the person came in close contact with an infected animal's blood..

title: Fact Check: Drivers in Canada face penalties of three demerit points and a $1,500 fine if a ...
text:
Claim: Drivers in Canada face penalties of three demerit points and a $1,500 fine if a passenger in their car is using a mobile phone

A: No province has a $1,500 fine for distracted driving, according to this Canadian Automobile Association website.. 

Q: What's the penalty that drivers in Canada face if a passenger in their car is using a mobile phone?
A: No answer could be found.. 

Q: Is there a driving fine in Canada that amounts to $1,500?
A: No. Fines for distracted driving vary across different regions of Canada, but there's no fine of $1,500.

title: Fact Check: Ghana’s Health Minister, Kwaku Agyeman-Manu claims that President Akufo-Addo is ...
text:
Claim: Ghana’s Health Minister, Kwaku Agyeman-Manu claims that President Akufo-Addo is tired of the coronavirus fight due to citizens reluctance to adhere to the preventive protocols.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: His speech was translated wrong - Ghana’s Health Minister, Kwaku Agyeman-Manu then clarified what he meant.

Evidence:

Q: Is Ghana’s Health Minister, Kwaku Agyeman-Manu quoted as saying that that President Akufo-Addo is tired of the coronavirus fight due to citizens reluctance to adhere to the preventive protocols.
A: Health Minister Kwaku Agyeman-Manu says recent media reports quoting him as saying the President is tired of the COVID-19 fight are a mistranslation of his comments he made in his native bono language.

According to the report circulated online, the health minister made the comments at a ceremony in Dormaa to suggest that President Akufo-Addo and health officials at the forefront are already tired adding that Ghanaians must take personal responsibility to protect themselves from contracting the virus.

But Mr Agyeman-Manu says the story is inaccurate.

"I only pleaded with Ghanaians on our normal COVID education awareness and I spoke about the hard work the President has put in to this battle. The tireless efforts that the President and health officials have put into this fight require that we all help and adhere to the safety protocols. If we don’t, may put the President’s labour in vain."

"I did not mean that the President or the government are tired" he said, adding that "I spoke in Bono and I suspect those translating got it wrong." 

Mr Agyeman-Manu has asked the general public to disregard the false reports..

title: Fact Check: President Donald Trump claimed that Nascar's decision to ban confederate flags a...

title: Fact Check: NOT ONE POLITICIAN DIED, LOST THEIR JOB OR WORN MASKS DURING THE COVID-19 PANDEM...
text:
Claim: NOT ONE POLITICIAN DIED, LOST THEIR JOB OR WORN MASKS DURING THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC

Verdict: Refuted

Q: Had any politician died by July 2020?
A: Louisiana State Rep. Reggie Bagala, South Dakota State Rep. Bob Glanzer and former Republican presidential candidate Herman Cain, according to media reports. Politicians in countries across the globe have also died due to the virus, per Al Jazeera.. 

Q: Has any polician lost his job due to the COVID-19?
A: Yes. At least one politician lost his job in the context of the COVID-19 pandemic. Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro fired former Health Minister Luiz Henrique Mandetta in April after weeks of disagreements about how to handle the coronavirus pandemic, CNN reported. Mandetta sent a series of tweets on April 16 announcing his removal as health minister.

Q: Have politicians been wearing masks?
A: Yes. Among those who have worn masks are President Donald Trump, Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden, U.K. Prime Minister Boris Johnson, Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau and German Chancellor Angela Merkel, among countless others.

title: Fact Check: An image in New Zealand shows that a rural New Zealand town is set to remove a t...
text:
Claim: An image in New Zealand shows that a rural New Zealand town is set to remove a trout statue

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Based on no statement/information  presented on the official website.

Evidence:

Q: Which locality in New Zealand has a trout statue
A: IN Gore, a town of 12,500 on the South Island of New Zealand, street signs proclaim that the visitor has arrived in the world capital of brown trout. To reinforce the point, town officials have erected a huge sculpture of the fish in a grassy park halfway between the town’s bustling main business street and the Mataura River, a world-famous brown trout stream a quarter-mile away.. 

Q: Has the Gore district officials decided to remove the trout statue
A: No. A search of the Gore official website reveals no information about it

title: Fact Check: The COVID-19 pandemic has seen conspiracy theories emerge with claims 5G vendors...
text:
Claim: The COVID-19 pandemic has seen conspiracy theories emerge with claims 5G vendors have used the lockdown in Australia – and elsewhere – to roll out 5G networks without public knowledge. Accompanying those are claims that the expanded network may cause negative health effects in people.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: From the 3rd QA it is evident that 5G has not been found to have an impact on health, therefore the claim is refuted

Q: What is the impact on health from the radiation emitted by 5G devices.
A: There is no established evidence that low level radio wave exposure from 5G and other wireless telecommunications can affect the immune system or cause any other long term or short term health effects..

"An upper respiratory specimen, particularly a nasopharyngeal swab, is the most common sample collected to reliably detect the virus," says Dr. Rodino. "Some lower respiratory samples like sputum are also acceptable in some settings.".

A: No answer could be found..

sanitisers is permitted by their scholars.

the amount of alcohol absorbed through the skin is negligible.

title: Fact Check: People are starting to enter ERs with fungal lung infections from wearing masks.
text:
Claim: People are starting to enter ERs with fungal lung infections from wearing masks.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: None of the Q&A suggest that the claim is true. 

Evidence:

Q: Can wearing a face mask cause fungal lung infections?
A: There is no evidence indicating that masks increase the wearer’s risk of developing pneumonia or other bacterial, viral, or fungal lung infections.

The WHOTrusted Source acknowledge that if a person wears the same mask for a long time, microorganisms may grow on the fabric.

The CDCTrusted Source recommend that a person removes the face covering once they return home and washes it before using it again.

“All masks should be changed if wet or visibly soiled; a wet mask should not be worn for an extended period of time. […] Either discard the mask or place it in a sealable bag where it is kept until it can be washed and cleaned,” the WHOTrusted Source advise.. 

Q: Have there been reports of people going to ERs with fungal lung infections from wearing masks?
A: No. There are no news reports on people going to ERs with fungal lung infections from wearing masks.

Q: How should masks be used safely?
A: The WHOTrusted Source acknowledge that if a person wears the same mask for a long time, microorganisms may grow on the fabric.

The CDCTrusted Source recommend that a person removes the face covering once they return home and washes it before using it again.

“All masks should be changed if wet or visibly soiled; a wet mask should not be worn for an extended period of time. […] Either discard the mask or place it in a sealable bag where it is kept until it can be washed and cleaned,” the WHOTrusted Source advise..

title: Fact Check: Wearing of a face mask while carrying a gun is a class 4 felony.
text:
Claim: Wearing of a face mask while carrying a gun is a class 4 felony.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The Q&As show that the claim is untrue so the claim is refuted.

Evidence:

Q: What is a class 4 felony in the U.S?
A: A Class 4 felony is a classification of a type of crime.  Although a Class 4 felony is the least serious of all felony charges, it still is a very serious charge.

Felony charges (from most serious to least) are: Class X, Class 1, Class 2, Class 3 and Class 4.  The level below a Class 4 felony is a Class A Misdemeanour.. 

Q: It it illegal to wear a mask whilst carrying a gun in any U.S
A: Only in Illinois is it a class 4 felony, And only when an individual commits the crime of unlawful use of weapons (no concealed carry permit). 

Q: Is there any federal law that bans carrying a concealed weapon while wearing a face mask
A: There is no nationwide law banning carrying a concealed weapon while wearing a face mask..

G1 does not appear to have published the article featured in the Facebook post. A search of the G1 website turned up no articles about Swift and the Statue of Liberty. The use of the Portuguese phrase “Atualizado ha 1 hora” in the screen grab, while the rest appears in English, indicates it is likely photoshopped.

While there is no record of Swift calling for the Statue of Liberty’s removal, she did ask the state of Tennessee to remove the statues of “racist historical figures” in a June 12 tweet.. 

Q: Did Taylor Swift urge people to remove the The Statue of Liberty ?
A: Taylor Swift is urging Tennessee officials to permanently remove statues 'that celebrate racist historical figures who did evil things' in the state..

title: Fact Check: Dr. Kary B. Mullis, Nobel Laureate and inventor of the Polymerase Chain Reaction...
text:
Claim: Dr. Kary B. Mullis, Nobel Laureate and inventor of the Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR) test used to detect coronavirus said it couldn't be used for virus detection.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Its obvious from the answers that the PCR test can be used for virus detection, so the claim is refuted. 

Evidence:

Q: Can a PCR detect the Coronavirus?
A: There are two types of tests that detect SARS-CoV-2’s genetic material, or RNA: PCR tests and isothermal amplification, or IA, tests. Because RNA is made up of nucleic acids, both PCR and IA tests are also called nucleic acid amplification technology, or NAAT, tests. PCR tests are considered the gold-standard of NAAT testing.. 

Q: How accurate is a PCR test in detecting Coronavirus?
A: RT-PCR tests are considered the gold standard for detecting many viruses, and a number of companies are making them. Researchers at the Foundation for Innovative New Diagnostics, a nonprofit research center in Geneva, tested five COVID-19 RT-PCR tests and found that all five achieved 100% sensitivity on positive samples, and at least 96% specificity on negative samples in a laboratory setting..

title: Fact Check: Leicester has gone back into lockdown soon after 5G coveage was rolled out there...
text:
Claim: Leicester has gone back into lockdown soon after 5G coveage was rolled out there.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Dates do not match.

Evidence:

Q: In the EE network article published in November 2019, was Leicester one of the cities already covered by 5G network?
A: Yes. EE has 5G in more places in the UK than other network, and is targeting 5G connectivity in 45 cities and large towns by the end of the year. Customers can enjoy 5G in the following cities and large towns today:

Cities:

London
Edinburgh
Birmingham
Belfast
Manchester
Cardiff
Bristol
Coventry
Leicester
Liverpool
Glasgow
Wolverhampton

Q: When did Leicester go into lockdown around the date of the claim?
A: On 29 June, the Secretary of State for Health and Social Care Matt Hancock set out the local action being taken in Leicester following a surge in coronavirus cases in the area.

This morning, the local councils set out the following areas of Leicestershire that are included in the localised lockdown:

in Blaby District:
Braunstone Town (including Fosse Park)
Glenfield
Glen Parva
Leicester Forest East (east of the M1)
Thorpe Astley
in Charnwood:
Birstall
Thurmaston
all areas of Oadby and Wigston.

5G is a radio wave and as scientifically proved, Covid-19 is a virus.

title: Fact Check: The national security law will only target an extremely small minority of people...
text:
Claim: The national security law will only target an extremely small minority of people who have breached the law, while the life and property, basic rights and freedoms of the overwhelming majority of Hong Kong residents will be protected.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The Q&As do not verify the claim as stated.  Two of the source answers are from Twitter accounts, without any further confirmation that the information is correct. And the last Q&A answer is unrelated to the question and the claim.
However, the evidence presented does lean towards the fact that it is not correct that more than "an extremely small minority of people who have breached the law" would be targeted. Therefore a refuted claim label is chosen.

Evidence:

Q: What is the law referred to in the claim?
A: The Law of the People’s Republic of China on Safeguarding National Security in the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region. 

Q: When was this law enacted?
A: 30/06/2020. 

Q: When was this law first violated?
A: 01/07/2020
A man was arrested for holding a #HKIndependence flag in #CausewayBay, Hong Kong, violating the #NationalSecurityLaw.  This is the first arrest made since the law has come into force..

title: Fact Check: US Congresswoman Maxine Waters of California introduced a bill, H.R. 2020, the E...
text:
Claim: US Congresswoman Maxine Waters of California introduced a bill, H.R. 2020, the Erasing Confederate History Act of 2020, to rename the 11 US states that originally made up the Confederacy.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The questions clearly show that this is satire and explain what and who the source is. 

Evidence:

Q: Did Rep. Maxine Waters of California introduce a bill, "H.R. 2020, the Erasing Confederate History Act of 2020," to rename the 11 states that originally made up the Confederacy?
A: No. Satire news.

Q: Where did the story originate?
A: WashingtonExterminator.com. 

Q: What is known about WashingtonExterminator.com?
A: satire - noun — the use of humor, irony, exaggeration, or ridicule to expose and criticize people's stupidity or vices, particularly in the context of contemporary politics and other topical issues.

The Washington Exterminator is a satirical news website..

title: Fact Check: Michelle Obama had to Surrender her Law License because she committed  'Insuranc...
text:
Claim: Michelle Obama had to Surrender her Law License because she committed  'Insurance Fraud'

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: This claim is refuted. According to the QA pairs, Michelle Obama is indeed a registered lawyer who is noted ass not 'authorised to practice'. However, there is no record of why nor any discipline actions attatched to why she is 'not authorised to practice'. The claim states it is due to 'insurance fraud' which is not proven in the QA pairs. Therefore, this claim is refuted. 

Evidence:

Q: Is there a record of Michelle Obama on the Illinois ARDC website?
A: Michelle Obama is shown as a registered lawyer, admitted on 5/12/1989, and is noted as not authorised to practice.. 

Q: Is there any record of Michelle Obama been disciplined or subject of a disciplinary proceeding in Illinois?
A: No. A search on the ARDC website does not list Michelle Obama as having a public record of discipline" or "pending proceedings" attached to her name.

title: Fact Check: “Oklahoma 100% positive coronavirus test rate after Trump Tulsa rally.”
text:
Claim: “Oklahoma 100% positive coronavirus test rate after Trump Tulsa rally.”

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Its clear that the claim is not true as there are too many inconsistencies to the covid testing and reporting. Plus not many people attended the rally. 

Evidence:

Q: What data did the claim speaker Chris Hayes use for this claim?
A: Oklahoma authorities weekend Covid 19 testing testing figures.. 

Q: Were the Oklahoma authorities weekend Covid 19 testing testing figures correct and complete?
A: The figure quoted did not provide a clear or complete picture because it was not the final numbers for Oklahoma’s weekend testing.. 

Q: Did the claim speaker make any follow-up comments relating to their claim?
A: Hayes said, The problem the claim is the lag in the way that Oklahoma reports its data. With fewer but almost entirely positive tests being reported on the weekends and then larger numbers including negative tests.

title: Fact Check: The next major advantage of the pandemic for the Deep State was the case made to...
text:
Claim: The next major advantage of the pandemic for the Deep State was the case made to the public for mail-in voting, a highly insecure practice proven to be rampant with fraud.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Mail-in voting is a safe and secure way for people to cast their votes 

Evidence:

Q: Is mail-in voting safe and secure?
A: U.S. citizens will vote by mail this year in record numbers. In the face of a global health
emergency, election officials across the country from both parties are working heroically to ensure
that voting by mail is accurate, accessible, safe & secure.. 

Q: What measures are taken to ensure mail-in voting does not lead to fraud?
A: Current and former election officials in vote-by-mail states said their systems are designed specifically to mitigate these risks, starting with a regular stream of mail contact with voters to establish that the address listed for them on the rolls is accurate. The ERIC system, as well as regular checks against DMV, death and other records, flag voter registration entries that may need updating. Federal law also requires states to conduct basic list maintenance.

Once voting begins, the linchpin of the process is a ballot return envelope, which typically requires the voter’s signature and includes a unique bar code linked to that voter’s record. When the ballot is returned and the bar code is scanned, no other ballot can be cast by that voter for that election.

Election officials and security experts said certain measures are important for preventing fraud in mail voting, such as accurate voter rolls and a method of authenticating ballots such as signature matching. Such safeguards have been put in place over time in the five states that currently run universal mail elections: Colorado, Hawaii, Oregon, Utah and Washington.

The other mainstay of election security in vote-by-mail states is the signature verification process. Election workers are trained by law enforcement agencies to detect when a signature on the ballot envelope does not match signatures in a voter’s file. Discrepancies trigger a review that could end with a voter proving his or her identity — or being reported to law enforcement for possible ballot tampering.

All-mail states have implemented a range of other safeguards to ensure ballots are secure at all times, including dropboxes under 24-hour surveillance cameras, rules that two people be present with any ballot from the moment of receipt or collection, and detailed logs and reconciliation rules that require votes to be accounted for, down to the ballot..

title: Fact Check: President Geingob of Namibia fined all those who attended the party he hosted to...
text:
Claim: President Geingob of Namibia fined all those who attended the party he hosted to mark his political party Swapo’s (South West Africa People’s Organisation) 60th birthday during the coronavirus lockdown when gatherings were banned.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The president did not personally fine the people who attended the party so the claim is refuted.

Evidence:

Q: Did President Geingob host a party to mark his political party’s (SWAPO) 60th birthday during a coronavirus lockdown in Namibia?
A: Yes. The South West Africa People’s Organisation (SWAPO) birthday party took place in parliament on April 19, when Namibia was under lockdown and group gatherings were banned to limit the spread of coronavirus.

Q: Have the people who attended the gathering to mark SWAPO’s 60th birthday been fined?
A: Yes. The president said that less than 10 people attended the event, including the Vice President, the Prime Minister and party’s Secretary General. All have since been fined Sh12,000 ($115).

Q: Did President Geingob directly issue the fines to those who attended SWAPO’s 60th birthday party or were they issued by law enforcement agencies representing the Namibian government?
A: Namibia’s President Hage Geingob on Thursday admitted to breaching coronavirus regulations last month by hosting a celebration to mark his party’s 60th anniversary and subsequently fining all the guests who attended..

title: Fact Check: They [Democrats and the Deep State] flooded US streets with deadly drugs to manu...
text:
Claim: They [Democrats and the Deep State] flooded US streets with deadly drugs to manufacture a devastating epidemic of addiction and mass incarceration.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Q&A 3 states democrats actually did not increase narcotic use to achieve more incarceration but instead became tougher on existing crime, 
Whilst Q&A 4 and 5 state Columbia is the largest producer of illegal drugs And smugglers use  ports of entry in the U.S to bring them in not the democrats as claimed.

Evidence:

Q: What is a Deep State?
A: Political scientists and foreign policy experts have used the term deep state for years to describe individuals and institutions who exercise power independent of—and sometimes over—civilian political leaders.. 

Q: Does a Deep State exist in America?
A: Whether any of this means there is a deep state in America depends on your definition. Powerful bureaucrats with access to government secrets and trusted media friends certainly do try to influence presidents from the shadows. But in Washington, at least, their views and goals are not monolithic. And unlike their counterparts in the developing world, they do tend to execute the orders they’re given by the president, however grudgingly—and are committed to upholding the rule of law.. 

Q: Did the Democrats and the Deep state do anything to create the narcotics epidemic in the USA?
A: They signed the 1994 Crime Bill which increased mass incarceration. They did not increase narcotic use to achieve this but instead became tougher on existing crime leading to more imprisonment..

title: Fact Check: COVID-19 (Polymerase chain reaction (PCR) tests are ‘scientifically meaningless’
text:
Claim: COVID-19 (Polymerase chain reaction (PCR) tests are ‘scientifically meaningless’

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The answers show they are not meaningless, they may not be 100% accurate, but do help in the fight against covid

Evidence:

Q: Are COVID-19 (Polymerase chain reaction (PCR) tests accurate?
A: a nonprofit research center in Geneva, tested five COVID-19 RT-PCR tests and found that all five achieved 100% sensitivity on positive samples, and at least 96% specificity on negative samples in a laboratory setting.. 

Q: Are PCR tests accurate in real world settings?
A: In the real world, testing conditions and process are far from perfect, and accuracy suffers. Researchers still don’t know what the real-world false positive rate is, but clinical sensitivity of RT-PCR tests ranges from 66% to 80%. That means nearly one in three infected people who are tested will receive false negative results.. 

Q: Are PCR tests useful in the fight against Covid 19?
A: Yes. Advantages of PCR Testing
 Valuable for detecting specific pathogens that are difficult to culture in vitro or require a
long cultivation period
 Significantly more rapid in providing results compared to culturing
o Enables earlier informed decision making
o Rapid diagnosis of bacteraemia, particularly for low levels of bacteria in specimens
 Useful in detecting cases in extra pulmonary specimens which may be missed by smear
and/or culture
 Valuable screening tool
o PCR is still considered an adjunct test for certain diagnostic tests that still rely on
smear and culture, such as tuberculosis

title: Fact Check: COVID-19 Removal Cards kill Coronavirus

Therefore, this claim is refuted.

A: the Japanese consumer affairs agency (in Japanese) on May 15, 2020 warned the public that the product was ineffective against COVID-19.

title: Fact Check: Keir Starmer stopped Jimmy Savile being charged in 2009.
text:
Claim: Keir Starmer stopped Jimmy Savile being charged in 2009.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The QAs show that there were a series of "blunders" in which allegations against Savile were not followed through. Therefore Keir Starmer cannot be held responsible.

Evidence:

Q: Why didn't Keir Starmer prosecute Jimmy Savile ?
A: On the request of Starmer, Alison Levitt, his then Principal Legal Adviser, released a report in 2013 on the 2009 decision not to prosecute Savile. It found that if prosecutors had taken a different approach then prosecution may indeed have been possible. Levitt found that Surrey Police did not tell the victims that other complaints had been made against Savile also, and that had they known this, victims would have been more likely to press charges.

The report also discovered a ‘lack of understanding’ by officers concerning the law and practice, concerning sexual offences. It was found that outdated regulations and training were partially to blame in the failure to prosecute Savile, indicating structural issues in the way officers were trained, rather than being a matter of personal responsibility.. 

Q: Was there blunders by the  police and lawyers during the prosecution of Jimmy Savile ?
A: Britain’s chief prosecutor apologised for the failure to pursue four separate allegations against the BBC star, one made as recently as four years ago.

Director of Public Prosecutions Keir Starmer said there were failures by police in Sussex and Surrey and by the principal lawyer in dealing with the allegations. He issued a personal apology for the mistakes by the Crown Prosecution Service and announced a series of changes to improve the investigation of allegations by child victims.. 

Q: Did Keir Starmer helped Jimmy Savile to escape justice?
A: In 2008 (a few months before Starmer became director of public prosecutions [DPP] at the CPS) Sussex Police launched an investigation into a possible sexual assault, but took no further action as the complainant did not wish to give evidence.  In 2009 the CPS reviewed four sexual assault claims against Savile and felt there was insufficient evidence with which to proceed - again, because none of Savile's accusers were prepared to support police action. Frankly, the CPS makes a lot of decisions like this and it would be strange for the director himself to make the decision personally - that's the responsibility of the reviewing lawyer. We may well question that decision, but asking whether there was in fact sufficient evidence is one thing; to assume that such evidence would have resulted in a conviction is quite another. Have any of us seen the evidence the CPS was presented with?  Have those spinning these accusations - or spreading them - actually spoken with any of those who brought the initial complaints against Savile? Starmer took over a CPS under fire on various fronts and, after 2011, especially on the Savile issue. While he had no personal involvement in the decision not to proceed, Starmer did commission a review, headed by Alison Levitt QC, in which he revealed failures at the heart of the CPS and in 2013 issued an apology. He acknowledged those failures, pledging to change the culture of the CPS and its internal mechanisms. A "fundamental shift" was required, he argued, as "we cannot afford another Savile moment in five or ten years. While "no improper motives" were found, the Evening Standard reported that one of the review's major criticisms was that "the CPS lawyer (my italics) should have challenged the police conclusions and sought to build a prosecution against Savile". It also suggested the complainants should have been informed that there had been other complaints about Savile, as this would potentially have encouraged them to give evidence. This.

title: Fact Check: The Taiwanese Ministry of Justice has imposed the following restrictions on Hong...
text:
Claim: The Taiwanese Ministry of Justice has imposed the following restrictions on Hong Kong citizens applying to emigrate to Taiwan:
1. Only accept family reunion applications from people with immediate family in Taiwan.
2. Only accept applications from professionals.
3. Only accept significant investors.

Verdict: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

Justification: It seems from the Q&as that some of the requirements are correct, but they are not as cut and dry as in the claim, and they have cherry picked some details. 

Evidence:

Q: What has the Taiwanese Ministry of Justice said regarding this claim?
A: a spokesperson for Taiwan’s National Immigration Agency told AFP in an email on June 30: “There’s no such information”. 

A spokesperson for Taiwan's Ministry of Justice also said the posts were "false" in an email to AFP on June 29.. 

Q: Does the Taiwanese Ministry of Justice have rules in place for conditions that have to be met by Hong Kong nationals wanting residency in Taiwan?
A: Yes. The Taiwan government has Article 16, which lists 16 circumstances in which Hong Kong or Macao residents may apply for residency in Taiwan.

Q: Does the Taiwanese Ministry of Justice have family reunion applications from people with immediate family in Taiwan as one of their circumstances under Article 16?
A: Yes. 1 listed requirement out of the 16 conditions are:

The direct blood relative or the spouse of the applicant has a household registration in Taiwan. However, in the case of adoption, the kinship should last for more than two years prior to application.

title: Fact Check: The average family in America forks over more of their hard-earned income to the...
text:
Claim: The average family in America forks over more of their hard-earned income to their local hospital than to the IRS.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: From the Q&A it seems the claim is true and this is backed up by the census data. 

Evidence:

Q: Does the average American spend more on hospital bills than on tax to the IRS?
A: Overall, as a country, Americans spent $1.2 trillion on hospital care in 2018. That’s over $3,600 for every man, woman, and child in the U.S. The Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services project that, by 2026, hospital spending will rise to $1.8 trillion: over $5,300 per person.
it’s more than the average family pays in federal taxes. The Tax Cuts and Jobs Act of 2017 cut the federal tax rate for a family of median income from 14.6 percent to 13.8 percent. That includes income taxes, payroll taxes, and every other federal tax that applies to middle-class families.
That is to say, the average family now hands over more of its paycheck to the hospital industry than it does to the federal government in taxes.. 

Q: Is there any data to back up this claim?
A: Yes. According to the Census

title: Fact Check: The United States Annual Arms Control Compliance Report does not address the U.S...
text:
Claim: The United States Annual Arms Control Compliance Report does not address the U.S. withdrawal from the Arms Trade Treaty (ATT).

Verdict: Supported

Justification: The compliance report does not mention the withdrawal 

Evidence:

Q: Does the United States Annual Arms Control Compliance Report address the U.S. withdrawal from the Arms Trade Treaty (ATT).
A: No. Donald Trump withdrew from the ATT but this is not mentioned in the Compliance Report.

Q: What is the Arms Trade Treaty (ATT)?
A: The Arms Trade Treaty is the first legally-binding instrument ever negotiated in the United Nations to establish common standards for the international transfer of conventional weapons..

title: Fact Check: Covid-19 surcharges are being applied in the USA.
text:
Claim: Covid-19 surcharges are being applied in the USA.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: Yes this claim is supported, a surcharge is being added to bills due to Covid.

Evidence:

Q: Are businesses in the USA adding a covid surcharge to bills?
A: Yes. Facing higher costs to keep workers and customers safe and an indefinite period of suppressed demand, businesses are navigating an ever-narrower path to profitability. To make the math work, some businesses are cutting services and jobs. Others are raising prices, including imposing coronavirus-related fees aimed at getting customers to share some of the expenses.

Q: What is a covid surcharge?
A: With businesses around the country reopening, customers may notice an additional expense on their bill: a COVID-19 surcharge.

This new surcharge is popping up around the country and is an extra fee that businesses can add to a bill to help alleviate the financial burden placed upon them during the virus outbreak. It is meant to help offset losses due to businesses having to temporarily close, or help businesses keep up with the new requirements to reopen under health guidelines..

After extensive deliberation, the United States has

Biological Weapons Convention, ... is not, in our view,
capable of achieving the mandate set forth for the Ad Hoc
Group, strengthening confidence in compliance with the
Biological Weapons Convention. ... We believe the
objective of the mandate was and is important to
international security, we will therefore be unable to support
the current text, even with changes, as an appropriate
outcome of the Ad Hoc Group efforts..

title: Fact Check: Cloth masks trap carbon dioxide which is a risk to health.
text:
Claim: Cloth masks trap carbon dioxide which is a risk to health.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Evidence found suggests that most carbon dioxide molecules either go through the mask or escape along the loose-fitting perimeter, and whilst some carbon dioxide cna collect between the mask and wearers face it doesnt reach unsafe levels so isnt a risk to health, the claim is refuted.

Evidence:

Q: Do face masks trap air?
A: Masks are designed to be breathed through and can protect against respiratory droplets, which are typically much larger than tiny carbon dioxide molecules. Consequently, most carbon dioxide molecules will either go through the mask or escape along the mask's loose-fitting perimeter. Some carbon dioxide might collect between the mask and the wearer's face, but not at unsafe levels..

title: Fact Check: Cloth masks do not filter anything.
text:
Claim: Cloth masks do not filter anything.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The answers and credible sources show that wearing masks do help in reducing transmission so the claim is refuted.

Evidence:

Q: Why are cloth masks worn?
A: Well-fitting disposable surgical masks offer more protection than cloth or other woven masks, but less protection than respirators but cloth masks are better for the environment as they are reusable and do not contribute to landfill and useful when there is a mask shortage. 

Q: Are cloth masks effective in preventing the spread of viruses?
A: There is evidence to suggest that use of cloth face coverings by the public during a pandemic helps reduce disease transmission. Their primary role is to reduce the release of infectious particles into the air when someone speaks, coughs, or sneezes, including someone who has COVID-19 but feels well. Cloth face coverings are not a substitute for physical distancing, washing hands and staying home when ill, but they may be helpful when combined with these interventions..

title: Fact Check: CERT-In issues a warning of possible phishing attacks.
text:
Claim: CERT-In issues a warning of possible phishing attacks.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: Q&A pair 1 answer the part of the claim talking about what the 'CERT-IN' mentioned in the claim is, which is a emergency computer response team in India.
Q&A 2 confirm that the CERT-IN did issue the warning shown in the claim about possible phishing attacks and so confirming the claim as true.

Evidence:

Q: What is CERT-in?
A: The Indian Computer Emergency Response Team (CERT-In) is serving as national agency for responding to cyber security incidents as per provisions of Section 70B of Information Technology Act, 2000. CERT-In receives inputs from its situational awareness systems and threat intelligence sources about malware infections in networks of entities across sectors. Whenever any incident comes to the notice of CERT-In, it issues alerts and advisories to the entities concerned and sectoral Computer Emergency Response Teams (CERTs) for remedial measures.. 

Q: Did CERT-in issue a warning about a potential cyber attack in June 2020?
A: Yes. India's cyber security nodal agency, CERT-In has issued an advisory warning that the potential phishing attacks could impersonate government agencies, departments and trade bodies that have been tasked to oversee disbursement of government fiscal aid.

title: Fact Check: Doctors were banned from social media during the pandemic, for calling the pande...
text:
Claim: Doctors were banned from social media during the pandemic, for calling the pandemic a ‘hoax’.

Verdict: Not Enough Evidence

Evidence:

Q: What does this claim refer to?
A: A controversial press conference by Doctors Dan Erickson and Artin Massihi of Accelerated Urgent Care, Bakersfield.. 

Q: How did the US medical authorities react to the press conference?
A: Joint Statement issued on April 27, 2020:

The American College of Emergency Physicians (ACEP) and the American Academy of Emergency Medicine (AAEM) jointly and emphatically condemn the recent opinions released by Dr. Daniel Erickson and Dr. Artin Massihi. These reckless and untested musings do not speak for medical societies and are inconsistent with current science and epidemiology regarding COVID-19. As owners of local urgent care clinics, it appears these two individuals are releasing biased, non-peer reviewed data to advance their personal financial interests without regard for the public’s health.

COVID-19 misinformation is widespread and dangerous. Members of ACEP and AAEM are first-hand witnesses to the human toll that COVID-19 is taking on our communities. ACEP and AAEM strongly advise against using any statements of Drs. Erickson and Massihi as a basis for policy and decision making.. 

Q: Did Doctors Dan Erickson and Artin Massihi call the pandemic a hoax?
A: No. they talked about the coronavirus pandemic both at the state and local levels.

title: Fact Check: Surgical masks were designed and approved for sterile environments. Every time a...
text:
Claim: Surgical masks were designed and approved for sterile environments. Every time a person puts on their (surgical) mask they are breathing in the germs from everywhere they went. They should be changed or thrown out every 20-30 minutes in a non sterile environment.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: QA pair states should only be changed when dirty or damaged and not at fixed time periods.

Evidence:

Q: How do surgical masks work?
A: Surgical face masks are fairly loose-fitting, disposable masks approved by the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) for use as medical devices. Doctors, dentists, and nurses often wear them while treating patients.

These masks prevent large droplets of bodily fluids that may contain viruses or other germs from escaping via the nose and mouth. They also protect against splashes and sprays from other people, such as those from sneezes and coughs.. 

Q: How often should surgical masks be changed?
A: Generally, one time use (one patient encounter). 

Q: Do we need to change the the surgical masks every 20-30 minutes as it  traps the  covid virus and we can breath as well as spread it ?
A: This is misleading. The person wearing the mask is breathing/coughing/sneezing into the mask and prevents the spread of virus.Surgical masks do not need to be changed out every 20-30 minutes. They need to be changed when they are noticeably dirty or damaged..

title: Fact Check: Alex Jones claimed on the InfoWars website that there were no patients for US ho...

Evidence:

Q: Were warships deployed during the pandemic
A: The United States is to deploy military hospital ships to fight the coronavirus. 

Q: Did the hospital ships have patients to treat
A: But hospital admissions came in much lower than expected and the ship's crew only treated 182 patients, of which around 70 percent had COVID-19, the navy said in a statement Wednesday.. 

Q: Were warships deployed during the pandemic?
A: The United States is to deploy military hospital ships to fight the coronavirus.

title: Fact Check: Vijaya Hospital founder's son died of Covid-19
text:

A: Vijaya Hospital Group runs Vijaya Hospital and Vijaya Health Centre at Vadapalani in Chennai. The group is founded by B. Nagi Reddy, publisher of children’s magazine ‘Chandamama’, founder of Vijaya Vauhini Studios. One of Nagi Reddy’s sons, Viswanatha Reddy is the chief administrative officer of the hospital while other family members are trustees,. 

Q: Who is the person who died?
A: Sarath Reddy, son of B. Viswanatha Reddy and grandson of B. Nagi Reddy. 

Q: How did he die?
A: B. Sarath Reddy died of Coronavirus on June 19. Jeeva said that Sarath Reddy was infected by the virus a few days ago and put on a ventilator at Vijaya Health Centre before he breathed his last..

title: Fact Check: Chancellor of Germany Angela Merkel tweeted "I stand with India" after clash bet...
text:
Claim: Chancellor of Germany Angela Merkel tweeted "I stand with India" after clash between the Indian Army and the Chinese PLA

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: While there is no proof from these questions and answers that the account is not Angela Merkel's, commonsense suggests that a public official such as the Chancellor of Germany would have a verified Twitter account. A further question exploring whether Angela Merkel had a verified Twitter account would have helped establish the evidence beyond all doubt.

Evidence:

Q: How is an twitter account is verified?
A: You can apply to be Twitter verified and receive a blue checkmark badge next to your name. To become verified on Twitter, you simply update your profile with current information, verify a phone number and email address, then fill out a form requesting consideration as a verified user.

If you're applying for verification of a personal profile as opposed to a business profile, you'll also need a copy of a photo ID like a passport or driver's license.. 

Q: How do you spot a fake twitter account?
A: Check the spelling and structure of the username: Fake Twitter accounts often use the real name, or something very similar, and the same photo as the genuine article, but the username is marginally different. 

Check the bio - what does it say?: Does it say spoof or parody or contain anything unusual that might set alarm bells ringing (see Felix Baumgartner, above)? According to Twitter’s terms of use, parody accounts are not discouraged but they are obliged to make this clear in the bio.  

Is the account verified?: Accounts with the official tick badge have been checked by Twitter and are who they purport to be.. 

Q: Is there a blue-tick verification on the alleged tweet from Angela Merkel in the claim?
A: No. There is no blue-tick verification in the claim tweet.

title: Fact Check: Police departments in Germany were defunded and eliminated by the Nazis under He...
text:
Claim: Police departments in Germany were defunded and eliminated by the Nazis under Hermann Goering.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: While the Nazi's took over the police forces they did not eliminate them.

Evidence:

Q: Who was Hermann Goering?
A: Hermann Göring, Göring also spelled Goering, (born January 12, 1893, Rosenheim, Germany—died October 15, 1946, Nürnberg), a leader of the Nazi Party and one of the primary architects of the Nazi police state in Germany.. 

Q: Was the police department in Germany defunded by the Nazis?
A: Beginning in 1933, the Nazis took control of and subsequently transformed the police forces of the Weimar Republic into instruments of state repression and, eventually, of genocide. They did so by Nazifying policing. 

The Nazis expanded police power and used the police to target people they considered their political, racial, social, and criminal opponents.. 

Q: Did the Nazis eliminate Germany's police departments?
A: The new government removed anti-Nazi police leaders, reorganized Germany’s police forces, and reoriented police culture towards Nazism..

title: Fact Check: A grocery store worker who wore a mask for hours at a time got a lung infection ...
text:
Claim: A grocery store worker who wore a mask for hours at a time got a lung infection (pleurisy,) from “breathing in her own bacteria”.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: From the third answer it is evident that gthe bacteria would not cause a virus. Therefore the claim is refuted

Evidence:

Q: What is pluerisy?
A: Pleurisy is swelling (inflammation) of the thin layers of tissue (pleura) covering the lungs and the chest wall.. 

Q: What causes pleurisy?
A: In young, healthy people, an infection of the lower respiratory system by a virus or bacteria may cause pleurisy. Pleurisy usually lasts a few days to 2 weeks. In very rare cases, the virus or bacteria may spread and cause pleurisy in others.

Other causes of pleurisy include air leaking into the pleural cavity from a hole in a lung (pneumothorax), injury to the chest (such as a broken rib), tuberculosis or other infections, or a tumor in the pleura.

Other conditions may also cause pleurisy. These include rheumatoid arthritis, lupus, sickle cell crisis, pulmonary embolism, or pancreatitis. Pleurisy may also develop as a complication of heart surgery.. 

Q: Can you catch a virus by breathing in your own bacteria?
A: No. you would be breathing in a virus you already have.
