title: Fact Check: Presidents Lincoln and Kennedy were Assasinated for trying to end Federal reserv...
text:
Claim: Presidents Lincoln and Kennedy were Assasinated for trying to end Federal reserve banking system.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: There is no evidence that Presidents Lincoln and Kennedy were assassinated for trying to end the Federal Reserve banking system.

Evidence:

Q: Was President Lincoln And Kennedy Assassinated  for trying  to End Federal Reserve banking system ?
A: There is a meme circulating on Facebook that seems to be based on the conspiracy theory that Abraham Lincoln and John F. Kennedy were assassinated by the Rothschilds because they wanted to “end the federal reserve banking system.” Let’s pick this meme apart to see how historically accurate it is.

1. There was no federal reserve system when Lincoln was president. The Federal Reserve System was not established until 1913.

2. Prior to the Federal Reserve System, there had been a national bank*, and Andrew Jackson had made its end one of his key second-term goals.

3. Two assassins attempted to kill Jackson, but no evidence suggests that they were sent by the Bank.**

4. Some people have emphasized the eerie similarities between Lincoln and Kennedy, which are easily explainable.

* There were two national banks, in fact: The 1st Bank of the U.S., which was chartered from 1791-1811 and the 2nd Bank of the U.S., chartered from 1816-1836.

** There is that pesky Booth letter, though..

title: Fact Check: Wisconsin is clearly seeing a decline in COVID infections
text:
Claim: Wisconsin is clearly seeing a decline in COVID infections

Verdict: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

Justification: Lower numbers seem attributed to lesser testing.

Evidence:

Q: How many confirmed cases in Wisconsin during this time period?
A: Zooming in to the last six days (April 15 to 20), Wisconsin had between 147 and 170 new confirmed cases per day. The tally was lower the days before that due to a lower number of tests being performed.

The most recent tally released prior to the statement from Vos and Fitzgerald was April 20, with 153 cases, up six from the day before. That’s on par with the April average of 157 new cases per day.. 

Q: What about hospitalizations?
A: This is the lone metric that shows a decline over the last couple weeks.

After rising to start the month, the daily tally leveled off around 440 per day from April 9 to 14.

The number then dropped for two days before holding steady between 357 and 361 from April 17 to 21.. 

Q: Does this show a clear decline in COVID infections?
A: There are a lot of ways to slice the coronavirus data, but this is an exaggeration.

New cases and deaths in the week before this claim were roughly in line with both the preceding week and the averages for the month of April. Hospitalizations had dropped somewhat from the week prior, but were holding steady for the five preceding days..

title: Fact Check: Coronavirus started spreading in the US in November 2019.
text:
Claim: Coronavirus started spreading in the US in November 2019.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The questions are very thorough and show when the first recorded case in the US was.

Evidence:

Q: What is coronavirus?
A: Coronaviruses (CoVs) are the largest group of viruses belonging to the Nidovirales order, which includes Coronaviridae, Arteriviridae, Mesoniviridae, and Roniviridae families. The Coronavirinae comprise one of two subfamilies in the Coronaviridae family, with the other being the Torovirinae. The Coronavirinae are further subdivided into four genera, the alpha, beta, gamma, and delta coronaviruses.. 

Q: Which strain of coronavirus does the claim refer to?
A: COVID-19, the infectious disease caused by the most recently discovered coronavirus.. 

Q: When was Covid 19 first reported in the U.S?
A: data for COVID-19 cases in the U.S lists the earliest date of illness onset as January 14, 2020..

title: Fact Check: The Covid-19 virus is a miracle of miracles, a miracle of miracles! Children do ...

Q: Do children catch covid-19?
A: yes, The U.S. Center for Disease Control and Prevention stated in a report published on April 6 that among 149,082 (99.6%) reported COVID-19 cases for which age was known, 2,572 (1.7%) were among children younger than 18 years.. 

Q: Do children get hospitalised from covid-19?
A: Yes - The U.S. Center for Disease Control and Prevention stated in a report published on April 6 that among 149,082 (99.6%) reported COVID-19 cases for which age was known, 2,572 (1.7%) were among children younger than 18 years. Of those, an estimated 5.7- 20 percent were hospitalized,. 

Q: Have any children died from covid 19?
A: Yes - The U.S. Center for Disease Control and Prevention stated in a report published on April 6 that among 149,082 (99.6%) reported COVID-19 cases for which age was known, 2,572 (1.7%) were among children younger than 18 years. Of those, an estimated 5.7- 20 percent were hospitalized, 0.58-2.0 percent were placed in an intensive care unit and three died.

title: Fact Check: Convalescent plasma therapy showing promise against COVID-19
text:
Claim: Convalescent plasma therapy showing promise against COVID-19

Verdict: Supported

Justification: Seems from the clinical data found in the questions to the answers, that this plasma therapy is indeed promising. Therefore, the claim is supported

Evidence:

Q: What is Convalescent plasma therapy?
A: Using convalescent plasma -- a component of blood -- as a treatment is a decades-old idea, and has been used to treat other diseases like influenza and measles. When a patient recovers from a disease, they produce antibodies to fight the presence of the antigen that caused the disease, and those proteins will remain in the blood for a few months.. 

Q: What proof is there that Convalescent plasma therapy is working for coronavirus patients?
A: Results  All 5 patients (age range, 36-65 years; 2 women) were receiving mechanical ventilation at the time of treatment and all had received antiviral agents and methylprednisolone. Following plasma transfusion, body temperature normalized within 3 days in 4 of 5 patients, the SOFA score decreased, and Pao2/Fio2 increased within 12 days (range, 172-276 before and 284-366 after). Viral loads also decreased and became negative within 12 days after the transfusion, and SARS-CoV-2–specific ELISA and neutralizing antibody titers increased following the transfusion (range, 40-60 before and 80-320 on day 7). ARDS resolved in 4 patients at 12 days after transfusion, and 3 patients were weaned from mechanical ventilation within 2 weeks of treatment. Of the 5 patients, 3 have been discharged from the hospital (length of stay: 53, 51, and 55 days), and 2 are in stable condition at 37 days after transfusion.

Conclusions and Relevance  In this preliminary uncontrolled case series of 5 critically ill patients with COVID-19 and ARDS, administration of convalescent plasma containing neutralizing antibody was followed by improvement in their clinical status. The limited sample size and study design preclude a definitive statement about the potential effectiveness of this treatment, and these observations require evaluation in clinical trials..

Added fats should be primarily liquid oils such as olive, canola, or soybean oil..

title: Fact Check: Drinking ash of Phyllostachys nigra (black bamboo) mixed with honey and cow’s mi...
text:
Claim: Drinking ash of Phyllostachys nigra (black bamboo) mixed with honey and cow’s milk is a potent treatment for COVID-19.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: QA pair states black bamboo is an alternative medicine and in another states no evidence to support alternative medicines being helpful.

Evidence:

Q: Is black bamboo used in alternative medicine?
A: Yes. 2.1.2 Phyllostachys nigra (Lodd.) Munro Commonly known as “black bamboo”, this is another major species in the genus Phyllostachys. Flavonoids extracted from black bamboo leaves have potent antioxidant activities (Hu et al., 2000; Zhang et al., 2002). Among these flavonoids, flavone c-glucosides and p-coumaric acid reportedly have long retention time in the colon and may contribute to free radical scavenging (Zhang et al., 2007). Luteolin 6-C-(6″-O-trans-caffeoylglucoside), an antioxidant isolated from the leaves, has been reported to protect against oxidative stress-induced cytotoxicity in retinal ganglion cells (Lee et al., 2010). It also enhances the activity of aldose reductase and inhibits the formation of advanced glycation end products, and therefore may potentially have a role in the prevention of diabetic complications (Jung et al., 2007).
Orientin, another antioxidant obtained from the leaves of black bamboo, exerts vaso-relaxant activity through the inhibition of intracellular Ca2+ release and extracellular Ca2+ influx (Fu et al., 2005). Orientin also prevents apoptosis induced by hypoxia and reoxygenation in myocardium and cardiomyocytes. The mechanism for this effect is inhibition of the activation of mitochondrial apoptotic pathway (Fu et al., 2006). These studies suggest potential for cardio-protective effects.

The acetone fraction of the leaves of Phyllostachys nigra (Lodd.) Munro has been shown to enhance leukemia cell differentiation (Kim et al., 2007b), and inhibit interleukin-12 (IL-12) production in lipopolysaccharide-activated macrophages via decreasing NF-kappaB binding activity (Kim et al., 2007a). These preliminary findings suggest potential anti-leukemia and anti-inflammation effects of the acetone extract.

Q: Can alternative medicines be used to effectively treat Covid-19?
A: No. It's a myth

title: Fact Check: The seasonal flu killed 80,000 people in the United States in 2018-2019
text:
Claim: The seasonal flu killed 80,000 people in the United States in 2018-2019

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: CDC estimates 28,000 deaths from influenza not 80,000.

Evidence:

Q: What was the mortality rate of the seasonal flu in 2018-2019 in the United States ?
A: 2018-2019 Estimates

Influenza activity in the United States during the 2018–2019 season began to increase in November and remained at high levels for several weeks during January–February5. Influenza A viruses were the predominant circulating viruses last year. While influenza A(H1N1pdm09) viruses predominated from October 2018 – mid February 2019, influenza A(H3N2) viruses were more commonly reported starting in late February 2019. Influenza B viruses were not commonly reported among circulating viruses during the 2018–2019 season. The season had moderate severity based on levels of outpatient influenza-like illness, hospitalizations rates, and proportions of pneumonia and influenza-associated deaths.

CDC estimates that the burden of illness during the 2018–2019 season included an estimated 35.5 million people getting sick with influenza, 16.5 million people going to a health care provider for their illness, 490,600 hospitalizations, and 34,200 deaths from influenza (Table 1). The number of influenza-associated illnesses that occurred last season was similar to the estimated number of influenza-associated illnesses during the 2012–2013 influenza season when an estimated 34 million people had symptomatic influenza illness6.

Peak activity during the 2018–2019 influenza season was classified as having moderate severity across ages in the population. Compared with the 2017–2018 season , which was classified as high severity, the overall rates and burden of influenza were much lower during the 2018–2019 season (Table 2). Among children, however, rates of influenza during the 2018–2019 season were similar to the 2017–2018 season. In addition, the 2018–2019 season had two waves of activity, including a wave predominated by influenza A(H1N1)pdm09 viruses and another wave of similar magnitude attributable to influenza A(H3N2) viruses5. The dual waves resulted in a protracted season during 2018–2019 that was less severe when compared with peak activity in 2017–2018, but r. 

Q: How many people got infected with the seasonal flu in 2018-2019 in the United States ?
A: The overall burden of influenza (flu) for the 2018-2019 season was an estimated 29 million flu illnesses, 13 million flu-related medical visits, 380,000 flu-related hospitalizations, and 28,000 flu deaths (Table 1).

For the past several years, CDC has estimated the numbers of flu illnesses, medical visits, hospitalizations, and deaths1–4. More information on How CDC Estimates Flu Burden and Why CDC Estimates Flu Burden is available.

title: Fact Check: All vaccines contain MRC-5 cells, which are aborted fetal cells.
text:
Claim: All vaccines contain MRC-5 cells, which are aborted fetal cells.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Some vaccines were developed using MRC-5 cells but not all. 

Evidence:

Q: What is MRC-5?
A: Human Cell Strains.
Two main human cell strains have been used to develop currently available vaccines, in each case with the original fetal cells in question obtained in the 1960s. The WI-38 cell strain was developed in 1962 in the United States, and the MRC-5 cell strain (also started with fetal lung cells) was developed, using Hayflick's technology, in 1970 at the Medical Research Center in the United Kingdom.. 

Q: What vaccines has MRC-5 been used to develop?
A: The vaccines below were developed using either the WI-38 or the MRC-5 cell strains.

Hepatitis A vaccines [VAQTA/Merck, Havrix/GlaxoSmithKline, and part of Twinrix/GlaxoSmithKline]
Rubella vaccine [MERUVAX II/Merck, part of MMR II/Merck, and ProQuad/Merck]
Varicella (chickenpox) vaccine [Varivax/Merck, and part of ProQuad/Merck]
Zoster (shingles) vaccine [Zostavax/Merck]
Adenovirus Type 4 and Type 7 oral vaccine [Barr Labs] *
Rabies vaccine [IMOVAX/Sanofi Pasteur] *. 

Q: Is there a Code of Ethics about using human fetal tissue for research?
A: Yes. Code of Medical Ethics Opinion 7.3.5

title: Fact Check: Chinese products can be identified by the first three digits of a barcode
text:
Claim: Chinese products can be identified by the first three digits of a barcode

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The prefix does not indicate country of origin.

Evidence:

Q: Does the GS1 Prefix (first 2 or 3 digits of the EAN-13 barcode number) show the country of origin?
A: ​​​No, The GS1 Prefix does not show the country of origin.
An EAN-13 barcode number always starts with the GS1 Prefix of the GS1 Member Organisation that allocated the barcode number. The GS1 Prefix does not indicate that the product was manufactured in a specific country or by a specific manufacturer; it may have been produced anywhere in the world..

title: Fact Check: There is always the possibility of an iatrogenic reaction to a vaccine.
text:
Claim: There is always the possibility of an iatrogenic reaction to a vaccine.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: Yes,fro  the 1st and 2nd QA it seems plausible that vaccines might cause an iatrogenic reaction. Therefore the claim is supported 

Evidence:

Q: Can vaccines cause an iatrogenic reaction?
A: Yes. Vaccines can cause a risk of side effects or complications.

Q: What is a Iatrogenic reaction?
A: Iatrogenic disease is the result of diagnostic and therapeutic procedures undertaken on a patient. With the multitude of drugs prescribed to a single patient adverse drug reactions are bound to occur. The Physician should take suitable steps to detect and manage them.

Iatrogenic (of a disease or symptoms) induced in a patient by the treatment or comments of a physician.

Chambers English Dictionary. 

Q: Are vaccines safe despite the risk of side effects or complications?
A: Any vaccine can cause side effects. For the most part these are minor (for example, a sore arm or low-grade fever) and go away within a few days. 

Remember, vaccines are continually monitored for safety, and like any medication, vaccines can cause side effects. However, a decision not to immunize a child also involves risk and could put the child and others who come into contact with him or her at risk of contracting a potentially deadly disease..

title: Fact Check: Immunization is compulsory in Canada

Q: Are there any circumstances where exemptions of mandatory vaccinations in those provinces for students are made?
A: While vaccination is generally required to attend school in Ontario and New Brunswick, there are exemptions given to those who are opposed..

title: Fact Check: Immunization is mandatory in the United States
text:
Claim: Immunization is mandatory in the United States

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The 14th Amendment asserts that no state shall make or enforce any law abridging the privileges of citizens of the United States, thus Immunization is not mandatory in the United States. 

Evidence:

Q: Does the claim refer to a single vaccine immunisation?
A: No. It refers to any enforced mandatory vaccination.

Q: Is is law in the U.S to accept any and all vaccines?
A: No. All 50 states have legislation requiring specified vaccines for students. Although exemptions vary from state to state, all school immunization laws grant exemptions to children for medical reasons. There are 44 states and Washington D.C. that grant religious exemptions for people who have religious objections to immunizations. Currently, 15 states allow philosophical exemptions for children whose parents object to immunizations because of personal, moral or other beliefs. Many states align their vaccine requirements with recommendations from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention’s Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices. At this time, no state requires children to receive the COVID-19 vaccine for school entry.

Q: is it lawful to impose mandatory immuisation
A: The 14th Amendment asserts that no state shall make or enforce any law abridging the privileges or immunities of citizens of the United States or deprive anY their rights.

title: Fact Check: There are 360,000 deaths a year in the US from swimming pools. But we don’t shut...

A: Every year in the United States there are an estimated:

3,960* fatal unintentional drownings, including boating-related drowning—that is an average of 11 drowning deaths per day.
8,080† nonfatal drownings—that is an average of 22 nonfatal drownings per day..

title: Fact Check: Jay Leno Dead at 71
text:

There are (tiny) satire logos in the header and in the eye of the eagle shown in the picture used to illustrate the story.
The site has an "About" page that explains the purpose of the site..

A: Yes. Hong Kong saw a COVID-19 surge which meant the government ordered facilities that had reopened to close again and for people to go back home.

title: Fact Check: Alcohol plays a major role in killing the coronavirus because it is a “throat sa...
text:
Claim: Alcohol plays a major role in killing the coronavirus because it is a “throat sanitizer”.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Drinking alcohol actually increased health risks when one is infected with COVID and increases susceptibility to catching COVID and other illnesses

Evidence:

Q: What is the basis of this claim?
A: The claim asserts that because alcohol is used in hand sanitizer and cleaning products to kill the virus that causes COVID-19 on hands and surfaces, drinking it will have the same effect inside the body and sanitize the throat. This is definitely not the case. The US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) notes that, while certain types of alcohol can be used to disinfect surfaces and your skin, they are poisonous when ingested. Alcohol-based hand sanitizers require an alcohol concentration of 60% to 80% by volume. 

Q: Will drinking alcohol disinfect your throat or kill COVID-19 in your body?
A: No. Drinking alcohol actually increased health risks when one is infected with COVID and increases susceptibility to catching COVID and other illnesses.

A: This story was first published by “Weekly Inquirer”, which was replicated by many other websites, says an India Today report.

But the India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) found this to be a hoax.

This is a satire article published by the website “Weekly Inquirer”, the AFWA said..

title: Fact Check: Trump Claims ‘Ultimate Authority’ to Override States’ Virus Measures
text:
Claim: Trump Claims ‘Ultimate Authority’ to Override States’ Virus Measures

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The 1st Q&A pair shows a rule that states that The President has no formal legal authority to categorically override local or state shelter-in-place orders  which refutes what trump says in the claim.

Evidence:

Q: What did Trump actually say?
A: Reporter: “There’s a debate over what authority you have to order the country reopened. What authority do you have on this one?”
Mr. Trump: “Well, I have the ultimate authority.”. 

Q: Does Trump have the authority to override stay-at-home or shelter-in-place orders from governors, or “total” authority in general?
A: No. “The President has no formal legal authority to categorically override local or state shelter-in-place orders or to reopen schools and small businesses,” Stephen I. Vladeck, a professor at the University of Texas School of Law, said on Twitter. “No statute delegates to him such power; no constitutional provision invests him with such authority.”

Q: What authority does he have?
A: While the federal government has authority over interstate and foreign quarantine measures, states have the primary authority to impose and enforce quarantine and isolation measures within their own borders, as part of the police powers conferred to states by the 10th Amendment of the Constitution, according to the Congressional Research Service and the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention..

CNN
 — 
Fears are mounting across Asia over the cross-border spread of a new coronavirus identified in China that has killed one patient and sickened dozens, as health authorities race to identify the source of the pathogen.

The new strain of coronavirus, in the same family as the deadly severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) and Middle East respiratory syndrome (MERS), originated in Wuhan, the largest city in central China. It was confirmed Thursday to have been detected in Japan, a few days after Thailand confirmed its first case of infection..

title: Fact Check: In June 2017, Conservative MPs voted against a pay rise for nurses.
text:
Claim: In June 2017, Conservative MPs voted against a pay rise for nurses.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: The majority of conservative MPs did vote against pay rises for nurses. 

Evidence:

Q: Did Conservative MPs vote against a pay rise for nurses in June 2017?
A: On 28 June 2017 MPs voted on whether or not to lift that 1 per cent cap, meaning workers including nurses might get a pay rise. And the majority voted against it.. 

Q: Did Conservative MPs lift the 1 percent cap?
A: In September of 2017 Theresa May began to show flexibility, allowing pay rises for police officers and prison workers. 

Then in March 2018 she lifted the cap on pay rises for NHS workers. 

This cap was eventually lifted was largely owing to pressure on Theresa May's government from worker's unions and the Labour Party who gained 30 seats in parliament less than a month before the vote in 2017.. 

Q: Did nurses receive a pay raise after the cap was lifted?
A: Unions including Unison and the Royal College of Nursing agreed on a pay rise of 6.5 per cent over three years for nurses, paramedics, midwives and healthcare assistants.

This would take starting pay for nurses from around £22,000 in 2018 to £25,000 next year..

Q: How much did Nebraska receive in stimulus payments per Covid case in 2020
A: over $300,000 per case.

title: Fact Check: In the United States, the CDC (Centers for Disease Control and Prevention) admit...

title: Fact Check: In October 2019, Bill Gates sponsored Event 201, a simulation that estimated 65 ...
text:
Claim: In October 2019, Bill Gates sponsored Event 201, a simulation that estimated 65 million people would be killed by coronavirus.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The 201 event was an exercise that illustrated areas where public-private partnerships will be necessary during the response to a severe pandemic in order to diminish large-scale economic and societal consequences. It had no association with the COVID-19 pandemic and did not predict 65 million deaths due to the coronavirus. Hence - this claim is refuted. 

Evidence:

Q: What was the event that Bill gates funded?
A: Event 201. 

Q: What was the event and did they predict covid-19 ?
A: It was an exercise and not a prediction. 
The Johns Hopkins Center for Health Security in partnership with the World Economic Forum and the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation hosted Event 201, a high-level pandemic exercise on October 18, 2019, in New York, NY. The exercise illustrated areas where public/private partnerships will be necessary during the response to a severe pandemic in order to diminish large-scale economic and societal consequences.. 

Q: Did they predict 65 million people would die?
A: No, there is no mention of this..

title: Fact Check: The U.S. government is planning to force Americans to take vaccinations during t...
text:
Claim: The U.S. government is planning to force Americans to take vaccinations during the coronavirus pandemic with the help of Bill Gates.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: From the Q&As you can see that the claim is not correct. People were not being forced to have the vaccine. 

Evidence:

Q: Did the U.S government intend to force  Americans to take the Covid-19 Vaccine in connivance  with Bill Gates ?
A: NEW YORK -- The World Health Organization (WHO), UNICEF, the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIAID) and the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation have announced a collaboration to increase coordination across the international vaccine community and create a Global Vaccine Action Plan.  This plan will build on the successes of current work to achieve key milestones in the discovery, development and delivery of lifesaving vaccines to the most vulnerable populations in the poorest countries over the next decade.

The collaboration follows the January 2010 call by Bill and Melinda Gates for the next ten years to be the Decade of Vaccines.  The Global Vaccine Action Plan will enable greater coordination across all stakeholder groups – national governments, multilateral organizations, civil society, the private sector and philanthropic organizations -- and will identify critical policy, resource, and other gaps that must be addressed to realize the life-saving potential of vaccines. 

The structure of the Decade of Vaccines Collaboration includes a Leadership Council to provide oversight for the planning effort, a Steering Committee that holds the primary responsibility for developing the action plan, an International Advisory Committee to assist the Leadership Council in evaluating the action plan, and a Secretariat for administrative support. 

Prof. Pedro Alonso, Director for the Institute for Global Health of Barcelona and Dr. Christopher Elias, President and CEO of PATH, have been appointed co-chairs of the Steering Committee and the Secretariat. 

“Vaccines are miracles,” said Prof. Alonso, “For just a few dollars per child, vaccines prevent disease and disability for a lifetime. We must make sure that people understand that vaccines are one of the best investments in health.”                                                             

The Leadership Council is comprised of:

    Dr. Mar. 

Q: Did the U.S government intend to force Americans to take the Covid-19 Vaccination in connivance  with Bill Gates?
A: NEW YORK -- The World Health Organization (WHO), UNICEF, the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIAID) and the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation have announced a collaboration to increase coordination across the international vaccine community and create a Global Vaccine Action Plan.  This plan will build on the successes of current work to achieve key milestones in the discovery, development and delivery of lifesaving vaccines to the most vulnerable populations in the poorest countries over the next decade.

The collaboration follows the January 2010 call by Bill and Melinda Gates for the next ten years to be the Decade of Vaccines.  The Global Vaccine Action Plan will enable greater coordination across all stakeholder groups – national governments, multilateral organizations, civil society, the private sector and philanthropic organizations -- and will identify critical policy, resource, and other gaps that must be addressed to realize the life-saving potential of vaccines. 

The structure of the Decade of Vaccines Collaboration includes a Leadership Council to provide oversight for the planning effort, a Steering Committee that holds the primary responsibility for developing the action plan, an International Advisory Committee to assist the Leadership Council in evaluating the action plan, and a Secretariat for administrative support. 

Prof. Pedro Alonso, Director for the Institute for Global Health of Barcelona and Dr. Christopher Elias, President and CEO of PATH, have been appointed co-chairs of the Steering Committee and the Secretariat. 

“Vaccines are miracles,” said Prof. Alonso, “For just a few dollars per child, vaccines prevent disease and disability for a lifetime. We must make sure that people understand that vaccines are one of the best investments in health.”                                                             

The Leadership Council is comprised of:

    Dr. Mar. 

Q: Is it mandatory for Americans to take the COVID-19 vaccinations?
A: No. Employees at Montgomery County (in the United States) are not required to be vaccinated. Their sites states: "while COVID-19 vaccines are encouraged, the choice to receive a vaccine is voluntary". Therefore, COVID-19 vaccinations are not mandatory.

title: Fact Check: 5G radiation is harmful to human health
text:
Claim: 5G radiation is harmful to human health

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: There are no major health risks associated with exposure to 5G radiation

Evidence:

Q: Is 5G radiation harmful to human health?
A: the World Health Organization's International EMF Project, which investigates the health effects of electromagnetic fields on humans, argues there are "no major public health risks [that] have emerged from several decades of EMF research.". 

Q: What are the potential health risks from 5G?
A: To date, and after much research performed, no adverse health effect has been causally linked with exposure to wireless technologies. Health-related conclusions are drawn from studies performed across the entire radio spectrum but, so far, only a few studies have been carried out at the frequencies to be used by 5G.

Tissue heating is the main mechanism of interaction between radiofrequency fields and the human body. Radiofrequency exposure levels from current technologies result in negligible temperature rise in the human body.

As the frequency increases, there is less penetration into the body tissues and absorption of the energy becomes more confined to the surface of the body (skin and eye). Provided that the overall exposure remains below international guidelines, no consequences for public health are anticipated..

Q: What happens to an inactive voter?
A: a State may remove a registrant who "(i) has failed to
respond to a notice" and "(ii) has not voted or appeared to vote ...
during the period beginning on the date of the notice and ending on
the day after the date of the second general election for Federal office
that occurs after the date of the notice" (about four years). 52 U. S. C.
§20507(d)(l)(B). Not only are States allowed to remove registrants
who satisfy these requirements, but federal law makes this removal
mandatory.. 

Q: What is the US Federal law regarding inactive voters?
A: The National Voter Registration Act (NVRA) is a federal law requiring the removal of inactive registrations from the voter rolls after two general federal elections (encompassing from 2 to 4 years).. 

Q: What are the main reasons that voters become inactive?
A: Inactive voter registrations belong, for the most part, to voters who have moved to another county or state or have passed away..

title: Fact Check: Consuming ewedu will cure COVID-19.
text:

Q: What is Ewedu?
A: Ewedu leaves, (Corchorus olitorius) Jute leaf, popularly called ewedu among the Yoruba, ahinghara in Igbo and rama in Hausa, is a popular vegetable in West Africa.. 

Q: What does it contain that is claimed to help coronovirus?
A: the ewedu leaves, botanically called ‘corchorus olitorius’, contain flavonoid that helps zinc to enter into the virus-infected cell and prevents the reproduction mechanism of its RNA genetic material to stop the virus from reproducing inside the body”.. 

Q: Is this special to Ewedu?
A: zinc, as a micronutrient, is not peculiar to Ewedu alone, there are other leaves or food with zinc. So, Coronavirus disease cure is not just by the micronutrient, rather, it has to do with claims that have been scientifically proven. 

Miss Ugochukwu noted that other sources of zinc are meat, whole grains and nuts; adding that “Whatever nutrients you can find in ewedu can also be found in other foods; not that Ewedu has whatever special properties.”.

title: Fact Check: British author David Icke claimed that the Covid-19 pandemic was orchestrated by...

Q: Is David Icke a conspiracy theorist?
A: Icke spent the rest of the decade fleshing out his prophecies, becoming a one-stop global clearinghouse for any and all fringe theories, from UFOlogy to the Illuminati to Matrix-style media critique to Occupy Wall Street (about which he made a documentary after traveling to New York). His cosmology is voracious and wide-ranging, absorbing all conspiracy theories into a single, massive omni-theory.. 

Q: Can viruses spread through new technologies?
A: Experts have also concluded that there was no proof that mobile phone technologies could cause cancer or be harmful. “Health-related conclusions are drawn from studies performed across the entire radio spectrum but, so far, only a few studies have been carried out at the frequencies to be used by 5G.”.

title: Fact Check: The RT-PCR test does not detect Covid-19.
text:
Claim: The RT-PCR test does not detect Covid-19.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: tests for qualitative detection of nucleic acid from SARS-CoV-2 in upper and lower
respiratory specimens (such as nasopharyngeal or oropharyngeal swabs, sputum, lower respiratory tract aspirates, bronchoalveolar lavage, and nasopharyngeal wash/aspirate or nasal aspirate)

Evidence:

Q: What is the RT-PCR test?
A: The CDC 2019-Novel Coronavirus (2019-nCoV) Real-Time RT-PCR Diagnostic Panel is a real-time RT-PCR
test intended for the qualitative detection of nucleic acid from SARS-CoV-2 in upper and lower
respiratory specimens (such as nasopharyngeal or oropharyngeal swabs, sputum, lower respiratory tract
aspirates, bronchoalveolar lavage, and nasopharyngeal wash/aspirate or nasal aspirate) collected from
individuals suspected of COVID-19 by their healthcare provider.

A: An exosome is an extracellular vesicle which is a particle with a lipid bilayer and cytoplasmic contents that cannot replicate like a cell and an exosome is an EV, usually a small one, that is released from an internal compartment of the cell”.

A: The exosomes is a sphere surrounded by a uniform membrane without the presence of spikes nor the shape of a crown but the coronavirus has “small peaks” (growths) formed by the protein “spike”, which gives it its characteristic crown shape.

This is not thought to be the main way the virus spreads, but we are still learning more about this virus.”

Q: Did the Philippine General Hospital claim that there is a correlation between grocery shopping and COVID-19?
A: No. In a statement posted on Facebook on April 4, 2020, the hospital said: “There is no such observed trend with our admitted COVID-19 (+) patients acquiring the illness from groceries.

Q: What did the Philippine General Hospital say about this claim
A: They said that there was no such correlation between their COVID-19 patients and grocery shopping.

title: Fact Check: Lighting a Diya or candle, can kill Coronavirus.
text:
Claim: Lighting a Diya or candle, can kill Coronavirus.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: From the evidence below, Lighting a Diya or candle is not listed as one of the preventative measures for COVID-19. No evidence to suggest a Diya or candle can kill the Coronavirus.

Evidence:

Q: Can Lighting a Diya or candle kill Coronavirus?
A: Prevention Strategies in Alignment With the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
Behavior

Wear a Mask: When in public settings or when around people outside of your household, wear a properly-fitting cloth face covering. Wash your hands before putting on your face covering, put it over your nose and mouth and secure it under your chin, and try to fit it snugly against the sides of your face. Make sure you can still breathe easily.

Hand washing: The most well-established way to prevent respiratory infections such as influenza and coronavirus is frequent and thorough hand washing with soap and water. Scrub your hands thoroughly with soap and water for at least 20 seconds.

Hand sanitizer: Handwashing with soap and water is the best way to reduce germs, but if they are not available, alcohol-based hand sanitizers that contain at least 60% alcohol can help to reduce the spread of infection. Note: avoid any products containing triclosan, a known hormone-disrupting chemical.

Covering your mouth and nose: Cover your mouth and nose with a tissue when coughing or sneezing; if your hands are not free or you don’t have a tissue, cough or sneeze into your sleeve, not your bare hands.

Not touching your face: Avoid touching your eyes, nose, and mouth with unwashed hands, which can help provide the virus with a route of entry into the body. Since the average individual touches their face an average of 15 times per hour, remain vigilant!

Keeping surfaces clean: Clean and disinfect frequently touched surfaces, especially when someone is ill. Surfaces to consider include doorknobs, phones, computer keyboards, remotes, and other surfaces that are frequently touched in rooms such as the bathroom and kitchen.
Lifestyle

Stress reduction: Chronic stress can negatively alter immune system responses, making you more likely to get sick. Identify your personal stress reduction strategies and practice them regularly.

Sleep: Sleep has a big influence on immune function, so it is es. 

Q: How does burning candles eliminate corona
A: COVID-19 can be transmitted by people with the virus coughing or sneezing, releasing tiny contaminated droplets into the air, putting anyone within range in danger of inhaling them. These droplets can travel more than a metre from the infected person, allowing them to settle on any surfaces ready to be transferred to anyone that touches the surface.

The virus can live on some surfaces for several days. Data from the 2003 SARS outbreak, which was a similar illness to the latest coronavirus, showed the virus could contaminate plastered walls for up to a day and a half, plastic and stainless steel for 72 hours, and glass for 96 hours. So it’s likely the mobile phone, tablet or computer screen you are reading this on could harbour COVID-19 for up to four days, and be transferred to anyone touching the screen.

Adopting good hygiene is one of the most effective weapons to slow or prevent the virus spreading. Here are six things you can do to protect yourself and others.


1. Avoid touching your eyes, nose and mouth

Our hands touch door handles, keyboards, taps and numerous other surfaces, so the virus could easily be picked up this way. Rubbing tired eyes or touching your nose or mouth could transfer the virus from your hands into your body.

2. Wash your hands regularly

Clean your hands thoroughly and often, using plenty of soap and water or an alcohol-based hand rub to kill any virus on your hands. Scrub for at least 20 seconds, making sure you clean fingers, thumbs and palms.



3. Practise respiratory hygiene


If you cough or sneeze, use a tissue and throw it in the trash afterwards. If you don’t have a tissue, cough into the crook of your arm instead of using your hand. If possible, avoid coughing or sneezing near other people.

4. Maintain social distancing

Be aware of people around you and keep your distance from anyone coughing or sneezing. Stay at least 1 metre away to prevent inhaling the small liquid droplets sprayed by coughs and sneezes..

title: Fact Check: Alcohol weakens the immune system, making it difficult for the body to fight inf...
text:
Claim: Alcohol weakens the immune system, making it difficult for the body to fight infections such as Covid-19.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: the answer show heavy alcohol consumption does affect the immune system, negatively. 

Evidence:

Q: Does Alcohol intake weakens the immune system ?
A: Too much alcohol dulls more than your wits. It also weakens your immune system and could make you much more vulnerable to viruses, including HIV.

To see how alcohol affects resistance to infection, Gyongyi Szabo of the University of Massachusetts Medical School in Worcester and colleagues exposed monocytes – white blood cells involved in the front-line defence against infection – to chemicals that mimic viruses and bacteria. Half of the cells were also soused in the levels of alcohol that a person might have in their blood after quaffing four or five alcoholic drinks daily for a week.

Alcohol blunted the monocytes’ defences. When the over-the-limit cells were exposed to a virus mimic, they produced only a quarter as much of the virus-fighting signalling molecule called type-1 interferon as teetotal monocytes made.

“Interferon is pivotal, the first response to any viral infection,” says Szabo. “There’s no viral elimination without it.”. 

Q: What is the effect of Alcohol  on the immune system ?
A: Weakening the immune system is one of many negative effects heavy alcohol consumption has on the body. The mechanism is not fully understood and other factors such as age, gender, diet, state of general health may play a part.

Some studies have shown that, in moderation, certain alcoholic beverages such as wine and beer can actually decrease inflammation in the body. But at the same time, other studies suggest that even moderate consumption can do damage.. 

Q: How does Alcohol impact the Immune System ?
A: Advanced knowledge into the complex multi-layered interactions of alcohol on the immune system has been exposed in a wide range of research papers over the past decade, concluding that excessive alcohol consumption and misuse can have serious long-term deleterious effects on the immune system. Additionally, a mother who exposes her developing fetus to alcohol puts the baby at risk for fetal alcohol syndrome (FAS) and an impaired immune system that is more susceptible to disease. An adult who drinks to excess puts themselves at risk of contracting pneumonia, as well as a greater likelihood of acute respiratory stress syndrome (ARDS), sepsis, alcoholic liver disease (ALD), and slower recovery from infection, wound healing and trauma..

Verdict: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

Justification: Evidence finds that the "Covid-Organics" herbal drink is composed of 62% Artemisia. Artemisia has been considered as a possible treatment for COVID-19 and should be tested for efficacy and adverse side effects. Artemisia herba-alba has also been found to be useful against COVID-19 (in silico); however, there is insufficient clinical research evidence based on these compounds for the treatment of SARS-CoV-2.

Evidence:

Q: What are the main ingredients of Covid-Organics?
A: The Covid-Organics is composed of 62% Artemisia and other medicinal plants with antiseptic properties, bronchial thinner used in the composition of traditional remedies for years.
(Google Translate). 

Q: What does World Health Organisation (WHO) say about the use of Artemisia to treat COVID-19?
A: Medicinal plants such as Artemisia annua are being considered as possible treatments for COVID-19 and should be tested for efficacy and adverse side effects.. 

Q: Has any testing of the use of Artemisia been carried out to treat COVID-19?
A: The Max Planck Institute of Colloids and Interfaces, Potsdam (Germany) will collaborate with ArtemiLife Inc., a US based company and medical researchers in Denmark and Germany to test Artemisia annua plant extract and artemisinin derivatives in laboratory cell studies against the novel coronavirus Sars-CoV-2..

title: Fact Check: The radiation from cell phones and 5G towers are what is currently killing peopl...
text:
Claim: The radiation from cell phones and 5G towers are what is currently killing people, not coronavirus.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Evidence finds that 5G is not harmful to people's health. It also finds that there are around 96,000 reported cases of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-2019) and 3300 reported deaths to date (March 5, 2020). Hence, the claim is refuted.

Evidence:

Q: Does radiation from cell phones and 5G towers kill people
A: There is no evidence that 5G is harmful to people’s health. 

Q: How many people have died from the coronaviirus on or before April 2020
A: There have been around 96,000 reported cases of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-2019) and 3300 reported deaths to date (05/03/2020).

title: Fact Check: Romanian workers are being brought in to do seasonal British farm work, despite ...
text:
Claim: Romanian workers are being brought in to do seasonal British farm work, despite huge interest in these roles by British people.

Verdict: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

Justification: QA pairs do state that there was an increase in interest however many did not follow up with interview offers.

It also states Romania workers have the experience required to work the roles while any British counterparts are trained up.

Evidence:

Q: Are romanian workers  being brought in to do seasonal British farm work?
A: Yes. In mid-april 2020 it was  confirmed that a number of flights would be privately chartered to bring in experienced farmworkers from Romania.

Q: Was there huge interest from British people, in these jobs?
A: job site Totaljobs reported at the start of April that there had been an 83% increase in applications for agricultural roles in the past month. 

Q: Was there still a shortage of workers despite this?
A: The Country Land and Business association estimates that 80,000 agricultural workers will be needed by the industry this season. Others report a shortage closer to 90,000, although it is unclear where this figure comes from.

The Guardian reported in mid-April that 450 Romanian workers were expected to be brought in to help by one charter airline. This would still leave the vast majority of roles needing to be filled. 

The same article quotes Concordia, a Brighton-based charity that recruits volunteers, as saying that despite high interest in paid roles, of the 35,000 applicants, only 5,500 had taken up interview offers..

title: Fact Check: Air India is evacuating Indians stranded in UK
text:
Claim: Air India is evacuating Indians stranded in UK

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The Q&As show that Indians were not being evacuated from the UK so the claim is refuted.

Evidence:

Q: has Air India ever evacuated Indians stranded in UK?
A: No. Air India did plane to provide nine charter flights in Indian cities to send stranded German nationals back home from India.

Q: Did Indians become stranded in the U.K?
A: Indians whose visas were about to expire in the near future were stranded due to the inability to travel out of the UK due to restrictions imposed over the coronavirus pandemic.. 

Q: Were Indians who were stranded in the UK due to Covid restrictions flown out by Air India?
A: No. The UK extended the  visa's of stranded Indians until May 31

title: Fact Check: There is a 70% contagion probability between a COVID-19 carrier not wearing a ma...
text:
Claim: There is a 70% contagion probability between a COVID-19 carrier not wearing a mask and a non-carrier wearing a mask; a 5% contagion probability between a COVID-19 carrier wearing a mask and a non-carrier not wearing a mask; and a 1.5% contagion probability between a COVID-19 carrier and a non-carrier both wearing masks.

Verdict: Not Enough Evidence

Justification: There's not enough evidence from the QA pair to either support or refute this claim 

Evidence:

Q: Is there evidence available about contagion percentages between carriers and non-carriers of Covid wearing masks?
A: No answer could be found.. 

Q: Do masks help prevent contagion between carriers and non-carriers of covid?
A: Wearing a high-quality mask along with vaccination, self-testing, and physical distancing, helps protect you and others by reducing the chance of spreading COVID-19.. 

Q: Is the COVID-19 contagion probability between two people 70% if the carrier is not masked?
A: No answer could be found..

title: Fact Check: India trying to prevent people from posting COVID-19 updates.
text:
Claim: India trying to prevent people from posting COVID-19 updates.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Q&A 1 and 2 show that the government of India had no law provisioning that they can stop people from posting updates or sharing news online during the time of the claim.
Q&A 3 shows that around the time of the claim the Indian Gov did ask its supreme court for the power to prevent only media from posting updates and news online with out checking facts first.
With Q&A 4 showing that no prevision was being sought or existed to prevent people from posting news and updates about the pandemic as they wish. so as the claim specifically says 'people' only then this is refuted.


Evidence:

Q: What actions had India taken during the COVID-19 outbreak, at the time of this claim, april 2020?
A: The Central government on 24 March, the day when the 21-day lockdown was announced, had stated that the Disaster Management Act, 2005 was being invoked to deal with COVID-19.. 

Q: Does this Act have a provision for preventing or sharing news related to COVID-19?
A: No. There is no provision to prevent the sharing of news about COVID-19

Q: Did the Indian government make any orders to try and prevent media from printing, publishing, or telecasting any news on the pandemic?
A: Yes. On 31 March, 2020 the Central government had approached the Supreme Court asking it to prevent media from printing, publishing, or telecasting any news on the pandemic without first ascertaining the facts with government authorities. But the Supreme Court had passed an order saying it did not intend to interfere with the free discussion about the pandemic but the media must refer to and publish the official versions of the developments.

title: Fact Check: The president of Nigeria has dismissed his Chief of Staff because of his wellbei...
text:
Claim: The president of Nigeria has dismissed his Chief of Staff because of his wellbeing challenge on the coronavirus.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Refuted as fake news in QA pair.

Evidence:

Q: Did The president of Nigeria dismiss his Chief of Staff because of his wellbeing challenge on the coronavirus?
A: Buhari Did NOT Sack Kyari Amid COVID-19 Status. 

Q: Did president of Nigeria, Muhammadu Buhari dismissed his Chief of Staff Abba Kyari’s due to his COVID-19 status ?
A: No, Buhari did not Sack Abba Kyari. Abba Kyari was tested +ve for Covid , but was not sacked. The Public Notice image circulated on WhatsApp was False..

title: Fact Check: If you ask Amazon’s Alexa about the origin of the coronavirus pandemic, it says ...
text:
Claim: If you ask Amazon’s Alexa about the origin of the coronavirus pandemic, it says “the government planned” it.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: There is a difference between saying somebody planned something and blaming someone for something.
There is a difference between planning a pandemic and creating a virus. 
The question and answer don't "match". The answer doesn't specifically answer what was asked.
The source given is a fact checking article.

Evidence:

Q: Does Alexa say that the government planned the covid pandemic?
A: Alexa doesn't blame the government for creating COVID-19.

title: Fact Check: Jio is giving Indian users a free recharge of ₹498.
text:
Claim: Jio is giving Indian users a free recharge of ₹498.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The answers and source show that the website that is claimed to give away the recharge does not load and therefore the claim is refuted.

Evidence:

Q: What is ₹ ?
A: Indian Rupee. 

Q: What website does this offer link to?
A: jiofreecharge.xyz. 

Q: Is .xyz a valid domain name?
A: Yes. .xyz is a top-level domain name.

title: Fact Check: The anti-tuberculosis vaccine protects against coronavirus.
text:
Claim: The anti-tuberculosis vaccine protects against coronavirus.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: From the 2nd QA it is evident that there is no truth to the tuberculosis vaccine being effective against covid. Therefore the label is refuted 

Evidence:

Q: What vaccine is used for tuberculosis?
A: BCG. 

Q: Is there any proof that the BCG vaccine offers protection against Covid-19?
A: WHO have said - There is no evidence that the Bacille Calmette-Guérin vaccine (BCG) protects people against infection with COVID-19 virus.".

title: Fact Check: In Serbia, the stricter Covid19 curfew measures prevented dog walking for up to ...
text:
Claim: In Serbia, the stricter Covid19 curfew measures prevented dog walking for up to 14 hours at a time.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: The ban in Serbia on weekends was from 15:00 to 5:00 which is 14hrs. 

Evidence:

Q: What were some of the stricter nationwide curfew measures  the Republic of Serbia introduced to prevent the spread of COVID-19 on March 28, 2020?
A: The government of the Republic of Serbia  decided to withdraw the decision on the allowed walk of pets for 20 minutes between 20.00 and 21.00, and people had to stay in their homes on Saturdays and Sundays, as well as weekdays, from 15.00 to 5.00.. 

Q: As a result of the new stricter measures, how many hours did dogs have to wait between being allowed outdoors?
A: In Serbia, the #Covid19 curfew means we can’t walk our dogs for up to 14 hours at a time..

title: Fact Check: COVID-19 virus could be spread from shoes.
text:
Claim: COVID-19 virus could be spread from shoes.

Verdict: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

Justification: If you are around someone with COVID-19 or in high-risk environments - then people coughing around you or your clothes touching contaminated surfaces - there is a risk of COVID-19 being spread to your shoes and being able to transmit the virus. 

Evidence:

Q: How is COVID-19 primarily spread?
A: The
disease can spread from person to person through small droplets from
the nose or mouth which are spread when a person with COVID-19
coughs or exhales. These droplets land on objects and surfaces around
the person. Other people then catch COVID-19 by touching these
objects or surfaces, then touching their eyes, nose or mouth. People
can also catch COVID-19 if they breathe in droplets from a person
with COVID-19 who coughs out or exhales droplets.. 

Q: Can clothing, like shoes, transmit COVID-19?
A: No. Unless someone is coughing on you, or your clothing is in contact with a high-contact surface, it’s not so likely that the virus would remain on your clothes

title: Fact Check: COVID-19 is transmitted through fruits and vegetables in Hong Kong
text:
Claim: COVID-19 is transmitted through fruits and vegetables in Hong Kong

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Q&A 1 states that  coronavirus disease can not penetrate food which is in line with what the claim says, 
Q&A 2 says no evidence to support transmission of COVID-19 associated with food. 

Evidence:

Q: What was the official advice at the time of the claim in Hong Kong related to COVID-19 when preparing fruit and vegatables?
A: Centre for Food Safety, Hong Kong stated in March 2020 - Social platforms continue to spew lies that 2019 coronavirus disease can penetrate food spread.
FYI: There are currently no reports of coronavirus infection in humans with food. - The Food Safety Center reminds citizens: Keep your hands clean, especially before and after food, as before and after food.. 

Q: What detailed food saftey information was available at the time of the claim from official sources?
A: The CFC stated - Currently there is no evidence to support transmission of COVID-19 associated with food. Before preparing or eating food, it is important to always wash your hands with soap and water for 20 seconds for general food safety. Throughout the day, wash your hands after blowing your nose, coughing or sneezing, or going to the bathroom.

It may be possible that a person can get COVID-19 by touching a surface or object that has the virus on it and then touching their own mouth, nose, or possibly their eyes, but this is not thought to be the main way the virus spreads. In general, because of poor survivability of these coronaviruses on surfaces, there is likely very low risk of spread from food products or packaging. You should always handle and prepare food safely, including keeping raw meat separate from other foods, refrigerating perishable foods, and cooking meat to the right temperature to kill harmful germs. See CDC’s Food Safety site for more information..

title: Fact Check: In India the 21-day lockdown due to COVID-19 is to be extended.
text:
Claim: In India the 21-day lockdown due to COVID-19 is to be extended.

Verdict: Refuted

Evidence:

Q: Did any news agencies research this claim and report on it?
A: PBNS got in touch with the Cabinet Secretary on this news article. 

The Cabinet Secretary expressed surprise & said that there is no such plan of extending the lockdown..

title: Fact Check: Depending on the poll, between 58% and 81% of Americans were supportive of keepi...
text:
Claim: Depending on the poll, between 58% and 81% of Americans were supportive of keeping current restrictions in place or even expanding them to the nation as a whole.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: the statistics of both 81% and 58% seem to be correct and are backed up by sources. 

Evidence:

Q: Were most Americans okay with movement restrictions during the pandemic
A: Yes they were okay with restrictions are they understood movement during that time was a health risk. 

Q: Are 58 - 81% of Americans supportive of keeping current Cobid-19 restrictions in place?
A: April 3 - 4, 2020 - 1000 US adult citizens
81% thought that staying at home unless they have an essential reason for going out is the right decision..

title: Fact Check: A Chinese doctor who went to help Italians found out that the main reason why CO...
text:
Claim: A Chinese doctor who went to help Italians found out that the main reason why COVID-19 spreads quickly in Italy is because Italians like to use the same shoes that they wear outside into the house, for some people even into the bedroom.”

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: This couldn't have been true because the major mode of transmission isn't what  was posited in the claim

Evidence:

Q: How is COVID-19 transmitted between humans?
A: According to current evidence, COVID-19 virus is transmitted between people through respiratory droplets and
contact routes.1-6

Droplet transmission occurs when a person is in in close contact (within 1 m) with someone who has respiratory
symptoms (e.g. coughing or sneezing,) and is therefore at risk of having his/her mucosae (mouth and nose) or
conjunctiva (eyes) exposed to potentially infective respiratory droplets (which are generally considered to
be > 5-10 μm in diameter). Droplet transmission may also occur through fomites in the immediate environment
around the infected person.7
 Therefore, transmission of the COVID-19 virus can occur by direct contact with
infected people and indirect contact with surfaces in the immediate environment or with objects used on the
infected person (e.g. stethoscope or thermometer). 

Q: What is the main source of transmission for COVID-19?
A: The latest guidelines from Chinese health authorities [23, 43] described three main transmission routes for the COVID-19: 1) droplets transmission, 2) contact transmission, and 3) aerosol transmission..

title: Fact Check: Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chauhan said that from 01/04/2020 pe...
text:
Claim: Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chauhan said that from 01/04/2020 people who violate lockdown would be shot down immediately.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The tweet was refuted on the government twitter page so would be a reputable source.

Evidence:

Q: Did Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chauhan issue a shoot on sight order for people violating lockdown?
A: No. This was refuted by a tweet from the official Twitter handle of Department of Public Relations, Government of Madhya Pradesh

title: Fact Check: Democratic nominee for president Joe Biden has received campaign donations from ...

Q: What is 'ANTIFA'
A: Antifa look to disrupt alt-right events and far-right speakers. They use a variety of tactics to do this – including shouting and chanting and forming human chains to block off right-wing demonstrators. 

Q: are there any reported links between George Soros and ANTIFA?
A: Numerous conspiracy theories allege, without evidence, that Soros backs the Antifa movement..

title: Fact Check: Illinois banned the sale of alcohol on March 30 2020
text:

A: A website that allows users to create their own news stories for the purpose of pranks..

title: Fact Check: It has been confirmed and tested that 2 spoonfuls of palm oil every morning can ...

WHO does not recommend self-medication with any medicines, including antibiotics, as a prevention or cure for COVID-19..

title: Fact Check: A Sri Lankan military hospital, Kotelawala Defence University Hospital, has been...

title: Fact Check: Nigella Sativa contains 100% hydroxychloroquine.
text:

Q: what are the active chemical components of Nigella Sativa
A: The most important 
active compounds are thymoquinone (30%-48%), 
thymohydroquinone, dithymoquinone, p-cymene (7%-
15%), carvacrol (6%-12%), 4-terpineol (2%-7%), t-anethol 
(1%-4%), sesquiterpene longifolene (1%-8%) α-pinene and 
thymol.

title: Fact Check: It took Obama ‘millions infected and over 1,000 deaths’ to declare the H1N1 flu ...
text:
Claim: It took Obama ‘millions infected and over 1,000 deaths’ to declare the H1N1 flu a health emergency.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The evidence presented gives evidence that the claim is false and that the first fatality only occurred after the declaration of a health emergency.

Evidence:

Q: What is H1N1?
A: A virus that was found to be a novel strain of influenza for which existing vaccines against seasonal flu provided little protection. 

Q: what date did Barack Obama declare a health emergency in relation to H1N1 in the U.S?
A: On April 26, 2009, the Secretary of Health and Human Services (the "Secretary") first declared a public health emergency under section 319 of the Public Health Service Act,42 U.S.C. 247d, in response to the 2009 H1N1 influenza virus.. 

Q: What date did the first recorded cases occur in the U.S from H1N1 in 2009?
A: The first two cases were discovered independently in the United States in April 2009.

title: Fact Check: Taking Nigella Sativa (Kalonji) seeds with honey can prevent infection from Covi...
text:
Claim: Taking Nigella Sativa (Kalonji) seeds with honey can prevent infection from Covid-19.

Verdict: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

Justification: Even though the Nigella Sativa seeds have some properties that can limit the action of the virus in the body, further studies needs to be done to arrive at a conclusion 

Evidence:

Q: What anti-covid properties does Nigella Sativa have?
A: COVID-19 pandemic has become a serious public
health concern with high transmission rate affecting
millions of lives worldwide. NS is a potential antiviral
therapy for combating COVID-19 infection. Molecular
docking studies have indicated that nigellidine and
α-hederin are major compounds in NS which have
capability to constrain COVID-19 infection. NS extract has
potential to increase IL-8 levels and alter the expression of
TRP genes during coronavirus infection. NS seed extracts
also has potential to block cytokine storm and oxidative
stress produced during COVID-19 infection. These
encouraging and supportive results provided an approach
to further perform in vitro and in vivo research.. 

Q: Does there need to be more clinical trial of Nigella Sativa, before conclusions can be drawn?
A: Future clinical trials conducted using TQ will unravel how exactly we can use it in the current COVID-19 pandemic state.. 

Q: Can Kalonji Seeds In Combination With Honey Cure COVID-19?
A: The seeds have a compound in them that can "constrain" Covid-19, but clinical trials need to be done before this evidence can be proven.

title: Fact Check: Coronavirus caused the serious birth defect of a stillborn baby in Rajasthan, In...

title: Fact Check: The government in India is going to shut down the internet to avoid panic about ...
text:
Claim: The government in India is going to shut down the internet to avoid panic about the Coronavirus.

A: Yes. In 2016 the Government incorporated a provision under the IT Act of 2008, giving the Central government, or any of its officers specially authorised by it, to block the internet if necessary.

Q: Did the Indian Government shut down the internet to avoid panic during the pandemic?
A: No answer could be found..

title: Fact Check: The coloured part of a surgical mask is to be worn inwards to the face to help  ...

with folds facing downwards of the surgical mask should face outwards.

title: Fact Check: A man in Pakistan threw a party consisting of 100 people after recovering from C...
text:

title: Fact Check: The installation of 5G in the United Kingdom a cover-up for a secret weapon depl...
text:

A: "Basically, 5G will provide a wider pipeline and faster lanes," says Verizon spokesman Marc Tracey. By faster, think about speeds that are ten times faster than 4G LTE; you'll be able to download Lord of the Rings in seconds, and enjoy a live VR experience streamed to your headset from across the country with very little lag. 5G will also offer lower latency in network communications.. 

Q: Will there need to be more mobile towers built in the UK to support 5G?
A: No answer could be found.. 

Q: Is 5G installation covering up a weapon deployment in the UK?

title: Fact Check: Biden called Trump ‘xenophobic’ for restrictions on travel from China.

title: Fact Check: No Democrats voted for the coronavirus stimulus measures.
text:
Claim: No Democrats voted for the coronavirus stimulus measures.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The answers show that democrats did vote for the measures so the claim is refuted.

Evidence:

Q: Did Italy disagree with WHO autopsies  instruction on COVID-19 casualties.
A: Apart from suspect, probable, or confirmed COVID-19 cases, autopsies might be requested for patients not suspected to be SARS-Cov2 positive. Due to the high level of contagion in hospitals and in the general population, any corpse is regarded as potential source of infection. Therefore, for any autopsy, we recommend always to adopt the same biosafety measures as for confirmed COVID-19 cases. In addition, in cases of autopsies without apparent SARS-CoV-2 infection, we recommend (i) to discuss with the clinicians the reason why the post-mortem examination is requested; (ii) and if available, to perform nasal-oropharyngeal swabs on corpses within 2 h of death to assess the presence of SARS-CoV-2 infection to implement the safety measures [3].. 

Q: Did the  WHO release guidelines to countries about preforming no autopsies  for COVID-19 casualties?
A: No. The guidelines did not say that autopsies should not be conducted.

title: Fact Check: Dr Li Wenliang China's whistleblower doctor suggested tea can cure Covid-19 pati...
text:
Claim: Dr Li Wenliang China's whistleblower doctor suggested tea can cure Covid-19 patients.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Q&A 1 shows that there is no evidence of the Dr named in the claim said this, and then points out the FDA claims that drinking tea is amongst fraudulent claims about cures for Covid which is what the claim says drinking tea will cure.

Evidence:

Q: Who is Dr Li Wenliang?
A: Li Wenliang (李文亮), MD, was an ophthalmologist in Wuhan, China, who warned several of his colleagues about the appearance of a new SARS-like virus in December 2019, at the very beginning of the global COVID-19 pandemic.. 

Q: Is there any evidence that Dr Li Wenliang suggested that drinking tea can cure COVID-19 patients?
A: No. This false claim - shared on social media - refers to the Chinese doctor Li Wenliang, who was hailed a hero for his efforts to raise the alarm about the virus early on in Wuhan, and who later died of the disease.

It claims that in his case files, the doctor had documented evidence that substances commonly found in tea - known as methylxanthines - can decrease the impact of the virus.

The widely shared post also falsely claimed that hospitals in China were giving Covid-19 patients tea three times a day. It's true that methylxanthines are found in tea, as well as in coffee and chocolate.

But there's no evidence Dr Li Wenliang was researching their effect - he was an eye specialist, rather than an expert on viruses - nor that hospitals in China were treating Covid-19 by giving patients tea.

Q: Can Covid-19 be cured by drinking tea as claimed by China's Dr Li Wenliang ?
A: It is a fake news.
We checked out the CNN website, but could not find any such news. We searched their Twitter handle for breaking news, but no such thing was reported.
We found a report about China's whistleblower doctor on CNN but that article too does not talk about the medication he suggested nor does it talk about the utility of the chemical compounds of tea as claimed by social media users.
Here's CNN Breaking News's Twitter handle.
On Google search too, we found no reports that support the claim. Also, there are no reports that doctors in China are serving tea to Covid-19 patients.
We found a news report by China Daily related to this topic.
According to this report, researchers from the Zhejiang Provincial Center for Disease Control and Prevention found through experiments that because of its chemical components, drinking tea could help prevent novel coronavirus infections.
But later the article was removed by the Zhejiang CDC on February 26, China Daily reported.
On checking FDA website it is found that tea is among the fraudelent product to cure Covid-19.

title: Fact Check: Novel coronavirus is an airbourne virus and remains infectious in the air for 8 ...
text:
Claim: Novel coronavirus is an airbourne virus and remains infectious in the air for 8 hours.

Verdict: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

Justification: COVID-19 can spread via airborne transmission, this means it can be airborne although it only stays in the air for 3 hours Under experimental conditions, and about 30 minutes in most real-world situations before settling onto surfaces.

Evidence:

Q: Is Corona virus an "airbourne" Virus?
A: Yes, When an infected person coughs, sneezes, or talks, droplets or tiny particles called aerosols carry the virus into the air from their nose or mouth. Anyone who is within 6 feet of that person can breathe it into their lungs. Airborne transmission. Research shows that the virus can live in the air for up to 3 hours.. 

Q: How long does corona virus last in the air?
A: Upto 3 hours.. 

Q: Can Corona virus be caught in any other ways than being airbourne?
A: Yes it can be caught by touching infected surfaces.

SARS-CoV-2 was more stable on plastic and stainless steel than on copper and cardboard, and viable virus was detected up to 72 hours after application to these surfaces (Figure 1A), although the virus titer was greatly reduced (from 103.7 to 100.6 TCID50 per milliliter of medium after 72 hours on plastic and from 103.7 to 100.6 TCID50 per milliliter after 48 hours on stainless steel). The stability kinetics of SARS-CoV-1 were similar (from 103.4 to 100.7 TCID50 per milliliter after 72 hours on plastic and from 103.6 to 100.6 TCID50 per milliliter after 48 hours on stainless steel). On copper, no viable SARS-CoV-2 was measured after 4 hours and no viable SARS-CoV-1 was measured after 8 hours. On cardboard, no viable SARS-CoV-2 was measured after 24 hours and no viable SARS-CoV-1 was measured after 8 hours (Figure 1A)..

title: Fact Check: American automakers, including Ford and General Motors, are manufacturing much n...
text:
Claim: American automakers, including Ford and General Motors, are manufacturing much needed medical ventilators “right now.”

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The Q&As show that at the time the claim was posted the ventilators were not being made so the claim is refuted.

Evidence:

Q: Did Ford and General Motors manufacture ventilators during the COVID-10 pandemic?
A: Yes. General Motors and Ventec Life Systems announced that the car company would begin retooling its manufacturing facility in Kokomo, Indiana, to make “critical care ventilators” that could be ready to “ship as soon as next month.”

Q: Did this happen before Trump made his claim it was happening "right now"?
A: No. It wasn’t until nearly a week after the president’s claim that General Motors and Ventec Life Systems announced that the car company would begin retooling its manufacturing facility in Kokomo, Indiana, to make “critical care ventilators” that could be ready to “ship as soon as next month.”

Prior to that, GM had been working to produce or procure parts for Ventec to increase Ventec’s output of ventilators, and GM was only “exploring the feasibility to build ventilators” at one of its own facilities, a company spokesman told us.

The CEO of Ford, meanwhile, has said recently that it could be May or June before Ford, which is partnering with another company that makes the lifesaving machines, begins to produce them in mass.

Q: Were alternative statements made around the time of the claim to - American automakers, including Ford and General Motors, manufacturing much needed medical ventilators "right now"?
A: Yes. Days after the claim was Tweeted Forbes reported Mar 23, 2020, - Though President Trump insisted this weekend that American automakers were already producing ventilators without his having to compel them using the Defense Production Act, the AP reported Monday that Ford, General Motors and Tesla are months away from being able to convert their factories into medical supply production facilities. On Sunday, the president tweeted: “Ford, General Motors and Tesla are being given the go ahead to make ventilators and other metal products, FAST! @fema Go for it auto execs, lets see how good you are?” 

Forbes further clarified - Neither Ford nor General Motors is making ventilators right now, and while Tesla’s Elon Musk has said his company is “working on it,” there’s no evidence to suggest that production is underway, and it could take months to get there, according to the AP report.

title: Fact Check: Chloroquine, a Covid-19 drug, would be made available 'almost immediately.'
text:
Claim: Chloroquine, a Covid-19 drug, would be made available 'almost immediately.'

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: At the date of the claim, chloroquine was still being researched as to its efficacy to treat COVID-19.

Evidence:

Q: Has chloroquine been approved for use in treating Covid-19?
A: No. The FDA has been working closely with other government agencies and academic centers that are investigating the use of the drug chloroquine, which is already approved for treating malaria, lupus and rheumatoid arthritis, to determine whether it can be used to treat patients with mild-to-moderate COVID-19 to potentially reduce the duration of symptoms, as well as viral shedding, which can help prevent the spread of disease. Studies are underway to determine the efficacy in using chloroquine to treat COVID-19.

Q: Has a timeline been established as to when this drug may be available for use treating Covid-19?
A: FDA Commissioner Stephen Hahn, speaking after the president, said the FDA is considering giving chloroquine to larger populations of coronavirus patients as part of an “expanded use” testing program. Such a trial in patients would allow the FDA to collect data to measure scientifically whether it works. It was not immediately clear how long it would take the FDA to design the study and get it working at trial sites around the country..

A: Yes. In BC, and across Canada, some First Nations communities are taking the step of establishing checkpoints or closing the borders of their communities. Many BC First Nations are looking for ways to restrict movement in and out of our communities to contain the spread of COVID-19. Our Elders are very precious to us – especially their roles in holding language, knowledge and culture – and therefore need increased protection from COVID-19.
