title: Fact Check: YES Bank may shut down
text:
Claim: YES Bank may shut down

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: From the answer it seems the claim is refuted

Evidence:

Q: What is the official statement from YES bank executives
A: “Recent market rumours and reports appear to have generated a lot of speculation around YES BANK Limited. We strongly refute them as being speculative, unsubstantiated, and irresponsible.

While this has impacted the share price adversely, the Bank would like to state that its capital and liquidity position are comfortably above the regulatory threshold and the asset quality is in line with the guidance provided post Q1 FY20 results. The Bank’s outstanding exposure to the Housing Finance / Real Estate conglomerate, which is in the news today, is totally secured and over the last six months there has been a reduction of approximately 30% in this exposure. The account is standard and current.

The Bank’s retail franchise continues to strengthen with an increase of 39% in the number of new Fixed Deposit (FD) accounts, over the previous quarter.

Subsequent to receiving the go ahead from the Reserve Bank of India on Friday, September 27, 2019, the Bank is firmly on track to raising the required growth capital.” - Ravneet Gill, MD & CEO, YES BANK.

title: Fact Check: Pretty Little Thing’s terms and conditions state that its products may contain c...
text:
Claim: Pretty Little Thing’s terms and conditions state that its products may contain chemicals that can cause cancer, birth defects or other reproductive harm.

Verdict: Not Enough Evidence

Justification: From the 2nd QA it seems evident that there is not enough information to make the claim as there is not enough scientific evidence to support that. Therefore, the label is not enough evidence

Evidence:

Q: Does Pretty Little Thing's products contain lead
A: Pretty Little Thing warns that some products such as wallets, handbags, purses, clutches, clothing, jewellery or shoes made of vinyl or imitation leather may contain traces of lead.. 

Q: Can high amount of lead cause cancer
A: There have been several agencies and organizations both in the United States and internationally that have reviewed studies and made an assessment about whether lead can cause cancer.

The Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) has determined that lead and lead compounds are reasonably anticipated to be human carcinogens
The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) has classified lead as a probable human carcinogen.
The International Agency for Research on Cancer (IARC) has determined that inorganic lead is probably carcinogenic to humans, and that there is insufficient information to determine whether organic lead compounds will cause cancer in humans..

title: Fact Check: Pretty Little Thing products may contain chemicals that can cause cancer, birth ...
text:
Claim: Pretty Little Thing products may contain chemicals that can cause cancer, birth defects or other reproductive harm.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: Mentioned explicitly in the terms and conditions of their own website

Evidence:

Q: Does the pretty little thing contain any harmful chemicals
A: Pretty Little Thing’s US website says that its products may contain “traces of lead”.  Long term or high-level exposure to lead can damage the nervous system and organs including the kidneys and reproductive organs. Studies have also found it could probably cause cancer in humans..

title: Fact Check: Donald Trump asked Ukrainian president Volodymyr Zelensky to "make up dirt" on B...
text:
Claim: Donald Trump asked Ukrainian president Volodymyr Zelensky to "make up dirt" on Biden.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Trump asked him to investigate claims but not to fabricate anything.

Evidence:

Q: What information did Trump ask Volodymyr Zelensky for relating to Joe Biden, during their July 25, 2019 call, and did he ask Zelensky to "make up" anything?
A: Donald Trump was officially quoted as saying - There’s a lot of talk about Biden’s son, that Biden stopped the prosecution and a lot of people want to find out about that so whatever you can do with the Attorney General would be great. Biden went around bragging that he stopped the prosecution so if you can look into it… It sounds horrible to me. Therefore Trump didn't ask Zelensky to "make up" anything..

title: Fact Check: Trump said Ukrainian president Volodymyr Zelensky to not call back until he'd sa...
text:
Claim: Trump said Ukrainian president Volodymyr Zelensky to not call back until he'd satisfied Donald Trump's demands.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: There is no evidence of the comment being made by the president 

Evidence:

Q: Did Donald Trump tell Ukrainian president Volodymyr Zelensky to not call back until he'd satisfied Trump's demands?
A: A document of the call makes no mention of trump saying Zelensky should not call back until he’d satisfied Trump’s demands,
the call ended with Trump congratulating Zelensky on his election..

title: Fact Check: During his telephone call with Ukrainian President Zelensky on 25th July 2019 Do...
text:
Claim: During his telephone call with Ukrainian President Zelensky on 25th July 2019 Donald Trump said the United States had been good to Ukraine.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: The 1st Q&A pair say that evidence of the call in the claim exists and in the 2nd Q&A it states that the record of the call shows that what is claimed was said by trump was said. so supported

Evidence:

Q: Is there a record of Trump's call with Zelensky on 25th July 2019?
A: Yes. The document is the record asked for in the question.

Q: During his call with Zelenksy how did Trump describe the United States' relationship with Ukraine?
A: "The United States has been very very good to Ukraine".

title: Fact Check: Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison has given himself a pay rise.
text:
Claim: Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison has given himself a pay rise.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Australian political structure does not allow for prime ministers to give themselves pay rises.

Evidence:

Q: Did the Australian PM Scott Morrison  give himself a pay rise then cut working class wages ?
A: Multiple posts have been shared thousands of times in on Facebook which claim Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison has given himself a pay rise, while his New Zealand counterpart Jacinda Ardern has frozen the salaries of the country’s politicians “until economy improves for citizens”. The claims are misleading; the renumeration for Australia and New Zealand’s politicians is determined by independent statutory bodies, not the prime ministers; a salary freeze was indeed imposed on New Zealand’s politicians in 2018, but it was in place to establish a fairer system that determines pay increases for key office holders, not because of economic conditions..

title: Fact Check: Luxembourg benefits the most from being in the EU, getting back 3,304% of what i...
text:
Claim: Luxembourg benefits the most from being in the EU, getting back 3,304% of what it pays in.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Luxembourg 3,199% less than stated pay in claim, meaning 16 countries in the EU including Romania, Bulgaria and Hungary get back more of what it pays in

Evidence:

Q: How much does Luxembourg get back from what it pays to EU?
A: Luxembourg gets back roughly 105% of what it pays. 

Q: What other EU countries get back more than Luxembourg?
A: 16 other countries get back more than Luxembourg, these countries include Romania, Bulgaria and Hungary.

title: Fact Check: Hunter Biden, son of then Vice President Joe Biden  had a payoff of $1.5 billion...
text:
Claim: Hunter Biden, son of then Vice President Joe Biden  had a payoff of $1.5 billion from China, after accompanying his father, on a 2013 diplomatic trip to Beijing.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: From answers provided it seems that Hunter Biden was not on the 2013 diplomatic trip to Beijing for business.

Evidence:

Q: In 2013 Did Hunter Biden travel on Air Force 2 to China with then Vice President Joe Biden who was on a diplomatic mission?
A: Yes. Hunter Biden went along because his daughter had been invited and needed a chaperone.

Q: Why did Hunter Biden Accompany his Father, Joe Biden (Then Vice President) on his diplomatic trip to China in 2013?
A: Hunter Biden went along because his daughter had been invited and needed a chaperone.. 

Q: Did Hunter Biden Conduct any business when he accompanied his Father Joe Biden on his Diplomatic trip to China in 2013?
A: He conducted no business there..

title: Fact Check: Donald Trump released a summary of his call with the Ukrainian President, Zelens...
text:
Claim: Donald Trump released a summary of his call with the Ukrainian President, Zelensky because Adam Schiff gave a false rendition of the call.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The claim was made on the 25th and the summary of the call released on the 24th, but the rendition of the call made by Adam Schiff was on the 26th at the DNI hearing so the claim must be fabricated.

Evidence:

Q: What date did President Donald J. Trump release a summary of his call with Ukrainian President, Zelensky?
A: The released summary from the white house of the call between president Donald J. Trump and Ukrainian president Zelensky is dated 24th September 2019.. 

Q: Where did did Adam Schiff give a rendition of the call between President Donald J. Trump and Ukrainian president Zelensky
A: In his full opening statement at DNI hearing on the 26th of September 2019.

title: Fact Check: US Democratic senators  threatened Donald Trump with votes and no money coming i...
text:
Claim: US Democratic senators  threatened Donald Trump with votes and no money coming into Ukraine.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The Senators did not mean to coerce Trump.

Evidence:

Q: Which democrats wrote a letter to Ukraine's special prosecutor
A: Patrick J. Leahy (Vt.), Richard J. Durbin (Ill.) and Robert Menendez (N.J.). 

Q: Did the senators imply to the Ukrainian chief prosecutor that if he does not cooperate assistance from the United States will cease
A: There is no implication of this in the letter written. 

Q: Did the US democrats who wrote the letter use it as a means to coerce Donald Trump
A: In the letter, the Senators were against the Ukrainian prosecutor halting investigations if it was in a bid not to anger Donald Trump.

title: Fact Check: Hunter Biden made millions of dollars from a deal made in China. The deal put $1...
text:
Claim: Hunter Biden made millions of dollars from a deal made in China. The deal put $1.5 billion into a fund after one quick meeting in China which he flew into on Air Force Two.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: No. “To date, Mr. Biden has not received any return or compensation on account of this investment or his position on the board of directors,” Meseris said in a statement Wednesday. “The characterization of Mr. Biden as owning a $1.5 billion private equity firm funded by the Chinese, or suggesting that Mr. Biden has earned millions of dollars from the firm is a gross misrepresentation of Mr. Biden’s role with BHR.”

Evidence:

Q: Where does the claim come from that Hunter Biden got China to put $1.5bn in a fund?
A: Book by Peter Schweizer, “Secret Empires,” that first detailed how Hunter Biden flew to China on Air Force Two with his father in 2013.. 

Q: What does the book claim?
A: Schweizer wrote in a summary of the 2018 book that 10 days after the Bidens arrived in China, “Hunter Biden’s firm scored a $1.5 billion deal with a subsidiary of the Chinese government’s Bank of China.”. 

Q: Did the Chinese put $1.5bn into a fund involving Hunter Biden?
A: No. “To date, Mr. Biden has not received any return or compensation on account of this investment or his position on the board of directors,” Meseris said in a statement Wednesday. “The characterization of Mr. Biden as owning a $1.5 billion private equity firm funded by the Chinese, or suggesting that Mr. Biden has earned millions of dollars from the firm is a gross misrepresentation of Mr. Biden’s role with BHR.”

title: Fact Check: Indian equity stock index markets, Sensex and Nifty have their biggest single da...
text:
Claim: Indian equity stock index markets, Sensex and Nifty have their biggest single day gains in the last ten years on 20th September 2019.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: Dates shown in Q&A pairs confirm the highest gain is the date period in the claim.

Evidence:

Q: When was highest one day gain on BSE Sensex from 20/09/2009 to 20/09/2019?
A: 20/09/2019 a gain of 1921.15.. 

Q: When was highest one day gain on NSE Nifty from 20/09/2009 to 20/09/2019?
A: 20/09/2019 a gain of 569.4..

title: Fact Check: The Trump family took seats reserved for disabled guests at the 74th session of ...
text:
Claim: The Trump family took seats reserved for disabled guests at the 74th session of the UN General Assembly.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The answers explain that they were not sitting in disabled guests reserved seats so the claim is refuted.

Evidence:

Q: Where did the Trump family sit at the the United Nations headquarters in New York City, US  for the 74th session of the U.N. General Assembly?
A: They sat in seats reserved for guests of the speaker, US President Donald Trump.. 

Q: Why was it thought that the Trump family were sitting in seats allocated for disabled people at the 74th session of the U.N. General Assembly?
A: A handicapped placard designates where two seats can be moved for allow for wheelchair access. In this case they were not needed and the seats were reserved for the Trump family..

title: Fact Check: President Muhammadu Buhari of Nigeria told the United Nations Climate Action Sum...
text:
Claim: President Muhammadu Buhari of Nigeria told the United Nations Climate Action Summit in New York last month that the Lake Chad basin has shrunk significantly due to climate change, depriving many people of their livelihood in the region.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: From the 2nd QA it indeed seems that the lake has not been shrinking. Therefore the claim is ref5

Evidence:

Q: When did the Lake Chad shrink
A: Lake Chad shrank dramatically at the beginning of the
1970s and reached less than 2,000 km2 during the 1980s, decreasing
by more 90 per cent in area. 

Q: Has Lake Chad shrunk in recent years
A: New research based on continuous satellite observations from the last 20 years has
been able to address this evidence gap and show instead that overall,
the lake is not shrinking.

title: Fact Check: ERNEST HEMINGWAY SAID, WE ARE ALL BROKEN — THAT’S HOW THE LIGHT GETS IN
text:
Claim: ERNEST HEMINGWAY SAID, WE ARE ALL BROKEN — THAT’S HOW THE LIGHT GETS IN

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: From the evidence the claim is not a quote from Ernest Hemingway 

Evidence:

Q: Is WE ARE ALL BROKEN — THAT’S HOW THE LIGHT GETS IN, a Ernest Hemingway quote?
A: QI has found no substantive evidence that Ernest Hemingway wrote or said this precise remark.. 

Q: Did Ernest Hemingway have a similar quote in the book a farewell to arms?
A: Hemingway did write in his 1929 novel, “The world breaks everyone and afterward many are strong at the broken places. But those that will not break it kills. It kills the very good and the very gentle and the very brave impartially.”.

title: Fact Check: Russian Energy Narrative Targets Poland, Ukraine and the Baltic States
text:
Claim: Russian Energy Narrative Targets Poland, Ukraine and the Baltic States

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: From the Q&As you can see that Ukraine, Poland and the Ukraine are adverse to Russian Energy. 

Evidence:

Q: Why is Ukraine adverse to Russian energy
A: The Nord Stream 2 infrastructure would enable Gazprom to cut Ukraine out of gas transit traffic, which could cost the country about $2 billion in transit fees (the equivalent of nearly 6 percent of its projected budget for 2018). Revenues aside, as Polish Prime Minister Mateusz Morawiecki recently stated in Berlin, the real danger lies in the fact that Russia can launch a massive land offensive against Ukraine without fear of damaging Ukraine’s pipeline infrastructure and interrupting Gazprom’s exports to Western countries.. 

Q: why is Poland adverse to Russian energy
A: The General Court next examines Poland’s argument that the 2016 decision breaches the principle 
of energy solidarity 8
in that it enables Gazprom and undertakings in the Gazprom group to redirect
additional volumes of gas onto the EU market by fully exploiting the capacities of the North Stream 
1 pipeline. Taking into account the lack of significant growth in demand for natural gas in central 
Europe, according to Poland, that would, as its only possible consequence, influence the 
conditions of supply and use of transmission services on the pipelines competing with OPAL. The 
General Court observes, in that regard, that that principle imposes not only obligations of mutual 
assistance where, for example following natural disasters or acts of terrorism, a Member State is in 
a critical or emergency situation as regards its gas supply, but also requires the European Union 
and the Member States to endeavour, in the exercise of their powers in the field of energy policy,
to avoid adopting measures likely to affect the interests of the EU and other Member States as 
regards security of supply, its economic and political viability, the diversification of supply or of 
sources of supply, and to do so in order to take account of their interdependence and de facto 
solidarity..

title: Fact Check: A Muslim man in India was killed by a mob after being accused of cow slaughter.
text:
Claim: A Muslim man in India was killed by a mob after being accused of cow slaughter.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Although a man was killed when a mob attacked three men after they were accused of cow slaughter, it was confirmed that none of the men were Muslim.

Evidence:

Q: What was the source of the information in the claim?
A: Reuters published the article under the headline:

Man in India killed by mob after being accused of cow slaughter. 

Q: Was there any mention in the original article about the religion of the man who was killed?
A: The three men attacked by the mob on Sunday were not Muslim, Meena said..

title: Fact Check: Banks in India will be closed from September 26 to October 2 2019.
text:
Claim: Banks in India will be closed from September 26 to October 2 2019.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Strikes called off and no listed holidays.

Evidence:

Q: Was the Indian bank strike scheduled for the 26th and 27th September 2019 called off?
A: The planned bank strike by employees of public sector banks on the 27th and 27th September was called off. 

Q: Were September 30th and October 1st 2019 public holidays in India?
A: No. They are not listed on the West Bengal 2019 calendar

title: Fact Check: Congress party claims regarding shortfall in Government earnings
text:
Claim: Congress party claims regarding shortfall in Government earnings

Verdict: Supported

Justification: The evidence shows a shortfall in government earnings

Evidence:

Q: What's the reason for the shortfall in government earnings
A: Lower gross tax revenue in the year 2018-2019; Growth rate of Central Government’s Fiscal Indicators ( in per cent)
Items 2014-15 2015-16 2016-17 2017-18 2018-19 PA 2019-20 BE*
Revenue Receipts 8.5 8.5 15.0 4.4 8.2 26.4
Gross Tax Revenue 9.3 16.9 17.9 11.8 8.4 18.3
Net Tax Revenue 10.8 4.4 16.7 12.8 6.0 25.3
Non-Tax Revenue -0.5 27.0 8.6 -29.4 22.3 32.9
Non-debt Capital 
Receipts#
23.0 22.3 3.8 77.0 -2.5 6.3
Non-debt Receipts 9.1 9.1 14.4 7.7 7.4 25.0
Total Expenditure 6.7 7.6 10.3 8.4 8.1 20.4
Revenue Expenditure 6.9 4.8 9.9 11.1 6.8 21.9
Capital Expenditure 4.8 28.6 12.5 -7.5 16.9 10.. 

Q: Was there a shortfall in government earnings in 2018-19 to the tune of Rs.1.7 lakh crores?
A: There is a difference which amounted to Rs. 1.7 lakh crores between the ‘Provisional Actuals’ of revenue receipts provided in the Economic Survey of India and the ‘Revised Estimates’ of revenue receipts as reported by the government for 2018-19. Since provisional actuals (PA) may be a better estimate of the actual figures, there could well be a shortfall in government earnings for 2018-19. Hence the claim is TRUE..

title: Fact Check: About universal basic income, Thomas Paine was for it at our founding ... Martin...
text:
Claim: About universal basic income, Thomas Paine was for it at our founding ... Martin Luther King, champion in the ‘60s, called it a guaranteed minimum income for all Americans… It passed the U.S. House of Representatives twice in 1971

Verdict: Supported

Justification: this is true, it was passed in 1970 and 71 and championed by Martin Luther King

Evidence:

Q: How many times did the Universal Basic Income bill make it to the House in the1970s
A: President Nixon's plan for a radical revision of the nation's welfare system was approved by the House with a vote of 243 to 155 in 1970. 

Q: Did Martin Luther King support Universal Income under the name guaranteed income
A: Yes. “I am now convinced that the simplest solution to poverty is to abolish it directly by a new widely discussed measure: the guaranteed income,” he wrote in his 1967 book, Where Do We Go From Here: Chaos or Community?

Q: How did founding father Thomas Paine view Universal income
A: Thomas Paine was among the first to argue that a basic income should be introduced as a kind of compensation for dispossession. In his brilliant 1797 pamphlet Agrarian Justice, he pointed out that “the earth, in its natural, uncultivated state was, and ever would have continued to be, the common property of the human race”. It was unfair that a few should enclose it for their own benefit, leaving the vast majority without their rightful inheritance. As far as Paine was concerned, this violated the most basic principles of justice..

title: Fact Check: Congresswoman Tulsi Gabbard is of Indian-origin.
text:
Claim: Congresswoman Tulsi Gabbard is of Indian-origin.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Answer 1 is a quote and is not identified as such until one looks at the source.
Q&A2 is what Q&A1 should have been.
Q&A3 confirms her ethnicity.

Evidence:

Q: Is congresswoman Tulsi Gabbard Indian?
A: I am not of Indian origin.. 

Q: Is Congresswoman Tulsi Gabbard of Indian heritage?
A: Congresswoman Tulsi Gabbard confirmed via a tweet that she is not of Indian-origin. 

@ronejoq @amisri I am not of Indian origin.

— Tulsi Gabbard (@TulsiGabbard) October 17, 2012. 

Q: What is Congresswoman Tulsi Gabbard's ancestry?
A: she is of Mixed ancestry, her father is of Samoan and European ancestry. While her mother is a Caucasian of German ancestry (born and brought up in Decatur, Indiana)..

title: Fact Check: AN 11-YEAR-OLD GIRL KILL TWO ILLEGAL IMMIGRANTS DURING AN ATTEMPTED HOME INVASIO...
text:
Claim: AN 11-YEAR-OLD GIRL KILL TWO ILLEGAL IMMIGRANTS DURING AN ATTEMPTED HOME INVASION

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: this story has been refuted by local law enforcement,

Evidence:

Q: Where does the story of an 11 year old girl shooting dead 2 illegal immigrants who burgled her home likely originate from ?
A: The bogus story has been circulating for the past year on Internet blogs and Web sites concerning a girl shooting two men who broke into her Butte home in November 2006.. 

Q: Has any official declared that the story of an 11 year old girl shooting dead 2 illegal immigrant burglars is fake?
A: When asked about the authenticity of the events described in this story, Butte-Silver Bow Sheriff John Walsh told The Montana Standard in an earlier interview that his office never investigated such an incident.

“This never happened,” Walsh said.. 

Q: Is the story about an 11-year-old Montana girl who killed two illegal immigrants during an attempted home invasion?
A: No. There was no Ralphel Resindez, there was no Enrico Garza, and despite her elevation to heroine status with some gun rights groups, there was no little girl name Patricia who bravely defended her home with her father's shotgun.

"This never happened," Butte-Silver Bow County Sheriff John Walsh told the Montana Standard, a few years back.

"It's amazing how these things get around," he said.

title: Fact Check: On average, one person dies by suicide every 22 hours in West Virginia, United S...
text:
Claim: On average, one person dies by suicide every 22 hours in West Virginia, United States.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: Confirmed by amount of suicides divided by amount of days as well as 22hrs being an actual answer.

Evidence:

Q: What is the rate of suicide in West Virginia compared to other states in the Country
A: The suicide rate in West Virginia is 27% higher than the national rate. 

Q: How many suicides were recorded in 2019  in West virginia
A: 393. 

Q: What is the hourly suicide rate in West Virginia
A: At least 1 person died every 22 hours in 2019.

title: Fact Check: Evidence Suggests Nigerians Attacked S.A Police During Shop Raids
text:
Claim: Evidence Suggests Nigerians Attacked S.A Police During Shop Raids

Verdict: Not Enough Evidence

Justification: The nationality of the attackers has nor been disclosed according to the second answer so there is not enough evidence to support or refute the claim.

Evidence:

Q: Were the police attacked while doing a raid on a shop in South Africa?
A: "police officers clashed with traders when they tried to seize counterfeit products in the area". 

Q: What nationality were the people arrested?
A: "Over 560 undocumented foreign nationals were taken in for processing," South Africa police said in the statement and added that authorities would check their immigration status and criminal records..

title: Fact Check: French philosopher Voltaire said “To learn who rules over you, simply find out w...
text:
Claim: French philosopher Voltaire said “To learn who rules over you, simply find out who you are not allowed to criticize.”

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Quote originated from US white supremacist Kevin Alfred Strom not voltaire.

Evidence:

Q: Who wrote “To learn who rules over you, simply find out who you are not allowed to criticize.”?
A: ...the quote, routinely misattributed to Voltaire, originated from US white supremacist Kevin Alfred Strom..

title: Fact Check: Your reaction to an optical illusion is an indication of your state of mind.
text:
Claim: Your reaction to an optical illusion is an indication of your state of mind.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The optical illusion test cannot state whether someone is stressed; the test is to see the level of stress a person can handle using stress pictures. Even then, it is an unscientific idea. Hence, the claim is refuted.

Evidence:

Q: Who created the illusion referred to in this claim?
A: Akiyoshi Kitaoka, Illusion artist & Professor, Dept. of Psychology, Ritsumeikan University, Kyoto, Japan. 

Q: Does Prof. Kitaoka say anything about optical illusions and stress levels?
A: Yes. Announcement: A website "Test online the level of stress a person can handle using stress pictures: are they animated, moving?" abuses three of my illusion works as well as claims an unscientific idea. To my knowledge, stress has nothing to do with visual illusion. <April 25, 2011>

title: Fact Check: Indian banks are to be closed continuously from 26th September 2019 to 30th Sept...
text:
Claim: Indian banks are to be closed continuously from 26th September 2019 to 30th September 2019.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Private banks were not affected so would have been open and not all public bank workers may have striked.

Evidence:

Q: Did four of India's bank unions call for a strike from September 25th 2019?
A: Yes. All India Bank Officer’s Confederation (AIBOC), All India Bank Officer’s Association (AIBOA), Indian National Bank Officer’s Congress (INBOC) and National Organisation of Bank Officers (NOBO) gave  a strike call from the midnight of 25th September to midnight of 27th September 2019.

Q: Did the call to strike result in the closure of all banks in India?
A: No. All bank employees may not have participated in the strike and the private banks  functioned normally..

title: Fact Check: Science fiction and popular science writer Isaac Asimov said your assumptions ar...
text:
Claim: Science fiction and popular science writer Isaac Asimov said your assumptions are your windows on the world.Scrub them off every once in a while, or the light won’t come in.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The quote was not made by Isaac Asimov. 

Evidence:

Q: Who made the quote "your assumptions are your windows on the world. scrub them off every once in a while or the light won't come in
A: Alan Alda said in the 62nd commencement speech in Connecticut college "Your 
assumptions are your windows on the world. Scrub them off every once in a while or the light 
won't come in. If you challenge your own, you won't be so quick to accept the unchallenged 
assumptions of others. You'll be a lot less likely to be caught up in bias or prejudice or be 
influenced by people who ask you to hand over your brains, your soul or your money because 
they have everything all figured out for you"..

title: Fact Check: Cherie Blair is representing Shamima Begum.
text:
Claim: Cherie Blair is representing Shamima Begum.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: I would expect this to be easy to verify if true, but no connection between Cherie Blair and Shamima Begum was found.

Evidence:

Q: Who do the media report is the lawyer of Shamima Begum?
A: RICHARD Madeley got into a heated clash with the lawyer representing Shamima Begum’s family, Tasnime Akunjee...

 Feb 18, 2019. 

Q: What links can be found between Cherie Blair and Shamima Begum on the internet?
A: No answer could be found..

title: Fact Check: Shamima Begum has been flown back or is due to be flown back to the UK.
text:
Claim: Shamima Begum has been flown back or is due to be flown back to the UK.

Verdict: Not Enough Evidence

Justification: No answer could be found and the third question is unrelated. 

Evidence:

Q: Is Shamima Begum still in Syria?
A: No answer could be found.. 

Q: Did Shamima Begum return to the UK in 2019?
A: No answer could be found.. 

Q: Does Cherie Blair deal with immigration law?
A: She is Founder and chair of law firm Omnia Strategy LLP. She specialises in employment, discrimination, and public law and, in this capacity, has occasionally represented claimants taking cases against the UK Government..

title: Fact Check: The Obama-Biden Administration did not conduct workplace raids
text:
Claim: The Obama-Biden Administration did not conduct workplace raids

Verdict: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

Justification: They did carry out raids but much less than the previous government and other tactics were used to help the situation first. So even though the claim is not correct, its not a completely cut and dry label. 

Evidence:

Q: What are 'workplace raids'?
A: The are raids carried out by Government officials to combat worker exploitation, illegal wages, child labour and to combat illegal immigrants working unlawfully in the U.S.. 

Q: Were any workplace raids carried out when Obama was president of the U.S?
A: Yes. But Government data on worksite enforcement operations shows that the number of individuals arrested on immigration law violation charges declined after Obama took office.

Q: What was the ICE doing under Obama's jurisdiction
A: Under current Department of Homeland Security (DHS) guidance on immigration-relatedworksite enforcement, the agency uses available civil and administrative tools, including civilfines and debarment, to penalize and prevent unlawful employment. According to 2012 estimates,there are some 8.1 million unauthorized workers in the U.S. civilian labor force.DHS’s U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) is responsible for immigration-relatedworksite enforcement, or enforcement of the prohibitions on unauthorized employment in Section274A of the Immigration and Nationality Act (INA). The INA Section 274A provisions,sometimes referred to as employer sanctions, make it unlawful for an employer to knowinglyhire, recruit or refer for a fee, or continue to employ an alien who is not authorized to be soemployed. Today, ICE’s worksite enforcement program is focused primarily on cases that involvecritical infrastructure facilities and cases involving employers who commit “egregious” violationsof criminal statutes and engage in worker exploitation.Employers who violate INA prohibitions on the unlawful employment of aliens may be subject tocivil monetary penalties and/or criminal penalties. Criminal investigations may result indefendants being charged with crimes beyond unlawful employment and being subject to therelevant penalties for those violations.

title: Fact Check: In the U.S fifty million people a year lose their private insurance when they qu...
text:
Claim: In the U.S fifty million people a year lose their private insurance when they quit a job, are made unemployed or employers change insurance policies.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Approximately 75.6% of adults reported being continuously insured during the preceding 12 months, 12.9% reported a gap in coverage, and 11.5% reported being uninsured during the preceding 12 months. 

Evidence:

Q: What information does Sanders use to base this claim on?
A: A report by the People's Policy Project.. 

Q: What is the People's Policy Project?
A: People’s Policy Project (3P) is a think tank founded in 2017. The primary mission of 3P is to publish ideas and analysis that assist in the development of an economic system that serves the many, not the few.

Unlike most think tanks, which are financed by large corporations and foundations, 3P is funded by small donors pledging $5 to $15 per month on the Patreon and ActBlue platforms. This unique funding source enables us to publish policy insights untainted by the compromises typically demanded by monied interests. We are, as the name suggests, the People’s Policy Project, not Walmart’s Policy Project and not the Gates Foundation’s Policy Project.. 

Q: Where does the report in the People's Policy Project get its information from?
A: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention reporting in their Morbidity and Mortality Weekly Report of February 24, 2017 which uses The Behavioral Risk Factor Surveillance System (BRFSS)-a telephone survey of noninstitutionalized adults aged over 18 residing in the  United States..

A: 113 were introduced by Cory booker by September 2019.

Between 2017 and 2018, the percentage of people with public coverage decreased 0.4 percentage points, and the percentage of people with private coverage did not statistically change..

title: Fact Check: Epidural injections given during childbirth are one of the worst and dangerous i...
text:
Claim: Epidural injections given during childbirth are one of the worst and dangerous injections in the world resulting in chronic back pain.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: This claim is refuted. According to the QA pairs, epidural injections are "very safe" and "serious complications are extremely rare". Although back pain can occur after an epidural is given, there is "no evidence that an epidural can cause permanent back pain". Therefore this claim is refuted. 

Evidence:

Q: What are the side effects of Epidural injections ?
A: Epidurals are very safe; serious complications are extremely rare. However, as with all medications and medical procedures, there are potential side effects:

    Decrease in blood pressure – The medication may lower your blood pressure, which may slow your baby’s heart rate. To make this less likely, you will be given extra fluids through a tube in your arm (IV), and you may need to lie on your side. Sometimes, your anesthesiologist will give you a medication to maintain your blood pressure.
    Sore back – Your lower back may be sore where the needle was inserted to deliver the medication. This soreness should last no more than a few days. There is no evidence that an epidural can cause permanent back pain.
    Headache – On rare occasions, the needle pierces the covering of the spinal cord, which can cause a headache that may last for a few days if left untreated. If this situation arises, discuss the treatment options with your anesthesiologist.. 

Q: Does epidural injections work on every pregnant woman?
A: No answer could be found.. 

Q: What percentage of women use an epidural injection when giving birth in hospitals ?
A: More than 50% of women giving birth at hospitals use epidural anesthesia..

title: Fact Check: US Representative Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez tweeted, "I see people are rushing ou...
text:
Claim: US Representative Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez tweeted, "I see people are rushing out to fill up their cars for this hurricane at the gas station. This wouldn’t be an issue if they had electric cars. If the power is out for a week how are they going to get gas? We need to start planning ahead and moving forward."

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: This claim is refuted. According to the QA pairs, Alexandria Ocasio-Cortex never tweeted this claim out. On archive website 'politwoops', they archive deleted tweet political figures and that claim tweet is not on that site either. Finally, AOC herself stated she did not tweet the claim out. Therefore, the claim is refuted.

Evidence:

Q: Does the tweet in the claim - “I see people are rushing out to fill up their cars for this hurricane at the gas station. This wouldn’t be an issue if they had electric cars. If the power is out for a week how are they going to get gas? We need to start planning ahead and moving forward." - appear on Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez’s twitter feed history?
A: No. No results found through an advanced search on Twitter for the words “I see people are rushing out to fill up their cars for this hurricane at the gas station. This wouldn’t be an issue if they had electric cars.” from  Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez.

Q: Is there a website which tracks and archives tweets that public officials may have deleted?
A: Yes. Politwoops tracks deleted tweets by public officials, including people currently in office and candidates for office.

Q: Does the tweet in the claim - “I see people are rushing out to fill up their cars for this hurricane at the gas station. This wouldn’t be an issue if they had electric cars. If the power is out for a week how are they going to get gas? We need to start planning ahead and moving forward." - appear on Politwoops as a tweet deleted by Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez?
A: No. The tweet was not found in a search on Politwoops through Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez’s deleted tweets of August and September 2019 (around the time the claim was made).

title: Fact Check: The last time people created a Hollywood blacklist, people ended up killing them...
text:
Claim: The last time people created a Hollywood blacklist, people ended up killing themselves. They were accused, and they lost their right to work.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: this is supported, the answers show that the blacklist existed, and lost the people the right to work, and one even killed themselves. 

Evidence:

Q: When did the blacklist take place
A: The blacklist Goldberg mentioned took place during the 1940s and 1950s, as the Cold War between the United States and Soviet Union heated up.. 

Q: What is the Hollywood blacklist based on?
A: In October 1947, 10 members of the Hollywood film industry publicly denounced the tactics employed by the House Un-American Activities Committee (HUAC), an investigative committee of the U.S. House of Representatives, during its probe of alleged communist influence in the American motion picture business. These prominent screenwriters and directors, who became known as the Hollywood Ten, received jail sentences and were banned from working for the major Hollywood studios. Their defiant stands also placed them at center stage in a national debate over the controversial anti-communist crackdown that swept through the United States in the late 1940s and early 1950s. Besides the Hollywood Ten, other members of the film industry with alleged communist ties were later banned from working for the big movie studios. The Hollywood blacklist came to an end in the 1960s.. 

Q: Were those who were blacklisted denied their right to work?
A: The studios pledged never again to employ a known Communist or unrepentant fellow traveler. At the studios and the networks, hundreds of artists were shown the door — or had it shut in their faces. Johnston’s declaration marked the formal onset of the blacklist era, a two-decade-long purgatory during which political allegiances, real or suspected, determined employment opportunities in the entertainment industry..

title: Fact Check: Life expectancy in the UK is falling
text:
Claim: Life expectancy in the UK is falling

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: There have been improvements in the life expectancy, howbeit slow. 

Evidence:

Q: How is life expectancy measured?
A: A cohort life table shows the probability of a person from a given cohort dying at each age over the course of their lifetime. In this context, a cohort refers to a group of people with the same year of birth.

The cohort life table is based on age-specific probabilities of death, which are calculated using observed deaths (mortality) data from the cohort.. 

Q: Has life expectancy in the UK been falling?
A: No. “The slowdown in life expectancy improvements in the UK has continued, as 2015 to 2017 saw the lowest improvements in life expectancy since the start of the series in 1980 to 1982. Some decreases in life expectancy at birth have been seen in Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland whilst in England life expectancy has remained unchanged from 2014 to 2016. This slowing in improvements is reflected in the chances of surviving to age 90 years from birth, which has also seen virtually no improvement since 2012 to 2014.”

title: Fact Check: America has more governors who’ve worn blackface than black governors
text:
Claim: America has more governors who’ve worn blackface than black governors

Verdict: Supported

Justification: Q.1 confirms that there are no Black US governors. Q.2 confirms that Gov. Kay Ivey wore blackface from her time as an Auburn student. Hence, this claim is supported. 

Evidence:

Q: How many US governors are black?
A: None.
Forty-seven of the nation’s governors are non-Hispanic white.* Michelle Lujan Grisham (D-NM) is Hispanic and David Ige (D-HI) is Asian. Kevin Stitt (R-OK) is a member of the Cherokee Nation.. 

Q: Have any US governors worn blackface?
A: Yes. Gov. Kay Ivey is contacting state legislators, and apologizing for her role in a racist student skit from her time as an Auburn student.

Ivey was president of her Alpha Gamma Delta pledge class at Auburn. Photos of her sorority sisters in blackface emerged earlier this year. None showed the governor.

But Thursday she apologized after audio emerged of a skit at a Baptist Student Union Party. The audio is a radio interview of Ivey and her then-fiance, Ben LaRavia. He describes Ivey as wearing blue coveralls and said she “had put some black paint all over her face.”

Q: What is "blackface"
A: We define blackface as “black makeup worn (as by a performer in a minstrel show) in a caricature of the appearance of a black person,” and also as “a performer wearing such makeup.” This definition is accompanied by a usage note: “The wearing of blackface by white performers was, from the early 19th through the mid-20th centuries, a prominent feature of minstrel shows and similar forms of entertainment featuring exaggerated and inaccurate caricatures of black people. Its modern occurrence in imitation of such performers is considered deeply offensive.”.

title: Fact Check: Getting up too quickly in the middle of the night can cause sudden death.
text:
Claim: Getting up too quickly in the middle of the night can cause sudden death.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: there is no link between getting up quickly and sudden death

Evidence:

Q: Does getting up at night require a gradual rise
A: Getting up at night has no special need for such a gradual rise...no to that ... There is nothing magical about 3 1/2 minutes ....

The reference to sudden death most closely would be a fit to the fact that 10 percent of heart attacks may present with sudden death ( caused by a fatal arrhythmia of the heart). 

Q: Is getting up at night associated directly with sudden death
A: abray1115 a cardiology physician said, "Getting up at night is not associated mysteriously with sudden death". 

Q: Is getting up at night associated with sudden death
A: A cardiology physician said, "Getting up at night is not associated with sudden death".

title: Fact Check: contraceptive pills can cause cancer.
text:
Claim: contraceptive pills can cause cancer.

Verdict: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

Justification: Some pills can increase the risk of cancer. 

Evidence:

Q: Do contraceptive pills causes cancer ?
A: The Pill and cancer

While high dose Pills reduce your risk of cancer of the ovary and womb if used in the long term, it is not clear whether lower dose Pills like Femodene ED also provide the same protective effects. However, it also seems that taking the Pill slightly increases your risk of cancer of the cervix – although this may be due to having sex without a condom, rather than the Pill. All women should have regular smear tests.

If you have breast cancer, or have had it in the past, you should not take the Pill. The Pill slightly increases your risk of breast cancer. This risk goes up the longer you’re on the Pill, but returns to normal within about 10 years of stopping it. Because breast cancer is rare in women under the age of 40, the extra cases of breast cancer in current and recent Pill users is small. For example:

    Of 10,000 women who have never taken the Pill, about 16 will have breast cancer by the time they are 35 years old.
    Of 10,000 women who take the Pill for 5 years in their early twenties, about 17–18 will have breast cancer by the time they are 35 years old.
    Of 10,000 women who have never taken the Pill, about 100 will have breast cancer by the time they are 45 years old.
    Of 10,000 women who take the Pill for 5 years in their early thirties, about 110 will have breast cancer by the time they are 45 years old.

Your risk of breast cancer is higher:

    if you have a close relative (mother, sister or grandmother) who has had breast cancer
    if you are seriously overweight

    See a doctor as soon as possible if you notice any changes in your breasts, such as dimpling of the skin, changes in the nipple or any lumps you can see or feel.

Taking the Pill has also been linked to liver diseases, such as jaundice and non-cancer liver tumours, but this is rare. Very rarely, the Pill has also been linked with some forms of liver cancer in women who have taken it for a long time.. 

Q: What is the name of birth control pills that causes cancer ?
A: The combined oral contraceptive pill (COCP), often referred to as the birth control pill or colloquially as "the pill", is a type of birth control that is designed to be taken orally by women. It includes a combination of an estrogen (usually ethinylestradiol) and a progestogen (specifically a progestin). When taken correctly, it alters the menstrual cycle to eliminate ovulation and prevent pregnancy.

They were first approved for contraceptive use in the United States in 1960, and are a very popular form of birth control. They are used by more than 100 million women worldwide and by almost 12 million females in the United States.[9] From 2015 to 2017, 12.6% of women aged 15–49 in the US reported using oral contraception, making it the second most common method of contraception in this age range with female sterilization being the most common method.[10] Use varies widely by country,[11] age, education, and marital status. For example, one third of women aged 16–49 in the United Kingdom currently use either the combined pill or progestogen-only pill (POP),[12][13] compared with less than 3% of women in Japan (as of 1950–2014).[14]

Combined oral contraceptives are on the World Health Organization's List of Essential Medicines.[15] The pill was a catalyst for the sexual revolution.[16].

title: Fact Check: Arsenic is present in the unwanted 72 contraceptive pill.
text:

Q: What is Arsenic?
A: Arsenic is a naturally occurring metal found in the earth’s crust. It occurs in various forms:
elemental (metallic) arsenic; combined with other elements such as oxygen, chlorine, sulfur
(inorganic arsenic); or combined with carbon and hydrogen (organic arsenic). Inorganic
arsenicals are generally more toxic than organic forms. 

Q: What ingredients does the unwanted 72 contraceptive pill contain?
A: The active ingredient of Unwanted 72 tablets is Levonorgestrel..

text:

Evidence:

Q: Where did this story originate?
A: The story originated from an article published by The Chester Bugle on August 23, 2019 titled "Nokia 3310 found in drawer after 20 years still has 70% battery"
The Chester Bugle is a satirical news website, written by a bunch of nut jobs. It's not actual news, even though it may look like it to some people.. 

Q: How long can the Nokia 3310 actually run?
A: When you give up so many power hungry features, there's one major goal behind them: battery life. And here the new Nokia 3310 runs rings around every modern smartphone on the market:

Nokia 3310 (2000) - 900mAh removable battery, 2.5 - 4 hours talk time, 55 hours standby
Nokia 3310 (2017) - 1200mAh removable battery, 22 hours talk time, 31 days standby

Yes, the 2017 Nokia 3310 can last up to one month between charges, around 30x more than you'll get out of your iPhone 7 and Galaxy S8. You'll be able to go on a two week holiday and not even need to pack a charger, mindblowing by today's high powered smartphone standards..

title: Fact Check: A 5G test in the Netherlands resulted in the death of 297 birds.
text:
Claim: A 5G test in the Netherlands resulted in the death of 297 birds.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: 1st QA confirms there have been no 5G tests in the park in The Hague where the birds were found dead - therefore could not be the cause of death.

Evidence:

Q: Were there any 5g tests taking place around the time of the birds deaths?
A: This is not the case. 5G has not been tested in the vicinity of the park. (translated). 

Q: Were the birds tested to find the cause of death?
A: esearchers at the Natural History Museum in Rotterdam and Wageningen University did autopsies on 15 of the starlings. From the birds’ internal injuries, the researchers concluded that they had probably died from hitting objects (possibly the ground, tree branches or each other) at great force.

The exact reason why the birds hit the objects is not known, but the university suggested that it may have been caused by panic due to a hunting owl or another disturbance.

The university confirmed that the official cause of death was bleeding as a result of trauma, but that tests also found traces of a toxin from the seeds of a berry starlings are known to eat. But it’s not known if the toxins played a part in their death..

text:
Claim: The UK has lost its measles free status just three years after the virus was eliminated.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: Confirmed in 2019 by who.

Evidence:

Q: Did the WHO ever announce that the UK had eliminated the measles virus
A: The WHO listed the UK among 42 other countries that had eliminated the virus s of 2016. 

Q: Does "eliminated" mean that there were no cases of the measles virus in the year it was declared
A: WHO defines measles elimination as the absence of circulating measles, in the presence of high vaccine coverage, along with good systems to identify cases of the disease. In countries that have eliminated measles, measles can still occur, but these will be isolated cases that only have limited spread within the community.. 

Q: Has the WHO removed the UK from the list of countries that were measles free
A: In 2019, WHO determined that the UK could no longer be consider as ‘eliminated’ and that transmission of measles had been re-established..

title: Fact Check: Trump has challenged Nevada’s new state election law - that requires mail-in bal...
text:
Claim: Trump has challenged Nevada’s new state election law - that requires mail-in ballots to be sent to all active voters amid the coronavirus pandemic - in court. Nevada’s Republican Secretary of State has asked the judge to dismiss the Trump lawsuit.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: Trump did challenge and request was made to dismiss as confirmed in the QA Pairs.

Evidence:

Q: Did Donald Trump file a lawsuit challenging Nevada’s new election law that would require mail-in ballots to be sent to all active voters during the coronavirus pandemic?
A: Yes. Plaintiffs Donald J. Trump for President, Inc., the Republican National Committee and Nevada Republican Party filed a lawsuit on 8th August 2020.

Q: Did the Nevada Republican Secretary of State, Barbara Cegavske, ask a judge to dismiss the lawsuit filed by Donald Trump against Nevada’s new mail-in ballot law?
A: Yes. In a court filing Monday, Cegavske’s attorneys asked a judge to dismiss the lawsuit and contended that the lawsuit addresses a policy debate that should occur outside of a courtroom. The filing also said the Trump campaign and Republicans who filed the suit don’t have legal standing to make their argument and don’t explain how they’d be harmed by changes in the law.

title: Fact Check: Former British Prime Minister Winston Churchill said, 'Courage is what it takes ...
text:
Claim: Former British Prime Minister Winston Churchill said, 'Courage is what it takes to stand up and speak; courage is also what it takes to sit down and listen'.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: It is not officially recorded as being said by him, and the International Churchill Society does not attribute it to him. 

Evidence:

Q: When did Winston Churchill say, 'Courage is what it takes to stand up and speak; courage is also what it takes to sit down and listen'.
A: This quote is very often attributed to Churchill but appears nowhere in the Churchill canon.. 

Q: What does the International Churchill Society say about this quote?
A: This quote is very often attributed to Churchill but appears nowhere in the Churchill canon..

title: Fact Check: Andrew Jackson said “One man with courage makes a majority.”
text:
Claim: Andrew Jackson said “One man with courage makes a majority.”

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Theres clear evidence in the answers to the questions that this wasnt a statement made by Andrew Jackson, theres also proof provided that it was actually a title of a book made by James Parton about Andrew Jackson, but not intended to be Jacksons words.

Evidence:

Q: Who is Andrew Jackson?
A: Andrew Jackson was the seventh U.S president and considered the founder of the democratic party.. 

Q: Where does the quote, "One man with courage makes a majority.” likely originate?
A: James Parton's 1860 biography of Andrew Jackson, said "desperate courage makes one a majority" on the title page. It was not intended to be interpreted as Jackson's words.. 

Q: Is there any evidence Andrew Jackson said "One man with courage makes a majority.”
A: No. There is no evidence that he said that quote at all.

title: Fact Check: Pennsylvania just opened up a $10 billion plant, during the presidency of Donald...
text:

Evidence:

Q: Is there a $10 billion plant in  Pennyslvania?
A: Yes. Shell is building a chemical plant that coverts natural gas to plastic products.

Q: What date was this plant approved and completed?
A: It was announced by Shell in 2012 and the decision was completed in June 2016.. 

Q: Was this during Donald Trump's presidency?
A: No. The plant predates Donald Trump's presidency.

title: Fact Check: TRUMP SAID Earlier this month, the U.S. government officially labeled China for ...

Q: When did Donald Trump make the statement

Q: Which U.S. government agency officially labeled China a currency manipulator
A: The United States Treasury.

title: Fact Check: The "boyfriend loophole" means that "if you commit a serious crime of domestic a...
text:
Claim: The "boyfriend loophole" means that "if you commit a serious crime of domestic abuse against your wife, you can't get a gun, but if you do it against your girlfriend, you can.

Verdict: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

Justification: Evidence finds that federal law defines domestic violence as the use or attempted use of physical force or the threatened use of a deadly weapon, committed by a current or former spouse, parent, or guardian of the victim; by a person with whom the victim shares a child in common; by a person who is cohabiting with or has cohabited with the victim as a spouse, parent, or guardian; or by a person similarly situated to a spouse, parent, or guardian of the victim. There is no mention of a more casual relationship in federal law. However, states have closed the gaps in federal law pertaining to people who commit misdemeanor crimes of domestic violence by enacting laws that prohibit domestic violence misdemeanors not covered by federal law from buying or possessing guns and/or ammunition. But, multiple states have no such law. 

Evidence:

Q: How does federal law define domestic violence?
A: the term “misdemeanor crime of domestic violence” means an offense that—
(i)is a misdemeanor under Federal, State, or Tribal [3] law; and
(ii)has, as an element, the use or attempted use of physical force, or the threatened use of a deadly weapon, committed by a current or former spouse, parent, or guardian of the victim, by a person with whom the victim shares a child in common, by a person who is cohabiting with or has cohabited with the victim as a spouse, parent, or guardian, or by a person similarly situated to a spouse, parent, or guardian of the victim.. 

Q: Does the gun prohibition in federal law apply to domestic violence committed in more casual boyfriend/girlfriend relationships or people who were merely dating?
A: No, there is no mention of a more casual relationship in federal law.. 

Q: Does state law exist that broadens the definition of domestic violence?
A: States have closed the gaps in federal law pertaining to people who commit misdemeanor crimes of domestic violence by enacting laws that:

Prohibit domestic violence misdemeanants not covered by federal law from buying or possessing guns and/or ammunition.
Authorize or require courts to order people convicted of domestic violence misdemeanors to relinquish their guns and/or ammunition.

title: Fact Check: CNN's Chris Cuomo exploded at a man who called him fredo.
text:

Verdict: Supported

Justification: "Exploded" is clearly metaphorical. I think threatening to throw someone down the stairs counts.

Evidence:

Q: Was Chris Cuomo referred to as a Fredo
A: On Tuesday, video surfaced of CNN anchor Chris Cuomo losing it after some guy (reportedly a Trump supporter) called him as “Fredo” on Sunday, in a reference to a character from the Godfather series. 

Q: What was his reaction for being called Fredo
A: He exploded and threatened to use violence.

title: Fact Check: Would Florida assault weapon law amendment proposal ban virtually all guns?
text:
Claim: Would Florida assault weapon law amendment proposal ban virtually all guns?

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Not all guns were banned in this proposal, only the defined assault weapons.

Evidence:

Q: What does the Florida gun law amendment propose?
A: BAWN’s proposal defines assault weapons more broadly than past definitions. Instead of listing design features to designate the banned weapons, the question describes assault weapons as “semiautomatic rifles and shotguns capable of holding more than 10 rounds of ammunition at once, either in a fixed or detachable magazine, or any other ammunition-feeding device.” This definition expands on several existing state laws by including weapons that can accept large-capacity detachable magazines, which are typically what make assault weapons so lethal.

BAWN’s assault-weapons ban, which exempts military or law-enforcement members, would make possession of the defined weapons a third-degree felony. It would also give Floridians who already own these weapons a year to register them before their possession becomes illegal..

title: Fact Check: Britons have spent £4bn stockpiling goods in case of no-deal Brexit.
text:
Claim: Britons have spent £4bn stockpiling goods in case of no-deal Brexit.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: From the sources, it says Britons have spent over £4.6 billion stockpiling household goods in preparation for a hard Brexit, according to new research.

Evidence:

Q: what is the total population of the UK
A: total adult population of the UK being just over 52 million.. 

Q: Did Britons stockpile supplies in anticipation of a no deal Brexit?
A: Yes. A survey carried out by finance provider Premium Credit shows that 17% of the country has started hoarding food, drink and medicine – with about 2.4 million people having spent more than £500 stockpiling.

Q: How much did Brits spend stockpiling before Brexit?
A: Brits spent over £4.6 billion at Brexit stockpiling peaks.

title: Fact Check: U.S. Attorney General William Barr made a secret visit to the Manhattan jail whe...

A: Justice Department spokeswoman Kerri Kupec told Lead Stories:

The claim is preposterous. In fact, Attorney General Barr has never visited MCC. (And as a reminder, he has 24/7 FBI protective detail, which means they would have had to be there, as well.

title: Fact Check: Attorney General William Barr visited the prison where accused sex trafficker Je...
text:

Q: Why was William Barr in New York City on July 23rd?
A: Attorney General William P. Barr Delivers Keynote Address at the International Conference on Cyber Security..

title: Fact Check: In the weeks following El Paso and Dayton, evidence of an impending mass shootin...
text:
Claim: In the weeks following El Paso and Dayton, evidence of an impending mass shooting spread on Snapchat and iMessage.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Police publicly addressed it as misinformation.

Evidence:

Q: Are the mass shooting messages spreading on Snapchat and iMessage after El Paso and Dayton based on credible information?
A: RUMOR ADDRESSED: Does this text message look familiar to you?

The Savanah Police Department has received word from some concerned citizens that this message is floating around through text message and on social media warning that a police officer claimed there could be shootings in Walmarts and are warning people not to go to these businesses. We are aware of the message, and after speaking with other law enforcement agencies we have learned that the message is floating around throughout the entire state and others as well. This message has not been determined to be a credible threat in the Savannah area, and appears to be the results of a wild internet rumor. Please be cautious of any social media rumors, and always bring them to law enforcement attention so that we can determine if there are any existing threats. Thank you to all who brought their concerns to the police department!. 

Q: What happened in the El Paso mass shooting?
A: Police in El Paso, a large city on the Mexico-US border, first received reports of gunshots at 10:39 local time (16:39 GMT) on Saturday.

A gunman had opened fire with an assault-style rifle in a crowded Walmart on the city's east side. Nearby businesses were placed on lockdown and shoppers were evacuated.

The store is near a retail park, the Cielo Vista Mall, which is popular with El Paso residents as well as shoppers from just across the Mexican border.

In addition to the 22 fatalities, 24 people were injured in the shooting. Eight Mexican nationals were among the dead and the victims' ages range from 15 to 90.

Officers arrived on the scene within six minutes and the attacker surrendered after he was confronted by police outside the store.. 

Q: What happened in the Dayton mass shooting?
A: Hours later, almost 1,600 miles away in Dayton, Ohio, shooting began at 01:07 local time (05:07 GMT) on Sunday in an area popular for its nightlife.

Security camera footage shows dozens of people racing through the doorway of the local Ned Peppers nightclub on E 5th Street. Nine people were killed and 27 were injured.

Just seconds later, the gunman is seen running towards the venue and being hit by police gunfire as he reaches the door. Police have confirmed they killed the gunman at the scene within 30 seconds of him opening fire.

Had the gunman made it through the door, Dayton Police Chief Richard Biehl said, the loss of life would have been "catastrophic".

The suspect, 24-year-old Connor Betts, used a .223-calibre assault rifle with high-capacity magazines that he had ordered legally from Texas. There was nothing in his history that would have stopped him from buying the gun legally, police said..

title: Fact Check: Donald Trump said that he 'did criminal justice reform, which President Obama co...
text:

Q: How did Trump reform criminal justice system?
A: The FIRST STEP Act is consequential because it includes provisions for meaningful sentencing reform, which would reduce the number and amount of people in prison and is part of the starting point of any serious legislation for criminal justice reform.. 

Q: Did Obama pass legislation reforming the justice system?
A: Yes. President Obama signed a bill reducing the disparity in penalties for the use of crack and powder cocaine. 
The enactment of the law sealed a hard-fought victory for civil rights activists who have argued for years that the differing punishments unfairly target African-Americans.

Corporations, including nonprofit corporations (although funds from a corporate separate segregated fund are permissible)
Labor organizations (although funds from a separate segregated fund are permissible)
Federal government contractors
Foreign nationals
Contributions in the name of another.

title: Fact Check: White supremacy is a hoax and "not a real problem in America."

Q: How many airplane crashes occurred between January 1, 2005, and November 7, 2006?
A: Oct. 22, 2005 – A Nigerian Bellview Airlines Boeing 737 airliner crashed shortly after take-off from Lagos. All 111 passengers and six crew were killed.

Dec. 10, 2005 – A Nigerian Sosoliso Airlines DC9 from Abuja crashed on landing in Port Harcourt, killing 106 people, half of them schoolchildren on their way home for Christmas.

Sept. 17, 2006 – Twelve Nigerian military personnel, mostly high-ranking officers, were killed in a plane crash in Benue state. Six survived.

Oct. 29, 2006 – An ADC airliner with 114 passengers on board crashed and burned after take-off from Abuja, killing 96 people.. 

Q: What was the death toll in airplane crashes between January 1, 2005, and November 7, 2006?
A: A total of 331 lives were lost..

- who has been adjudicated as a mental defective or has been committed to any mental institution;. 

Q: What is the definition of a 'mental defective' in the U.S?
A: A determination by a court, board, commission, or other lawful authority that a person, as a result of marked subnormal intelligence, or mental illness, incompetency, condition, or disease:.

A: Donald J. Trump is a Republican party member..

title: Fact Check: The common theme with mass shooters is that the assailants were on psychotropic ...
text:

Evidence:

Q: Is an increase in use of psychiatric medications is causing an increase of violence?
A: The problem with the argument blaming medications,however, is that though there has been a signicant increase in the use of psychiatric medications, there has not been a corresponding increase in violence. In fact, just the opposite has occurred. Violent crime has decreased dramatically.. 

Q: How many shooters were on psychiatric medications — or coming off them — at the time of their attacks?
A: The following data is drawn from the sample of 48 shooters profiled in my book School Shooters: Understanding High School, College, and Adult Perpetrators. Out of 24 secondary school shooters, only two were taking medication at the time of their attacks: Eric Harris and Jeffrey Weise. Alvaro Castillo might have been, or he may have stopped his medication within three weeks of his attack and thus still have been coming off the drug. If we include him, then 12.5% of the sample was taking medications. Put differently, over 87% of the secondary school shooters were not on psychiatric medications at the time of their attacks. Furthermore, there is no evidence that medication made Harris, Weise, or Castillo manic or psychotic. The numbers are essentially the same for the college and adult shooters..

title: Fact Check: AG William Barr Tweets Odds Of Mass Shootings In Hometowns Of 2 Democrat Preside...

Q: Did Attorney General William Barr tweet that the odds were 250 Billion to 1 against mass shootings happening in  the hometowns of both Democratic presidential candidates, in the same weekend ?
A: No. There is no evidence that William Barr tweeted this information. The tweet was fake.

title: Fact Check: Geckos carry pathogenic bacteria in their mouths which are very toxic to humans.
text:
Claim: Geckos carry pathogenic bacteria in their mouths which are very toxic to humans.

Verdict: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

Justification: Evidence finds conflicting evidence, where one side showcases that wild-caught geckos may have different types of bacteria in their oral cavities than captive-hatched ones. The bacteria can be potentially dangerous bacteria, protozoa, or, rarely, a pathogenic fungus that can be transmitted to a human via a bite that punctures the skin. There was also a Salmonella outbreak in 16 states that was linked to pet geckos. On the other hand, it is said that geckos are non-toxic, do not bite, and are not known to transmit any kind of infection or disease to humans.

Evidence:

Q: Are geckos harmful to humans?
A: Wild caught geckos may have different types of bacteria in their oral cavities than captive-hatched ones.

They can, however, carry potentially dangerous bacteria, protozoa or, rarely, a pathogenic fungus that can be transmitted to a human via a bite that punctures the skin..

title: Fact Check: Police stopped a mass shooting in Omaha, NE, in early August 2019
text:
Claim: Police stopped a mass shooting in Omaha, NE, in early August 2019

Verdict: Refuted

Q: Was there a mass shooting in Omaha, Nebraska, in August 2019?

Q: What is the list of mass shootings that have happened in Omaha, Nebraska?
A: Dec. 5, 2007 —Omaha, Nebraska. Robert A. Hawkins killed eight people and himself using a semiautomatic rifle after entering the Westroads Mall.. 

Q: Where did the claim originate from?
A: City News.

title: Fact Check: Police stopped a mass shooting in Des Moines, IA, in early August 2019
text:
Claim: Police stopped a mass shooting in Des Moines, IA, in early August 2019

Verdict: Refuted

Evidence:

Q: Where was this claim made?
A: A website called City News published this article claiming that the Omaha Police Department had "foiled a mass shooting plot by a 32-year old man.. 

Q: Does the Omaha Police Department have any records of this event?
A: No answer could be found.. 

Q: Is the news site legitimate?
A: No. Domain records show that the City News website was registered in China last month for a period of one year — a telltale sign that the site is bogus.

five years (2014 – 2018) El Paso has averaged eighteen (18) Murders per year..

If accidentally ingested please seek medical advice and for any further questions contact our careline at 1-800-321-3279

Clearblue pregnancy tests do NOT contain Plan B.
All our tests contain a small desiccant tablet which is included to absorb moisture and should not be eaten.

title: Fact Check: So far in 2019, the United States has had 249 mass shootings, while Mexico had t...
text:
Claim: So far in 2019, the United States has had 249 mass shootings, while Mexico had three, New Zealand, the Netherlands, Brazil and Canada had one, and many other countries had none.

Verdict: Not Enough Evidence

Justification: The Q&A Pair did not Specifically ask questions about the number (249 ) of mass shootings in United States, 2019 and many other countries. There is no direct source to refute or support the claim. 

Evidence:

Q: What is the definition of "mass shooting" in the US?
A: According to a Congressional Research Service report dated 18/03/2013:
There is no broadly agreed-to, specific conceptualization of this issue, so this report uses its own definition for public mass shootings. These are incidents occurring in relatively public places,
involving four or more deaths—not including the shooter(s)—and gunmen who select victims
somewhat indiscriminately. The violence in these cases is not a means to an end—the gunmen do
not pursue criminal profit or kill in the name of terrorist ideologies, for example.. 

Q: How does US compare to the rest of the world in connection with mass shootings?
A: According to a research paper written by John R Lott, Crime Prevention Research Center dated  November 12, 2018:

The U.S. is well below the world average in terms of the number of mass public shootings, and the global increase over time has been much bigger than for the United States.

Over the 18 years from 1998 to 2015, our list contains 2,354 attacks and at least 4,880 shooters outside the United States and 53 attacks and 57 shooters within our country. By our count, the US makes up less than 1.15% of the mass public shooters, 1.49% of their murders, and 2.20% of their attacks. All these are much less than the US’s 4.6% share of the world population. Attacks in the US are not only less frequent than other countries, but they are also much less deadly on average.. 

Q: What does the updated version dated August 11, 2020 of this paper state?
A: The U.S. is well below the world average in terms of the number of mass public shootings, and the global increase over time has been much bigger than for the United States.

Over the 20 years from 1998 to 2017, our list contains 2,772 attacks and at least 5,764 shooters outside the United States and 62 attacks and 66 shooters within our country. By our count, the US makes up less than 1.13% of the mass public shooters, 1.77% of their murders, and 2.19% of their attacks. All these are much less than the US’s 4.6% share of the world population. Attacks in the US are not only less frequent than other countries, they are also much less deadly on average. Out of the 101 countries where we have identified mass public shootings occurring, the United States ranks 66th in the per capita frequency of these attacks and 56th in the murder rate..
