title: Fact Check: In an op-ed, then-sen. Joe Biden wrote that he believed that women working outsi...
text:
Claim: In an op-ed, then-sen. Joe Biden wrote that he believed that women working outside the home would, quote, "create the deterioration of family." He also said that women who were working outside the home were, quote, "avoiding responsibility."

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The evidence shows the op-ed and it doesn't mention women working outside the home at all.

Evidence:

Q: Did Joe Biden state in an op-ed that women working outside of the home were "avoiding responsibility"?
A: No. Joe Biden spoke on responsibility in his op-ed wen he said, "make it easier for people who have neither the financial necessity nor personal need to forsake their responsibility to care for their own children."

Q: Did Joe Biden state in an op-ed that women working outside of the home would "create the deterioration of family."?
A: No. Although Biden spoke about the deterioration of families, He didn't specifically say 'working women' would cause the deterioration of the family.

Q: Does Joe Biden oppose women working outside the home?
A: No. In July 28, 1981, Joe Biden praised his wife and said "She is a career woman. She is very devoted to her career, and very concerned about it, and she has good reason to be, and I am proud of the fact that she has such a career,"

However he did add "But it is outrageous to make my father, who makes less than $20,000 a year, to pay a tax to see to it that I can put my child in a day care center. I think that is preposterous."

title: Fact Check: Rodrigo Duterte changed his position again on opening in-person classes amid the...
text:
Claim: Rodrigo Duterte changed his position again on opening in-person classes amid the coronavirus 2019 pandemic.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: It does look like Rodrigo Duterte changed his position on classed amid the covid-19 pandemic. 

Evidence:

Q: Has Rodrigo Duterte changed alternated his position on opening in-person classes amid the coronavirus 2019 pandemic?
A: Yes. May 25
The president says it is “useless” to talk about opening of classes “unless [he is] sure that [school children] are really safe":

“I will not allow the opening of classes na magdikit-dikit iyang mga bata... Bahala na hindi na makatapos...wala nang aral. Laro na lang…Para sa akin, bakuna muna.”

June 5
Still intent on waiting for a vaccine, Duterte announces that he is considering the proposal of the Department of Education (DepEd) to use teleconferencing as an alternative to face-to-face classes:

“[I]f she (Education Secretary Leonor Briones) has [the technology] or if we can afford it, we’ll buy it and...the children can continue with their education.”

Q: Did Rodrigo Duterte changed his position again on opening in-person classes amid the coronavirus 2019 pandemic ?
A: Yes, The President has earlier approved the trial run of the face-to-face classes in areas considered at low risk for COVID-19. He later said I’m calling back the order and I will not allow face-to-face classes of children until we are through with this  following the emergence of a more infectious variant of the coronavirus disease in the UK..

title: Fact Check: The City of New York could not proceed with the case of murder of Eric Garner be...
text:
Claim: The City of New York could not proceed with the case of murder of Eric Garner because the Justice Department was pursuing its prosecution.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: There not exists a law that prevents the city of New York making an investigation if there is a federal investigation.

Evidence:

Q: Is there a law that prevents the city of New York making an investigation if there is a federal investigation?
A: No. De Blasio also said that it was a mistake for the city to wait for federal prosecutors to finish investigating Garner’s death before the police department began disciplinary proceedings. But there is no rule requiring the NYPD to do so.

Q: Did other journalists point out that there was no legal requirement for the city of New York to not investigate if there was a federal request?
A: Yes. Nolan Hicks of the New York Post tweeted: 'There was nothing that prevented the de Blasio administration legally from bringing the administrative charges against Daniel Pantaleo while waiting on the Justice Department. City Hall says they held off on the Justice Department's behest.'

Q: Did the federal prosecutors refuse to take the case of murder of Eric Garner because the Justice Department was pursuing their prosecution ?
A: The NYPD could have started those proceedings years ago. In fact, it did start that process well before the Justice Department closed its civil rights investigation this year with no charges. The NYPD’s delay had a material effect, because it meant more requirements for prosecutors seeking to prove Pantaleo’s culpability..

title: Fact Check: 500,000 Americans are sleeping out on the street

were experiencing homelessness in the United
States. About two-thirds (65%) were staying in

human habitation..

text:

A: Yes. Trump declared that cutting drug prices was a top priority for him.

Q: Did the U.S democrat party want to bring down prescription drug prices.

U.S. Reps. Elijah Cummings (Democrat.) and Peter Welch (Democrat.) met privately for about an hour with Trump and his newly appointed HHS secretary, Tom Price, to discuss ways to combat high drug prices.

title: Fact Check: 87 million Americans are uninsured or underinsured
text:
Claim: 87 million Americans are uninsured or underinsured

Verdict: Supported

Justification: When the uninsured and underinsured figures are added they support the claim. 

Evidence:

Q: Where did this figure come from?
A: Sanders is quoting from a 2019 report from the Commonwealth Fund. The report said that the number of people who are uninsured — 24 million — had declined since the passage of the Affordable Care Act in 2010, but that more people are “underinsured.”. 

Q: What does underinsured mean?
A: That term refers to out-of-pocket costs that exceed 10 percent of income (or 5 percent of income if low-income, as well as deductible that were more than 5 percent of income. It also covers people who may have had a gap in insurance coverage.. 

Q: How many total are underinsured?
A: 63.1 million people which includes 43.8 million people had insurance but were underinsured, while 19.3 million people had a coverage gap..

title: Fact Check: Albert Einstein once said, “Art is standing with one hand extended into the univ...
text:
Claim: Albert Einstein once said, “Art is standing with one hand extended into the universe and one hand extended into the world, and letting ourselves be a conduit for passing energy.”

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: There's enough here to refute the claim but the source for Q3&4 might be considered fact checking material.

Evidence:

Q: Can the phrase "one hand extended into the world" be found in the Einstein Archives Online?
A: No. Page shows a negative result from the search of the online archive.

Q: Can the phrase "one hand extended into the world" be found in 'The Ultimate Quotable Einstein'?
A: No. Page shows a negative result from the search of 'The Ultimate Quotable Einstein'.

Q: Where does the quote "Art is standing with one hand extended into the universe and one hand extended into the world and letting ourselves be a conduit for passing energy" come from?
A: The quote may be from Christina Baldwin's 1990 book, Life’s Companion: Journal Writing as a Spiritual Quest, where a quote says, "Spiritual love is a position of standing with one hand extended into the universe and one hand extended into the world, letting ourselves be a conduit for passing energy.".

title: Fact Check: The health-care industry made $100 billion in profits last year

a significant increase in net earnings to $23.4 billion.

A: Yes, Sanders is correct: The total net revenues, or profits, these companies posted in 2018 comes to just more than $100 billion — $100.96 billion, in fact.

title: Fact Check: A 24 year old Indian Hindu man Hitesh Mulchandani in the city of Pune was murder...
text:
Claim: A 24 year old Indian Hindu man Hitesh Mulchandani in the city of Pune was murdered by a Muslim gang for raising his voice against public urination.

Verdict: Not Enough Evidence

Evidence:

Q: Was the murder of Hitesh Mulchandani in the city of Pune India, carried out by Muslim gang ?
A: Pimpri Inspector Kalyan Pawar said, “The accused are on record criminals who have killed Hitesh over a spat. Amin was handed over to us by the hotel staff. However the others are absconding while we have launched a hunt to trace them.”. 

Q: Does the murder of Hitesh Mulchandani in the city of Pune India, has any religious inclination ?
A: A youth was allegedly abducted and mercilessly killed in Pimpri following a spat with a gang of criminals who were urinating outside a hotel near Pimpri railway station in wee hours of Tuesday.

The victim was identified as Hitesh Govardhan Mulchandani (24) a resident of Pimpri Camp.

The accused were identified as Amin Khan of Mominpura, Shahbaaz Qureshi of Kasarwadi, Arbaaz Sheikh of Khadki, Akshay Bhosale alias Linga of Sangvi and one Langda of Sangvi.

The Pimpri police said that five accused came at Krunal Bar and Restaurant at Radhika Chowk near Pimpri railway station. The accused had reportedly come there for drinks.

One of the accused identified as Amin Khan was allegedly urinating outside the hotel when the hotel staff objected.

The police added that the objection of the hotel staff led to a huge spat between Amin and the staffers

The police further said the hotel owner Rohit Sukheja arrived there with his friends including Hitesh Mulchandani. Hitesh tried to bring peace between the groups however it fired back at him.

When Rohit’s friend, Sahil Lalwani intervened to stop Amin, he allegedly got into fisticuffs. Amin also allegedly broke a bottle of beer on the head of another friend of Kailash Patil and injured him.. 

Q: what is india's stand on public urination
A: Any person who, on any road or in any open place or street or thoroughfare within the limits of any town to which this section shall be specially extended by the State Government, commits any of the following offences, to the obstructions inconvenience, annoyance, risk, danger or damage of the residents or passengers shall, on conviction before a Magistrate, be liable to fine not exceeding fifty rupees, or to imprisonment with or without hard labor not exceeding eight days;”.

title: Fact Check: More than half of death row prisoners are people of color
text:
Claim: More than half of death row prisoners are people of color

Verdict: Supported

Justification: It is evidently clear from the source provided  More than half of death row prisoners are people of color. If you sum up all the non white death row prisoners. 

Evidence:

Q: what is the percentile distribution of those in death sentence
A: White -- 27 (43.5%)

Black -- 26 (41.9%)

Latino -- 7 (11.3%)

Native American -- 1 (1.6%) 

Asian -- 1 (1.6%). 

Q: what does person of color define ?
A: a person who is not a white person.. 

Q: What is a 'white person'?
A: White is a category for everyone
left out of specific racial or ethnic groups..

title: Fact Check: Robert S Mueller can't provide evidence that his investigation into  Russia’s in...
text:
Claim: Robert S Mueller can't provide evidence that his investigation into  Russia’s interference in the 2016 presidential election reached a conclusion.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The evidence below suggests that evidence was concluded on the investigation of Russia's interference in the 2016 presidential election.

Evidence:

Q: Who is Robert S Mueller?
A: He is former FBI director and named special counsel for Russia investigation. 

Q: What is the investigation into Russia’s interference?
A: The Russian investigation was investigating Russia's interference in the 2016 presidential election.. 

Q: Did the Mueller Report reach a conclusion?
A: on January 6, 2017, the Office of the Director of National Intelligence released a report concluding that “Russian President Vladimir Putin ordered an influence campaign in 2016 aimed at the US presidential election”, that the goal of this campaign was “to undermine public faith in the US democratic process”, and that “Putin and the Russian Government developed a clear preference for President-elect Trump”;.

title: Fact Check: The European Union asked for a 100 billion euro settlement for the UK to leave t...
text:
Claim: The European Union asked for a 100 billion euro settlement for the UK to leave the EU.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Numbers suggest the amount in QA pairs was around 1/3 of amount stated in claim.

Evidence:

Q: What is the latest estimate for the UK's divorce bill upon leaving the EU?
A: Based on our March forecast, but assuming a 31 October 2019 exit date, the financial
settlement would be €36.3 billion, or £32.8 billion, with the remaining £5.0 billion
difference being paid as part of the UK’s normal membership contributions to the EU.. 

Q: What is a Brexit divorce bill?
A: In the financial settlement (the settlement), the UK and EU have set out how they will
settle their outstanding financial obligations to each other. The obligations arise out of the
UK’s participation in the EU Budget and broader aspects of its EU membership.
The settlement says which financial commitments will be covered, the methodology for
calculating the UK’s share and the payment schedule. The settlement is part of the
Withdrawal Agreement, which is the legally binding treaty setting out the negotiated
terms of the UK’s departure from the EU.
There is no definitive cost to the settlement. The final cost to the UK will depend on future
events such as future exchange rates and EU budgets. The Office for Budget Responsibility
estimate that the net cost to the UK may be £34 billion..

title: Fact Check: India’s Debt From The World Bank Reduced To Zero Under PM Narendra Modi in July ...

Verdict: Not Enough Evidence

Q: Does the World Bank offer loans to countries of the world?
A: Yes. The International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (IBRD) lends to governments of middle-income and creditworthy low-income countries.

Q: Did India have any loans with the IBRD in July 2019?
A: Data is only available for 26/10/2017. 

Q: Did India have any loans with the World Bank in 2019?
A: No answer could be found..

title: Fact Check: President Trump fully co-operated with the investigation into Russian interferen...
text:
Claim: President Trump fully co-operated with the investigation into Russian interference in the 2016 U.S presidential campaign.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Mueller said “If we had confidence after a thorough investigation of the facts that the President clearly did not commit obstruction of justice, we would so state. Based on the facts and the applicable legal standards, we are unable to reach that judgment.”
Clearly this is not "full cooperation".

Evidence:

Q: What was the investigation into Russian interference in the 2016 U.S presidential campaign called?
A: The Mueller Report.. 

Q: What is the Mueller Report?
A: The report is a summation of the findings from the special counsel investigation. It is expected to contain the details of the investigation, from its interviews with key witnesses and other evidence amassed throughout the process and the Mueller team’s conclusions – or lack thereof.

In a letter to lawmakers, Attorney General William Barr said the report “sets forth the Special Counsel’s findings, analysis and the reasons for his conclusions.” 

Mueller was appointed in May 2017 shortly after Trump fired Comey. Mueller was authorized to investigate Russian interference in the 2016 election, whether any Trump associates coordinated or colluded with the Russians, whether Trump obstructed the investigation and any other crimes that were uncovered during the investigation.. 

Q: Did Donald Trump act in good faith when being investigated?
A: Trump consistently denied that he or anyone on his team colluded with Russia to interfere in the election, and he has rejected further the intelligence community’s conclusion that Russia attempted to interfere in the election at all, including while standing next to Russian President Vladimir Putin shortly after Mueller’s appointment. He likewise denied the possibility he had obstructed justice.

Throughout the process, Trump railed against Mueller and Mueller’s team, accusing them of political bias and maligning both the intelligence community and Justice Department more broadly..

title: Fact Check: Robert Mueller applied and was interviewed for the job of FBI director the day b...
text:
Claim: Robert Mueller applied and was interviewed for the job of FBI director the day before he was appointed Special Counsel.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: He was there to 'give advice on the type of person that we should select to be FBI director'

Evidence:

Q: What did Robert Mueller go to the Whitehouse for on May 16 2017?
A: He was there to 'give advice on the type of person that we should select to be FBI director'.

title: Fact Check: The Trump campaign welcomed and made full use of Russian intervention  in the 20...
text:
Claim: The Trump campaign welcomed and made full use of Russian intervention  in the 2016 U.S presidential election.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The investigation into the matter could not prove that the
Campaign coordinated or conspired with the Russian government in its election-interference
activities 

Evidence:

Q: How did Russia intervene in USA 2016 presidential elections?
A: The Russian government interfered in the 2016 presidential election in sweeping and
systematic fashion. Evidence of Russian government operations began to surface in mid-2016. In
June, the Democratic National Committee and its cyber response team publicly announced that
Russian hackers had compromised its computer network. Releases of hacked materials—hacks
that public reporting soon attributed to the Russian government—began that same month.
Additional releases followed in July through the organization WikiLeaks, with further releases in
October and November. 

Q: Did Russian government contact Trump Campaign to offer assistance during the 2016 presidential campaign?
A: The investigation established multiple links between Trump Campaign officials and
individuals tied to the Russian government. Those links included Russian offers of assistance to
the Campaign.. 

Q: Did Trump's Campaign accept the Russian offers of assistance?
A: In some instances, the Campaign was receptive to the offer, while in other instances
the Campaign officials shied away. Ultimately, the investigation did not establish that the
Campaign coordinated or conspired with the Russian government in its election-interference
activities..

title: Fact Check: A dossier by former British intelligence officer Christopher Steele containing c...
text:
Claim: A dossier by former British intelligence officer Christopher Steele containing contacts between Russian officials and members of the Trump campaign started the investigation into Russian interference in the 2016 election campaign.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The Dossier was received weeks to months later after the investigation had began.

Evidence:

Q: What prompted the Russian interference investigation in the 2016 election campaign In the U.S?
A: James Comey said ,  the "basis" for the start of the FBI's Russia investigation was "information we'd received about a conversation that a Trump campaign foreign policy adviser had with an individual in London about stolen emails that the Russians had that would be harmful to Hillary Clinton." Comey added that "it was weeks or months later that the so-called Steele dossier came to our attention.". 

Q: Who is James Comey?
A: FBI Director at time of April 2016. 

Q: Did the Christopher Steele-compiled dossier, which detailed interactions between Russian officials and Trump campaign members, serve as the impetus for the Russia investigation?
A: Christopher Steele's raw intelligence reporting did not inform the FBI's decision to initiate its  counterintelligence investigation in late July 2016..

title: Fact Check: The Baltnews.lv news website is an “independent and not controlled by the state ...
text:

Q: Who is Rossiya Segodnya?
A: Rossia Segodnya, Russia's state-run media conglomerate.

title: Fact Check: Paul Manafort case recovers between forty two and forty six million U.S dollars ...
text:

A: Mueller may have paid for his own investigation - because, as part of his plea deal with the special counsel, Manafort agreed to forfeit real estate and cash estimated to be worth between $42 million and $46 million..

A: The nearly two-year special counsel investigation of Russian election interference led by Robert Mueller cost nearly $32 million in total, a new filing shows - the special counsel’s fourth and final expenditures as reported by the Justice Department..

A: According to Jerrold Nadler the cost of the Russian investigation the cost to the US taxpayer approaches zero as a result of the $42 million recovered by Mueller..

title: Fact Check: London has no go areas.
text:
Claim: London has no go areas.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: From the question and answer pairs, everythign is very well explained. It seems that London does not have no-go areas, therefore the claim is refuted.

Evidence:

Q: What is a no-go area?
A: A "no-go area" or "no-go zone" is a neighborhood or other geographic area where some or all outsiders either are physically prevented from entering or can enter only at risk.
In the 21st century, the term has most often been used to refer to areas that police or medical workers consider too dangerous to enter without heavy backup.. 

Q: Are there any no-go areas in London?
A: There are no areas in the UK in which the laws of the UK cannot be enforced..

title: Fact Check: London is now one of the world’s most violent capital cities.
text:
Claim: London is now one of the world’s most violent capital cities.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: From the Q&A it seems that London is never mentioned in any of the lists of the most violent cities. So the claim is refuted. 

Evidence:

Q: Which capital cities is the most violent cities in the world?
A: Venezuela's capital city of Caracas is and will be, until January of next year at least, considered the world's most violent city... except it isn't.

Mexican non-governmental organization (NGO) the Citizen's Council for Public Security and Criminal Justice (Consejo Ciudadano para la Seguridad Pública y la Justicia Penal – CCSPJP) has published its list of the world's 50 Most Violent Cities in 2015, which ranked Caracas number one.Since El Faro's Sala Negra was created five years ago, I have worked as a journalist who tries to understand violence indicators in El Salvador, and I like to compare them with what is happening in other countries in Latin America.

While international news agencies and prestigious media outlets elevate this Mexican NGO's list as absolute truth, we at Sala Negra dismissed it as a trusted source some two or three years ago. And we did it for one simple reason: in my opinion, the list's errors and superficiality are far too serious.. 

Q: Where are the world’s most violent capital cities ?
A: Murder is more common in Latin America than in any other part of the world.

That's the most striking takeaway from a ranking of the most violent cities compiled earlier this year by Mexico's Citizens' Council for Public Security and Criminal Justice. The ranking doesn't count deaths in war zones or cities with unavailable data.Thirty-four of the 50 worst cities were located in the region, including repeat murder capital of the world — San Pedro Sula, Honduras — which saw 187 homicides per 100,000 inhabitants in 2013 and is getting steadily worse. A full one-third of global homicides occur in Latin America even though the region has just 8% of the world's population, according to United Nations data.

Drug trafficking, gang wars, political instability, corruption, and poverty combine to cause the region's elevated violence.

US cities also made the list, led by Detroit at No. 24 and New Orleans at No. 26..

Q: Is there any other proof that these weapons were not seized from a mosque?

title: Fact Check: Abraham Lincoln said "America will never be destroyed from the outside. If we lo...
text:
Claim: Abraham Lincoln said "America will never be destroyed from the outside. If we lose our freedoms it will be because we have destroyed ourselves from within."

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Since the claim is a quote and those words were not his specific words, then he didn't say them 

Evidence:

Q: Did Abraham Lincoln say "America will never be destroyed from the outside"?
A: No. Lincoln did not say those words but when talking about the approach of danger, he said "it must spring up amongst us. It cannot come from abroad." So the context is similar although the specific words were not his.

Q: Did Abraham Lincoln say "If we lose our freedoms it will be because we have destroyed ourselves from within." ?
A: No. Lincoln did not say those words but when talking about the approach of danger, he said "If destruction be our lot, we must ourselves be its author and finisher." So the context is similar although the specific words were not his.

title: Fact Check: Trump claims his deregulatory actions are saving American households $3,000 a ye...
text:
Claim: Trump claims his deregulatory actions are saving American households $3,000 a year.

Verdict: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

Justification: as the data which was used to decide the 3000 a year was refuted by several places.  

Evidence:

Q: Where did Trump get the $3,000 a year saving figure from?
A: The Economic Effects of Federal Deregulation since January 2017: An 
Interim Report by The Council of Economic Advisers
June 2019. 

Q: What does the report 'The Economic Effects of Federal Deregulation since January 2017: An Interim Report' say about the $3,000 saving as a result of deregulations?
A: The Council of Economic 
Advisers (CEA) estimates that after 5 to 10 years, this new approach to Federal regulation will 
have raised real incomes by $3,100 per household per year.. 

Q: Are the many figures used in the report reliable?
A: The figures are estimates and have been refuted by numerous sources such as the Office of Management and Budget (OMB) which argued that the 'Stream Protection Rule' had less effect than the CEA argued it did..

title: Fact Check: kenya's forestry sector contributes 3.6% of the national gross domestic product.

Q: Does the forestry sector in Kenya contributes 3.6% of GDP by 2019 ?
A: The FAO report estimated that the formal forestry sector made up 1.2% of GDP in 2011, from wages, profits and timber. When the informal sector such as woodfuel and charcoal was counted, forestry’s contribution rose to 3% – still lower than the taskforce’s estimate of 3.6%.
The report said the official figure, which put forestry’s GDP contribution at 1.1%, was a “gross underestimate”. This was by “at least 2.5%, which puts the estimate of its annual contribution to GDP to around 3.6%”.But their was no proof of the same. Hence, this claim is unproven.. 

Q: Are 60% of the national energy requirements in Kenya are from wood fuel by 2019 ?
A: But the Energy Regulatory Commission says biomass, including wood fuel, makes up 70% of Kenya’s energy supply. The FAO’s 2014 State of the World’s Forests puts this at 68%.This claim is true.. 

Q: What was the estimated GDP amount contributed to forestry in 2018?
A: An estimated 1.3% contributed to forestry and logging in 2018..

title: Fact Check: Microwave Ovens Are Banned In Japan
text:
Claim: Microwave Ovens Are Banned In Japan

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: No evidence suggests this. 

Evidence:

Q: Has Japan banned Microwave ovens?
A: The former Soviet Union may have banned micro- wave ovens for a short period, but no countries ban them today.. 

Q: Is there any plans to ban microwave ovens in Japan?
A: No answer could be found.. 

Q: Are microwave ovens harmful to humans?
A: Microwave ovens produce electromagnetic radiation.

You may find this concerning due to radiation’s negative connotations. However, this is not the type of radiation associated with atomic bombs and nuclear disasters.

Microwave ovens produce non-ionizing radiation, which is like the radiation from your cell phone — though much stronger.

Keep in mind that light is also electromagnetic radiation, so clearly not all radiation is bad.

Microwave ovens have metal shields and metal screens over the window that prevent the radiation from leaving the oven, so there shouldn’t be any risk of harm..

Q: Is there evidence of this legislation changing?

title: Fact Check:
text:
Claim: 

Verdict: Supported

Justification: The claim is correct.

Evidence:

Q: Do some countries campaign until the day of election?
A: Yes. In various countries campaigning is allowed up to the day of election. The United States of America has no uniform set of electoral rules for its states, yet, a popular rule amongst is that campaigning must be restricted in the polling place and its closest surroundings.

Campaigns and electoral advertisements in Australia are restricted a day before the election, but there are no controls over political campaigns on social media. In Argentina, Egypt, India, and Mozambique, campaign ends 48 hours before polls.

However, in the United Kingdom’s Code of Conduct for Campaigners, campaigners are allowed to put their messages to voters on polling day, including in public spaces outside polling places.

Q: What is the rules around Nigeria's electoral campaigning, in this regard?
A: Election silence is a period where there are no electoral campaigns with the aim of allowing voters to reflect on who to vote for.  In Nigeria, according to Section 99 (1) of the Electoral Act 2010, as amended, campaigning in public by any political party shall commence 90 days before polling day and end 24 hours prior to that day..

title: Fact Check: That Joel Osteen's Ministries charge people for prayers via a "prayer request ac...
text:

Evidence:

Q: Where was this claim published?
A: Facebook - the account has since been deleted.. 

Q: Have Joel Osteen Ministries addressed this claim?
A: Yes. Lakewood Church has been warning people about a Facebook account posing as "Joel Osteen Ministries," which has been asking people for donations up to $50 to activate prayer request accounts.
A church spokesperson said she didn't know where the post originated. She said the Lakewood social media team saw hundreds of people receiving the fake messages.

The church quickly notified people that that they do not, in fact, charge for prayer requests.

title: Fact Check: No European country engages in electronic voting
text:

Verdict: Refuted

Evidence:

Q: Is there a country in Europe that uses electronic voting for their elections
A: Estonia has been using electronic voting for their elections since 2005. 

Q: Are there other countries in Europe that have experimented with electronic voting
A: Norway tested i-voting in parliamentary elections in 2011 and 2013, but decided to discontinue online voting due to political disagreement and voters' concerns.

And France previously allowed citizens living abroad to cast their vote online in legislative elections, but has disallowed this for the upcoming June legislative elections amid cyber-security concerns..

title: Fact Check: Female soccer players in the U.S are earning less money than male players.
text:
Claim: Female soccer players in the U.S are earning less money than male players.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: Q&A 1 explains that yes overall women soccer players are paid less as they bring lesser revenue. which is in agreement with the claims point.

Evidence:

Q: How much does the U.S Female soccer players earn compared to USMNT?
A: In March, every member of the U.S. women's team filed a lawsuit against the soccer federation for gender discrimination. It stipulates that currently, if each team played and won 20 exhibition games in a year, “female WNT players would earn a maximum of $99,000 or $4,950 per game, while similarly situated male MNT players would earn an average of $263,320 or $13,166 per game." So the team is seeking equal treatment and pay, because as it stands, the women reportedly 38% of what their male counterparts make. As far as individual players' incomes, they can vary markedly based on sponsorships and star power. Goalie Ashlyn Harris told The New York Times that she expects to make “between $300,000 and $400,000” this year, and another player estimated $167,500. Alex Morgan is estimated to earn $1 million annually. But for players without endorsement deals and less celebrity status, the numbers can be a lot lower.Prior to the U.S. team's most recent landslide victory, Democratic presidential candidates Kirsten Gillibrand, Kamala Harris, and Elizabeth Warren have long taken up the cause of equal pay in sports. The Paycheck Fairness Act, passed by House Democrats, would protect against gender discrimination, though it is currently stalled in the Senate. Notably, when asked by a reporter earlier this week if the women's team should be paid the same as the men, President Trump declined to respond.. 

Q: How much is Women's World Cup 2019 Prize Money ?
A: The 2019 World Cup championship team will win $4 million, and the total prize money awarded to all teams during this summer's World Cup is roughly $30 million. Both figures are double what the women's World Cup paid out to teams during the 2015 tournament in Canada. But let's compare those figures with the men's World Cup: In 2018, World Cup champion France was awarded $38 million by FIFA for winning the tournament, which is more than what all of the 2019 women's World Cup teams get combined. The prize money overall for the men's 2018 World Cup in Russia came to a total of $400 million, or over 13 times more than the FIFA prize money for the women this summer. What's more, members of the USA women's team earned bonuses of $90,000 for reaching the quarterfinals in the 2019 World Cup. If the U.S. men's team had reached the same point in last year's World Cup, they would have gotten bonuses of $550,000. This is the case even though the U.S. women's team outearns the men's team in revenues. The main argument for why the men's World Cup prize money totals are so much bigger than the women's counterpart is that men's soccer has far more interest among fans — and far higher revenues overall around the globe. The women's World Cup 2015 in Canada reportedly brought in $73 million in revenues, including some $17 million in TV ads just in the U.S. Those are actually tiny numbers compared to the $6 billion in revenues FIFA raked in during the 2018 men's World Cup in Russia.. 

Q: How Much Money U.S. Women's National Team Players Make ?
A: The U.S. women's national team fought for a raise, and got one in 2017, when players began receiving an undisclosed pay increase. Before then, members of the U.S. national team were paid "a maximum of $4,950 per 'friendly,' or non-tournament, game that they won, while men’s national-team players earned an average of $13,166 for the same thing," according to The Atlantic. Yet even after the pay raise, America's female national team still makes significantly less than their male equivalents. This is the case even though the women have won three World Cups and four Olympic gold medals over the past two decades, compared to zero and zero for the U.S. men's team. Earlier this year, the U.S. women's team filed a lawsuit against U.S. Soccer, seeking better pay for women, who reportedly earn 38% of what their male counterparts make. Among other arguments U.S. Soccer attorneys have made to explain the gender pay differences are that the men's and women's national teams "have separate collective bargaining agreements; and have separate budgets that take into account the different revenue that the teams generate." While U.S. Soccer fights the women's national team lawsuit, sponsors have stepped up in the battle over equal pay. In early April, USWNT sponsor LUNA Bar made a donation that will give each member of the women's team $31,250 — which is the difference between the World Cup bonuses for America's men's and women's teams. Meanwhile, U.S. Soccer sponsor Visa says that under the terms of a new five-year deal more than 50% of its funding will go to the women's team, rather than a 50-50 split between men and women like in the past. And soccer branding titan Adidas says that it will pay equal bonuses to all of its sponsored players, male and female alike, for winning the World Cup. So how much money could U.S. women's national team players make if they win the World Cup 2019? It's difficult.

title: Fact Check: The crime bill was opposed by Republicans.
text:
Claim: The crime bill was opposed by Republicans.

Verdict: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

Justification: All but eight Republicans rejected the bill

Evidence:

Q: what is the crime bill?
A: The 1994 crime bill, which Biden, as chairman of the Senate Judiciary Committee, largely wrote and shepherded through the legislative process. The Violent Crime Control and Law Enforcement Act of 1994 received bipartisan support at the time but has been criticized for some of its provisions, such as mandatory minimum sentencing, and its impact on mass incarceration. (When we looked at claims in 2016 from both sides on the law’s role in mass incarceration, we found the trend of increasing imprisonment began well before 1994, but experts told us the 1994 law exacerbated the issue.). 

Q: Did the republicans vote against the crime bill?
A: McConnell, now the Senate majority leader, did vote against the final version of the bill in August 1994, as did all but eight Republican senators. However, months earlier, in November 1993, the original bill had garnered near universal support in the Senate, with McConnell on the “yes” ledger.. 

Q: Why did they switch their vote?
A: they objected to additional spending in the final bill, calling it “pork.” McConnell told CNN on Aug. 15, 1994, 10 days before the final Senate vote: “The Kentucky Fraternal Order of Police this weekend came out against this crime bill. … [B]ecause they thought it was porked up, that it was going to be a bill basically about social workers and not police officers.”.

A: To name a few, it included bans on assault weapons, increased funding to ensure the Brady bill still runs properly and grant program to support police and prosecutor efforts and
victims services in cases involving sexual violence or domestic
abuse, and for other programs which strengthen enforcement and
provide services to victims in such cases.

title: Fact Check: The UK is the best country for education in 2019.
text:
Claim: The UK is the best country for education in 2019.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Ranked 3rd based on Answer provided.

Evidence:

Q: Which country had the best educational system in 2019
A: According to the Ranking of National Higher
Education Systems 2019 article, the US had the best educational system in 2019 followed by Switzerland then the UK.

title: Fact Check: Joe Biden wrote into the 1994 Crime Bill that anyone arrested for for drug relat...
text:
Claim: Joe Biden wrote into the 1994 Crime Bill that anyone arrested for for drug related crimes, who are suffering from drug addictions, should be diverted into drug courts.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: Correct

Evidence:

Q: Did the 1994 Crime Bill provide funding to divert drug users to a different court for sentencing?
A: Yes. The 1994 law provided $1 billion for drug courts over six years

Q: Was Biden involved in making  the 1994 crime bill?
A: Yes. Biden, as chairman of the Senate Judiciary Committee, wrote and brought through  The Violent Crime Control and Law Enforcement Act of 1994

Q: Did the 1994 law say addicts should go to a separate court and not to prison system?
A: a March 2018 CRS report explains. “Many drug courts offer a treatment and social service alternative for those who otherwise may have faced traditional criminal sanctions for their offenses. In some drug courts, individuals that have been arrested are diverted from local courts into special judge-involved programs; these courts are often viewed as ‘second chance’ courts. Other drug court programs offer reentry assistance after an offender has served his or her sentence.”.

title: Fact Check: Republicans didn’t like the fact that democrats removed mandatory minimums for f...
text:
Claim: Republicans didn’t like the fact that democrats removed mandatory minimums for first-time offenders.

Verdict: Not Enough Evidence

Justification: None of the evidence found comes to a conclusion on what the Republicans think about the Democrats removing the policy of mandatory minimums, it's safe to assume the Republicans did not agree with its removal by the Democracts but the QA didnt manage to discover any evidence backing that assumption.

Evidence:

Q: What legislation is being discussed?
A: The final legislation included a so-called “safety valve” provision that limited the use of mandatory minimum federal sentences for some drug offenses. A defendant could qualify to be exempt from those mandatory sentences if he or she met certain criteria, including: that the defendant didn’t use violence or possess a gun or dangerous weapon during the act, no one was killed or seriously injured, and the defendant wasn’t “an organizer, leader, manager, or supervisor of others in the offense.”. 

Q: What is the three strikes rule?
A: Mandatory life imprisonment without possibility of parole for Federal
offenders with three or more convictions for serious violent felonies or
drug trafficking crimes.. 

Q: What this supported by Biden?
A: Biden did not back the three strikes provision, but he did back a Republican amendment that was added to the Senate legislation. Biden is on record at the time as saying he supported a three-strikes provision for “serious [violent] felonies against a person,” but he was against including nonviolent offenses and expressed concern that minor crimes could get swept up in the measure..

title: Fact Check: Biden didn’t support more money to build state prisons.
text:
Claim: Biden didn’t support more money to build state prisons.

Verdict: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

Justification: QA shows Biden supported $6 billion but not $10 billion of funding to build state prisons. Claim does not define what ‘more’ is, but clear that Biden supported at least some funding of state prison construction.
NB QA source links to a fact checking article.

Evidence:

Q: Was money assigned for state prison construction?
A: Biden did support $6 billion in funding for state prison construction, but not the $10 billion that was part of the final bill. His campaign says the $4 billion difference is what he means when he says he “didn’t support more money to build state prisons.”.

title: Fact Check: In 2017, The US had more arrests for marijuana possession  than for all other vi...
text:
Claim: In 2017, The US had more arrests for marijuana possession  than for all other violent crimes combined.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: The source shows that there were less arrests for violent crimes than for marijuana possession.

Evidence:

Q: what is the prison rate for marijuana possession in america?
A: As for Booker’s claim, according to the FBI’s Uniform Crime Reporting (UCR) database, law enforcement nationwide made an estimated 518,617 arrests for violent crimes in 2017. That includes murder and nonnegligent manslaughter, rape, robbery and aggravated assault.

That figure is lower than the 599,282 arrests made for possession of marijuana..

title: Fact Check: Moscow, Russia, metro allows free rides to commuters for 30 squats
text:
Claim: Moscow, Russia, metro allows free rides to commuters for 30 squats

Verdict: Supported

Justification: To promote the winter Olympics the Russian Olympics committee with the Moscow officials allowed passengers to board the train when they do squats 

Evidence:

Q: Does Moscow Russia have a scheme where you get free metro ticket if you do exercise to earn it?
A: In an effort to promote both the then upcoming Winter Olympic Games in Sochi and physical fitness, Moscow city officials and the Russian Olympic Committee are allowing subway riders to pay 30 squats instead of 30 rubles (about 92 cents) for a trip on thetrain..

title: Fact Check: Coconut oil is an antibiotic and can prevent dengue fever.
text:
Claim: Coconut oil is an antibiotic and can prevent dengue fever.

Verdict: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

Justification: Coconut oil may act as a repellant and stop insects that carry dengue fever from biting, but it does not prevent dengue fever if the insect still bites. 

Evidence:

Q: It coconut oil an antibiotic?
A: Coconut oil is a natural antibiotic. 

Q: How does the claim say to use coconut oil to prevent dengue fever?
A: claim says to rub coconut oil below the knees to stop mosquito bites.. 

Q: Does putting oil on the skin prevent mosquito bites?
A: Compounds derived from coconut oil are better than DEET at repelling blood-sucking insects, according to a new U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) study..

title: Fact Check: Whatsapp has been sold to Mukesh Ambani.
text:
Claim: Whatsapp has been sold to Mukesh Ambani.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: WhatsApp has been sold to Facebook. Though Mukesh Ambani has ties with WhatsApp, he does not own it.

Evidence:

Q: Who owns WhatsApp?
A: WhatsApp was founded by Jan Koum and Brian Acton who had previously spent 20 years combined at Yahoo. WhatsApp joined Facebook in 2014, but continues to operate as a separate app.. 

Q: Who is Mukesh Ambani?
A: He is an indian billionaire and businessman. 

Q: What is his relationship to Whatsapp?
A: It seems that he has some business ties with Whatsapp, but he does not own the company.

title: Fact Check: The EU has decided to increase the size of fisherman’s meshes.
text:
Claim: The EU has decided to increase the size of fisherman’s meshes.

Verdict: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

Justification: The claim makes refernce to the EU deciding to chance the size of fishing net holes to increase their size, which as Q&A 1 states will result in less fish being caught.
Q&A 5 only shows that the EU wanted a minimum net size which is not an increase as claimed but could be for some fishermen depending.

Evidence:

Q: What is the relationship between mesh size and the fish that can be captured?
A: The size selectivity of most fishing gears can be changed by making changes to the mesh size. Bigger mesh gives the opportunity for more small fish to escape. This does depend on the smaller fish actually coming into close contact with the larger meshes.. 

Q: What was the EU commission change to mesh sizes at the time of the claim?
A: Vessels shall be prohibited from using any beam trawl with a mesh size between 32 and 99 mm north of a line joined by the following points by a point on the East Coast of the United Kingdom at latitude 55° N, then east to latitude 55°, longitude 5° E, then north to latitude 56° N and east to a point on the west coast of Denmark at latitude 56° N. It is prohibited to use any beam trawl of mesh size range 32 to 119 mm within ICES Division.. 

Q: Was the EU commissions change to mesh sizes around the time of the claim responsible for substantial financial losses in the fishing industry?
A: Aggressive fishing in the late 1950s saw an increase in landings, which started the collapse in catch numbers between 1965 and 1982 before mesh size regulations as part of EU Common Fisheries Policy (Cfp )..

title: Fact Check: EU change to mesh sizes has reduced fishermen’s income by 40%.
text:
Claim: EU change to mesh sizes has reduced fishermen’s income by 40%.

Verdict: Not Enough Evidence

Justification: The claim even states there is no proof of the fishermen loosing 40% of their income

Evidence:

Q: What changes did the EU make to fishermen's mesh net sizes?
A: '...mesh sizes are now minimum sizes and do not prevent fishermen from using larger mesh sizes if they want to.'. 

Q: Has this change in mesh size reduced fishermen's income by 40%?
A: "Some claimed it could lose up to 40% of their income from just this one ruling" but this comes from an unknown source cited in an interview in a Cornish news site.. 

Q: Did the EU's decision to increase the size of fisherman’s meshes will reduce the fisherman's income to 40% ?
A: The larger the mesh the easier it is for small fish to escape nets undamaged. 
EU regulation has changed and there is now a minimum mesh size in certain areas. That came in place on 1 July 2019.
The European Parliament and Council had two months to object to the delegated act on fishing regulations, but this didn’t happen so it is now law. It’s also now in UK law. The fishermen catching squid too and some claimed it could lose up to 40% of their income from just this one ruling but this hasnt been proved..

title: Fact Check: Fox News Channel reports that Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg has suffered massive s...
text:
Claim: Fox News Channel reports that Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg has suffered massive stroke.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg did not suffered a massive stroke. The news was posted by an unverified Fox News Channel , which has since been taken down.

A: No answer could be found.. 

Q: What page posted the original claim?
A: Fox News Channel.. 

Q: Is that a verified Facebook page?
A: No. No verification tick.

title: Fact Check: Varun Pulani is the director of WhatsApp.
text:
Claim: Varun Pulani is the director of WhatsApp.

Verdict: Refuted

A: WhatsApp founder Jan Koum and his business partner Brian Acton..

A: Mr Koum, 37, and Mr Acton, 42, have sold WhatsApp to Facebook for $19bn (£11.4bn).. 

Q: Who is the director of Whatsapp?
A: Carl Woog - Director of Communications -
Carl is currently the Director of Communications for WhatsApp, the world's largest private messaging service..

title: Fact Check: A proposed $4.6 billion US emergency aid bill wasn’t humanitarian.
text:
Claim: A proposed $4.6 billion US emergency aid bill wasn’t humanitarian.

Q: What was the $4.6 billion US emergency aid bill intended for?
A: The $4.6 billion bipartisan humanitarian aid bill was intended to provide shelter and care for unaccompanied children, and providing care in licensed shelters and expanding the supplies of shelters.. 

Q: Is some of the bill providing non-humanitarian funding?
A: Yes. It included money for the military and department of justice too.

Q: Is the bill humanitarian?
A: Yes. As the largest portion of the funding is for Health and Human services, which is humanitarian.

text:

title: Fact Check: President Trump Said "I Will Pay For July 4 Parade Out Of My Own Pocket"
text:
Claim: President Trump Said "I Will Pay For July 4 Parade Out Of My Own Pocket"

Verdict: Refuted

Evidence:

Q: Where did the claim originate from
A: It originated from the website called Taters.com. 

Q: What kind of website is Tater.com
A: They refer to themselves on their About Us page as "Tatersgonnatate.com is a subsidiary of the “America’s Last Line of Defense” network of parody, satire, and tomfoolery, or as Snopes called it before they lost their war on satire: Junk News".

Claim: President Trump said “I will pay for July 4 Parade out of my own pocket.”

A: No answer could be found..

title: Fact Check: hen asked if the United States should have a military parade to show off its mig...
text:
Claim: hen asked if the United States should have a military parade to show off its might, President Dwight Eisenhower said ‘Absolutely not. We are the pre-eminent power on Earth. For us to try and imitate what the Soviets are doing in Red Square would make us look weak.’"

Verdict: Not Enough Evidence

Justification: there isn't evidence that Eisenhower said this. 

Evidence:

Q: Where did this quote originate?
A: From an NPR  interview with historian Michael Beschloss in 2018.. 

Q: What did Michael Beschloss say in his interview with NPR on 07/02/2018?
A: Beschloss points to the 1950s, when Dwight D. Eisenhower was president and Soviet leader Nikita Khrushchev presided over large military parades showing off the latest in Soviet military might. Beschloss says some in the White House approached Eisenhower, himself a decorated military general, suggesting the U.S. do the same, to show off American might.

"Eisenhower said absolutely not, we are the pre-eminent power on Earth," Beschloss says, recalling Eisenhower's response. "For us to try to imitate what the Soviets are doing in Red Square would make us look weak.". 

Q: Is there evidence that Eisenhower said, "For us to try to imitate what the Soviets are doing in Red Square would make us look weak"?
A: No answer could be found..

title: Fact Check: One in four South African employees have been diagnosed with depression.
text:
Claim: One in four South African employees have been diagnosed with depression.

Verdict: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

Justification: As much there's a study that claims this to be true, the study has several limitations 

Evidence:

Q: How common is depression in South Africa?
A: Depression is one of the most common mental disorders in South Africa, with an estimated 9·8% lifetime prevalence for major depressive disorder in adults.. 

Q: How common is depression in South African Employees?
A: A single study in 2016, showed one in four workers reported depression but the study in question was only for employees who worked in advertising or market research.. 

Q: Is this study enough to generalise to workforces in South Africa as a whole?
A: No. The study has limitations as it is self reported, and does not allow the diagnosis of depression to be verified, it is also only a small sample from a specific workforce.

title: Fact Check: About half of Customs and Border Patrol agents were members of a secret Facebook...
text:

Verdict: Not Enough Evidence

Evidence:

Q: What is the name of the Facebook group
A: The Facebook group is called “I’m 10-15”. 

Q: How many members of the CBP are current members of "I'm 10 - 15"
A: No answer could be found..

title: Fact Check: The U.S. is using SWIFT as a political weapon in its foreign policy.
text:
Claim: The U.S. is using SWIFT as a political weapon in its foreign policy.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Controlled by Belgium not USA.

Evidence:

Q: What is RT News?
A: It was founded in 2005 as Russia Today and rebranded as RT in 2009. RT News is Russia’s state-funded international broadcaster.. 

Q: Is RT News propaganda?
A: Lata Nott, the Newseum Institute's executive director says "The edge between journalism and propaganda is very thin, especially, if we are talking about the media which is founded by the government... Not all materials of RT are propaganda, but it is very clear that they have only one angle and they have never criticised their own government.". 

Q: What is SWIFT?
A: Society for Worldwide Interbank Financial Telecommunication (SWIFT) is a cooperative utility whose objective is to develop standardized messaging and processing of transaction services for financial institutions globally, making global cross-border transfers easier.

Swift is the network backbone of the international finance industry. It serves more than 200 countries and territories. Swift payments are a type of international transfer sent via the Swift network. Swift does not facilitate the transfer of funds. Instead, it sends payment orders via its secure and reliable network, which must be then settled by the correspondent accounts that institutions have with each other. When sending or receiving international payments, a Swift code is used to identify a specific bank..

title: Fact Check: Detainees in US border patrol facilities told by guards to drink water from toil...
text:
Claim: Detainees in US border patrol facilities told by guards to drink water from toilets.

Verdict: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

Justification: it is unclear what was being referred to in this case, the answers say "the women were told they could drink out the bowl" but It’s unclear whether the reference to toilets was to a sink/toilet combination unit and the tap water from the sink part.

Evidence:

Q: Were detainees in border patrol facilities told by guards to drink water from toilets?
A: Ocasio-Cortez responded to that tweet, saying it was indeed a toilet like that but the sink portion wasn’t working.

“This was in fact the type of toilet we saw in the cell. Except there was just one, and the sink portion was not functioning – @AyannaPressley smartly tried to open the faucet, and nothing came out,” Ocasio-Cortez said, referring to Rep. Ayanna Pressley of Massachusetts. “So the women were told they could drink out of the bowl.”. 

Q: Are Border Patrol agents making detainees in US border patrol facilities to drink out of toilets?
A: It’s unclear whether the reference to toilets was to a sink/toilet combination unit and the tap water from the sink part..

title: Fact Check: About half of US Customs and Border Patrol agents were members of a secret Faceb...
text:
Claim: About half of US Customs and Border Patrol agents were members of a secret Facebook group page that included offensive posts.

Verdict: Not Enough Evidence

Evidence:

Q: Was a secret facebook group for current and former Border Patrol agents page found ?
A: Yes. Page was uncovered.

Q: Are all members of the secret group Current and former border partrol workers?
A: No answer could be found..

title: Fact Check: Guards had instructed the U.S. Customs and Border Protection detainees to drink ...
text:
Claim: Guards had instructed the U.S. Customs and Border Protection detainees to drink water from toilets.

Q: Are there reports of guards telling people at the Border facilities to drink water from toilets
A: Three members of Congress who visited Border Patrol facilities on Monday said immigrant women were being detained without running water and told by agents to drink from the toilets..

title: Fact Check: We spent just over £1 trillion bailing out the banks after the financial crisis.

Claim: We spent just over £1 trillion bailing out the banks after the financial crisis.

Q: From 2007 to 2009 how much did the government spend bailing out banks?
A: £137 billion..

title: Fact Check: North Korea blew up the office used for South Korea talks.
text:
Claim: North Korea blew up the office used for South Korea talks.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: The building used was indeed destroyed.

Evidence:

Q: Which office did North Korean blow up?
A: North Korea blew up an inter-Korean liaison office building. 

Q: What is the inter-Korean liaison office used for?
A: The Republic of Korea (ROK) and the Democratic People's Republic of Korea (DPRK) launched their joint liaison office on Friday, securing a platform for round-the-clock communication that is expected to help foster cross-border exchange and ease tensions..

title: Fact Check: RSS workers thrash a Dalit woman
text:
Claim: RSS workers thrash a Dalit woman

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The video was not related to RSS workers

Evidence:

Q: Where was the video of a girl being beaten with sticks in India by men originally from?
A: A police officer said the family members of the woman, a resident of Gatbori village, about 90 km from Dhar, were angry over her affair with the man with whom she had eloped recently, but later returned home. It was therefore nothing to do with RSS workers..

title: Fact Check: Section 1325 of the U.S immigration law was "put into place in 1929, by a segreg...
text:
Claim: Section 1325 of the U.S immigration law was "put into place in 1929, by a segregationist".

Verdict: Supported

Justification: True, well written

Evidence:

Q: What is section 1325?
A: Any alien who (1) enters or attempts to enter the United States at any time or place other than as designated by immigration officers, or (2) eludes examination or inspection by immigration officers, or (3) attempts to enter or obtains entry to the United States by a willfully false or misleading representation or the willful concealment of a material fact, shall, for the first commission of any such offense, be fined under title 18 or imprisoned not more than 6 months, or both, and, for a subsequent commission of any such offense, be fined under title 18, or imprisoned not more than 2 years, or both.. 

Q: Who put this into place?
A: According to University of California Los Angeles historian Kelly Lytle Hernandez, white supremacist South Carolina Sen. Coleman Livingston Blease was its architect.. 

Q: Was Blease a  segregationist?
A: Yes. In a speech delivered in 1911 after he was sworn in as governor, Blease described his vision for South Carolina, which included "liberal appropriations for Confederate veterans" and having "white and colored convicts worked in different camps." He also said he opposed taxing white people to cover the cost of education for black people.

Blease was also a vocal supporter of lynching, and was quoted as saying, "to hell with the Constitution," to the extent that it required people to be tried for crimes before a jury.

title: Fact Check: President Obama 'begged' to meet with Chairman Kim Jong Un, but Chairman Kim Jon...
text:
Claim: President Obama 'begged' to meet with Chairman Kim Jong Un, but Chairman Kim Jong Un refused.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: QAs show three people who worked for President Obama confirmed that Obama did not beg for a meeting with Kim Jong Un.

Evidence:

Q: Did President Obama sought out a meet with Chairman Kim Jong Un?
A: No. Ben Rhodes, former deputy national security adviser to Obama said on Twitter: 

"Trump is lying. I was there for all 8 years. Obama never sought a meeting with Kim Jong Un. Foreign policy isn’t reality television it’s reality".

Q: Was the Obama administration open to negotiations with North Korea?
A: Yes. Kelsey Davenport, director for nonproliferation policy at the Arms Control Association stated:

"The Obama administration was open to negotiations with North Korea, but they set onerous preconditions for talks. Requiring that North Korea take significant steps toward denuclearization prior to diplomatic engagement is a far cry from ‘begging’ for a meeting."

Q: What did officials who served under President Obama say about the claim
A: Susan Rice said that it was not correct in no uncertain terms.

title: Fact Check: BJP Mahila Morcha Leader made offensive remarks asking Hindu brothers to rape Mu...
text:
Claim: BJP Mahila Morcha Leader made offensive remarks asking Hindu brothers to rape Muslim mothers and sisters

Verdict: Supported

Justification: Supported by answers and sources given in QA pairs.

Evidence:

Q: Was a hate comment made by BJP Mahila Morcha concerning Hindus and Muslims
A: Yes. The woman in the claim did make hate comments and has been suspended by the party

Q: Did a local BJP Mahila Morcha Leader make offensive remarks regarding Muslims?
A: Yes. BJP Mahila Morcha said it will not tolerate any hateful comments whatsoever from any karyakarta. The lady in question has been expelled

Q: Who was the lady in question who made hateful comments and was removed?
A: Sunitha Singh Gowda.

title: Fact Check: Migrant children housed at U.S. Customs and Border Protection detention faciliti...
text:
Claim: Migrant children housed at U.S. Customs and Border Protection detention facilities at the border are receiving access to key supplies, including toothbrushes, appropriate meals, blankets, showers as soon as they can be provided and medical screening.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The inspection results and a date that this happened provides concise evidence that even if these services were provided in some places, it was certainly not across the board. 

Evidence:

Q: Has the Office of Inspector General inspected and reported on the conditions at Border Patrol Facilites?
A: Yes. During the week of
June 10, 2019, they travelled to the Rio Grande Valley in Texas, inspected facilities and issued a report.

Q: According to the 2019 IG report on Border Patrol facilities, were children receiving appropriate meals?
A: No. Two facilities had not provided children access to hot meals — as is required by the TEDS standards — until the week we arrived. Instead, the children were fed sandwiches and snacks for their meals.

Q: According to the 2019 IG report on Border Patrol facilities, did children have access to showers?
A: No. Children at three of the five Border Patrol facilities we visited had no access to showers.

title: Fact Check: Kenya's County governments have allocated on average 6.7 % of their total budget...
text:
Claim: Kenya's County governments have allocated on average 6.7 % of their total budgets to the agriculture sector

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The average of 5.6 and 6.3 is 5.95%, not 6.7%.

Evidence:

Q: What percentage of their total budget did Kenya’s county governments allocate to agriculture in the 2017/18 financial year?
A: 5.6%. 

Q: What percentage of their total budget did Kenya’s county governments allocate to agriculture in the first six months of the 2018/19 financial year?
A: 6.3%.

title: Fact Check: Since 2013, County Governments in Kenya have cumulatively received KSh1.57 trill...
text:
Claim: Since 2013, County Governments in Kenya have cumulatively received KSh1.57 trillion worth of the equitable share of the allocation of the consolidated fund revenue budget.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: There is to much of a difference between the confirmed 1.3 and the claimed 1.57 for it just to be a rounding up error.

Evidence:

Q: How much money have county Governments in Kenya cumulatively received  from the consolidated fund revenue budget?
A: National-Treasury-on-County-Fiscal-Transfers shows KSh1.3 trillion transferred to counties in Kenya..

title: Fact Check: Children in U.S. Customs and Border Protection custody are receiving appropriate...
text:
Claim: Children in U.S. Customs and Border Protection custody are receiving appropriate meals and showers.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Standards are not meeting the required TEDS standards. 

Evidence:

Q: What meals are children in U.S. Customs and Border Protection custody receiving?
A: While all facilities had
infant formula, diapers, baby wipes, and juice and snacks for children, we
observed that two facilities had not provided children access to hot meals
— as is required by the TEDS standards — until the week we arrived.
Instead, the children were fed sandwiches and snacks for their meals.. 

Q: Do children in U.S. Customs and Border Protection custody have access to showers?
A: No. For example, children at three of
the five Border Patrol facilities we visited had no access to showers,
despite the TEDS standards requiring that “reasonable efforts” be made to
provide showers to children approaching 48 hours in detention. At these
facilities, children had limited access to a change of clothes; Border Patrol
had few spare clothes and no laundry facilities.

title: Fact Check: In 2013 to 2019 the total shareable revenue in Kenya totalled 7.8 trillion shill...
text:
Claim: In 2013 to 2019 the total shareable revenue in Kenya totalled 7.8 trillion shillings, of which 20% or KSh1.57 trillion was transferred to the counties.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: The answers show that the claim is correct. Therefore the claim is supported.

Evidence:

Q: What was the total shareable revenue in Kenya in 2013?
A: KSh920.4 billion. 

Q: What was the total shareable revenue in Kenya in 2014?
A: KSh1,026. 3 billion. 

Q: What was the total shareable revenue in Kenya in 2015?
A: KSh1,242.7 billion.

title: Fact Check: KSh1.57 trillion is equivalent to 20% of the total shareable revenue of 7.8 tril...
text:
Claim: KSh1.57 trillion is equivalent to 20% of the total shareable revenue of 7.8 trillion shillings.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: The numbers appear to add up 

Evidence:

Q: What was the total shareable revenue from 2013 to 2019 in the division of revenue acts?
A: -2013 – KSh920.4 billion
-2014 – KSh1,026. 3 billion
-2015 – KSh1,242.7 billion
-2016 – KSh1,380.2 billion
-2017 – KSh1,560.3 billion
-2018 – KSh1,688.5 billion. 

Q: How much does 2013 to 2018 total shareable revenue add up to?
A: KSh7, 818 billion, or KSh7.8 trillion. 

Q: What is the percentage equivalent for the total shareable revenue between 2012-2019?
A: These work out as 21% and 19% of the KSh7.8 trillion in total shareable revenue.

title: Fact Check: as of 2019, 47 Kenyan counties has met the two-thirds threshold on the appointme...
text:
Claim: as of 2019, 47 Kenyan counties has met the two-thirds threshold on the appointment of the county executive committee members, with three counties of Kilifi, Nyeri and Kericho attaining a 50-50 representation.

Verdict: Supported

Justification:  In Kilifi, Nyeri and Kericho counties there’s gender parity in the composition of the county cabinets.


Evidence:

Q: What is the two-thirds threshold in Kenya?
A: Kenya’s constitution promotes gender equality by setting out that  “not more than two-thirds of the members of elective or appointive bodies shall be of the same gender”.. 

Q: How many counties have met this gender principle?
A: Each of the 47 counties have met this principle. 

Q: Have Kilifi, Neyeri and Kericho met the 50/50 ratio?
A: Yes. in Kilifi, Nyeri and Kericho counties there’s gender parity in the composition of the county cabinets.

title: Fact Check: In Kenya the County Governments’ allocation of 6.7% of their total budgets to th...
text:
Claim: In Kenya the County Governments’ allocation of 6.7% of their total budgets to the agriculture sector is just 3% less than the 10% recommended allocation for agriculture as per the Comprehensive Africa Agriculture Development Program (CAADP) Malabo declaration.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Both figures are incorrect. Even though one is only out by a few percentage points, the other one is hugely different. So it cant be said to be correct. 

Evidence:

Q: is the County Governments’ allocation of 6.7% of their total budgets to the agriculture sector just 3% less than the 10% recommended allocation for agriculture as per the Comprehensive Africa Agriculture Development Program ?
A: In 2018/19, agriculture’s share rose to KSh29.1 billion (6.3%) out of a total of KSh462.1 billion. A 10% allocation would have been KSh46.2 billion.

This works out to a difference of just over three percentage points. 

But the difference between the 2018/19 allocation of KSh29.1 billion and the Malabo aspiration of at least 10% of the total county budget (KSh46.2 billion) works out to a gap of 37%, not 3%..

title: Fact Check: KSh1.57 trillion is equivalent to 20% of Kenya's total shareable revenue of KSh7...
text:

Evidence:

Q: What is the date for this claim?
A: 2019. 

Q: What is Kenya's total shareable revenue between 2013 and the claim date 2019?
A: The total shareable revenue from 2013 to 2019 is given in the division of revenue acts: 
2013 – KSh920.4 billion
2014 – KSh1,026.3 billion
2015 – KSh1,242.7 billion
2016 – KSh1,380.2 billion
2017 – KSh1,560.3 billion
2018 – KSh1,688.5 billion

These add up to KSh7,818 trillion. 

Q: What is 20% of 7.818 trillion?
A: 1.56 trillion.

title: Fact Check: In 2018/2019 in Kenya, all county governments allocated at least 20% of their bu...
text:
Claim: In 2018/2019 in Kenya, all county governments allocated at least 20% of their budgets to health.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: There were at least five  counties that allocated less than 20%  to health. The Counties are Kakamega (17.1%), Laikipia (13.4%), Taita Taveta (7.7%), Tana River (17.8%) and Turkana (11.6%).

Evidence:

Q: what state returned from kenya in 219?
A: In his 2019 State of Devolution Address, council of governors chair Wycliffe Oparanya made three claims on revenue allocation to counties, two claims each on healthcare and agriculture, and a claim on gender equality in county governments.
Two of the claims on revenue were correct, as were claims about gender equality and healthcare facilities.
One claim about agriculture was mostly correct, and the other incorrect. A third claim on revenue was also mostly correct, but a claim on healthcare budgets was incorrect.. 

Q: what state returned from kenya in 2019?
A: In his 2019 State of Devolution Address, council of governors chair Wycliffe Oparanya made three claims on revenue allocation to counties, two claims each on healthcare and agriculture, and a claim on gender equality in county governments.
Two of the claims on revenue were correct, as were claims about gender equality and healthcare facilities.
One claim about agriculture was mostly correct, and the other incorrect. A third claim on revenue was also mostly correct, but a claim on healthcare budgets was incorrect.. 

Q: Did all Counties in Kenya allocate at least 20% of their budget to health care?
A: In 2017/18 at least five counties allocated less than 20%  to health. These were Kakamega (17.1%), Laikipia (13.4%), Taita Taveta (7.7%), Tana River (17.8%) and Turkana (11.6%).

And in 2018/19, nine counties allocated less than 20% of their budgets to health. These were Baringo (2%), Kakamega (13%), Laikipia (13%), Mandera (18%), Nyandarua (11%), Taita Taveta (7%), Tana River (19%), Turkana (11%) and Wajir (17%).

Studies predict that with sufficiently high HPV vaccine coverage and regular cervical cancer screening, the disease can eventually be eliminated..
