title: Fact Check: Companies like Halliburton and Amazon pay nothing in US taxes
text:
Claim: Companies like Halliburton and Amazon pay nothing in US taxes

Verdict: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

Justification: Evidence has found that both Amazon and Halliburton pay US taxes. However, there is a contradiction where the evidence has found that it's Amazon's second straight year owing no tax: In 2017, Amazon filed for a $137 million refund on $5.6 billion in profit. Hence, conflicting evidence.

Evidence:

Q: Does Amazon pay taxes
A: Amazon itself paid $957 million in income taxes worldwide in 2017, according to a regulatory filing.. 

Q: Does Halliburton pay tax
A: Halliburton annual/quarterly income after taxes history and growth rate from 2010 to 2022. Income after taxes can be defined as earnings or losses after income tax expense but before minority interest, extraordinary items, discontinued operations, preferred dividends and accounting changes have been accounted for.
Halliburton income after taxes for the quarter ending September 30, 2022 was $0.549B, a 128.75% increase year-over-year.
Halliburton income after taxes for the twelve months ending September 30, 2022 was $1.757B, a 324.4% increase year-over-year.
Halliburton annual income after taxes for 2021 was $1.468B, a 149.9% decline from 2020.
Halliburton annual income after taxes for 2020 was $-2.942B, a 160.58% increase from 2019.
Halliburton annual income after taxes for 2019 was $-1.129B, a 168.14% decline from 2018..

title: Fact Check: President Trump “immediately discontinued” an aid program to Central America whi...
text:
Claim: President Trump “immediately discontinued” an aid program to Central America which is the cause of surging immigration across the U.S.-Mexico border.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Answer support a drop in funding but not an immediate discontinuation which makes the further points of the claim invalid however there was an increase in attempted crossings.

Evidence:

Q: What aid program is being talked about here?
A: Biden was referring to the “U.S. Strategy for Engagement in Central America,” which began under Obama in fiscal year 2016 at a level of $750 million, according to a June 12 report by the Congressional Research Service, an arm of the Library of Congress. (See Table 5, page 13.). 

Q: How much had the program decreased before Trump was elected?
A: Appropriations for the program had already decreased to just under $685 million by fiscal year 2017, which began Oct. 1, 2016, before Trump was elected and nearly four months before he took office.. 

Q: How much further did it reduce during Trump's administration?
A: From there, appropriations fell further to an estimated $527.6 million in the current fiscal year, according to the CRS report. That’s a reduction of just under 23 percent.

Trump’s budget request for fiscal 2020, which begins Oct. 1, calls for a further cut to $445 million — which would represent a cumulative reduction in annual appropriation levels of 35 percent since the last fiscal year that began under Obama..

title: Fact Check: Many of America's 2.3 million prisoners are incarcerated for nonviolent drug cri...
text:
Claim: Many of America's 2.3 million prisoners are incarcerated for nonviolent drug crimes

Verdict: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

Justification: Evidence finds that there are 2,121,600 prisoners in U.S. prisons, not 2.3 million as the claim states. Evidence also finds that even though most Americans assume the figure is about 50%, somewhat fewer than 15% are incarcerated for drug offenses. Drug offenses are far more prevalent in the federal prison system, but that houses only about 10 percent of all prisoners; most incarcerated people are in state prison. Hence, the evidence is conflicting.

Evidence:

Q: What is the prison population of the USA?
A: 2 121 600. 

Q: How many of those are incarcerated for non-violent drug crime?
A: But the simple truth is that, at a minimum, 55 percent of those in state prison have been convicted of a violent crime — and more than half of these people, or nearly 30 percent of the total prison population, have been found guilty of murder, manslaughter, rape or sexual assault, according to the Bureau of Justice Statistics. Slightly less than 15 percent are incarcerated for drug crimes, even though most Americans believe the figure to be about 50 percent. (Drugs play a bigger role in the federal prison system, but that holds only about 10 percent of all prisoners; most incarcerated people are in state prison.).

title: Fact Check: The price of 2,500 drugs has gone up in double digits under Donald Trump's admin...
text:
Claim: The price of 2,500 drugs has gone up in double digits under Donald Trump's administration

Verdict: Supported

Justification: 2,500 drugs increased in price in 2018 when Trump is the president, according to the Centers for Medicare Services in the United States. 

Evidence:

Q: What is the Centers for Medicare Services in the United States?
A: The Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS) is the U.S. federal agency that works with state governments to manage the Medicare program, and administer Medicaid and the Children’s Health Insurance program. CMS offers many great resources for researchers who are looking for health data.. 

Q: How many drugs increased in price in 2018, according to the Centers for Medicare Services in the United States?
A: 2,500. 

Q: What is one of the 2,500 drugs from the Centers for Medicare Services, that has increased in price?
A: Januvia.

title: Fact Check: President Donald Trump has thrown 32 million people off their health care that t...
text:
Claim: President Donald Trump has thrown 32 million people off their health care that they have.

Verdict: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

Justification: Not all of the 32million will be taken off their health care

Evidence:

Q: Where did the figure 32 million come from?
A: In 2017 the Congressional Budget Office estimated the Obamacare Repeal Reconciliation Act of 2017, a bill that would fit that description,  would increase the number of uninsured by 32 million people over 10 years.. 

Q: Would all these people likely be thrown off their insurance?
A: No. not all of them would be thrown off their insurance. CBO said: “In the nongroup market, some people would choose not to have insurance partly because they choose to be covered by insurance under current law to avoid paying the penalty.”

Q: Did Donald trump plan a bill that would throw people of their health plans?
A: Yes. He planned on removing an Obama health care bill nicknamed Obamacare but known as the affordable care act.

title: Fact Check: The top 1 percent wealthiest control 90 percent of the wealth in the US
text:
Claim: The top 1 percent wealthiest control 90 percent of the wealth in the US

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The third Q&A shows that the control is less than the 90% in the claim so the claim is refuted.

Evidence:

Q: In 2017, the Washington Post published an article quoting a new paper by economist Edward N. Wolff. What are the statistics?
A: The wealthiest 1 percent of American households own 40 percent of the country's wealth, according to a new paper by economist Edward N. Wolff.. 

Q: Paper entitled
Measuring Income and Wealth at the Top, 
Using Administrative and Survey Data
prepared for the Brookings Panel on Economic Activity, March 10th and 11th, 2016 indicates what?
A: Most available estimates of US wealth and income concentration indicate that top shares are high and rising in recent decades, but there is some disagreement about specific levels
and trends.. 

Q: How much of America's wealth is controlled by the top 1% wealthiest Americans?
A: The wealthiest 1 percent of American households own 40 percent of the country's wealth, according to a new paper by economist Edward N. Wolff. That share is higher than it has been at any point since at least 1962, according to Wolff's data, which comes from the federal Survey of Consumer Finances..

title: Fact Check: Number one reason for why American families go broke is the cost of healthcare
text:
Claim: Number one reason for why American families go broke is the cost of healthcare

Verdict: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

Justification: Q7A 1 shows that contrary to what is claimed medical factors play a much smaller role in causing U.S. bankruptcies than has previously been claimed
Q&A 2 is also contrary to the claim showing that evidence on medical bankruptcy is built on the fallacy that when two things occur together there is necessarily a causal relationship between them. along with Q&A's 4 also not agreeing with the claim
However Q&A 5 shows that 60 percent of bankruptcies are linked to medical bills which conflicts with the other Q&A's so this is problematic for judging the claim.


Evidence:

Q: Is healthcare the number one reason for personal bankruptcy in America
A: Our findings suggest that medical factors play a much smaller role in causing U.S. bankruptcies than has previously been claimed. Overemphasizing 'medical bankruptcies' may distract from understanding the true nature of economic hardship arising from high-cost health problems,” wrote researchers of the 2018 study. 

Q: Can medical debt lead to personal bankruptcy
A: The fact that, according to a 2014 report from the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, about 20% of Americans have substantial medical debt yet in a given year less than 1% of Americans file for personal bankruptcy suggests that this assumption is problematic. Clearly, many people face medical debt but do not go bankrupt. Even after correcting for overly broad definitions of “medical” expenses,3 the existing, widely cited evidence on medical bankruptcy is built on the fallacy that when two things occur together there is necessarily a causal relationship between them.. 

Q: Are medical bills the main reason why people in the United States file for bankruptcy?
A: A study published in the New England Journal of Medicine in 2018 indicated that while hospital costs had an impact on bankruptcy, they were frequently just one of many contributing factors.

"...our findings suggest that medical factors play a much smaller role in causing U.S. bankruptcies than has previously been claimed. Overemphasizing “medical bankruptcies” may distract from understanding the true nature of economic hardship arising from high-cost health problems.".

title: Fact Check: Rep. Tim Ryan of Ohio said: “The bottom 60 percent of Americans haven’t seen a r...
text:

title: Fact Check: The reason that they are separating these little children from their families is...
text:
Claim: The reason that they are separating these little children from their families is that they are using Section 1325 of that act, which criminalizes coming across the border to incarcerate the parents and then separate them. Some of us on this stage have called to end that section, to terminate it, some like Congressman O’Rourke have not.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: Evidence shows section 1325 criminalises crossing the border, and that O'Rourke opposed appealing it, but the claim is worded badly and is a copied quote. 

Evidence:

Q: Does Section 1325 of the United States Code criminalize illegal entry into the country?
A: Yes. Section 1325 is the part of the United States Code that criminalizes illegal entry into the country as a misdemeanor, punishable by imprisonment or fines.

Q: Has Congressman O’Rourke opposed repealing the Section 1325 law?
A: Yes. Mr. O’Rourke has opposed repealing the law.

Q: What is Section 1325 of the United States Code ?
A: Section 1325 related to the punishment for illegal reentry to the UA. It states than an alien previously denied admission and removed,  shall be fined under title 18, or imprisoned not more than 2 years, or both..

title: Fact Check: The US-Iran nuclear deal pushed back a nuclear breakout by 10–20 years.
text:
Claim: The US-Iran nuclear deal pushed back a nuclear breakout by 10–20 years.

Verdict: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

Justification: It seems that a nuclear breakout is a bit big of a statement, therefore the evidence is conflicting. From the 3rd QA it is evident that the deal is in place to prevent Iran from chaning middle eastern politics. Therefore the label is conflicting evidence

Evidence:

Q: What is the US-Iran nuclear deal?
A: The Iran nuclear deal effectively shuts Iran’s pathways to nuclear weapons while preserving its legal right to civilian nuclear energy. The deal substantially lengthens the time Iran would need to enrich enough uranium for nuclear weapons, putting eyes on the program to detect any activity toward overt weaponization and drastically increasing the chance of detecting any so-called secret “sneakout.”. 

Q: Is the Iran nuclear deal delaying a nuclear breakout?
A: The deal extends the time Iran would need to produce an atomic bomb from two or
three months to at least one year, which would give the United States and its allies an
opportunity to react if the Iranians broke the agreement.. 

Q: Does the Iran nuclear deal limit Iran's ability to produce nuclear weapons?
A: It puts strong, verifiable limits on Iran’s ability to develop a nuclear weapon for at least the next 10 to 15 years and is potentially one of the most consequential accords in recent diplomatic history, with the ability not just to keep
Iran from obtaining a nuclear weapon but also to reshape Middle East politics..

title: Fact Check: In states like Connecticut that enacted a permit-to-purchase gun law, they saw 4...
text:
Claim: In states like Connecticut that enacted a permit-to-purchase gun law, they saw 40 percent drops in gun violence and 15 percent drops in suicides.

Verdict: Not Enough Evidence

Justification: There is a sufficient evidence supporting the 15 percent drops in suicides in states Connecticut, but none for 40 percent drops in gun violence. 

Evidence:

Q: When did the permit-to-purchase gun law pass in Connecticut?
A: In 1995, a permit-to-purchase handgun law went into effect in Connecticut, stating that people who want to buy a gun must apply for a license (or permit) with the local police, a process that involves a background check, as well as complete at least eight hours of gun safety training.. 

Q: What were the amounts of gun violence in 1994 in Connecticut?
A: No answer could be found.. 

Q: How many suicides occurred in Connecticut in 1994?
A: No answer could be found..

total wealth of $248.5 billion.

title: Fact Check: Sen Cory Booker said when Connecticut enacted a permit-to-purchase gun law, “the...
text:
Claim: Sen Cory Booker said when Connecticut enacted a permit-to-purchase gun law, “they saw 40 percent drops in gun violence and 15 percent drops in suicides.”

A: Yes. Following Connecticut’s implementation of a licensing law, the state’s firearm homicide rate declined 40 percent and the firearm suicide rate declined 15.4 percent.[1]

Q: Did they see a 40 percent drop in gun violence and 15 percent drops in suicides.”

title: Fact Check: About 30% of LGBTQ kids do not go to school because of fear.
text:
Claim: About 30% of LGBTQ kids do not go to school because of fear.

Verdict: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

Justification: The 6th and 7th Q&A show conflicting evidence. One says 12.5% and one says 35% so the claim has conflicting evidence. Lots of the results are also unrelated to the claim.

Evidence:

Q: Did the Iran nucleur deal push back a nucleur breakout 10/20 yrs as claimed by Booker ?
A: “First and foremost, it was a mistake to pull out of that deal,” Cory said. “And one of the reasons why we are seeing this hostility now is because Donald Trump is marching us toward a far more dangerous situation. Literally, he took us out of a deal that gave us transparency into their nuclear program and pushed back a nuclear breakout 10-20 years, and now we see Iran threatening to go further and we are being pulled further and further into this crisis.. 

Q: Is Tim Ryan correct in saying that the bottom 60% of American households are not getting raises ?
A: This is incorrect. The bottom 60% have seen their income rise since 1980. 

It’s unclear where Ryan is pulling this statistic from, but a 2018 report from the Congressional Budget Office says that the bottom 60% saw an increase in household income of 32% -- adjusted for inflation -- from 1979 to 2015. 

Meanwhile the top 1% saw their income rise by 233%.. 

Q: Was Booker correct in saying that the private insurance overhead was 15 percent while Medicare’s was only at 2 percent ?
A: It’s true that the most recent Trustees Report of the Medicare system puts total “administrative expenses” at $9.9 billion last year. That’s actually 1.3 percent of total Medicare expenditures for the year — even less than the 2 percent figure Booker cited. So far, so good. Our conclusion: Booker and others using this and similar claims have a point — Medicare does spend less on administration than private insurers. But it’s not so simple as they would have you believe..

title: Fact Check: Sen. Cory Booker claimed the Iran nuclear deal “pushed back a nuclear breakout 1...
text:
Claim: Sen. Cory Booker claimed the Iran nuclear deal “pushed back a nuclear breakout 10, 20 years.” during the 2020 U.S presidential debate

Verdict: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

Evidence:

Q: Was there a nuclear deal with Iran?
A: Sen. Cory Booker claimed the Iran nuclear deal “pushed back a nuclear breakout 10, 20 years.” The deal pushed back the breakout time from two or three months to one year for at least 10 years.. 

Q: How long did the Iran agreement delay the breakout time?
A: The deal extends the time Iran would need to produce an atomic bomb from two or
three months to at least one year, which would give the United States and its allies an
opportunity to react if the Iranians broke the agreement.. 

Q: What is the Iran agreement?
A: Known as the Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action, this deal:

Cuts off all of Iran’s pathways to a nuclear weapon, including a covert pathway

Puts in place vigorous, intrusive, and unprecedented
transparency measures that are necessary to verify that Iran cannot pursue a weapon

Ensures sanctions can be snapped back into place if Iran violates the deal.

title: Fact Check: Sen. Cory Booker claimed private insurance overhead was 15 percent, while Medica...
text:
Claim: Sen. Cory Booker claimed private insurance overhead was 15 percent, while Medicare’s was “only at 2 percent.”

Verdict: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

Justification: Q&A 4 states that the claim was made by the person as claimed in the claim, 
Q&A 1 states that Medicare's overhead is only 1.3% not 2 as claimed, (0.7%diffrence)
Q&A 3 shows that actually The definitions are incompatible and not reconcilable between the systems. so comparing Medicares overhead cost  to private health cares in this way is incorrect, with Q&A 3 listing good points why these figures are incompatible in the way claim shows.


Evidence:

Q: What were Medicare's admin expenses as a percentage of total expenses in 2018?
A: 1.3%. 

Q: How does the overhead charge for healthcare compare to the admin cost of healthcare?
A: Comparing data for the public Medicare with private Medicare, we show that the administrative expenses percentage of benefits for the public system is much lower.
The definitions are incompatible and not reconcilable between the systems.
We expand the focus to more financial data. Per-member income and benefits are larger for the public Medicare and grew faster than Medicare Part C, reversing earlier trends. The public Medicare is not solvent in many years, whereas the insurers’ Medicare has an 85% loss ratio.. 

Q: Are there other reasons that these numbers are incomparable.
A: Yes. Medicare beneficiaries are all age 65 or over, or disabled, and on average have much larger medical bills than the mostly under-65 population served by private health insurance. A 2006 study estimated that in 2003, the average medical cost for Medicare was $6,600 per person per year while the average medical cost for private health insurance (excluding out-of-pocket costs) was less than half that — $2,700 per person per year.

title: Fact Check: Purdue Pharma has been able to act with complete impunity and pay no consequence...
text:
Claim: Purdue Pharma has been able to act with complete impunity and pay no consequences for the opioid crisis. Not a single night in jail.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Purdue Pharma has indeed faced consequences for the opioid crisis. 

Evidence:

Q: Has Purdue Pharma faced legal action in the past?
A: Yes. John L. Brownlee, United States Attorney for the Western District of Virginia, and Virginia
Attorney General Bob McDonnell announced today that The Purdue Frederick Company, Inc.,
along with its President, Chief Legal Officer, and former Chief Medical Officer have pleaded guilty to charges of misbranding Purdue’s addictive and highly abusable drug OxyContin.

Q: What was the reason for Purdue Pharma's legal action?
A: The Purdue Frederick Company, Inc., and the three executives have
admitted that Purdue fraudulently marketed OxyContin by falsely claiming that OxyContin
was less addictive, less subject to abuse, and less likely to cause withdrawal symptoms than
other pain medications when there was no medical research to support these claims and
without Food and Drug Administration approval of these claims.. 

Q: What were Purdue Pharma's consequences for the charges of misbranding of Purdue’s addictive and highly abusable drug OxyContin?
A: Purdue and the three executives will pay a total of $634,515,475..

title: Fact Check: Despite what Purdue Pharma has done; their connection to the opioid crisis and t...
text:
Claim: Despite what Purdue Pharma has done; their connection to the opioid crisis and the overdose deaths throughout the United States, as of 26/06/2019 they have been able to act with complete impunity and pay no consequences.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: They have been punished as a consequence of court findings involving fines, probation and community service for employees.

Evidence:

Q: What consequences have Purdue Pharma, the maker of OxyContin paid in light of the alleged connection to the opioid crisis and the overdose deaths in the United States?
A: Purdue Pharma, the maker of Oxycontin, has settled with Oklahoma for $270 million after it was accused of fueling the nation's opioid epidemic;  the charges that Purdue deceptively marketed OxyContin would have been on full display in a state hit hard by the opioid crisis.. 

Q: As of the date of the claim have Purdue Pharma, the maker of OxyContin faced criminal charges in light of the alleged connection to the opioid crisis and the overdose deaths in the United States?
A: The company, Purdue Pharma, got five years probation and must pay the huge fines, and the three individuals involved - Michael Friedman, who is the former president; Howard Udell, who is the chief counsel; and Paul Goldenheim, the medical director, formerly - they all got three years probation and 400 hours of community service work.. 

Q: What is complete impunity?
A: Impunity means "exemption from punishment or loss or escape from fines".[1] In the international law of human rights, it refers to the failure to bring perpetrators of human rights violations to justice and, as such, itself constitutes a denial of the victims' right to justice and redress..

title: Fact Check: More Americans are uninsured today than when US President Donald Trump took offi...
text:
Claim: More Americans are uninsured today than when US President Donald Trump took office.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: From January 2028 there was reports on more Americans becoming uninsured 

Evidence:

Q: How many people were uninsured in 2016, the year before Trump took office?
A: 28.6 million people. That represents 9% of the population.. 

Q: How many people were uninsured in 2018?
A: 30.4 million people. That represents 9.4% of the population.. 

Q: Is U.S. Sen. Baldwin right that more Americans are without health insurance?
A: Jan. 23, 2019, Gallup report: "U.S. Uninsured Rate Rises to Four-Year High."
— April 25, 2019, Georgetown University Health Policy Institute: "Updated CBO Estimates Find Uninsured Increased by 1.4 Million Between 2016 and 2018."
— Jan. 23, 2019, Forbes: "Uninsured rate hits four-year high amid Trump’s Obamacare attacks." 

— May 9, 2019, USA Today: "CDC: 1.1 million more American lost health insurance coverage in 2018." 
— Jan. 23, 2019, Los Angeles Times: "Uninsured rate under Trump surges to highest level since Obamacare began." 
The U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention’s National Center for Health Statistics report on health insurance shows there were 28.6 million people uninsured in 2016, the year before Trump took office. That represents 9% of the population.
In 2018, that number showed 30.4 million people, or 9.4% of people all ages were without insurance..

title: Fact Check: Russia is not using illegitimate sanctions against Georgia.
text:
Claim: Russia is not using illegitimate sanctions against Georgia.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: the russian santions against georgia are not legal and authroised. 

Evidence:

Q: Is Russia using illegitimate sanctions against Georgia?
A: We have seen the Russian consumer-protection agency politicize trade and ban certain products when political relations with Russia deteriorate, not only in Georgia, but also in the Baltics, Moldova, Ukraine, and Central Asia,” Sergi Kapanadze, the Dean of the Caucasus School of Governance at the Caucasus University in Tbilisi wrote in a 2014 policy memo for the European Council on Foreign relations.. 

Q: What are the sanctions imposed by Russia against Georgia?
A: After the Rose Revolution brought Saakashvili to power in 2004, Moscow soon began applying energy sanctions to the recalcitrant Georgian leader. As with other defiant ex-Soviet states, Georgia was subjected to massive gas price increases. From 2004 to 2006 the price demanded by Gazprom, the Russian state gas monopoly, increased by nearly 500 percent, from $50 to $235 per thousand cubic meters.19 Moscow tried to portray this as a ‘normal’ price increase, designed to bring Georgia in line with prices charged to Moscow's West European purchasers, which the Kremlin described as the “world market price.” Yet the political rationale was clear. First, price increases were targeted carefully to states which angered Moscow. Georgia, in fact, was treated the worst of any state—it was the first to be forced to pay full ‘Western’ prices, even ahead of Ukraine. Russia's most dramatic action, though, took place on January 22, 2006. Just days earlier it had stopped gas supplies to the Ukraine, allegedly over a pricing dispute. But it seemed that simply turning off the gas valves, even in midwinter, was not enough of a punishment for Georgia. Russia announced that both main gas lines to Georgia had been cut by bomb blasts, allegedly the work of Chechen separatists.23 Doubts were quickly raised. Why would Chechens target Georgia, a state which was at worst neutral in their dispute with Russia—and perhaps covertly a supporter, as Moscow alleged? Although it was never proven, many believed that Moscow had cut the lines deliberately, to weaken Saakashvili's government. Georgia suffered through a few days of closed schools and factories and freezing homes until gas service was restored.24. 

Q: What's meant by illigitimate sanctions?
A: Max Weber
famously defined political legitimacy as the de facto ability of a political regime to
secure acceptance based on belief (‘Legitimita¨tsglaube’) as opposed to securing compliance based on coercion alone.6 In ‘Reply to Habermas’ Rawls dismisses the sociological
or descriptive concept of political legitimacy associated with Weber as insufficient.7 Not
because he thinks that Weber is wrong to focus on de facto acceptance of political
authority, but because Rawls thinks that any sufficient definition of legitimacy would
Langvatn 133
Downloaded from psc.sagepub.com by guest on January 18, 2016
have to acknowledge that there must be a benchmark of appropriate acceptance, or a
benchmark for when our belief that something is legitimate is appropriate. A full examination of political legitimacy must also ask whether
the agent who made the decision is authorized to make the decision, and whether the
decision has been made in accordance with established and recognized procedures that
are themselves appropriately authorized and sufficiently just..

title: Fact Check: Ninety percent of the people applying for asylum never show up for their immigra...
text:
Claim: Ninety percent of the people applying for asylum never show up for their immigration court hearing in the months ahead.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: data shows 96% of asylum seeker show up for their court hearings. 

Evidence:

Q: What percentage of migrants show up to immigration court hearings, in the United States?
A: Data show that 96 percent of asylum applicants show up to all their immigration court hearings.. 

Q: Does the United States government provide defensive asylum seekers with appointed immigration lawyers?
A: Right to due process

What the law says: The Fifth Amendment states that “no person … shall be compelled in any criminal case to be a witness against himself, nor be deprived of life, liberty, or property, without due process of law.”

The issue of due process is at the heart of many immigration cases, including Reno v. Flores, the 1993 Supreme Court case that has returned to the spotlight with the surge in family separations. The case led to an agreement requiring the government to release children to their parents, a relative or a licensed program within 20 days.

In the ruling, Justice Antonin Scalia wrote “it is well established that the Fifth Amendment entitles aliens to due process of law in deportation proceedings.”

How it works in practice: Immigrants have the right to due process. But in reality, says, Andrew Arthur, a resident fellow in law and policy at the conservative Center for Immigration Studies, “courts of law run the gamut.”

In some cases, immigrants are not granted a hearing at all. When asked about the president’s tweet, White House Press Secretary Sarah Sanders pointed to the process of “expedited removal,” which was created by the Illegal Immigration Reform and Immigrant Responsibility Act of 1996.

“Just because you don’t see a judge doesn’t mean you aren’t receiving due process,” Sanders said.

Under the expedited removal process, immigrants who have been in the country illegally for less than two years and are apprehended within 100 miles of the border can be deported almost immediately without going through a court hearing.

The exception is asylum seekers, who must be granted a hearing.

Those who are not processed through expedited removal have the right to due process in an immigration court, where the main goal is to decide whether a person has a legal claim to remain in the U.S.

“In immigration court, you have very few rights,” said John Gihon, an immigration attorney who spent six years as a prosecutor for U.S. Immigration and Cust.

title: Fact Check: The UN recommends a police-population ratio of one police officer to 220 people
text:
Claim: The UN recommends a police-population ratio of one police officer to 220 people

Verdict: Not Enough Evidence

Justification: Without more information about where this claim was initiated and a question posed as to what is the ideal the ratio of people to policemen, it is not possible to verify this claim.

Evidence:

Q: Has the UN Recommended that a police force should have one police officer for every 220 people?
A: No answer could be found.. 

Q: Has a proposed police officer to person ration been mentioned before elsewhere?
A: in 1945. one American policeman oversaw 450 German civilians. Its success at the time has tended to inform international policing, with the ratio being passed down from one UN document to another over the years..

title: Fact Check: Russia violated South Korean airspace
text:
Claim: Russia violated South Korean airspace

Verdict: Not Enough Evidence

Justification: Q1 is too vague and "opinions" aren't facts. I'm not sure that Japan could be considered a "neutral country".
Q2 A question about  air defence identification zones would have been better but even then the question doesn't specifically address the claim.

Evidence:

Q: Did any neutral countries have an opinion on what happened?
A: Japan meanwhile has protested against both Russia and South Korea.

Because it claims sovereignty over the islands, Japan's government said that Russia had violated its airspace. It also said that South Korea's response was extremely regrettable.. 

Q: What are the defence zones of South Korea ?
A: South Korea claims Russia went beyond its ADIZ (air defence identification zone ) and into the territorial airspace surrounding the islands.

But other nations do not recognise South Korea's claim of sovereignty..

title: Fact Check: Russian Mercenaries in Syria are Private Contractors and They Are Not Engaged in...
text:
Claim: Russian Mercenaries in Syria are Private Contractors and They Are Not Engaged in Combat

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Evidence provided that Russian mercenaries are strongly linked to Russian state and that they are engaged in combat in Syria - this counters both claims.

Evidence:

Q: Have Russian mercenaries been engaged in combat in Syria?
A: Yes. The Russian mercenaries fighting in Syria say they are not in the country for the money or to help Syrian President Bashar al-Assad.
Early last month, an unknown number of Russian mercenaries -- some reports say a dozen, others as many as 200 -- were killed by U.S. air strikes during fighting in Syria. The men were hired by a private military contracting firm called ChVK Vagner, which has been sending Russians to fight in Syria since 2015.

Q: Is ChVK Vagner sponsored by Russia?
A: Mark Galeotti, a researcher with the Institute of International Relations in Prague, has written extensively on the topic of Wagner and Russia’s use of mercenaries as a potentially deniable asset. According to him, Wagner cannot be considered a legitimate private military company.

“I tend to call Wagner a pseudo-mercenary outfit because it is somewhere in between,” Galeotti told Polygraph.info. “Given that it seems largely bankrolled through Evro Polis [a company owned by Prigozhin], and it has a contract with the Syrian government worth 25% of the output of any gas and oil fields it recovers, there is clearly some truly mercenary aspect, even if much of the time it is working for the Russian command cell in Damascus.”

But while he acknowledges a possible change in Wagner’s ownership, Galeotti agreed that the organization was undoubtedly tied to the Russian state, at least in the beginning: “I don't think there is any question they were originally a state-sponsored op, is there?”

And given the fact that wounded fighters still appear to be receiving treatment at Russian military hospitals, possibly arriving on Russian military transport aircraft, it appears that Russian authorities know far more about Wagner and its activities than they have so far admitted in public.. 

Q: Have any Russian mercenaries received state medals of the type usually awarded to military personnel?
A: Yes. According to Fontanka, Troshev (Wagners executive director) was awarded the Hero of Russia honor for assisting in the capture of Palmyra. Bogatov also reportedly won this title. Kuznetsov and Uktin have reportedly won the Order of Courage four times.

text:

title: Fact Check: The Jamnagar Junagarh Highway bridge that collapsed, was inaugurated by PM Modi.
text:
Claim: The Jamnagar Junagarh Highway bridge that collapsed, was inaugurated by PM Modi.

title: Fact Check: Jamnagar-Junagarh highway bridge in India collapsed within 3 months of inaugurat...
text:
Claim: Jamnagar-Junagarh highway bridge in India collapsed within 3 months of inauguration.

Verdict: Refuted

Evidence:

Q: Which Bridge collapsed?
A: Jamnagar-Junagarh highway bridge. 

Q: Was the bridge built only 3 months prior to the collapse?
A: No, Google earth has an image showing the bridge is already there in 2009. 

Q: Was the bridge inaugurated by PM modi?
A: Alt News contacted GV Joshi, the executive engineer at Road and Buildings department in Rajkot to confirm the approximate time of construction. He said, “No it’s not all true. The bridge was built at least 45 years ago. It is also not true that the bridge was inaugurated by PM Modi.”.

title: Fact Check: Muslims in Bangalore have named a mosque after Indian Prime Minister Narendra Mo...
text:
Claim: Muslims in Bangalore have named a mosque after Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: There are mosques with the name Modi but they are not named after the Prime minister but an historic figure.

Evidence:

Q: How many mosques are in Bangaluru (Bangalore)?
A: There are 400 mosques in Bengaluru.. 

Q: Is there a mosque called Modi Masjid in Bangalore?
A: Yes. There are three. The one in question is the Modi Abdul Gafoor Masjid.

Q: Was the mosque named after Prime Minister Narendra Modi?
A: The mosque was named after Modi Abdul Gafoor, a 19th century merchant. Apart from this mosque, there are two more mosques are in Bengaluru known as Modi Masjid..

title: Fact Check: Founding father of the United States, Patrick Henry said, “It cannot be emphasiz...
text:
Claim: Founding father of the United States, Patrick Henry said, “It cannot be emphasized too strongly or too often that this great nation was founded, not by religionists, but by Christians; not on religions, but on the gospel of Jesus Christ. For this very reason peoples of other faiths have been afforded asylum, prosperity, and freedom of worship here.”

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Patrick Henry is not the founding father of the United States and also did not state the claims quote - it actually comes from The Virginian, April 1956, Vol. II No. 3.

Evidence:

Q: Was Patrick Henry a founding father of the United States?
A: No. Henry served as a delegate to both the first and second Continental Congresses and was largely responsible for the establishment of a colonial militia. He helped draft a constitution for the new state of Virginia and served as its first governor from 1776 to 1779, when Thomas Jefferson succeeded him. After serving again as governor from 1784 to 1786, Henry was elected to the Constitutional Convention of 1787, but he declined to attend. At the Virginia ratifying convention, he opposed the federal Constitution, believing it to be a threat to state sovereignty.

Q: Dad Patrick Henry say “It cannot be emphasized too strongly or too often that this great nation was founded, not by religionists, but by Christians; not on religions, but on the gospel of Jesus Christ. For this very reason peoples of other faiths have been afforded asylum, prosperity, and freedom of worship here.”?
A: No. The Virginian, April 1956, Vol. II No. 3

title: Fact Check: Margaret Hello was phone inventor Alexander Graham Bell’s girlfriend
text:
Claim: Margaret Hello was phone inventor Alexander Graham Bell’s girlfriend

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: There are no QA that would indicate that Margaret Hello was bell's girlfriend. The 3rd QA says that there is not answer. Therefore the claim is refuted

Evidence:

Q: When was the telephone invented?
A: On March 7, 1876, Bell was granted his telephone patent. A few days later, he made the first-ever telephone call to Watson, allegedly uttering the now-famous phrase, “Mr. Watson, come here. I want you.”. 

Q: Did Bell have a girlfriend at the time?
A: While teaching, Bell met Mabel Hubbard, a deaf student. The couple married on July 11, 1877.. 

Q: Who was Margaret Hello?
A: No answer could be found..

title: Fact Check: Irish poet and playwright Oscar Wilde once said, “Some cause happiness wherever ...
text:
Claim: Irish poet and playwright Oscar Wilde once said, “Some cause happiness wherever they go; others whenever they go.”

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: There is no evidence of this quote ever being said or written by Oscar wilde, so the claim is refuted. 

Evidence:

Q: Who was Oscar Wilde?
A: Wilde was a poet, novelist and playwright who featured prominently in the aestheticism movement, in which beauty was considered to be the primary purpose of art. Two of his best known works, the 1895 satirical play “The Importance of Being Earnest” and the 1891 philosophical novel “The Picture of Dorian Gray,” are both considered literary classics.. 

Q: Does this quote appear In any of his works?
A: nowhere in these works, or any of his others, does the phrase about happiness appear. A search of his complete works turned up no matching or similar expressions..

title: Fact Check: Pakistan cricketers were out till late at night smoking hookah before their matc...
text:
Claim: Pakistan cricketers were out till late at night smoking hookah before their match against India which led to their loss

Verdict: Refuted

Evidence:

A: on the Sunday. 

Q: What date was the video from?
A: The video was from the night of June 14 (Friday) not Saturday as being alleged by fans and on social media. 

In a statement, the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) clarified that no player had violated curfew and returned to their hotel rooms’ on-time the night before Pakistan’s match against India. The board added that players had gone out with their families two days before the match..

A: Incorrect. 37% of fathers who responded to a recent survey said that either they, or someone they knew, had ever experienced not seeing their children on Father's Day..

title: Fact Check: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau is converting to Islam from Christianity.
text:

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: From the 2ndQA it is evident that the website is satirical. Therefore thclaim is refuted

Evidence:

Q: Where was this claim published?
A: Vatican Enquirer. 

Q: What is Vatican Enquirer?
A: The Vatican Enquirer is a satirical look at headlines around the world.
The stories are not real and purely fictional. All details are fabricated, and is not intended for readers under 18 years of age. Invented names are use in all of its stories, except in cases of known public figures being satirized. Any other use of real names is purely accidental and coincidental..

title: Fact Check: A little girl photographed in a hospital bed receives a dollar for a kidney tran...

title: Fact Check: Two brands of salt in India, Samnhar refined salt and Tata salt contain high lev...
text:

Verdict: Refuted

Evidence:

Q: Is potassium ferrocyanide toxic?
A: Sodium, potassium and calcium ferrocyanide were evaluated by a working group established by the Nordic Council of Ministers in 2000. Sodium, potassium and calcium ferrocyanide were not considered to cause a safety problem due to the very small quantities consumed..

title: Fact Check: Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez claimed Amazon was paying full-time employees so little...

A: In November 2018, Amazon raised it's minimum wage to $15 an hour, or $35,096 for a full time employee.. 

Q: What were Amazon wages prior to this date?
A: Prior to 2018, half of Amazon's workers made less than $35,096 as the $15 an hour minimum wage wasn't yet in effect.. 

Q: What is the federal poverty level in 2019?
A: The federal poverty level in 2019 is $25,750..

title: Fact Check: Sri Lanka has been ranked in the top four most corrupt nations in the world
text:
Claim: Sri Lanka has been ranked in the top four most corrupt nations in the world

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Corruption can be measured in many ways but neither of the sources cited here put Sri Lanka in the top four. 

Evidence:

Q: Which Country is the most most corrupt nation globally?
A: Alexander E.M. Hess, Michael Sauter  |  24/7 Wall Street

More than half of the world's population believes corruption in the public sector is a very serious problem. Liberia and Mongolia are the two most corrupt countries in the world, according to a recent study. In both countries, 86% of residents believe corruption in the public sector is a very serious problem. Residents in the vast majority of countries around the world believe corruption has only gotten worse in the past two years.

Anti-corruption nonprofit Transparency International has released its 2013 Global Corruption Barometer, which surveyed residents in 107 countries. The world's corrupt nations differ in many ways. Four are located in Africa, three in Latin America and two in Asia. These nations also vary considerably in size and population. Mongolia has just 3.2 million residents, while Mexico, Nigeria and Russia are three of the largest countries on the globe, each with more than 100 million people. Based on the percentage of surveyed residents that reported corruption in the public sector is a very serious problem, these are the world's most corrupt nations. 

Q: Is Sri Lanka among the top four most corrupt nations in the world?
A: Below are the top 10 most corrupt countries in the world, according to the U.S. News and World Report for 2018. The data was compiled from the 2018 Best Countries rankings, an analysis of 80 countries based on a survey of over 21,000 citizens around the world. The survey gauged how participants perceived the corruption in other countries.
1. Nigeria

2. Colombia

3. Pakistan

4. Iran

5. Mexico

6. Ghana

7. Angola

8. Russ.

title: Fact Check: "Kenya has been ranked 85th globally in e-commerce uptake.”
text:
Claim: "Kenya has been ranked 85th globally in e-commerce uptake.”

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Kenya ranks at 89th of 151 countries in the 2018 UNCTAD B2C E-commerce Index - not 85th. 

Evidence:

Q: What data set does the figure that Kenya has been ranked 85th globally in e-commerce uptake come from?
A: The figure comes from the 2018 UN Conference on Trade and Development (UNCTAD) Business -to-consumer E-commerce index. The 2018 UNCTAD B2C E-commerce Index, measures an economy’s preparedness to 
support online shopping.. 

Q: Does the data in the 2018 UNCTAD B2C E-commerce Index include the whole world?
A: No. The 2018 UNCTAD B2C E-commerce Index has expanded its coverage to include 151 economies, up seven 
from the 2017 edition.

Q: Where is Kenya in the 2018 UNCTAD B2C E-commerce Index?
A: Kenya is ranked 89th of 151 countries..

title: Fact Check: The domestic Indonesian flight route CI9798 is being Operated by China Airlines.
text:
Claim: The domestic Indonesian flight route CI9798 is being Operated by China Airlines.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The flight route CI9798 is not being operated by China Airlines but by Garuda Indonesia - who also share the flight GA-612 such as :
Malaysia Airlines (MH)5780 & ANA (NH)5519.

Evidence:

Q: What is the criteria to operate a domestic flight in Indonesia?
A: National commercial air transportation business entities as referred to in
referred to in paragraph (1), all or most of the
capital, must be owned by an Indonesian legal entity or
Indonesian citizens.

(translated from)
Badan usaha angkutan udara niaga nasional sebagaimana
dimaksud pada ayat (1), seluruh atau sebagian besar
modalnya, harus dimiliki oleh badan hukum Indonesia atau
warga negara Indonesia.. 

Q: Who operates flight CI9798  in Indonesia?
A: flight CI9798 is a code share for flight GA-612 operated by Garuda Indonesia.

Other airlines also code share the flight GA-612 such as :
Malaysia Airlines (MH)5780 & ANA (NH)5519.. 

Q: What is a code share flight?
A: Code sharing is a marketing arrangement in which an airline places its designator code on a flight operated by another airline, and sells tickets for that flight. Airlines throughout the world continue to form code-share arrangements to strengthen or expand their market presence and competitive ability..

title: Fact Check: 25% of drug users in Nigeria are women
text:
Claim: 25% of drug users in Nigeria are women

Verdict: Supported

Justification: The second answer states that 1 in 4 users are women so the claim is supported. The source is a trustworthy source.

Evidence:

Q: Are about 14.4 million Nigerians are currently on drugs ?.
A: A UN report based on the country’s first comprehensive survey of drug use found an estimated 14.3 million Nigerians – not 14.4 million – aged 15 to 64 used drugs in 2017. This claim is mostly correct .. 

Q: Are 25% of drug users in Nigeria are women ?
A: The report estimated that one in four drug users in Nigeria was a woman. This worked out to 3.4 million women aged 15 to 64 in 2017.

Women reported having less control than men over how and from whom they acquired mostly illicit drugs. They were also far more likely to be supplied drugs by a male partner..

title: Fact Check: ”Kenya has been ranked 85th globally in e-commerce uptake.”
text:
Claim: ”Kenya has been ranked 85th globally in e-commerce uptake.”

A: Kenya's GLOBAL placing in the (Unctad) Business-to-Consumer E-commerce Index..

A: The claim says that the ranking was in 2018. 

Q: What place  GLOBALY does Kenya show in the 2018 (Unctad) Business-to-Consumer E-commerce Index?
A: Kenya is ranked 89th GLOBALY.

title: Fact Check: “This growth is well above the sub-Saharan Africa region average growth of 3% an...
text:

Evidence:

Q: What was the sub-Saharan Africa regions GDP growth as a percentage in 2018?
A: The International Monetary Fund has annual data on economic growth in 194 countries. Its latest World Economic Outlook, released in April 2019, estimates sub-Saharan Africa’s 2018 GDP growth at 3%.. 

Q: What was Kenya's GDP growth as a percentage in 2018?
A: 6.0%. 

Q: What was the global economy growth in 2018 as a percent?
A: 3.6%.

title: Fact Check: On 13 June 2019 Kenya’s finance minister Henry Rotich claimed that Kenyas  growt...

Evidence:

Q: What is the global average growth rate?
A: After peaking at close to 4 percent in 2017, global growth remained strong, at 3.8 percent in the first half of 2018, but dropped to 3.2 percent in the second half of the year.. 

Q: What is the Sub-Saharan Africa growth rate?
A: 3.0% for 2018. 

Q: What is the growth rate for Kenya?
A: 6.3%.

title: Fact Check: Cosmetologists train  eleven times longer than emergency medical technicians
text:
Claim: Cosmetologists train  eleven times longer than emergency medical technicians

Verdict: Supported

Justification: You would have to do 11.5 times more training to be a qualified cosmetologist in comparison to becoming an EMT based on the average numbers of 1500hrs for Cosmetology and 120hrs for EMT.

Evidence:

Q: How many hours are required to complete a cosmetology course?
A: Each state sets its own standards. Most require 1,500 hours, and some, like New York and Massachusetts, require only 1,000. Iowa requires 2,100.. 

Q: How many hours of training does it take to become an EMT?
A: You can become an emergency medical technician in the state of Iowa after 132 hours.. 

Q: Using the Iowa Numbers of 2100hrs for cosmetology vs 132 hours for EMT training, How many times longer does it take to become a cosmetologist in Iowa?
A: 2100/132= 15.9090909091
(rounded up to 16 it works out you have to do an additional 15 times as much..

title: Fact Check: Kenya’s excise revenue has declined from approximately 3% of GDP in 2003/04 to a...
text:
Claim: Kenya’s excise revenue has declined from approximately 3% of GDP in 2003/04 to about 2% in 2017/18.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: The answers and sources show that the amounts are correct and so the claim is supported.

Evidence:

Q: What is excise revenue?
A: Excise duties and levies are imposed mostly on high-volume daily consumable products (e.g. petroleum and alcohol and tobacco products) as well as certain non-essential or luxury items (e.g. electronic equipment and cosmetics).   The primary function of these duties and levies is to ensure a constant stream of revenue for the State, with a secondary function of discouraging consumption of certain harmful products; i.e. harmful to human health or to the environment.. 

Q: What was Kenya’s excise revenue as a percentage share of GDP in 2003/04?
A: 3.7% (provisional figure). 

Q: What was Kenya’s excise revenue as a percentage share of GDP in 2017/18?
A: 1.84%
(Table 7, page 22 in Quarterly Economic and Budgetary Review Fourth Quarter, Financial Year 2017/2018 Period ending 30th June, 2018).

title: Fact Check: Kenya's excise revenue has declined from approximately 3% of GDP in 2003/04 to a...

title: Fact Check: Republicans voted against military pay rises
text:

Q: Did the other republicans not believe in a military pay rise?

A: The Chairman’s Mark supports a 3.1% military pay raise, essential end strength increases, an increase in compensation for military spouses to acquire professional licenses, and significant bipartisan housing reform to protect military families. The Mark continues reforms focused on sexual assault prevention and response. The Chairman’s Mark also prohibits the reduction of military health care personnel..

title: Fact Check: “This growth is well above the sub-Saharan Africa region average growth of 3% an...

title: Fact Check: Sri Lankan Muslims are demolishing mosques and are converting into Hinduism.

Q: Is the Sri Lankan  mosque getting demolished so that the Muslims get converted to Hindus ?

title: Fact Check: Over 2013-2018, the Russian economy has grown by only 3%, i.e. less than 1% per ...
text:
Claim: Over 2013-2018, the Russian economy has grown by only 3%, i.e. less than 1% per year

Verdict: Supported

Justification: The Russian economy grew by less than 1% within the said time frame 

Evidence:

Q: What was the average growth in the Russian economy from 1999-2008?
A: The growth of the Russian economy in the decade from 1999 to 2008 averaged 6.9% - the annual figures given by both the International Monetary Fund (IMF) and Rosstat (Russia’s state statistical agency) for this period converge.. 

Q: What was the growth rate from 2009-2018?
A: As for the next ten years – from 2009 to 2018 -- IMF and Rosstat data do not coincide in only two cases. Additionally, Russia's economic growth during that period averaged 0.97% per year, according to the IMF, while Rosstat says it grew 0.91% per year. In any case, both estimates indicate that Russia’s economy grew “less than 1% per year,” as Kudrin noted in his interview..

title: Fact Check: Nigeria was the number one destination for foreign direct investment during the ...
text:

Verdict: Refuted

Evidence:

A: Nigeria topped all other African countries in Mr Jonathan’s first two years with respective earnings of $8.84 and $7.07 billion. A drop to $5.5 and $4.65 billion in his subsequent two years in charge blew Nigeria off the top spot to the third spot in Africa. By his last year in office, the nation’s FDI had shrunk to $3.14 billion, placing Nigeria as Africa’s 7th destination for FDI..

title: Fact Check: Nigeria has made solid progress in fighting corruption in the past four years
text:
Claim: Nigeria has made solid progress in fighting corruption in the past four years

Verdict: Supported

Justification: Convictions for corruption have increased year on year over that time

Evidence:

Q: Was Buhari Administration substantially able cut down corruption in the past four years ?
A: Nigeria has a reputation for very massive corruption. I also know that the President (Buhari) has been able to cut that down very substantially. We talked about that, he is working on it and they have made a lot of progress and I think they will continue to make a lot of progress,” Trump said. Trump said this cut down on corruption in Nigeria will attract investors from the US to Nigeria. We have a lot of people in this country that invests in Nigeria, so cutting down on that corruption element and a corrupt element is very important to us and the President (Buhari) will be able to do that,” he added.

He also recognised Nigeria’s effort in its fight against terrorism and promised to support the country in that regard.

“Nigeria is one of the first African nation to join the coalition to defeat ISIS and Nigerian forces are currently leading regional efforts to defeat ISIS in West Africa and doing very well as we have. Nigeria is also leading Africa in the fight against Boko Haram,” he said.. 

Q: How many Nigerian have been convicted of corruption since President Buhari took office ?
A: In the three years that I have been in charge of EFCC, we have secured 703 convictions. For me, it was an auspicious opportunity to contribute my quota to Mr President’s vision of a corruption-free nation. The opportunity to fully subscribe to President Buhari’s mantra to `kill corruption before it kills us’, was for me, the highest call to duty – one that required absolute commitment and passion.

“Indeed, the task of fighting corruption in Nigeria has never been, is not and can never be an easy one,” he said.

He said that in 2015, ”there were 103 convictions; in 2016, 194 convictions; in 2017, 189 were secured while 217 convictions were secured from January, 2018 until date”. 

Q: What is Nigeria's Ranking on Corruption Perception Index (CPI) for 2018 ?
A: The Civil Society Legislative Advocacy Centre (CISLAC), Transparency International Chapter in Nigeria, said in a Tuesday morning statement to PREMIUM TIMES that “Nigeria scored 27 out of 100 points in the 2018 CPI, maintaining the same score as in the 2017 CPI.” In the country comparison, Nigeria ranks 144 out of 180 countries this year as opposed to 148 out of 180 countries in the 2017 CPI, the group added. Nigeria is thus still perceived as highly corrupt, and although the ranking shows that Nigeria moved up four (4) places, it only means that four other countries have scored worse while Nigeria stagnated..

title: Fact Check: Nigeria has made solid progress in the area of economic growth and agriculture a...

A: Since the implementation of the EGRP (Economic Recovery and Growth Plan) after the recession in 2016, the economy has been averaging at 2.7% and in 2019 it puts the economy on the third straight year with economic decline. 

Q: Is Nigeria among the growing economies in Africa based on their GDP
A: Nigeria not among the fastest growing economies in Sub-Saharan Africa (SSA) by percentage growth in GDP.

title: Fact Check: In 2014 in McDowell County, West Virginia, life expectancy for men was 64 years.

Q: What is the current life expectancy in McDowell County?
A: It was 67 for males and 73.8 for women.. 

Q: Was the life expentancy in McDowell  lesser than that of Fairfax county in 2014 ?
A: In 2014 ... in McDowell County, W.Va., one of the poorest counties in the nation, life expectancy for men was 64 years. In Fairfax County, Va., a wealthy county, just 350 miles away, life expectancy was nearly 82 years, an 18 year differential. The life expectancy gap for women in the two counties was 12 years.the gap for men between the two counties 15 years, rather than the 18-year figure Sanders cited..

title: Fact Check: Nigeria are meeting the challenges of security with much greater support to the ...
text:
Claim: Nigeria are meeting the challenges of security with much greater support to the security forces in terms of money, equipment and improved local intelligence. Nigeria are meeting these challenges with superior firepower and resolve

Verdict: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

Justification: Q&A 1 and 2 show that as claimed Nigeria does have security challenges, and it is committed to appropriate funding of its armed forces to fight these challenges.
However Q&A 3 says that the armed forces do not have superior firepower to take on the challenges they experience, with the final Q&A showing attacks are still happening from terror organisations frequently.

Evidence:

Q: What challenges of security is Nigeria facing?
A: The Nigeria Security Tracker (NST), a project of the Council on Foreign Relations' Africa program, documents and maps violence in Nigeria that is motivated by political, economic, or social grievances. Different groups in Nigeria resort to violence. The militant Islamist movement Boko Haram is active in northern Nigeria. Violence among ethnic groups, farmers, and herdsmen sometimes acquires religious overtones. A new generation of Niger Delta militants threatens war against the state. Government soldiers kill civilians indiscriminately. Police are notorious for extrajudicial murder.. 

Q: What support is Nigerian Government giving to the security forces?
A: President Muhammadu Buhari has reiterated his administration's commitment to ensure appropriate funding for the Armed Forces in order to enhance the capacity of its personnel and deepen professionalism in the fight against insurgency.. 

Q: Do Nigerian security forces have superior firepower?
A: There are claims that the Buhari administration and the Nigerian military are inadequately equipping soldiers for the fight against Boko Haram.

Q: Can UK prisoners watch TV for free?
A: Prisoners must purchase phone credit themselves and pay rent for a TV..

title: Fact Check: The U.S. women’s soccer team bring in more revenue but get paid less than the me...

Q: Are the U.S. women’s soccer team paid less than the men?
A: Yes. Despite their successes on the field, players on the U.S. Women’s National Team are still paid considerably less than their male counterparts.

Q: When has the U.S. women's soccer team been paid less than the men's?
A: ...the U.S. Men’s National Team received nearly $5.4 million in total performance bonuses after losing in the Round of 16 of the 2014 World Cup, while the U.S. Women’s National Team received less than a third of that amount for winning the World Cup the following year..

title: Fact Check: Mexican drug cartels make £500 billion a year.
text:
Claim: Mexican drug cartels make £500 billion a year.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Numbers suggest far lower number.

Evidence:

Q: What are the worldwide proceeds from drugs estimated to be?
A: If only flows related to drug trafficking and other
transnational organized crime activities were considered, related proceeds would have been equivalent to
around US$650 billion per year in the first decade
of the new millennium, equivalent to 1.5% of global
GDP or US$870 billion in 2009 assuming that the
proportions remained unchanged. The funds available
for laundering through the financial system would
have been equivalent to some 1% of global GDP or
US$580 billion in 2009.. 

Q: Does the UN have estimates for Mexican drug cartels?
A: Calculating trafficking profits to North America (total
transit profits of US5.3 bn) is relatively straightforward.
The largest part of these profits are generated by South
American groups, notably groups from Colombia (most
of the US$3.3 bn in profits generated in shipping the
cocaine to Mexico), followed by profits made by Mexican drug cartels (US$2 bn for shipping the cocaine
across the border to the USA; far more money is then
made by the Mexican drug cartels within the United
States in trafficking the cocaine to the various wholesalers and retailers).. 

Q: What is the estimated revenue of Mexican drug cartels?
A: The cash-rich cartels, believed by the Mexican government to generate well over $21 billion each year..

title: Fact Check: It costs £8 per day to watch TV in hospital if you’re 82.

Q: Does Hospedia provide free TV services?
A: Yes. FREE TV typically 8am-12noon, channels 1-5*
FREE TV 7am-7pm in children’s wards*
FREE outbound phone calls to 01, 02, 03 numbers and mobiles
FREE radio

Q: How much do you have to pay to watch TV in a hospital?
A: For instance, as of April 2018 at the County Durham and Darlington NHS Trust, TV was free on channels one to five in the mornings, with prices ranging from £7.90 per day for the "1 Day TV Bundle" to the most expensive rate at £24.90 per day for the "3 Day TV & Movies Bundle.".

title: Fact Check: Former Vice President Joe Biden leaked the names of US Navy SEAL Team 6 families...
text:
Claim: Former Vice President Joe Biden leaked the names of US Navy SEAL Team 6 families to Al Qaeda.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: No names were said by Joe Biden according to the Q&As so the claim is incorrect. 

Evidence:

Q: What event is this alluding to?
A: Referring to the Navy SEALs unit responsible for the 2011 assassination of al Qaeda leader Osama Bin Laden. 

Q: What did Biden say about the people involved in the operation?
A: President Barack Obama on May 1, 2011, announced to the nation that “a small team of Americans carried out the operation” at a compound in Abbottabad, Pakistan. Press reports immediately following Obama’s announcement identified the SEALs’ involvement; some explicitly named Team 6.. 

Q: Did he mention anyone specifically by name?
A: No. Then, on May 3, Biden in remarks at an Atlantic Council event lauded the SEALs for their work. He did not mention the specific unit or any specific members by name.

“Let me briefly acknowledge tonight’s distinguished honorees. Admiral Jim Stavridis is the real deal,” Biden said. “He can tell you more about and understands the incredible, the phenomenal, the just almost unbelievable capacity of his Navy SEALs and what they did last Sunday.”

He later continued: “I’d be remiss also if I didn’t say an extra word about the incredible events, extraordinary events of this past Sunday. As vice president of the United States, as an American, I was in absolute awe, awe, of the capacity and dedication of the entire team — both the intelligence community, the CIA, the SEALs.”

title: Fact Check: Standing next to a mobile phone antenna or staying too long in its vicinity is a...
text:
Claim: Standing next to a mobile phone antenna or staying too long in its vicinity is a radiation risk.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Seems from the answer that  there isn't a risk for radiation. Therefore the claim is refuted.

Evidence:

Q: Can standing next to a mobile phone antenna or staying too long in its vicinity be a radiation risk?
A: No. Ofcom has been carrying out radio frequency electromagnetic field (EMF) measurements near mobile phone base stations for many years.  These published measurements have consistently shown that EMF levels are well within the internationally agreed levels published in the ICNIRP Guidelines.

title: Fact Check: Prolonged exposure to radiofrequency radiation from a mobile phone antenna may e...
text:
Claim: Prolonged exposure to radiofrequency radiation from a mobile phone antenna may exceed the recommended guidelines.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Each antenna was tested and passed results, meaning prolonged exposures are safe

Evidence:

Q: Has there been studies to account for how much prolonged radiofrequency radiation?
A: Yes. Certificate of ICNIRP (the International Commission on Non-Ionizing Radiation
Protection) Safety Measurement

Q: Have these tests been passed?
A: Yes. The PASS/FAIL result relates to the measurements taken at each location and compares the emission levels for each band of frequencies in relation to the ICNIRP standards for that band.

Each location is the document is labelled PASS.

title: Fact Check: Indian Prime Minister Modi launched an initiative for improving women's safety b...
text:
Claim: Indian Prime Minister Modi launched an initiative for improving women's safety by setting up a helpline number that helps in keeping GPRS track of the vehicle that women are travelling in.

Evidence:

Q: Where did this initiative start?
A: in 2014, Mumbai Police under their ‘Travel Safe When Alone’ initiative, had started an SMS helpline for women travelling alone. As part of the initiative, women travelling alone at nights through autos or taxis can SMS their vehicle’s registration number to 9969777888 that helps Police to keep track of the vehicle that the woman is taking and would get her location through GPS.. 

Q: Is this still operational?
A: No. this special helpline was later on shut down by Mumbai Police owing to the poor response from Women users.

Q: When was this claim made?
A: 03/06/2019.

title: Fact Check: Former Minnesota Senator Franken was accused credibly by eight women of groping ...
text:
Claim: Former Minnesota Senator Franken was accused credibly by eight women of groping and forceable kissing, all of which were corroborated in real time.

Q: Who was the first to accuse Senator Franken of sexual misconduct

title: Fact Check: Being vegan for a year saves 6,670kg of grain.

Q: Is this a reputable and accurate source?
A: None of these figures for the amount of grain saved by switching to a vegan diet appears in the book, but it does give a figure of 865 million tons of grain being used to feed livestock and fish globally in the year 2011 (around 780 billion kg). It is unclear how you would get from this figure to an estimate of either 6,670kg or 7,455kg per person; that would seem to imply there are just over 100 million meat eaters in the world..

title: Fact Check: Trump insisted that the special counsel was totally conflicted
text:
Claim: Trump insisted that the special counsel was totally conflicted

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: It appears that the conflict is acceptable. 

Evidence:

Q: Who was the US special council at the time of the claim?
A: Robert Mueller, in full Robert Swan Mueller III, (born August 7, 1944, New York, New York, U.S.), American law enforcement official who served as director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) from 2001 to 2013. In 2017–19 he was special counsel to a Department of Justice investigation into possible Russian interference in the U.S. presidential election of 2016.. 

Q: What are the basis for the claim that Robert Mueller have conflict of interests after being appointed as a special council?
A: Mueller’s former law firm, WilmerHale, represents Trump’s son-in-law Jared Kushner, who met with a Russian bank executive in December, and the president’s former campaign manager Paul Manafort, who is a subject of a federal investigation.

Legal experts said the ethics rule can be waived by the Justice Department, which appointed Mueller. He did not represent Kushner or Manafort directly at his former law firm.. 

Q: What did the US department of Justice conclude regarding the special council's conflict of interest?
A: Justice Department ethics officials concluded that it is “appropriate” for recently named special counsel Robert Mueller to move forward with investigating Russia and the 2016 election, despite work by his former law firm that might overlap with his inquiry, a DOJ spokeswoman said Tuesday.

“While we cannot confirm or deny the applicability of the regulation to the matters to which Special Counsel Mueller was appointed, we can confirm that the Department ethics experts have reviewed the matters and determined that Mr. Mueller’s participation in the matters assigned to him is appropriate,” she added..

title: Fact Check: Barack Obama said, "Anybody can buy any weapon, any time without much, if any, r...
text:
Claim: Barack Obama said, "Anybody can buy any weapon, any time without much, if any, regulation. They buy it over the internet. They can buy machine guns."

Verdict: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

Justification: From the answers and sources the claim is half right as people can buy firearms on the internet but there are regulations in place. 

Evidence:

Q: What are the regulations on the sale of weapons in the US?
A: There are about 300 federal and state gun laws that regulate the sale and acquisition of firearms in the United States. When it comes to internet gun sales, the firearm is sent to a gun dealer who holds a federal firearms license. An FBI background check is then conducted before the firearm is transferred to the buyer.. 

Q: Can firearms be sold on the internet in the US?
A: Yes. Potential gun buyers can view firearm advertisements and make
purchases from the following categories of websites: major retailers,
online retailers, online auctions and marketplaces, online classified
listings, online forums and social media networks, and Dark Web
websites.

Q: Who can buy a machine gun in the US?
A: Contrary to popular belief, it is perfectly legal for a law-abiding American citizen to own/possess a machine gun (sometimes called a full-auto firearm or automatic weapon).

The absolute easiest way is for someone to get a Federal Firearms License or “FFL” (even a home-based FFL).

Depending on the type of FFL, the FFL-holder can purchase and sell machine guns, regardless of when they were made (more on this below), and they can even legally make their own machine guns or lawfully convert current firearms into full-autos..

It is useless to expatiate on its disadvantages. I think it however a greater evil to the white than to the black race, & while my feelings are strongly interested in behalf of the latter, my sympathies are more strong for the former..

title: Fact Check: Drug Abuse Resistance Education has removed cannabis from its list of gateway dr...
text:
Claim: Drug Abuse Resistance Education has removed cannabis from its list of gateway drugs.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: DARE's CEO directly refutes the claim and points to assumptions being drawn from a partial text.

Evidence:

Q: What is Drug Abuse Resistance Education?
A: D.A.R.E. IS SUBSTANCE ABUSE PREVENTION EDUCATION AND MUCH MORE!

This year millions of school children around the world will benefit from D.A.R.E. (Drug Abuse Resistance Education), the highly acclaimed program that gives kids the skills they need to avoid involvement in drugs, gangs, and violence.

D.A.R.E. was founded in 1983 and has proven so successful that it has been implemented in thousands of schools throughout the United States and many other countries.

D.A.R.E. is a police officer-led series of classroom lessons that teaches children from kindergarten through 12th grade how to resist peer pressure and live productive drug and violence-free lives.. 

Q: What is a gateway drug?
A: A gateway drug is a drug that opens the door to the use of other, harder drugs. Gateway drugs are typically inexpensive and readily available.. 

Q: Has DARE changed their belief about cannabis being a gateway drug?
A: No. Frank Pegueros, DARE America’s president and CEO, tells me the organization’s position on that question has not changed. He says the confusion is “based on what appears to have been a partial posting of a document on our website.” The part that was posted (which has since been removed) discussed alcohol and tobacco as gateway drugs; the part discussing marijuana as a gateway drug was on a subsequent page that was not posted. “It’s obvious from looking at the document that the entire document was in fact not posted, because it only addressed tobacco and alcohol,” Pegueros says. “It didn’t address marijuana or inhalants, the typical substances considered to be gateway drugs.

Instead, that money will come from the Commodity Credit Corp., part of the U.S. Department of Agriculture. The CCC was created in the 1930s to stabilize and protect farm income, with the Wall Street Journal noting it has the authority to draw $30 billion annually from the Treasury Department in support of farmers..

"I voted for the president, I support his agenda and I’m running for Congress because the president needs somebody in the 27th congressional district who can win this seat in 2020 and help move his agenda in Congress," Jacobs said in a statement.

title: Fact Check: None of Kinya's ministers asked to step aside in 2015 has made it to court becau...

Suspended Kenyan Minister for transport and infrastructure Michael Kamau (R) and former resident engineer in the ministry Nicholas Ndung’u Ng’ang’a (L) stand in the dock at the Milimani Law Courts in the capital Nairobi, June 4, 2015. Kamau was charged on Thursday for abuse of office over a road project that wasted public funds, the first high profile official to appear in court in a campaign against corruption. According to court documents, Ndung’u Ng’ang’a faced similar charges

Evidence:

Q: What were Kenya's ministers asked to step aside in 2015 accused of?
A: The ministers have been accused of Corruption. President Uhura Kenyatta, asked officers named in the Confidential Report prepared by the Ethics and Anti - Corruption Commission to step aside to allow the Commission to carry out and complete its investigations.. 

Q: Who were the ministers?
A: President Uhuru Kenyatta Saturday suspended Cabinet Secretaries Kazungu Kambi (Labour), Michael Kamau (Transport), Davis Chirchir (Energy) and Felix Koskei (Agriculture) after being named in EACC report.. 

Q: Did any of the ministers get charged?
A: Charity Ngilu's has been charged with obstructing Ethics and Anti-Corruption Commission officials during the investigations into the land in Karen that was allegedly grabbed by high-profile individuals, including government fficials..

"Teachers can do a lot to ensure that elections are fair - voting often takes place in school buildings, the composition of election commissions is often formed from teachers and heads of educational institutions," the authors of the appeal write.

Meanwhile, only those teachers who are members of United Russia will be members of election commissions in Moscow. In addition, a distribution order for a pro-Putin rally on February 4 on Poklonnaya Hill was sent to schools. Schools are required to provide several people to participate in the rally.

The publication also claims that employees of schools and state-owned companies are forced to go on February 4 to the opposition procession "For Fair Elections" from Yakimanka to Bolotnaya Square, but with posters and slogans in support of Vladimir Putin.
