title: Fact Check: Joe Biden improperly used his influence as vice president to get Ukraine to sack...
text:
Claim: Joe Biden improperly used his influence as vice president to get Ukraine to sack its top prosecutor, Viktor Shokin, to benefit his son Hunter Biden in 2016

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The evidence shows that Joe Biden didn't interfere in this matter.

Evidence:

Q: Did Biden threaten to withhold the $1 billion in loan guarantees to unseat Ukraine’s top prosecutor ?
A: Now, that prosecutor general, Viktor Shokin, says he was fired because he was pursuing Zlochevsky and Burisma. “I didn’t get the hints that we should stop the investigation of Burisma wrongdoing,” he said in an interview published this week, in which he also accuses Biden of pursuing “personal interests” in Ukraine and recruiting Ukrainian officials to protect them — charges Biden denies. Shokin’s claims are highly questionable. The illegal enrichment and money laundering investigation against Zlochevsky was started in August 2014 at the request of Shokin’s deputy, Vitaly Kasko. He had a strained relationship with his boss, and resigned in early 2016, two months before Shokin’s firing. Shokin didn’t actually lead the Zlochevsky investigation, so his removal wasn’t necessary to stop it. Besides, Kasko denies there was any U.S. pressure to end the investigation: He told Bloomberg News that the case had been dormant for a while when Shokin was fired.. 

Q: Was The vice president’s trip in March 2016, to Ukraine connected to  Ukraine's sack of its top prosecutor, Viktor Shokin ?
A: Ukraine’s prosecutor general said in an interview that he had no evidence of wrongdoing by U.S. Democratic presidential candidate Joe Biden or his son, despite a swirl of allegations by President Donald Trump’s lawyer.. 

Q: Did the The U.S. plan to push for Viktor Shokin’s dismissal  initially  come from Joe Biden ?
A: The U.S. plan to push for Shokin’s dismissal didn’t initially come from Biden, but rather filtered up from officials at the U.S. Embassy in Kiev, according to a person with direct knowledge of the situation. Embassy personnel had called for U.S. loan guarantees to Ukraine to be tied to broader anti-corruption efforts, including Shokin’s dismissal, this person said..

title: Fact Check: The Chinese government put millions of dollars into Biden's family business.
text:

The fund was announced in late 2013 — days after Hunter Biden and one of his daughters flew to China from Japan aboard Air Force Two with the vice president, who was in the midst of a diplomatic mission intended to calm rising tensions in the region. During the trip, Vice President Biden warned Chinese leaders not to use fighter jets to enforce an air defense zone created by Beijing over contested waters.

The conservative author Peter Schweizer has suggested that Hunter Biden used the trip to secure a deal with the Bank of China — a suggestion that has been echoed by Mr. Trump’s allies in the conservative news media.. 

Q: Did Hunter Biden make any money from the deal?
A: a lawyer for Hunter Biden said he did not conduct any business related to the China investment fund on that trip, and was not an equity owner in the fund while his father was vice president. He later acquired a 10 percent interest in the entity that oversees the fund, but to date has not received any money from the arrangement, according to the lawyer..

title: Fact Check: Tariffs are now being paid to the United States by China of 25% on 250 Billion D...
text:
Claim: Tariffs are now being paid to the United States by China of 25% on 250 Billion Dollars worth of goods & products. These massive payments go directly to the Treasury of the U.S.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The 1st Q&A pair point out that tariffs are paid by the US consumer when buying products from the tariffed country (china) not as is claimed that tariffs are paid by china to the us gov.
The 3rd Q&A pair does giv figures on these tarifs but they are substantially lower than what is claimed overall so as no parts of the claim are proved true then refuted has been chosen.


Evidence:

Q: Were China’s tariffs paid to the United States  by China?
A: Tariffs are a tax paid by American companies and consumers — not by the foreign governments targeted by the tariffs.. 

Q: How much did the Trump’s tariffs really cost Americans?
A: If American technology companies cannot export to China, they would only create next competitors there, while losing access to a huge market.. 

Q: Did More Trump Tariffs Hamper China’s Development
A: It is widely expected that these tariffs have thus far added more than one or two billion dollars in fiscal revenue to US government coffers. President Trump is complacent and self-congratulatory. However, the 10% tariff increase from the previous round seems to have been paid by American companies and consumers! US importers must see their profits eroded by tariffs if they do not directly pass these costs onto US companies downstream. A study by a group of economists from Princeton, Columbia, and the Federal Reserve Bank of New York estimates that US companies have suffered a loss of $1.4 billion due to tariffs, while American consumers have footed the bill for more than $3 billion. Another study by another group of economists from the World Bank and the International Finance Corporation argues that the US-China trade war has cost the American economy $6.4 billion, equivalent to 0.03% of GDP. It seems unwise to let American companies and consumers take such large losses for such little increase in fiscal revenue..

title: Fact Check: The UK’s pension age is going up.
text:

Verdict: Supported

every five years.

Evidence:

Q: What is the current UK Pension age as of 2018?
A: 65. 

Q: Is the pension age rising in the UK?
A: In March 2019 it began to rise, and will increase to 66 for both men and women by October 2020. It will then rise again, from 66 to 67, between the years 2026 and 2028, and then from 67 to 68 between 2044 and 2046..

All characters appearing in the articles in this website – even those based on real people – are entirely fictional and any resemblance between them and any person, living, dead or undead, is purely a miracle.'.

title: Fact Check: Poland lowered its retirement age using money from the EU.
text:

Verdict: Not Enough Evidence

Evidence:

Q: Where does the funding Poland gets from the EU go towards?
A: The funding Poland gets from the EU budget goes to specific schemes such as  supporting agriculture, infrastructure or economic development.. 

Q: Is there evidence that the EU contributes to Poland's pension fund?
A: No. Obviously this funding could mean that Poland has more to spend overall, but there is no evidence that EU contributions are what directly fund its lowering of the pension age.

Q: Is Poland a "net beneficiary" from the EU's budget?
A: Yes. Yes, Poland is one of the 'net beneficiary' countries from the EU's budget , which means it gets back more than it pays in.

title: Fact Check: You inherit your DNA, temperament, tastes, and emotions from your maternal grand...
text:
Claim: You inherit your DNA, temperament, tastes, and emotions from your maternal grandmother

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: this isn't what the study shows, it was investigating the "grandmother hypothesis" According to the ‘grandmother hypothesis’, post-menopausal women can increase their genetic contribution to future generations by increasing the survivorship of their grandchildren.

Evidence:

Q: Did a study reveal children get most of their genes from their maternal grandmother?
A: No, the study quoted in the claim is 
"Grandma plays favourites: X-chromosome relatedness and sex-specific childhood mortality"

It looked at the survival rate of grandchildren in certain populations and compared that to which grandparents were present in the life of the child. They were trying to see if there was an effect if a grandparent with more or less certainty of having provided the X or Y chromosome of the kid was present or not.. 

Q: Where does a child get his/her DNA from
A: Your DNA contains a record of your ancestors, but you aren't a carbon copy of any one of them. The particular mix of DNA you inherit is unique to you. You receive 50% of your DNA from each of your parents, who received 50% of theirs from each of their parents, and so on. In the chart below you can see how the amount of DNA you receive from a particular ancestor decreases over generations. If you go back far enough, there is a chance that you inherited no DNA from a particular ancestor..

title: Fact Check: U.S Representative Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez says 'trucks are killing America'.
text:
Claim: U.S Representative Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez says 'trucks are killing America'.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: QA pair shows that the article was published by a satirical website 

Evidence:

Q: Rep. Did Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez Say Trucks Are Killing America?
A: Articles from Blair's sites frequently get copied by "real" fake news sites who omit the satire disclaimer and other hints the stories are fake. One of the most persistent networks of such sites is run by a man from Pakistan named Kashif Shahzad Khokhar (aka "DashiKashi") who has spammed hundreds of such stolen stories into conservative and right-wing Facebook pages in order to profit from the ad revenue.

When fact checkers point this out to the people liking and sharing these copycat stories some of them get mad at the fact checkers instead of directing their anger at the foreign spammers or the liberal satire writers. Others send a polite "thank you" note, which is much appreciated.. 

Q: Who are the source and publishers of this claim ?
A: BustaTroll.org is a subsidiary of the “America’s Last Line of Defense” network of parody, satire, and tomfoolery, or as Snopes called it before they lost their war on satire: Junk News, which means what they post are mainly false..

title: Fact Check: NASA spent more than $165 million over 10 years to develop a pen that writes in ...
text:
Claim: NASA spent more than $165 million over 10 years to develop a pen that writes in zero gravity, upside down and in extreme temperatures while the Russians used a pencil instead.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The questions and answers show that NASA did not develop the pen and that astronauts up to then used pencils not just the Russian astronauts so the claim is refuted.

Evidence:

Q: Did NASA spend millions on writing pens to be used in  space?
A: The pens never cost a lot of money and were not developed by wasteful bureaucrats or overactive NASA engineers. 

Q: Did Russia use pencils aboard their early space flights?
A: The crafty Russians used a pencil.. 

Q: What is the Fisher's Space Pen?
A: In 1953 Paul Fisher invented the "Universal Refill" which could be used in most pens. Not content, Paul continued to work on making a better refill. After much experimentation he perfected a refill using thixotropic ink-semisolid until the shearing action of the rolling ball liquefied it-that would flow only when needed. The cartridge was pressurized with nitrogen so that it didn't rely on gravity to make it work. It was dependable in freezing cold and desert heat. It could also write underwater and upside down. The trick was to have the ink flow when you wanted it to, and not to flow the rest of the time, a problem Fisher solved. Fisher's development couldn't have come at a more opportune time. The space race was on, and the astronauts involved in the Mercury and Gemini missions had been using pencils to take notes in space since standard ball points did not work in zero gravity. The Fisher cartridge did work in the weightlessness of outer space and the astronauts, beginning with the October, 1968 Apollo 7 mission began using the Fisher AG-7 Space Pen and cartridge developed in 1966..

title: Fact Check: A change in US federal policy under the Trump administration,was responsible for...

A: SAN DIEGO, April 17, 2012 /PRNewswire/ -- A Sempra Energy (NYSE: SRE) unit, Cameron LNG, today announced that the company has signed commercial development agreements with Mitsubishi Corporation (8058.TYO) and Mitsui & Co., Ltd. (8031.TYO) to develop and construct a natural gas liquefaction export facility at the site of  Cameron LNG receipt terminal in Hackberry, La.. 

Q: When was Barack Obama in office?
A: Dates In Office: 
January 20, 2009 to January 20, 2017. 

Q: When was the LNG export terminal approved?
A: On February 11, 2014, the Office of Fossil Energy of the Department of Energy
(DOE/FE) issued Order No. 3391 to Cameron LNG, LLC (Cameron) pursuant to section 3(a) of
the Natural Gas Act (NGA)1 (Conditional Order or Order No. 3391).
2
 In that order, DOE/FE
conditionally granted Cameron’s Application3 for long-term, multi-contract authorization to
export domestically produced liquefied natural gas (LNG) by vessel to nations with which the
United States has not entered into a free trade agreement providing for national treatment for
trade in natural gas (non-FTA nations)..

title: Fact Check: Caitlyn Jenner was "pissed" none of her kids wished her a happy mothers day.
text:
Claim: Caitlyn Jenner was "pissed" none of her kids wished her a happy mothers day.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Q&As establish who this is and they they have children.
There is no Q&A to establish the source as a satire site although the source does have a small print disclaimer at the bottom of the article.

Evidence:

Q: Who is Caitlin Jenner?
A: Caitlyn Jenner, formerly known as Bruce, was a gold medal-winning track star who set a world record in the decathlon at the 1976 Summer Olympics. As Bruce, he also appeared on the popular reality show 'Keeping Up with the Kardashians.’ In 2015, Jenner revealed that she is transgender and has become a woman, now known as Caitlyn.. 

Q: Does Caitlin Jenner have children?
A: Yes. Caitlyn is the mother of 6 children, Burt, Brandon, Cassandra, Brody, Kendall and Kylie and step mother of four, Kourtney, Khloe, Kim and Rob and a host of grandkids.

Q: Has Caitlin Jenner openly expressed annoyance that none of her kids wished her happy mothers day?
A: No. The claim came from a satire site, not a news site.

title: Fact Check: There is no reason for the U.S. Consumer to pay the Tariffs, which take effect o...
text:
Claim: There is no reason for the U.S. Consumer to pay the Tariffs, which take effect on China today. This has been proven recently when only 4 points were paid by the U.S., 21 points by China because China subsidizes product to such a large degree.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Study quoted in question 3 says the opposite has happened.

Evidence:

Q: What tariffs is Donald Trump talking about?
A: On September 24th 2018, the United States introduced import tariffs on a wide range of
Chinese products. The tariffs will affect US imports from China with a value that exceeds
USD 250 billion -around 50% of all imports. 

Q: What study is Trump quoting here?
A: Trump is quoting from a study by European economists that predicted that a 25-percentage-point increase in tariffs raises U.S. consumer prices on all affected Chinese products by only 4.5 percent on average, while the producer price of Chinese firms declines by 20.5 percent. 

Q: Is this backed up by other sources?
A: No. The study was released in November, using previously released studies from the 1990s, not actual data on prices. But a paper published March 2, by three prominent U.S. economists, found exactly the opposite had happened when actual trade data was studied.

Q: What percent of people who tested positive for covid 19 in Scotland then died?
A: 13,305 were positive
1,847 patients who tested positive have die

The Math:
100/13305x1847= 13.88%. 

Q: What percent of people who tested positive for covid 19 in Italy then died?
A: 14%.

A: So what if there was another you? Someone who looked like you, sounded like you – perhaps even funnier than you! How would you react? This is a parody account.

Well Twitter has some pretty straight-forward rules about impersonating, in essence impersonation is a violation of the ‘Twitter rules’..

title: Fact Check: China hurts U.S. farmers by not buying their produce.
text:

Verdict: Supported

Justification: According to the sources, because of the huge tariffs imposed on China by USA, China no longer buy the produce of US farmers 

Evidence:

Q: Why did China stop purchasing produce from the United States?
A: President Trump's initial round of tariffs led China to strike back and stop purchasing from the United States.. 

Q: What tariff did President Trump impose on China?
A: So far, the US has slapped tariffs on US$550 billion worth of Chinese products.. 

Q: How will U.S. farmers be affected by the tariffs imposed on China by the United States?
A: U.S. farmers and
ranchers have a strong interest in maintaining and
expanding export markets. Because of the broad scope of
farm products subject to the retaliatory tariffs from China
and other countries and the importance of some of the
markets involved, many farmers and ranchers are likely to
experience some negative effects, such as lost market
opportunities and potentially lower prices for their products.
While the Administration has released the trade aid package
to mitigate short-term losses to farmers and ranchers, it is
not designed to address potential longer-term negative
consequences, such as lower commodity prices and reduced
farm income from lost export sales..

title: Fact Check: Joe Biden tried to cut Social Security and Medicare for decades. … Now Biden’s p...
text:

A: Biden proposed a pause on all spending to help federal budget deficits. This was rejected and it was opposed by a majority of both parties.. 

Q: Did Biden promise other people's benefits to illegal immigrants?
A: No. The executive actions would have an effect on social security, but it is calculated on an individual basis. Nobody would receive benefits until they were legal, as documented in the Homeland Security document - 'For 
2024, we estimate that the additional number of individuals receiving a benefit from Social 
Security as a result of the 2014 executive actions will be just 16,000, increasing the total number 
of beneficiaries by 0.02 percent. By 2050, we project the increase in beneficiaries due to the 
executive actions will rise to about 0.76 percent, and will decline thereafter as the affected 
populations age.'

Q: Was there a recorded attempt by Biden to cut social security and medicare
A: In a day-long debate on the plan, opponents contended it would savage Reagan's military buildup, while proponents described it as Congress' "last best chance," as Biden put it, to keep deficits from undermining the economic recovery and dropping the country into another recession..

title: Fact Check: US President Donald Trump says four hundred miles of wall are getting built alon...
text:
Claim: US President Donald Trump says four hundred miles of wall are getting built along the US-Mexico border.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Based on the statistics provided in the QA pairs, less than 400 miles of wall are getting built under the administration of Trump.

Evidence:

Q: How many miles of border wall did Trump build?
A: Officials say the construction starting in February is only part of the picture. Funding from fiscal year 2018, they say, also covers the cost of building 70 more miles of barriers – about 57 miles of which is replacement fencing.

And if the Trump administration’s proposal for $5.7 billion more for a border wall is approved, officials say they’ll be able to build 234 miles of new and replacement barriers – about 100 miles of which will cover parts of the border that didn’t have a barrier before.

But given that a partial government shutdown over the wall is already in its fifth week, whether that work will happen – and exactly what will happen next – is anybody’s guess.. 

Q: Is there a construction of  four hundred miles of wall by Trump on the  Mexico border ?
A: A few prototypes were built in 2017, and over 100 miles of existing barriers have been, or are slated to be, repaired or replaced.
U.S. Customs and Border Protection said about 205 miles of new and replacement barriers have been funded since January 2017, and as of May 23, work had been completed on 42 miles of replacement fencing in California, Texas and Arizona.

A few prototypes with different designs were built in San Diego in 2017 and tested, but they have been demolished to make way for fencing. U.S. Customs and Border Protection has said the prototypes could “inform future border wall design standards in some capacity.”. 

Q: How much did Trump's border wall cost?
A: President Donald Trump’s “wall” along the U.S.-Mexico border would be a series of fences and walls that would cost as much as $21.6 billion, and take more than three years to construct, based on a U.S. Department of Homeland Security internal report seen by Reuters on Thursday..

title: Fact Check: The South African freedom fighter, Solomon Mahlangu, was killed by the man who s...
text:
Claim: The South African freedom fighter, Solomon Mahlangu, was killed by the man who started the Democratic Alliance (DA), the country's official opposition.

Q: What was Solomon Mahlangu's cause of death?
A: Cause of death by hanging.. 

Q: Why was Solomon Mahlangu killed?
A: On June 11 1977 he returned to South Africa as a cadre, heavily armed, through Swaziland.

Two days later Mahlangu and his companions, Mondy Johannes Motloung and George "Lucky" Mahlangu, were confronted by police in Goch Street, Johannesburg. "Lucky" Mahlangu managed to escape. In the ensuing gun battle two civilians were killed and two wounded. Solomon Mahlangu and Motloung were arrested.

Motloung was found to be unfit to stand trial after his brutal police interrogation. Mahlangu was sentenced to death by hanging under the Terrorism Act.. 

Q: Who sentenced Solomon Mahlangu to death?
A: Judge CDJ Theron.

Q: Was Maxine Waters indicted for steering TARP money to her husband's private bank account?

title: Fact Check: US  Attorney General William P. Barr mischaracterized special counsel Robert Mue...
text:
Claim: US  Attorney General William P. Barr mischaracterized special counsel Robert Mueller's remarks about his office's decision not to reach a determination about  whether President Donald Trump had committed obstruction of justice. This issue referred to Russia's attempts to damage Hillary Clinton's presidential campaign.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: us attorney did downplay he role that factors that Mueller stated affected his decisions and made assumptions as to why he did what he did in not reaching a conclusion 

Evidence:

Q: How did Robert Mueller summarize the issues that arose during the course of the investigation into Russia and the presidential election
A: He said that a conclusion couldn't be reached because of some directives in the US constitution and the DOJ's laws. 

Q: Did William Barr agree with Robert Mueller on the inability of his team to reach a conclusion on the matter because of factors within the constitution that could not let him act
A: William Barr downplayed the role that factors that Mueller stated affected his decisions and made assumptions as to why he did what he did in not reaching a conclusion. 

Q: what is mischaracterization
A: The act of characterizing something in an inaccurate or misleading way.

title: Fact Check: Kenyans with old generation passports will still be issued with U.S visas.
text:
Claim: Kenyans with old generation passports will still be issued with U.S visas.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Kenyans with old passports will need to have a new e-passport for entry. 

Evidence:

Q: Do Kenyans need new generation passports to get US Visas
A: Travelers with a valid U.S. visa may travel with their current visa in the old passport but must also have a new e-passport for entry. It is not necessary to apply for a new visa. 

Q: Can old-generation Kenyan passports be solely used to obtain US visas?
A: must also have a new e-passport for entry.. 

Q: Can Kenyans travel to the U.S. without an e-passport?
A: The US Embassy, Nairobi, has said it will no longer issue visas to Kenyans who don't have the new e-passports.

In a post on the embassy's Facebook page, it said,  "All travelers to the United States from Kenya must have a passport valid for at least six months from date of entry. Therefore, U.S. Embassy Nairobi can no longer place U.S. visas in the previously issued non-digital passport expiring August 31, 2019.".

title: Fact Check: A million Australians are doing two jobs.

title: Fact Check: US president claims that the $2 Trillion tax cut did not benefit most people as ...
text:
Claim: US president claims that the $2 Trillion tax cut did not benefit most people as it all went to the folks at the top and corporations that pay no taxes.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The 1st Q&A pair states that contrary to what the claim states that actually about 81 percent of Americans received a tax cut which refutes what the claim says which is that a tax cut did not benefit most Americans.

Evidence:

Q: What percent of people received this tax cut?
A: The independent Tax Policy Center estimated that 64.8 percent of people received a federal income tax cut in 2018, while 6.3 saw an increase. About 81.7 percent of Americans who made $50,000 to $75,000 — roughly a median income — received a tax cut that averaged $750. That’s consistent with estimates from the Joint Committee on Taxation, the nonpartisan analysts of Congress.. 

Q: Did lower incomes also benefit?
A: Yes. About 81.7 percent of Americans who made $50,000 to $75,000 — roughly a median income — received a tax cut that averaged $750.

A: True, In 2017, were about 61 percent of the overdose deaths in Delaware involved fentanyl and 40 percent involved heroin..

"I am an optimist," the Vindicator quotes him as saying. "I am an optimist because I know the history of the journey of this country … We have always had faith in the ability of ordinary people to do extraordinary things.".

Q: Did Biden say anything about 'pearl Harbor'  or the war in that speech?

title: Fact Check: Donald Trump said that there were very fine people on both sides of the violent ...
text:
Claim: Donald Trump said that there were very fine people on both sides of the violent protests in 2017, at Charlottesville.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: The sources show that Donald Trump did say the quote is a speech so the claim is supported.

Evidence:

Q: What exactly did Donald Trump say?
A: "Excuse me, excuse me. They didn’t put themselves -- and you had some very bad people in that group, but you also had people that were very fine people, on both sides. You had people in that group. Excuse me, excuse me. I saw the same pictures as you did. You had people in that group that were there to protest the taking down of, to them, a very, very important statue and the renaming of a park from Robert E. Lee to another name.". 

Q: Did Donald Trump clarify his statement?
A: He went on to say, ""Now, in the other group also, you had some fine people. But you also had troublemakers, and you see them come with the black outfits and with the helmets, and with the baseball bats. You had a lot of bad people in the other group. But you had a lot of people in that group that were there to innocently protest, and very legally protest -- because, I don’t know if you know, they had a permit. The other group didn’t have a permit. So I only tell you this: There are two sides to a story. I thought what took place was a horrible moment for our country -- a horrible moment.  But there are two sides to the country.".

title: Fact Check: A CIA survey, published by the BBC, has predicted the NDA's defeat in the ongoin...

A: The BBC via an email response said, "This fake survey on the Lok Sabha polls has been circulating on WhatsApp and Facebook, with messages claiming it to be from the BBC News. We'd like to make it absolutely clear that it is fake and does not come from the BBC. The BBC does not support pre-election surveys in India.". 

Q: Did the BBC publish a CIA survey, predicting the NDA's defeat in the Lok Sabha polls ?
A: The URL given in the viral message is correct and takes you to the homepage of BBC. However, there is no such news on the website. We also looked for any such news item of the BBC website with keywords but did not find anything.. 

Q: Does CIA carry out surveys on elections ?
A: No answer could be found..

title: Fact Check: The Russian government has no desire to create problems for the new Ukrainian go...

Q: Is Luhansk part of Russia?

title: Fact Check: There is more bacteria found in a mans beard than in a dogs fur.
text:
Claim: There is more bacteria found in a mans beard than in a dogs fur.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: The number of bacterial load in colony forming units taken from men's beards were more than that in dogs fur 

Evidence:

Q: Who carried out the study?
A: The study was led by a Swiss doctor, Dr Andreas Gutzeit.. 

Q: What was the purpose of the study?
A: To determine whether it would be hygienic to evaluate dogs and humans in the same MRI scanner.. 

Q: How was the experiment carried out ?
A: They compared the bacterial load in colony-forming units (CFU) of human-pathogenic microorganisms in specimens taken from 18 men and 30 dogs. In addition, They compared the extent of bacterial contamination of an MRI scanner shared by dogs and humans with two other MRI scanners used exclusively by humans..

title: Fact Check: You've got millions of families paying 40, 50, 60% of their limited incomes to p...

A: Study estimates from the Harvard Joint Center for Housing Studies, by somewhat defining Cost-Burdened Households into 'Not', 'Moderately' and 'Severly' Burdened by  using income percentage.. 

Q: What was the data for Severely Cost-Burdened Households defined by Harvard Joint Center for Housing Studies at the time of the claim?
A: Figures for 2016 estimated 18,505 million of US homeowners and renters were Severely Cost-Burdened; therefore spending more than 50% of their income on housing alone..

title: Fact Check: According to Rahul Gandhi India's Modi government has made a law which allows th...
text:
Claim: According to Rahul Gandhi India's Modi government has made a law which allows the shooting of tribals.

Verdict: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

Justification: The law allows a forest officer to use necessary force if a person is committing an offence against the Wildlife (Protection) Act. Also, the law hasn't officially passed yet

Evidence:

Q: What law was Rahul Gandhi referencing in his speech?
A: Amendments to the Indian Forest Act 1927. 

Q: What is the Amendments to the Indian Forest Act 1927?
A: An act to provide for conservation, enrichment and sustainable management of forest resources and matters connected therewith to safeguard ecological stability to ensure provision of ecosystem services in perpetuity and to address the concerns related to climate change and international commitments.. 

Q: Does this act allow for the shooting of tribals?
A: Any forest officer, may if necessary, to prevent the commission of any offence under this Act or under the Wildlife (Protection) Act, 1972, or to apprehend any person engaged in the commission of an offence under the said Acts, or who has committed such offence, use as little force including firearms and do as little injury to person and property, as may be consistent with the prevention of the offence..

title: Fact Check: North Carolina has banned and criminalized Islamic Sharia Law
text:
Claim: North Carolina has banned and criminalized Islamic Sharia Law

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: It is not banned, but no foreign law can not be used in state courts.

Evidence:

Q: What is Islamic Sharia Law?
A: All aspects of a Muslim's life are governed by Sharia. Sharia law comes from a combination of sources including the Qur'an (the Muslim holy book), the Hadith (sayings and conduct of the prophet Muhammad) and fatwas (the rulings of Islamic scholars).

Many people, including Muslims, misunderstand Sharia. It's often associated with the amputation of limbs, death by stoning, lashes and other medieval punishments. Because of this, it is sometimes thought of as draconian. Some people in the West view Sharia as archaic and unfair social ideas that are imposed upon people who live in Sharia-controlled countires.. 

Q: Is Sharia law banned in North Carolina?
A: No - it is not banned but no foreign law can not be used in state courts. 
In recognition that the United States Constitution and the Constitution of North Carolina
constitute the supreme law of this State, the General Assembly hereby declares it to be the
public policy of this State to protect its citizens from the application of foreign law that would
result in the violation of a fundamental constitutional right of a natural person. The public
policies expressed in this section shall apply only to actual or foreseeable violations of a
fundamental constitutional right resulting from the application of the foreign law..

title: Fact Check: The enumeration clause of the US Constitution speaks to the count of every indiv...
text:
Claim: The enumeration clause of the US Constitution speaks to the count of every individual and not just Americans, not just citizens. It’s everyone."

Verdict: Supported

Justification: Evidence finds this claim to be true; resident population counts include both citizens and non-citizens who are living in the US at the time of the census.

Evidence:

Q: Who is counted in the census?
A: The resident population counts include all people (citizens and non-citizens) who are living in the United States at the time of the census.. 

Q: Are non-citizens included in Census counts?
A: The resident population counts include all people (citizens and non-citizens) who are living in the United States at the time of the census.. 

Q: What is the enumeration clause?
A: The Enumeration Clause delegates authority to the United States, and requires the United States, to conduct an enumeration, i.e., an actual head-count, of the populations of the states (not the populations of non-state areas), once every ten years; and requires the United States to allocate seats in the House of Representatives according to the counted population;.

That all elections ought to be free and without corruption, and that all voters, having a sufficient, evident, common interest with, and attachment to the community, have a right to elect officers, and be elected into office, agreeably to the regulations made in this constitution..

title: Fact Check: India's Congress President Rahul Gandhi has apologised to India's Supreme Court ...
text:
Claim: India's Congress President Rahul Gandhi has apologised to India's Supreme Court for saying Chowkidar Chor Hai  in relation to the Rafale aircraft deal.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: the answers show that  President Rahul Gandhi  has apologised to the supreme court in this matter. 

Evidence:

Q: In what context did India's Congress President Rahul Gandhi say he made the statement: Chowkidar Chor Hai?
A: On 10.04.2019, at the time of and in my statement, the issues relating to court proceedings unfortunately got juxtaposed and mingled with a political slogan being used extensively by answering Respondent's party as well as answering Respondent for the last several months, which is a matter of intense and frenzied public debate during the ongoing Lok Sabha elections. That slogan is "Chowkidar Chor Hai".. 

Q: What did India's Congress President Rahul Gandhi apologise to the Supreme Court for?
A: Rahul Gandhi’s expression of regret to the Supreme Court was in the context of the Congress President having falsely ascribed the term ‘Chowkidar Chor Hai’ to the top court.. 

Q: What did Rahul Gandhi apologize to the supreme court for
A: Congress President Rahul Gandhi expressed "regret" in the Supreme Court on Monday over his remarks in connection with the Rafale judgment, which the apex court had said was "incorrectly attributed" to it, saying it was made in the "heat of political campaigning".

The apex court on April 15 had given a categorical clarification that in its Rafale verdict there was no occasion for it to make a mention of the contemptuous observation that "chowkidar Narendra Modi chor hain" as has been attributed to it by Gandhi.

title: Fact Check: Elizabeth Warren says she warned about the financial crisis before it happened
text:
Claim: Elizabeth Warren says she warned about the financial crisis before it happened

Verdict: Supported

Justification: Supported via multiple QA pairs.

Evidence:

Q: When did Elizabeth Warren warn about the crisis of the 2000s
A: In January 2007, she testified before the Senate Committee on Banking, Housing and  Urban Affairs about how the housing market was broken and could hurt consumers. 

Q: Which factors help cause the financial crisis of the 2000s
A: In the fall of 2008, our economy faced challenges on a scale not seen since the Great Depression. The crisis was caused by many factors. Among them were an unsustainable housing boom fueled in part by the easy availability of mortgages, financial institutions taking on too much risk, and the rapid growth of the nation’s financial system with regulations that were designed for a different era. Forces built up over many years until the crisis reached its apex in September of 2008.. 

Q: Did Elizabeth Warren warn against the financial crisis?
A: Yes. In a New York Times article in October 2005, the article said, "Professor Warren of Harvard believes that disaster lurks as homeowners borrow against their homes to forestall bankruptcy. When the stock market tumbled five years ago, people in trouble could sell stocks to stay afloat, she said. But home equity doesn't work the same way. As she put it, "You can't sell a part of your home like you could a stock in the stock market bubble."

title: Fact Check: With repeated use of vaccines, cell-mediated immunity weakens, encouraging viral...
text:
Claim: With repeated use of vaccines, cell-mediated immunity weakens, encouraging viral mutations, and future infections of the cells.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The question is too closely related to the claim, therefore it is quite biased. it seems from the answer, that the cells will not be weakened by vaccination. These two events are independent. Therefore, the claim is refuted

Evidence:

Q: With repeated use of vaccines, does the cell-mediated immunity weakens, encouraging viral mutations, and future infections of the cells?
A: Vaccination protects people from natural infection mainly by stimulating the humoral immune response and establishing immunological memory against a specific pathogen. This enables the body to respond swiftly and effectively upon encountering a natural infection by that pathogen in future. However, this does not come at the expense of cell-mediated immunity, which remains robust and active after vaccination..

title: Fact Check: The South African Government have recently built 4 million houses.
text:
Claim: The South African Government have recently built 4 million houses.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The source in the first answer shows that 3 263 331 were built in 24 years so the claim is refuted as the number is below 4 million. 24 years is not classed as recently either.

Evidence:

Q: How many houses has the South African Government delivered in South Africa ?
A: 1. 2018/19 figures are for 9 months only (April to Dec 2018) and are preliminary;
2. EEDBS* (or DBS): Enhanced Extended Discount Benefit Scheme refers to the Housing Programme
that provides state subsidies to repair / rehabilitate and even demolish & re‐build where necessary,
Govt (rental) houses built before 1994 and then transfer houses into the ownership of legitimate occupants.
3. In some years, such as 2014/15, 2016/17 and 2017/18, the numbers for EEDBS were removed after
verification processes from the figure for Units as they are to be counted only under the EEDBS programme.
4. Twenty Year totals are still: Serviced Sites Houses/ Units Total H/O
903 543 2 835 275 3 738 818. 

Q: How many people own property in South Africa ?
A: Between 2002 and 2015, the percentage of households that lived in formal dwellings and whose dwellings
were fully owned increased from 52,9% to 53,8% while the percentage of partially owned dwellings
declined from 15,5% to 9,7%. About 13,6% of households had ‘other’ forms of tenure arrangements in
2015.
More than three-quarters (78,1%) of South African households lived in formal dwellings, followed by 14,1%
who lived in informal dwellings, and 6,9% in traditional dwellings. The highest concentration of households
in Limpopo (90,5%) lived in formal dwellings, followed by the households in Northern Cape (86,1%). The
highest percentage of informal dwellings were found in North West (22%) and Gauteng (21%).
At the time of the survey, 14,4% of South African households were living in ‘RDP’ or state-subsidised
dwellings. A higher percentage of female-headed (18%) than male-headed households (12%) received a
government housing subsidy. Some residents have, however, raised concerns about the quality of
subsidised houses and 14,2% said that the walls were weak or very weak while 13,8% regarded the
dwellings’ roofs as weak or very weak..

title: Fact Check: People catching and spreading chickenpox have been vaccinated.
text:
Claim: People catching and spreading chickenpox have been vaccinated.

Verdict: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

Justification: This claim has cherry picked evidence. According to the QA pairs, it is possible to get chickenpox after being vaccinated as it has a 97% efficency rate (3% chance). It also seems that the vaccination helped lessen side effects of chickenpox if caught, e.g. deaths among those 50 years old and younger, decreased by 75% or more. This claim is true in the fact that people can catch and spread chickenpox despite being vaccinated, however a lot of positive factors are left out of the claim. Therefore, this claim was cherry-picked evidence.

Evidence:

Q: Can you catch chicken pox after vaccination?
A: Yes. A case-control study conducted from 1997 to 2003 showed that 1 dose of vaccine was 97% effective in the first year after vaccination and 86% effective in the second year. From the second to eighth year after vaccination, the vaccine effectiveness remained stable at 81 to 86%.

Q: After the vaccine for chickenpox rolled out did cases drop?
A: Yes. From 1995 to 2001, chickenpox hospitalizations declined by 72 percent and deaths, among those 50 years old and younger, decreased by 75% or more.

title: Fact Check: Ramaphosa promised to build 1 million in Alexandra.
text:
Claim: Ramaphosa promised to build 1 million in Alexandra.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Ramaphosa does promise to built 1 million houses but across the whole country not in Alexandra. 

Evidence:

Q: Has President Ramaphosa promised to build 1 million houses in Alex?
A: The million houses issue in Alex is a huge distortion. The ANC government intends to build 1 million over the next 5 years throughout the country. Every province will be given a target that they must meet. This is something that I would like to see and it is possible.. 

Q: Has the South African government ever delivered 1 million housing units within 5 years?
A: Looking within 1994/95 to 1998/99, 1999/2000 to 2003/04, 2004/05 to 2008/09, 2009/10 to 2013/14 and 2014/15 to 2018/19*. None of the five consecutive years have seen the construction of one million housing units. The highest 5-year period to see the most housing units built was in the years 1999/2000 to 2003/2004, which saw 758,342 houses built..

title: Fact Check: Since 2011, there has been documentation of 1,671 dead bodies recovered in Texas...
text:

Verdict: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

Justification: The US Border Patrol figures show many more than 1,671 deaths but it's unclear how this relates to "dead bodies recovered".
Many were found in Brooks County, that part seems true.

Evidence:

Q: Are official figures of deaths published by US Government?
A: Yes. Official figures are published on the U.S Customs and Border patrol website.

Q: Are more deaths reported in  Brooks county than other areas of Texas?
A: in 2012 Texas surpassed Arizona in deaths, with the majority occurring in the Rio Grande Valley and more specifically in Brooks, County, Texas (USBP, 2012).. 

Q: what is the number of dead immgrants found in the usa-meico border
A: No comprehensive estimates exist on the number of injuries or deaths that occur along the border but  As of April 15, 2011, 145 bodies had been recovered in the graves, as families throughout Mexico wait to find out if their loved ones are among the dead.[.

title: Fact Check: There have been zero reported instances of any child born alive after an abortio...
text:
Claim: There have been zero reported instances of any child born alive after an abortion in Texas.

Verdict: Not Enough Evidence

Justification: There is not enough evidence as there is no data on the number of infant death certificates issued in Texas 

Evidence:

Q: How many instances were there of a baby born alive after abortion between 2003 and 2014?
A: 143 infants. 

Q: How many infant death certificates in the US mention abortion/termination of pregnancy?
A: Infant deaths for the 12 year period 2003 – 2014 assigned to code ICD-10 code P96.4 – Termination of pregnancy, affecting fetus and newborn were reviewed.
143 (24.3%) could definitively be classified as involving an induced termination. 

Q: Does the US collects data on abortions?
A: Yes. Since 1969, CDC has conducted abortion surveillance to document the number and characteristics of women obtaining legal induced abortions in the United States.
Each year, CDC requests abortion data from the central health agencies of 52 reporting areas (the 50 states, the District of Columbia, and New York City).

title: Fact Check: Bumblebee has officially been added to the ever-growing list of endangered speci...
text:
Claim: Bumblebee has officially been added to the ever-growing list of endangered species

Verdict: Supported

Justification: Q&A 1 shows that yes the Bumblebee was added to the list of endangered species as claimed. But although only a single certain species of bumblebee  not all 'bumblebees' but the claim only says bumblebee not all, so it is supportive enough.

Evidence:

Q: Is the bumblebee an endangered species?
A: Yes. On January 11, 2017, the Fish and Wildlife Service published a rule to list the rusty patched bumble bee (Bombus affinis), a species that occurs in the eastern and Midwestern United States and Ontario, Canada, as an endangered species under the Endangered Species Act of 1973, as amended (16 U.S.C. 1531 et seq.). The rule was to be effective on February 10, 2017.

Q: When is a species considered as endangered?
A: The conservation status of a species indicates the likelihood that it will become extinct. Multiple factors are considered when assessing the status of a species; e.g., such statistics as the number remaining, the overall increase or decrease in the population over time, breeding success rates, or known threats.[4] The IUCN Red List of Threatened Species is the best-known worldwide conservation status listing and ranking system.[5]

Over 50% of the world's species are estimated to be at risk of extinction.[6] Internationally, 195 countries have signed an accord to create Biodiversity Action Plans that will protect endangered and other threatened species. In the United States, such plans are usually called Species Recovery Plans.. 

Q: What role do bees play in the ecosystem?
A: More than 75 percent of the world's food crops rely to some extent on pollination for yield and quality. The absence of bees and other pollinators would wipe out coffee, apples, almonds, tomatoes and cocoa, to name just a few of the crops that rely on pollination.
 
"Each one of us has an individual responsibility towards protecting bees and we should all make pollinator-friendly choices. Even growing flowers at home to feed bees contributes to this effort," Graziano da Silva said.

Pollinators, such as bees, wild bees, birds, bats, butterflies and beetles fly, hop and crawl over flowers to help plants fertilize. Pollinator numbers and diversity have declined in the past decades, and evidence indicates that the decline is primarily a consequence of human activities including climate change which can disrupt flowering seasons..

title: Fact Check: The War Powers Act has been invoked for the first time.
text:
Claim: The War Powers Act has been invoked for the first time.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: Answers direct match claim

Evidence:

Q: Did the US Congress resolve to end US involvement in Saudi Arabia's war in Yemen?
A: Yes. Congress has given final approval on a resolution to end American military assistance for Saudi Arabia’s war in Yemen.

Q: Has the US War Powers Act ever been invoked?
A: Yes. April 2019 marks the first time Congress has invoked the 1973 War Powers Act to curb the executive’s power to take the country into a conflict without congressional approval. It is aimed at ending US involvement in the long-running Yemen conflict.

title: Fact Check: The United States has "three families owning more wealth than the bottom half of...
text:

Q: How much are  Bill Gates, Jeff Bezos and Warren Buffet worth combined?
A: Based on a 2017 report, the three wealthiest Americans — Bill Gates, Jeff Bezos and Warren Buffett — together were worth $248.5 billion.. 

Q: What is the total net worth of the bottom 50% of the USA Population?
A: The wealth of the bottom 160 million people (the bottom half) was $245 billion..

NYH would be financed through a new trust with money from the federal government (in place of federal financing for current health programs, if federal waivers are approved), current state health care funding, and two new progressively graduated state taxes: a payroll tax paid jointly by employers (80 percent) and employees (20 percent) and a tax on nonpayroll income.

Q: Why can Amazon avoid paying federal income tax?
A: CNN explains that the U.S. tax code allows companies that lose money to reduce their future taxable income. That has worked in Amazon's favor because its past has been marked with billions of dollars in losses and some of its profits come from global sources not subject to the U.S. tax code, the network explains..

text:

Consequently, I hereby direct that all Officials of the National and County governments that are adversely mentioned in this report, whether you are a Cabinet Secretary, Principal Secretary, or Chief Executive of a state institution, to immediately step aside pending conclusion of the investigations of the allegations against them."

title: Fact Check: The Kenyan law states that if you are allocated a piece of land you must develop...
text:
Claim: The Kenyan law states that if you are allocated a piece of land you must develop it within two years or it reverts to the government.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: The claim states that when someone in Kenya is given land from the government they must develop that land within 2 years, Q&A pair 2 confirms that the government of Kenya does give out land and Q&A 3 states that is must be developed within 2 years or revert back to the government ( although this is rarely implemented it says) but still true.

Evidence:

Q: What act regulates the allocation of public land?
A: The Land Act sets out how public land can be allocated to private individuals, businesses and foreign governments.

“Where the land allocated … is not developed in accordance with the terms and conditions stipulated in the lease, that land shall automatically revert back to the national or county government, as the case may be,” the law says.. 

Q: Must the land allocated, be developed?
A: Yes. “The presumption is that when you are given [public] land you must put it into good use as stipulated in the lease agreement. That is what guides the transaction,” David Mufuayia of land rights lobby the Kenya Land Alliance told Africa Check.

For example, public land provided under the export processing zone law must be developed within two years.

Q: Is this always applied across the board?
A: No. it is not always this clear cut. “It is very difficult to apply [the two-year-rule] across the board, because the land is normally leased specific to the use,” said Ibrahim Mwathane, chair of the Land Development and Governance Institute.

“The government would normally attach a whole lot of conditions on a lease, and one would need to look at those conditions and decide whether they have been complied with or contravened.” Mwathane is also a columnist on land issues for the country’s Daily Nation newspaper.

title: Fact Check: Kenyan deputy president William Ruto asked six ministers in the last term (2015 ...

Q: Were any Kenyan ministers asked to step aside in the 2015-19 term of office?
A: Yes. Today, I take the extra-ordinary step of attaching the afore-mentioned confidential report from the CEO of the Ethics and Anti Corruption Commission as an annex to my annual report on Values to Parliament.

(b) Consequently, I hereby direct that all Officials of the National and County governments that are adversely mentioned in this report, whether you are a Cabinet Secretary, Principal Secretary, or Chief Executive of a state institution, to immediately step aside pending conclusion of the investigations of the allegations against them.

Q: Were any government officials suspended?
A: Yes. President Uhuru Kenyatta Saturday suspended Cabinet Secretaries Kazungu Kambi (Labour), Michael Kamau (Transport), Davis Chirchir (Energy) and Felix Koskei (Agriculture) after being named in EACC report.

Q: Did any other government officials leave government?
A: Yes. Anne Waiguru, who until Saturday served as the Devolution Cabinet Secretary, has finally bowed to public pressure to resign.

title: Fact Check: None of the allegations made against Kenyan government ministers in 2015 made it...

A: Kenyan President Uhuru Kenyatta has suspended four cabinet ministers and 12 other high-ranking officials after they were implicated in corrupt deals. The suspended cabinet secretaries are Felix Kosgey (Agriculture), Davis Chirchir (Energy), Michael Kamau (Transport) and Kazungu Kambi (Labour).. 

Q: Have any of the Kenyan government ministers against whom allegations were made, been charged in court?
A: The High Court has ordered suspended Transport Cabinet Secretary Eng Michael Kamau to appear before the Ethics and Anti-Corruption Court on Thursday morning in relation to the graft charges leveled against him.
Eng Kamau faces charges of abuse of office due to allegations of his involvement in irregular awarding of a Ksh 33 million shillings tender for the redesigning of Kamukuywa-Kaptama-Kapsokwony-Sirisia road in Western Kenya.. 

Q: Out of the dropped Kenyan ministers, who has gone to court over allegations leveled against them?
A: The appellant Eng. Michael Sistu Mwaura Kamau, who at the material time was the Cabinet Secretary for Transport and Infrastructure..

title: Fact Check: Kenya’s deputy president, Ruto, asked six ministers in the last term to step asi...
text:
Claim: Kenya’s deputy president, Ruto, asked six ministers in the last term to step aside.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: there were six people who were either asked to step aside, forced to leave or who left under pressure. 

Evidence:

Q: Were ministers in the last term asked to step aside?
A: Yes. In a 2015 state of the nation address, President Uhuru Kenyatta asked that "...all Officials of the National and County governments that are adversely mentioned in this report, whether you are a Cabinet Secretary, Principal Secretary, or Chief Executive of a state institution, to immediately step aside pending conclusion of the investigations of the allegations against them. "

Q: How many ministers were suspended by the president's office?
A: Four cabinet secretaries were suspended: Kazungu Kambi (Labour), Michael Kamau (Transport), Davis Chirchir (Energy) and Felix Koskei (Agriculture).. 

Q: Did any cabinet members step down?
A: Yes. Suspended Lands Cabinet Secretary Charity Ngilu yesterday walked out of her Ardhi House office, claiming that powerful individuals had succeeded in pushing for her inclusion in the graft list submitted to President Uhuru Kenyatta by Ethics and Anti Corruption Commission ( EACC).

title: Fact Check: Kenya’s deputy president Ruto said “None of [the dropped ministers] even made it...
text:
Claim: Kenya’s deputy president Ruto said “None of [the dropped ministers] even made it to court because the allegations that were made [against them] did not have any basis.”

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Both of the ministers were acquitted by the ethics agency. Later on, Kamau was taken to court in April 2019. And he was charged with violating procurement laws. While Charity Ngilu was charged with obstructing commission officials from investigating the 134-acre Karen land scandal.

Evidence:

Q: Is it true that None of Kenya's dropped ministers made it to court because the allegations that were made [against them] did not have any basis?
A: They were both acquitted after successfully challenging the composition of the ethics agency. But Kamau was back in court in April 2019, on the same charges.. 

Q: Out of the dropped ministers, were there any who were charged and taken to court?
A: Yes. Former Transport Cabinet Secretary Michael Kamau was charged with violating procurement laws.

Q: Was Charity Ngilu, a former land minister, acquitted?
A: A criminal case against former Lands Cabinet Secretary Charity Ngilu touching on the Sh8 billion Karen land has been terminated.

The court on Monday dropped the case following a Court of Appeal order that declared the trial unconstitutional..

title: Fact Check: Like every budget passed by the Senate since Dan Patrick has been lieutenant gov...
text:
Claim: Like every budget passed by the Senate since Dan Patrick has been lieutenant governor, Senate Bill 1 is within the spending limit set by the Texas Constitution.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: confirmed with : House Bill 1 is within all of these limits from QA pair..

Evidence:

Q: Is the Senate Bill 1 within the spending limit of the Texas constitution
A: The Texas Constitution includes four limitations on state
spending:
• Debt limit
• Welfare spending limit
• Pay-as-you-go limit
• Limit on the growth of certain appropriations (a.k.a.
spending limit)
House Bill 1 is within all of these limits.

title: Fact Check: Housing costs are crushing the middle class. Over 11 million Americans are spend...
text:
Claim: Housing costs are crushing the middle class. Over 11 million Americans are spending more than half of their income on housing.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: It seems from the 2nd QA that many Americans are indeed paying half of their income on housing. Therefore, the claim is supported

Evidence:

Q: What did Kamalla Harris say about American democracy?
A: This is an example of a line that appears to have been tweaked in response to a fact check. Harris used to say that “over 11 million Americans spend more than half of what they make on rent,” adding that “this means less money for other necessities like bus fares, groceries, heat and medicine.”. 

Q: How many Americans spend more than half of their income on housing?
A: More than 11 million renter households, most with incomes below the poverty line, pay more than half their income for housing..

title: Fact Check: Hyderabad Police seized Rs 8 crore cash withdrawn from BJP’s bank account.
text:
Claim: Hyderabad Police seized Rs 8 crore cash withdrawn from BJP’s bank account.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: The claim as it stands is supported by the second Q&A. 

Evidence:

Q: Has money ever been seized from the BJP?
A: Yes. Money has been seized multiple times from BJP workers - numerous of times.

Q: How much withdrawn money has been seized from BJP’s bank account?
A: A cheque to withdraw Rs 8 crore in cash was signed by the BJP’s state president K. Laxman and was later seized by the Hyderabad police..

title: Fact Check: William Shakespeare wrote “I always feel happy, you know why? Because I don’t ex...
text:
Claim: William Shakespeare wrote “I always feel happy, you know why? Because I don’t expect anything from anyone. Expectations always hurt. Life is short, so love your life, be happy. And keep smiling. Just live for yourself and before you speak, listen. Before you write, think. Before you spend, earn. Before you pray, forgive. Before you hurt, feel. Before you quit, try. Before you die, live.”

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: A similar quote is attributed to William Arthur Ward 

Evidence:

Q: Did William Shakespeare write, “I always feel happy, you know why? Because I don’t expect anything from anyone. Expectations always hurt. Life is short, so love your life, be happy. And keep smiling. Just live for yourself and before you speak, listen. Before you write, think. Before you spend, earn. Before you pray, forgive. Before you hurt, feel. Before you quit, try. Before you die, live.”?
A: No match found. 

Q: Is there a similar quote from someone else?
A: Yes. Before you speak, listen.
Before you write, think.
Before you spend, earn.
Before you invest, investigate.
Before you criticize, wait.
Before you pray, forgive.
Before you quit, try.
Before you retire, save.
Before you die, give.

William Arthur Ward

title: Fact Check: Russian President Vladimir Putin has said more than once that for settling the c...
text:
Claim: Russian President Vladimir Putin has said more than once that for settling the conflict in Donbass the most important thing is not dialogue with Moscow, because Moscow is not a party to this conflict. It is an intra-Ukrainian conflict and it is up to the Ukrainians to settle it, if they talk to each other."

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The claim is not a quote verification but about whether Russia (Moscow) played a role in the Donbass conflict. However, Moscow always plays an important role in the Ukrainian conflict.

Evidence:

Q: Has Putin/Russia said more than once that for settling the conflict in Donbass the most important thing is not dialogue with Moscow, because Moscow is not a party to this conflict. It is an intra-Ukrainian conflict and it is up to the Ukrainians to settle it, if they talk to each other."
A: “We are ready to explain to any Ukrainian citizen that Russia is not occupying any Ukrainian territories and generally there can be no talk about that," the Kremlin spokesman said.. 

Q: Did Russia trigger the Ukrainian invasion of Donbass?
A: Russian national Igor Strelkov, a former commander of pro-Moscow separatists in eastern Ukraine, has claimed personal responsibility for unleashing the conflict in which 4,300 people have been killed since April.

"I was the one who pulled the trigger of this war," Strelkov said in an interview published Thursday with Russia's Zavtra newspaper, which espouses imperialist views.

"If our unit hadn't crossed the border, everything would have fizzled out — like in [the Ukrainian city of] Kharkiv, like in Odessa," Strelkov, who uses that nom-de-guerre meaning "Shooter" to replace his last name Girkin, was quoted as saying.. 

Q: Has Russia denied being a party to the conflict in eastern Ukraine?
A: Yes. Russia says no proof it sent troops, arms to east Ukraine.

A: No answer could be found.. 

Q: Which economic projects were done by Senator Buttigieg in South Bend Indiana to reduce the unemployment rate
A: Building of a Casino in South Bend.

title: Fact Check: The 2008 United States election was the first election in which voters of color ...
text:
Claim: The 2008 United States election was the first election in which voters of color comprised over 25 percent of the electorate, and that number is going up.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: In 2008, Records have shown that over 25 percent of the electorate comprised of voters of color. Subsequently the figures keeps getting higher. 

Evidence:

Q: What was the percentage of black voters in the last elections?
A: Strong minority and black voter turnout made a difference in electing the first African-American president in 2008 and again in 2012. But without Obama on the ticket in 2016, the black turnout rate fell for the first time in 20 years in a presidential election, Pew found, down to 59 percent.. 

Q: What was the percentage of minority eligible voters in 2008?
A: 26.6 percent. 

Q: What was the percentage of minority eligible voters in 2012?
A: 28.9 percent.

title: Fact Check: African-American women inmates in Caifornia prisons are sterilized to cut welfar...
text:
Claim: African-American women inmates in Caifornia prisons are sterilized to cut welfare costs in California.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: There is evidence given that African-American woman have been sterilised it also shows that asian and hispanic woman were included in the counts. This appears to be happening illegally, a law in the 1970s made it illegal to pressure anyone to be sterilised or ask for it during labor and childbirth, as evidence has been found that doctors are still operating without consent from the state then one should probably assume that if that is the case the state has not given directives for it to happen and therefore it’s untrue that the official reason would be to cut welfare costs in California.

Evidence:

Q: Were women in California sterilized without consent
A: The Center for Investigative Reporting has found doctors under contract with the California Department of Corrections and Rehabilitation sterilized nearly 150 female inmates from 2006 to 2010 without the required state approvals. 

Q: Were all women sterilized in the California prisons between 2006 and 2010 of African-American descent
A: There were Asian and Hispanic women in the mix. 

Q: Were the women sterilized legally by the state in an attempt to save welfare cost
A: A number of policies in the 1970s  made it illegal to pressure anyone to be sterilized or ask for consent during labor or childbirth and the doctors were operating without consent from the state.

title: Fact Check: NATO Caused the Crisis in Libya with terrorism, weapons smuggling and illegal im...
text:
Claim: NATO Caused the Crisis in Libya with terrorism, weapons smuggling and illegal immigration beginning after the 2011 NATO intervention.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: NATO intervention took place 1 month after the crisis is deemed to have started based on the answers provided in the QA Pairs.

Crisis started: 15th Feb 2011.

NATO involvement: 19th March 2011.

Evidence:

Q: When did Libya's civil war start?
A: The First Libyan Civil War was an armed conflict in 2011...It erupted with the Libyan Revolution, also known as the 17 February Revolution.  The war was preceded by protests in Zawiya on 8 August 2009 and finally ignited by protests in Benghazi beginning on Tuesday, 15 February 2011. 

Q: When did NATO become involved in the Libyan situation?
A: On 19 March 2011, a multi-state NATO-led coalition began a military intervention in Libya, to implement United Nations Security Council Resolution 1973, in response to events during the First Libyan Civil War.. 

Q: What does the Libyan Crisis refer to?
A: The Libyan Crisis refers to the current humanitarian crisis and political-military instability occurring in Libya, beginning with the Arab Spring protests of 2011, which led to a civil war, foreign military intervention....

title: Fact Check: Prime Minister Scott Morrison says an electric vehicle can't tow a boat or trail...
text:
Claim: Prime Minister Scott Morrison says an electric vehicle can't tow a boat or trailer.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: the claim reads like a quote verification, using it to confirm if electric vehicles can't tow, this is untrue. They can tow. 

Evidence:

Q: Do electric vehicles have towing capacity
A: If they have been tested and approved for towing, electric cars actually excel at pulling heavy loads, with instant torque, powerful acceleration and smooth power output making them a great choice for towing caravans and trailers.. 

Q: which electric car has been approved for towing
A: At the moment, the only fully-electric car on the market that can tow is the Tesla Model X, which has been developed to make it as capable as any other SUV. With a 2,700kg towing weight, the Model X can tow heavy caravans, but you should know that the quoted 270-mile range will be affected by towing heavy loads.. 

Q: Are there plenty of vehicles that have a high towing capacity?
A: Electric motors are also increasingly being used in shipping, again because of their ability to push large loads.

For over a decade electric motors have been used in mining trucks, sometimes with a capacity greater than 100 tonnes, due to their powerful, instant torque and ability to pull large loads at slow speeds..

title: Fact Check: Forty percent of Americans say they don’t have enough cash to cover a $400 emerg...
text:

of U.S. Households in 2017.

Q: According to the US federal reserve report on the Economic Well-Being
of U.S. Households in 2017, how many Americans say they have enough cash to cover a $400 emergency spending?
A: Four in 10 adults, if faced with an unexpected
expense of $400, would either not be able to cover
it or would cover it by selling something or borrowing money.. 

Q: When was the latest issued US federal reserve report on the Economic Well-Being
of U.S. Households prior to the date of the claim (April 2019)?
A: May 2018..

title: Fact Check: Kenyatta's aggressive push of the universal access to basic education agenda has...
text:
Claim: Kenyatta's aggressive push of the universal access to basic education agenda has as of 2019 seen Kenya achieve 100% transition rate

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The transition rate is 93.14% rather than 100%.

Evidence:

Q: Did Kenyatta's aggressive push of the universal access to basic education agenda achieved a 100% transition rate in 2019 ?
A: A recent education ministry report puts the rate at 93.14% on 22 February 2019. In March Amina Mohammed, then the cabinet secretary for education, tweeted that the transition rate was “93% and rising”.. 

Q: What is the cause of the gradual rise on the Kenyatta's universal access to basic education agenda,    in 2019 ?
A: The rise from 83.1% to 93.14% can be attributed to the free-day high school subsidy, and the work of provincial administration – chiefs and their assistants – to ensure all students who sit their final primary school exam get into secondary school. This is according to Amos Kaburu from Uwezo, a literacy and numeracy programme at Twaweza East Africa.

Dr John Mugo, who has researched education in Kenya, said that while the transition rate had risen, it was unlikely to have reached 100%..

A: he Government of Kenya (GoK) has committed to deliver a series of ambitious social programs to promote long-term economic development for Kenyan citizens through its Big Four agenda: (1) affordable housing; (2) universal health coverage; (3) enhancing manufacturing; and (4) food security and nutrition.

The housing pillar in the Big Four agenda will facilitate the development of 500,000 low cost homes, together with the supporting infrastructure, using innovative funding mechanisms and technologies by 2022 (“Affordable Housing Programme” or “AHP”). The State Department of Housing and Urban Development (“SDHUD”) is championing the realization of the AHP through establishment of a robust project delivery and financing framework that will leverage on private sector funding.

SDHUD is inviting interested and eligible Strategic Partners, including developers, investors, financiers, and/or consortiums, both local and international, with expertise in development of affordable mass housing to undertake projects under the AHP within the cycle period 2018 – 2022 through a Specially Permitted Procurement Method. Interested parties should be well versed with the AHP Development Framework Guidelines (DFGs), the list of projects in the AHP Project Pipeline, as well as the guidelines and requirements set forth in the Instructions to AHP Call for Applications for Strategic Partners, available on the SDHUD website at www.housingandurban.go.ke/affordable-housing as well as the Affordable Housing Portal at www.bomayangu.go.ke/ahp. Interested parties are advised to familiarize themselves with these documents as they form part of the requirements for submission and evaluation..

title: Fact Check: Not all North Caroline teachers get a duty free lunch break.
text:
Claim: Not all North Caroline teachers get a duty free lunch break.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: It seems the current legislation has a goal of providing a duty free lunch break instead of guaranteeing it. 

Evidence:

Q: What is the current law in North Carolina about lunch breaks for teachers?
A: The current ACT TO PROVIDE FOR INSTRUCTIONAL PLANNING TIME AND A
DUTY-FREE LUNCH PERIOD FOR TEACHERS (2005) says every school "shall include a plan to provide a duty-free lunch period for every
teacher on a daily basis or as otherwise approved by the school
improvement team,  and
(7) Shall include a plan to provide duty-free instructional planning time
for every teacher under G.S. 115C-301.1, with the goal of providing an
average of at least five hours of planning time per week.. 

Q: Are there plans to guarantee NC teachers a duty free lunch break?
A: Yes. House Bill 563 (Public) Filed Tuesday, April 2, 2019 proposes an amendment to require that all full-time assigned classroom teachers employed by public schools or schools receiving State funds be provided with at least 30 minutes of duty-free lunch time on a daily basis during regular student contact hours.

title: Fact Check: The UAE has banned three-month tourist visas for Nigerians
text:
Claim: The UAE has banned three-month tourist visas for Nigerians

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: While restrictions are being imposed there is no mention of a ban on 3 month tourist visas for Nigerians visiting UAE.

Evidence:

Q: What is the tourist Visa requirements for Nigerians, in UAE ?
A: The Embassy in Abu Dhabi and Consulate in Dubai of Nigeria requires that all applicants applying for Nigerian Visa in the UAE is mandatory to submit their application to OIS Office in JLT, Dubai
All Visa applications must be submitted by the applicant in person.
Applicants are NOT to go to the Embassy or Consulate unless they are called for an interview.

THE GENERAL PUBLIC IS HEREBY INFORMED THAT BIOMETRICS VISA ENROLLMENT WILL COMMENCE FULLY ON 15TH NOVEMBER 2017. ALL APPLICANTS ARE EXPECTED TO COME IN ON APPOINTMENT DATE WITH THEIR DOCUMENTS FOR VISA APPLICATIONS AND BIOMETRICS. BOOK APPOINTMENT AT OIS SERVICES APPOINTMENT BOOKING SITE BEFORE COMING. KINDLY PRESENT THE APPOINTMENT BOOKING SLIP WHEN YOU COME TO SUBMIT YOUR APPLICATION.

IMPORTANT NOTES:

NON EMIRATI PASSPORT HOLDER`S OR NATIONALITY WHERE NIGERIA DOES NOT MAINTAIN A MISSION MUST SUBMIT EVIDENCE OF LEGAL STAY OR RESIDENCE IN THE UAE.

OTHERWISE, THEY ARE ADVISED TO OBTAIN THEIR VISAS FROM COUNTRIES OF ORIGIN.

Note: Application not supported by all the requirements will not be accepted by the Nigerian Embassy/Consulate.

Multiple permits/visas are issued at the discretion of the Visas Officer


Kindly note, once the applicant decided to withdraw their passport in the time that the application is still under processing for Nigerian Visa the application will be closed and canceled completely. The withdrawal request may take up to 2-3 business days to complete and that all the Visa fee online, Agency fee and processing fee is Non- refundable. The applicant needs to send the Request letter attached to this email infodubai@oisservices.com.

All letters must be addressed to the proper processing center selected in the online application form.

For The Embassy of Nigeria Abu Dhabi address the letters to:
The Ambassador
Nigerian Embassy
Abu Dhabi, UAE.

For The Consulate of Nigeria Dubai address the letters to:
The Consul General
Consulate of Nigeria
Dubai, UAE.. 

Q: Why was there a visa restriction on Nigerians ?
A: Last month, the government of the United Arab Emirates (UAE) imposed visa restrictions on Nigerians; according to the new policy, only Nigerians who are 40 years and above can travel to the UAE for business, tourism or any other private visit.

Before now, young Nigerians troop to UAE, particularly Dubai for different purposes.
Some go their to relax; some travel there just because they want to have their previously-unstamped international passports stamped; some travel there for business, among others. It is even not uncommon to find a group of friends fixing Dubai as the destination of their next social gathering.

Our politicians also have choice properties in this Arab state, but with the new immigration policy, only people who are 40 years and above can visit the UAE now, although the authorities gave certain conditions for people who are less than 40 years old who want to visit.

When I first heard of this new policy, I knew Nigerians have ‘spoilt’ this Arab country as well.
In 1988, I was travelling to India and had a stop-over in Dubai; the place was nothing to write home at that time, but now, less than 30 years later, Nigerians of all ages troop to Dubai for different purposes. It is just so unfortunate that while we have regressed, they have progressed.

Why have our leaders chosen to enrich themselves only at the expense of the people?; Why have we failed to develop? Where are all the money we have made selling oil, and yet cannot boast more than $30billion in foreign reserves?

We will continue to be treated with disdain in other parts of the world if we don’t develop our country.
Other countries will never respect us if we cant live in our country, and instead prefer to travel for greener pastures outside.
It is so painful today seeing Nigerians in even less-developed countries ekeing out a living.
I hope we can wake up on time before we experience more foreign insults.

Dr Tajudeen Alalade,
Ilorin, Kwara state.
