Q&A 2 and 3  states the ingredients are only used in production of some vaccines, which gives an impression they are not in the final injected product, 

Evidence:

Q: When would a reaction occur for these substances?
A: When someone is severely allergic. 

Q: Is gentamicin Sulphate found in vaccines?
A: It is an antibiotic and used in the production of vaccines to stop bacteria growing in them.

Because of this, only trace amounts of these can end up in vaccines. 

Q: Is polymyxin B found in vaccines?
A: It is an antibiotic and used in the production of vaccines to stop bacteria growing in them.

Because of this, only trace amounts of these can end up in vaccines.

title: Fact Check: Mercury (aka thimerosal or thiomersal) is in vaccines and can damage the brain, ...
text:
Claim: Mercury (aka thimerosal or thiomersal) is in vaccines and can damage the brain, gut, liver, bone marrow, nervous system, and kidneys. It is linked to autoimmune disorders, including autism.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Mercury is not in the vaccines. 

Evidence:

Q: Is the mercury-based chemical thiomersal (also known as thimerosal) found in vaccines?
A: Thiomersal was removed from UK vaccines between 2003 and 2005, and is no longer found in any of the childhood or adult vaccines routinely used in the UK. Before 2005, thiomersal was present in diphtheria- and tetanus-containing vaccines, as well as hepatitis B vaccine and some flu vaccines. It was not used in the MMR vaccine, the Hib vaccine, the MenC vaccine, the oral polio vaccine or the BCG vaccine. Thiomersal was present in the Swine Flu (H1N1) vaccine Pandemrix, used in the 2009-10 and 2010-11 flu seasons in the UK. However, it is not present in any of the annual flu vaccines currently in use in the UK.. 

Q: Why was the mercury-based chemical thiomersal (also known as thimerosal) removed from vaccines?
A: In the US, UK and Europe, thiomersal was removed from vaccines as a precaution. This was in line with the global goal of reducing environmental exposure to mercury from all sources.. 

Q: Was the mercury-based chemical thiomersal (also known as thimerosal) in vaccines harmful to humans?
A: ...there was no evidence that thiomersal in vaccines caused harm. Thiomersal contains a compound called ethyl mercury, but concern about mercury in the environment has centred on a different compound called methyl mercury, which accumulates in the food chain and in the human body..

title: Fact Check: Farmers are declaring bankruptcy "in record numbers" and "the median income for ...
text:
Claim: Farmers are declaring bankruptcy "in record numbers" and "the median income for U.S. farm households was -$1,548 in 2018."

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: There were fewer bankruptcies in 2018 than there were in 2017. From the evidence, it also looks as though the median income was not $1,548. Hence, this claim is refuted. 

Evidence:

Q: Do farmers make all their money from their farm?
A: Income (farm-operator households receive income from farm and off-farm sources):. 

Q: What are off farm resources?
A: Off-farm sources—including wage income, nonfarm business earnings, dividends, and transfers—are the main contributor to income for most farm operator households in the United States, including the majority of residential and intermediate farm households (see glossary for definitions). These households, which derive less than half their income from farming, are not as affected by changes in farming costs and returns as are large commercial farms, but may be more susceptible to changes in the broader economy.. 

Q: Are farmers seeing a decline in their income and declaring bankruptcy in record numbers?
A: Many farm households primarily rely on off-farm income: median off-farm income in 2021 is estimated at $82,809, an increase of 22 percent from $67,873 in 2020, and to continue increasing by 6.3 percent to $88,034 in 2022. The increase in 2021 was mainly due to higher earned income—income from wages, salary, and nonfarm businesses—which rose 54 percent from $32,428 in 2020 to $50,000 in 2021..

title: Fact Check: Alexandreia Ocasio-Coretz posted in a tweet, "We must block Trump from stopping ...

Q: Is @AOCpress the official twitter account of Senator Alexandrea Cortez
A: No. Her official twitter account is @AOC and it has a verified tick

Q: Where did she post the comment claimed?
A: On a  twitter account named @AOCpress.

title: Fact Check: Farm credit target raised to 11 lakh crore rupees for 2018-19
text:
Claim: Farm credit target raised to 11 lakh crore rupees for 2018-19

Verdict: Supported

A: The target for agricultural credit in 2017-18 has been fixed at a record
level of ` 10 lakh crores.. 

Q: What was the agricultural credit target for 2018-2019 in India?

institutional credit for agriculture sector from year-to-year from `8.5 lakh
crore in 2014-15 to `10 lakh crore in 2017-18. I now propose to raise this
to `11 lakh crore for the year 2018-19..

title: Fact Check: Rs. 2000 crore for agri-market infrastructure fund set up
text:
Claim: Rs. 2000 crore for agri-market infrastructure fund set up

Verdict: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

Justification: THe agri-market infrastructure fund has been approved recently, but hte budget is not clear.

Evidence:

Q: What is agri-market infrastructure?
A: in order to improve market accessibility and to facilitate the farmers to directly sell their produce to the consumer to get better price realization for their produce, the Government has announced in Union Budget 2018-19, to develop and upgrade existing 22000 rural haats into Gramin Agricultural Markets (GrAMs). In these GrAMs, physical infrastructure will be strengthened using Government Schemes such as MGNREGA (Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act). These GrAMs are to be exempted from regulations of Agriculture Produce Marketing Committee (APMCs) and linked to e-NAM to provide farmers with better market accessibility and facilities to sell their produce at remunerative prices’.. 

Q: How much is put aside for agri-market infrastructure fund set up.
A: An Agri-Market Infrastructure Fund with a corpus of Rs. 2000 crore is targeted to be set up for developing and upgrading agricultural marketing infrastructure in the 22000 GrAMs including 585 Agriculture Produce Marketing Committees (APMCs). The cabinet approved for the Agri-Market Infrastructure fund recently in February 2019. The budgetary allocation to the fund is however not clear and the Rs. 2000 crore is not the government’s budgetary support..

title: Fact Check: Countries are putting bad people into the United States visa lottery program.
text:
Claim: Countries are putting bad people into the United States visa lottery program.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The decision does not depend on the foreign countries but on the United states government 

Evidence:

Q: What is the US Visa lottery system?
A: Congress established the diversity visa program through the Immigration Act of 1990 in an effort to promote immigration from countries underrepresented in the United States. The number of diversity visas is limited by law to 55,000 per fiscal year, but the annual cap has been reduced to 50,000 since fiscal year 2000. While Congress called this cap a “temporary reduction,” it does not have an expiration date. As of 2017, the U.S. government states that this reduction will remain in effect as long as needed, including for 2019.. 

Q: Do countries send immigrants to the US lottery.
A: No. Potential visa recipients are randomly selected from the pool of qualified entries, administered by the United States, not foreign governments. Yet, being randomly selected—or "winning" the lottery—does not guarantee admission to the United States but rather provides the individual an opportunity to apply for the Diversity Visa. The odds of being selected for this opportunity are very small, with an average of 13.3 million people submitting applications each year.

title: Fact Check: China has a death penalty for drug dealers
text:
Claim: China has a death penalty for drug dealers

Verdict: Supported

Justification: Confirmed.

Evidence:

Q: Is dealing drugs in China punishable by the death penalty?
A: Yes. Smuggling, dealing, transporting or manufacturing drugs is under Crimes against public order.

title: Fact Check: Former President Barack Obama would have gone to war with North Korea.
text:
Claim: Former President Barack Obama would have gone to war with North Korea.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Although nothing confirmed for definite the consensus in the answers point towards it being unlikely.

Evidence:

Q: How likely was it that the US was on the precipice of war with North Korea during Obama's tenure?
A: Not very likely, ""There was no crisis brewing or heightened tension at the end of the Obama presidency," said Robert S. Ross, an Asia specialist with appointments at Boston College and Harvard University.". 

Q: What was Obama's strategy with North Korea during his time as president?
A: The overall policy toward North Korea during Obama’s tenure was "strategic patience" — the notion that "if we ignore them, they will go away and eventually implode," said John Pike, the director of globalsecurity.org.

There’s room for disagreement about how effective "strategic patience" was. But it was "not the same thing as preparing for war, or planning a war, or even intending to conduct a war," said Joseph DeThomas, a professor at the Penn State School of International Affairs. "Obama was doing none of those. He was upgrading military deployments in order to deter North Korea and to reassure allies.".

title: Fact Check: In China, a drug dealer gets the death penalty. In America, a drug dealer gets a...
text:
Claim: In China, a drug dealer gets the death penalty. In America, a drug dealer gets a fine.

Verdict: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

Justification: The claim says that drug dealers get a fine in the US but the second source shows that a drug dealer would go to prison. A drug dealer may get the death penalty in China but not in all cases. The claim has cherry picked the evidence.

Evidence:

Q: What are the penalties for drug possession and smuggling in China
A: Chinese law says that individuals who smuggle, traffic, transport or manufacture drugs and meet certain conditions are to be punished with 15 years of fixed-term imprisonment, life imprisonment or death sentence, and confiscation of their properties.. 

Q: What are the penalties for drug related offenses in the United States
A: One of the penalties of drug related offenses is incarceration. 

Q: Are fines more rampant for drug related offenders in America than other forms of punishment
A: In fiscal year 2017, more than 95 percent of about 18,000 individuals sentenced in federal drug-trafficking cases got a prison sentence.

title: Fact Check: President Obama put more debt on the USA than any president in the history of ou...
text:
Claim: President Obama put more debt on the USA than any president in the history of our country combined.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The debt before Obama was around $10 trillion, and he added around $9 trillion to that, so it is slightly less than the debt of all presidents before him combined.

Evidence:

Q: What is the total amount in national debt during President Barack Obama’s administration ?
A: President Barack Obama’s administration racked up nearly as much debt in eight years than in the entire 232-year history of the country before he took office. He entered with $10.6 trillion in total debt and left with the country owing $19.9 trillion. That’s an average tab of $1.16 trillion a year.. 

Q: How much debt the US government added under President Obama ?
A: Based on quarterly data released by the US Treasury, the debt at the end of 2008 — just before Obama took office — stood at roughly $10,699,805,000,000. As of the third quarter of 2016, the most recent data available, the debt as Obama is set to leave office stood at $19,573,445,000,000.

Based on the website USdebtclock.com, which extrapolates the US national debt in real time based on committed government spending, the debt will be roughly $19.97 trillion when President-elect Donald Trump takes office on Friday.

Thus, the national debt under Obama will have grown by about $9 trillion, or an increase of 86%.

Some of this debt is attributable to bills passed by Obama's predecessor, George W. Bush, since the federal government's fiscal year budget operate differently from the calendar year. Also, both Bush and Obama rolled out large investment bills to help the US recover from the depths of the financial crisis..

title: Fact Check: The US Government may be using parts of one of the national emergencies that (Pr...
text:
Claim: The US Government may be using parts of one of the national emergencies that (President Barack Obama) signed having to do with cartels, criminal cartels

Verdict: Supported

Justification: From the Q&As it does seem that Barack Obama did in fact use an emergency power when dealing with cartels.

Evidence:

Q: What are emergency powers?
A: Congressionally-authorized emergency presidential powers are sweeping and dramatic, and range from suspending all laws regulating chemical and biological weapons, including the ban on human testing (50 U.S.C.. 

Q: Did Obama use emergency powers  to do with criminal cartels?
A: Obama did use emergency powers to freeze the financial assets of four foreign criminal operations, but it’s unclear how that would help build a wall.

On July 25, 2011, Obama announced that "significant transnational criminal organizations constitute an unusual and extraordinary threat to the national security, foreign policy, and economy of the United States.".

title: Fact Check: When countries put people into the diversity visa lottery program, they’re putti...
text:
Claim: When countries put people into the diversity visa lottery program, they’re putting some very bad people in the lottery

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: It seems that other countries do not put people into the visa lottery programme. Therefore, the claim is refuted

Evidence:

Q: What is the diversity visa lottery programme?
A: The Diversity Immigrant Visa Program (DV Program) makes up to 50,000 immigrant visas available annually, drawn from random selection among all entries to individuals who are from countries with low rates of immigration to the United States. The DV Program is administered by the U.S. Department of State (DOS).

Most lottery winners reside outside the United States and immigrate through consular processing and issuance of an immigrant visa. To learn more, visit the U.S. Department of State's website.. 

Q: Do other countries put people into the DV programme?
A: No. Individuals must register for the programme.

title: Fact Check: A big majority of the big drugs, the big drug loads, don't go through ports of e...
text:

A: Yes. The third largest methamphetamine seizure was made at Nogales Area Port  in Arizona.

title: Fact Check: Sayfullo Saipov, the Uzbekistan-born suspect on trial for the 2017 truck attack ...
text:
Claim: Sayfullo Saipov, the Uzbekistan-born suspect on trial for the 2017 truck attack in New York, US, is an example of chain migration, ie bringing many people into the US.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: This is claim is refuted. Sayfullo Sapio won US residency through a lottery system, not chain migration. 

Evidence:

Q: Did Sayfullo Saipov bring his wife over from Uzbeckistan?
A: Saipov had won a U.S. green (residence) card in a 2010 lottery and left for the United States that same year where he had later married an Uzbek woman living there, Jahon said.. 

Q: Did Sayfullo Saipov bring is parents over from Uzbeckistan?
A: No. His parents live in Tashkent

title: Fact Check: Drug loads can't enter the US through US ports of entry.
text:
Claim: Drug loads can't enter the US through US ports of entry.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: This claim is refuted. House Appropriations Committee Lowey says that "opioids are coming through the point of entry" and the Drug Enforcement Agency says that "the southwest border remains the primary entry point for heroin into the United States". Therefore, drugs can enter the US through US ports of entry and the claim is refuted.

Evidence:

Q: How do drugs come into the US
A: Lowey, who chairs the House Appropriations Committee, called the amount of opioids coming through ports of entry a "real threat." She said people should know that opioids arrive in the United States through smugglers approaching legal points of entry.

"The facts are, the majority of opioids and all kinds of other things that are connected to the opioids are coming through the point of entry," she said. "They’re not coming with an individual person, maybe some are. But they’re coming in trucks, they’re coming in cars, they’re coming right through the point of entry.". 

Q: What port of entry is the major port of entry for Heroin
A: The southwest border "remains the primary entry point for heroin into the United States," according to the Drug Enforcement Agency..

title: Fact Check: In China, a drug dealer gets a thing called the death penalty. Our criminal list...
text:
Claim: In China, a drug dealer gets a thing called the death penalty. Our criminal list, a drug dealer gets a thing called, how about a fine?

Verdict: Refuted

Evidence:

Q: What is the penalty for drug related offences in China
A: individuals who smuggle, traffic, transport or manufacture drugs and meet certain conditions are to be punished with 15 years of fixed-term imprisonment, life imprisonment or death sentence, and confiscation of their properties.but data on executions is unreliable. 

Q: What are the penalties for drug possession and drug related offences in the United States
A: As a general rule, federal judges must impose a minimum term of imprisonment upon defendants convicted of various controlled substance (drug) offenses and drug-related offenses. The severity of those sentences depends primarily upon the nature and amount of the drugs involved, the defendant’s prior criminal record, any resulting injuries or death.

title: Fact Check: US President Obama was ready to have gone to war with North Korea.
text:
Claim: US President Obama was ready to have gone to war with North Korea.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: This claim is refuted. According to the QA pairs, President Obama's close aides said he was "never close to an attack" even when North Korea reported a nuclear test. President Obama reportedly said that a ground invasion of North Korea is "unthinkable". The claim states that he was "ready to go to war" and that clearly wasn't the case. Therefore, the claim is refuted. 

Evidence:

Q: Did Barack obamas cabinet have anything to say about the claim?
A: We were not on the brink of war with North Korea in 2016,” Benjamin J. Rhodes, Mr. Obama’s deputy national security adviser, wrote on Twitter.

John Brennan, Mr. Obama’s C.I.A. director, told NBC News, “President Obama was never on the verge of starting any war with North Korea, large or small.”. 

Q: Were there any other reports about Obama wanting war?
A: In his most recent book, Bob Woodward (Washington post) reported that after a North Korean nuclear test in September 2016, Mr. Obama asked if a surgical strike could take out the country’s arsenal, but after being told it would require a ground invasion, he rejected any action as “unthinkable.” His former aides say he never came close to ordering an attack..

title: Fact Check: The US has chain migration, where a family member can bring in 20+ people and th...
text:
Claim: The US has chain migration, where a family member can bring in 20+ people and that is what happened on the West Side highway. A young man killed eight people and brought in many people because of chain migration.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: An immigrant cannot bring in 20+ people into the United States 

Evidence:

Q: Who is Trump referring to here?
A: Sayfullo Saipov, the Uzbekistan-born suspect on trial for the 2017 truck attack in New York,. 

Q: Did he bring in many people?
A: No. s a green card holder, he could only petition for a spouse and unmarried children to come to the United States. Media reports indicate that Saipov married a woman who already lived in the United States and that their three children were born in the United States

Q: Is it possible for an immigrant to bring 20+ other family members?
A: No. Theoretically, one immigrant’s arrival in the United States could lead to the immigration of an aunt or uncle — if the first immigrant becomes a U.S. citizen and petitioned a parent, that parent could eventually become a U.S. citizen and petition his or her siblings.

But no one can directly petition an aunt, uncle, cousin, niece, nephew, in-law relative or grandparent. Citizens may sponsor other types of immediate family members for immigration, such as brothers and sisters, although except for spouses, parents and young children, the numbers they can sponsor are limited. Green card holders, in contrast, may petition only on behalf of spouses and unmarried children.

title: Fact Check: The U.S. will have a national emergency and will then be sued in the Ninth Circu...
text:
Claim: The U.S. will have a national emergency and will then be sued in the Ninth Circuit.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: Discriptive

Evidence:

Q: What is the Ninth Circuit in the U.S?
A: The United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit is a federal appellate court with appellate jurisdiction. It hears appeals from all of the circuit courts within its jurisdiction and its rulings may be appealed to the Supreme Court of the United States.

The Ninth Circuit is the largest appellate court with 29 authorized judicial posts. Appeals are heard in the James R. Browning Federal Courthouse in San Francisco, California, th. 

Q: Who does the claim mean can sue the Government in the Ninth circuit court?
A: States lawmakers and private landowners  over the legality surrounding a Mexico boarder wall. 

Q: Could states and private landowners sue the U.S government in the ninth circuit court?
A: Yes. It would fall within its scope.

title: Fact Check: Lawsuits challenging the emergency order to secure funding for a border wall sho...
text:
Claim: Lawsuits challenging the emergency order to secure funding for a border wall shouldn't be heard in the Ninth Circuit Court of Appeals.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit has appellate jurisdiction over some of the states in the US southern border 

Evidence:

Q: What is the emergency order to secure funding for a border wall?
A: President Donald Trump has officially declared a national emergency in order to secure funding for his border wall. 
Trump is issuing the declaration under the National Emergencies Act of 1976, which lets presidents issue an emergency declaration but under certain constraints — namely, Trump can only use specific powers Congress has already codified by law, and he has to say which powers he’s using. The act doesn’t define what counts as an emergency… there’s enough ambiguity in the law to let Trump declare an emergency. But the maneuver may not stand up to legal scrutiny once challenged in court. He is effectively trying to circumvent Congress — which is supposed to have the “power of the purse” and has decided against funding his border wall.. 

Q: Which US states are part of the border wall between the US and Mexico?
A: U.S. states along the border are California, Arizona, New Mexico, and Texas.. 

Q: What lawsuits could emerge in the border states as a result of the emergency order to secure funding for the border wall?
A: Long before Trump’s emergency declaration, one likely source of resistance has been clear: people who own land along the US-Mexico border where Trump wants the wall to be built.
The federal government can legally invoke “eminent domain,” a power to take private land or property and convert it into public use enshrined within the US Constitution, but if Trump tries to do so for the border wall, he could very well face a fight. Landowners could sue, as they did after Bush’s order, to keep the government from taking their land..

title: Fact Check: You have the lottery — It’s a horror show. Because when countries put people int...
text:
Claim: You have the lottery — It’s a horror show. Because when countries put people into the lottery, they’re not putting you in. They’re putting some very bad people in the lottery. It’s common sense.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The answers show that there are requirements to be able to be put in the lottery so the claim is refuted.

Evidence:

Q: What Lottery does the claim refer to?
A: the ‘Diversity Visa Lottery Program,

also known as the green-card lottery, issues up to 50,000 visas a year to people from dozens of countries, a tiny fraction of the roughly 1 million green cards the government issues annually. The aim is to mix up the nation’s melting pot.. 

Q: Is the'' diversity lottery program'' in the U.S insecure?
A: No. Applicants who are selected in the program (“selectees”) must meet simple but strict eligibility
requirements to qualify for a diversity visa. such as education and work requirements to be eligible. and background checks and security screenings for those selected

title: Fact Check: In the US a drug dealer gets a fine.
text:
Claim: In the US a drug dealer gets a fine.

Q: What is the sentence for a drug dealer in the US
A: According to the US sentencing commission, more than 95% of 18,000 individuals sentenced in Federal drug trafficking cases get a prison sentence.

title: Fact Check: President Obama put more debt on this country than any president in the history ...
text:
Claim: President Obama put more debt on this country than any president in the history of our country combined.

Verdict: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

Justification: The 3rd Q&A pair state no evidence for what is claimed, Q&A 2 does state that Obama alone was not responsible for all debt accumulated by the U.S government during his term and that congress was also responsible, for the large debt shown in q1

Evidence:

Q: Did Obama accumulate more debt than any other president?
A: The treasury department data confirms that when Obama became president there was $6.3Trillion public debt. When he left it had risen to $14.4Trillion, an $8.1 trillion increase.. 

Q: Who is responsible for the debt?
A: The Obama administration is not solely responsible for the debt increase. A chunk of the debt is a consequence of spending decisions predating Obama’s terms. Congress is also responsible for tax and spending levels.. 

Q: Was there more debt while Obama was president than any other president?
A: No answer could be found..

title: Fact Check: President Donald Trump will sign a national emergency which has been signed many...
text:
Claim: President Donald Trump will sign a national emergency which has been signed many times before. It's been signed by other presidents from 1977 or so, it gave the presidents the power. There's rarely been a problem.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: Donald Trump did indeed sign a national emergency to fund his border wall, and yes it has been signed 58 times before by other presidents 

Evidence:

Q: Under what conditions can a national emergency be called
A: Any authority granted to the President by section 1702 of this title may be exercised to deal with any unusual and extraordinary threat, which has its source in whole or substantial part outside the United States, to the national security, foreign policy, or economy of the United States, if the President declares a national emergency with respect to such threat.. 

Q: What power does a national emergency confer on the president
A: When the President declares a national emergency, no powers or authorities made available by statute for use in the event of an emergency shall be exercised unless and until the President specifies the provisions of law under which he proposes that he, or other officers will act.. 

Q: Did Trump declare a national emergency?
A: After more than a month of threats, a government shutdown, and bipartisan action by Congress, President Trump has finally declared a national emergency to spend billions of taxpayer dollars on his border wall obsession.

title: Fact Check: You have chain migration. Where a bad person comes in, brings 22 or 23 or 35 of ...
text:
Claim: You have chain migration. Where a bad person comes in, brings 22 or 23 or 35 of his family members, because he has his mother, his grandmother, sister, cousin, uncle. They are all in. You know what happened on the west side highway? That young wise guy drove over and killed eight people... He had many people brought in because he was in the United States.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: QA pairs state the person referred to in the claim did not bring in migrants using .chain migration 

Evidence:

Q: How does chain migration work
A: U.S. citizens and lawful permanent residents (LPRs) can sponsor certain family members for a visa that provides permanent residence, also known as a “green card.”. 

Q: How many visas can be issued to relatives of someone in the US
A: To ensure that family visas are not issued just to immediate relatives, immigration law requires that at least 226,000family visas be allocated through the family preference categories. 

Q: How many relatives did Sayfullo Saipov petition for them to be brought to the states
A: No answer could be found..

title: Fact Check: US chain migration allows a bad person to come into the US, and bring 22 or 23 o...
text:
Claim: US chain migration allows a bad person to come into the US, and bring 22 or 23 or 35 of his family members because he has his mother, his grandmother, sister, cousin, uncle.

Verdict: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

Justification:  If a migrant to the us become US citizen then they could bring in the family members as claimed according to Q&A 3 which is conflicting with Q&A 1 which states that Neither U.S. citizens nor lawful permanent residents can directly petition for an aunt, uncle, cousin, niece, nephew, in-law relative or grandparent to come to the United States.

Evidence:

Q: Can you bring relatives into the US?
A: Neither U.S. citizens nor lawful permanent residents can directly petition for an aunt, uncle, cousin, niece, nephew, in-law relative or grandparent to come to the United States.. 

Q: Are there restrictions on what relatives you can bring into the US?
A: U.S. citizens and lawful permanent residents (green card holders) can bring certain family members to the United States to live here permanently.

But there are restrictions. No one can directly petition for an aunt, uncle, cousin, niece, nephew, in-law relative or grandparent, according to USCIS.. 

Q: Are there situations where for example an aunt or uncle could be allowed into the US?
A: Theoretically, one immigrant’s arrival in the United States could lead to the immigration of an aunt or uncle — if the first immigrant becomes a U.S. citizen and petitioned a parent, that parent could eventually become a U.S. citizen and petition his or her siblings..

title: Fact Check: The U.S. may be using one of the national emergencies that President Barack Obam...
text:
Claim: The U.S. may be using one of the national emergencies that President Barack Obama signed having to do with cartels, criminal cartels.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: The Q&A's show that the U.S was using some national emergency declarations at the time of the claim, it does not link them directly to cartel activity, but showing that they relate to  transnational criminal organizations which will very likely include criminal cartels.
with Q&A 2 stating that is was a  one of the national emergencies that President Barack Obama signed as claimed then it is supportive of the claim overall.

Evidence:

Q: How many national emergency declarations are still in effect in the USA?
A: 31. 

Q: Did Barack Obama declare a national emergency Blocking Property of Transnational Criminal
Organizations ?
A: Yes. EO 13581 25/07/2011:
I therefore determine that significant transnational criminal organizations constitute an unusual and extraordinary threat to the national security, foreign policy, and economy of the United States, and hereby declare a national emergency to deal with that threat.

Q: Is EO 13581 still in effect?
A: Yes. It was extended for one year by Donald Trump on 19/07/2019

title: Fact Check: A big majority of the big drugs, the big drug loads don't go through US ports of...
text:
Claim: A big majority of the big drugs, the big drug loads don't go through US ports of entry.

Verdict: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

Justification: From the evidence, it looks as though certain "big" drugs do go through US ports of entry. 90 percent of heroin seized along the border, 88 percent of cocaine, and 84 percent of the methamphetamine in the 2018 fiscal year were caught trying to be smuggled in at legal crossing points.
The exception is marijuana, only 39 percent of which was seized at ports of entry, according to the CBP.

Evidence:

Q: What drugs are considered to be “big drugs” in the United States?
A: The most commonly abused drugs are:
Marijuana
Cocaine
Opiates e.g. Heroin
Methamphetamine. 

Q: Of all the big drugs seized by US officials in 2018, what percentage were seized at US ports of entry (as opposed to being seized between ports of entry along the border)?
A: According to U.S. Customs and Border Protection statistics, 90 percent of heroin seized along the border, 88 percent of cocaine, and 84 percent of the methamphetamine in the 2018 fiscal year was caught trying to be smuggled in at legal crossing points.
The exception is marijuana, only 39 percent of which was seized at ports of entry, according to the CBP.. 

Q: If US government data shows the majority of the drugs seized along the border were seized at the ports of entry, does this conclusively prove that most drugs in the US come through legal ports of entry?
A: No. According to the Congressional Research Service: “data on seizures are available, but these reflect an unknown portion of total drugs traversing U.S. borders."

title: Fact Check: Beto O’Rourke said, "If I could throw two kinds of people in the garbage it woul...
text:
Claim: Beto O’Rourke said, "If I could throw two kinds of people in the garbage it would be the elderly and wounded veterans. When a tool breaks, you don’t fix it; you throw it in the damn trash."

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Denied by spokesman and answers show she supports them.

Evidence:

Q: Did Beto O’Rourke say, "If I could throw two kinds of people in the garbage it would be the elderly and wounded veterans." "When a tool breaks you don’t fix it, you throw it in the damn trash."?
A: "Of course not," O’Rourke spokesman Chris Evans. 

Q: What has Beto O’Rourke said about veterans?
A: I will strengthen services for those who have put their lives on the line for this country.

My top priority while serving in Congress was delivering for Texas veterans. Serving on both the Veterans Affairs and Armed Services committees in the U.S. House of Representatives, I worked with Republicans and Democrats alike to lift up the heroes who have put their lives on the line for our country.
My VA health care reform plan added two new VA clinics in my hometown of El Paso, nearly doubled the number of mental health providers at the local VA, and ultimately brought wait times down from an average of 71 days to an average of 5 days.

In addition, I authored and passed legislation that expanded access to VA mental health care to veterans with other-than-honorable discharges, granted every separating service member access to a mental health screening, improved and customized transition assistance for service members leaving the military—and more.

Texas can and must do more to serve our veterans. As governor, I will prioritize efforts to end veteran homelessness in Texas by the end of my first year in office, cut property taxes for disabled and low-income veterans, dramatically expand the state’s veterans health care case management system, strengthen services for veterans suffering from toxic exposure, expand access to medical marijuana and other alternatives to harmful opioids, and strengthen access to the education and employment benefits that our veterans have earned.. 

Q: What has Beto O’Rourke said about the elderly?
A: Texas seniors have built the families, communities, and businesses we now enjoy. We owe it to them to honor and protect the commitment we made to care for them through Social Security and Medicare..

title: Fact Check: nearly half" of House US Republicans have supported a nonpartisan redistricting ...

title: Fact Check: Net migration to the UK could be 100,000 higher after Brexit under the governmen...
text:
Claim: Net migration to the UK could be 100,000 higher after Brexit under the government’s plans.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The third Q&A shows that the site which published the claim admitted the numbers were wrong so the claim is refuted.

Evidence:

Q: What was the net population migration from the EU to the UK in 2019?
A: "An estimated 202,000 citizens from other EU countries immigrated to the UK in the year to September 2018, and about 145,000 emigrated abroad. So EU ‘net migration’ was around 57,000."
"Estimated non-EU net migration, meanwhile, is 261,000 a year"
57,000 plus 261,000 is a net migration of 308,000.. 

Q: How might Brexit affect net migration into the UK?
A: "A conservative estimate is that the United Kingdom would continue to receive an inflow of 500,000 or more immigrants per year, with annual net migration above 200,000.". 

Q: Did Migration Watch withdraw this claim?
A: We have decided to withdraw the paper issued today on post-Brexit migration levels. There was an error in the calculations which was unfortunately overlooked at the final stages of preparation. We apologise for the error and will rectify it in the course of producing a revised version..

title: Fact Check: Green New Deal would eliminate air travel
text:
Claim: Green New Deal would eliminate air travel

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: From the Q&As you can see that the Green deal would not eliminate air travel but it will help make it cleaner. So the claim is refuted. 

Evidence:

Q: What does Liz Cheney say about the Green New Deal will eliminating air travel?
A: And even when it comes down to something like air travel, which the FAQ’s say they want to eliminate within the next ten years, that means the government is going to be telling people where they can fly to and where they can’t.. 

Q: What is listed in the Green New Deal FAQ's about air travel.
A: To totally overhaul transportation by massively expanding electric vehicle  manufacturing, build charging stations everywhere, build out highspeed rail at a scale where air travel stops becoming necessary, create affordable public transit available to all, with goal to replace every combustion-engine vehicle - as listed under 'National mobilization our economy through 14 infrastructure and industrial projects.' - Every project strives to remove greenhouse gas emissions and pollution from every sector of our economy, as part of the 'Resolution Summary'. 

Q: How does Liz Cheney suggest that air travel will be eliminated?
A: Liz Cheney stated, "I would just say that it’s going to be crucially important for us to recognize and understand when we outlaw plane travel, we outlaw gasoline, we outlaw cars, I think actually probably the entire US military because of the Green New Deal that we are able to explain to our constituents and to people all across this country what that really means. And even when it comes down to something like air travel, which the FAQ’s say they want to eliminate within the next ten years.".

title: Fact Check: Mississippi passed the 5-71-226 Anti-Youth Subversion Act banning talking to min...
text:

title: Fact Check: Prior to 2019, South Korea was paying $500 million a year under a cost-sharing d...
text:
Claim: Prior to 2019, South Korea was paying $500 million a year under a cost-sharing deal that helps fund American military forces in that country..

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: It seems from all of the answer and question pairs, that the amount that was spent was far greater than 500$ million. the last question and answer pair seems quite cheeky, it is however understandable. Therefore the claim is refuted.

Evidence:

Q: In 2019 how much was South Korea  paying to fund American military forces being in South Korea?
A: Total amount of 1.0389 trillion Won for the year 2019 which was an 8.2% increase on the previous year.. 

Q: Approximately what is  1.0389 trillion Won in USD in  2019?
A: approximately $924 million USD. 

Q: Is 8% less of 924,000,000 greater than 500,000 ?
A: Yes. Mathematics.

title: Fact Check: Fact checkers did not hold Obama accountable for his promises on the care act.
text:
Claim: Fact checkers did not hold Obama accountable for his promises on the care act.

Verdict: Not Enough Evidence

Justification: The answer doesn't really address if Obama was held accountable or not. 

Evidence:

Q: Did Obama make promises on the care act ?
A: These promises included:

    Universal coverage

    PROMOTED
    No new taxes on the middle class
    Annual premium savings of $2,500
    No increase in the deficit
    You can keep your plan if you like it

I will address these in reverse order since it is probably the easiest to prove even to Obamacare admirers (after all, even left-leaning Politifact.com has labeled this promise the 2013 Lie of the Year)..

title: Fact Check: The US trade deficit has decreased during US President Trump's term of office.
text:
Claim: The US trade deficit has decreased during US President Trump's term of office.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: the trade deficit increased during Trump's term

Evidence:

Q: What was the US trade deficit in November 2018?
A: $49.3 Billion. 

Q: Is the US trade deficit smaller than it was in October 2018?
A: Yes. November exports were $209.9 billion, $1.3 billion less than October exports. November imports were
$259.2 billion, $7.7 billion less than October imports.

Q: Has the US trade deficit continued to rise?
A: Yes. Year-to-date, the goods and services deficit increased $51.9 billion, or 10.4 percent, from the same period in 2017. Exports increased $157.1 billion or 7.3 percent. Imports increased $208.9 billion or 7.9 percent.

title: Fact Check: There were 1,200 murders in 2018 in Juarez, Mexico compared with 23 just across ...
text:
Claim: There were 1,200 murders in 2018 in Juarez, Mexico compared with 23 just across the border in El Paso, Texas, US, due to the construction of the border fence.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The Mayor of El Paso tweeted "We‘ve had a fence for 10 years and it has impacted illegal immigration and curbed criminal activity. It is NOT the sole deterrent. Law enforcement in our community continues to keep us safe #SOTU" meaning the wall has nothing to do with the low murder rates

Evidence:

Q: When was the border fence constructed at El Paso?
A: Construction started on the fencing in the El Paso sector in 2008 and had finished by mid-2009.. 

Q: What was the violent crime rate in El Paso before the border fence was constructed?
A: The city had the third-lowest violent crime rate among 35 U.S. cities with a population over 500,000 from 2005 to 2007 -– all before construction on the fence began. And, according to the Uniform Crime Reports from the FBI, between 1993 and 2006 the number of violent crimes dropped by more than 34 percent.. 

Q: What do the statistics show on the history of violent crime in El Paso?
A: Looking broadly at the past 30 years, the rate of violent crime reached its peak in 1993, when more than 6,500 violent crimes were recorded.

But between 1996 and 2006, the number of violent crimes reported by law enforcement fell by more than 34 percent and less than 2,700 crimes were reported.

From 2006 to 2011 — two years before the fence was built to two years after — the number of violent crimes recorded in El Paso increased by 17 percent..

title: Fact Check: Actor and legendary comedian Bill Murray has died.
text:

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The source is a satirical website. Also Murray's biography (source of the answer to Q1) does not say he is dead.

Q: Who is Bill  Murray?
A: Actor William James Murray is a comedy icon best known for his popular 'Saturday Night Live' characters and movie classics such as 'Meatballs,' 'Caddyshack' and 'Ghostbusters.' He was nominated for an Oscar for his seriocomic role in 'Lost in Translation.'. 

Q: What date was it when Bill  Murray was claimed to have died?
A: February 02, 2019 was listed as Murray's death.. 

Q: Where was the information published?
A: In Conservative Tears:
William Billington “Bill” Murray is dead this evening in his home in Winnetka, Wisconsin..

title: Fact Check: A diet based on your blood type fights fatigue.
text:
Claim: A diet based on your blood type fights fatigue.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The Q&As overwhelmingly show that there is no evidence that the claim is true. So it is refuted. 

Evidence:

Q: Is there any evidence to suggest a diet based on your blood type works?
A: Blood type diets may yield weight loss and other positive results because they’re highly restrictive. They also eliminate foods which are known to adversely affect health.

However, there’s no scientific evidence linking a person’s blood type to their need to avoid, or eat, specific foods.. 

Q: Can fatigue be fought  It with the blood type diet ?
A: Dr Walter Mwanda, a haematologist at the University of Nairobi’s School of Medicine, if eating according to your blood type was good advice. He was unequivocal.

“That is very false information,” he said. “Forget about it, there’s nothing like that.”. 

Q: Does having a diet based on your blood type fights fatigue ?
A: No answer could be found..

title: Fact Check: Vice-Presidential candidate of the Peoples’ Democratic Party (PDP), Peter Obi’s ...
text:
Claim: Vice-Presidential candidate of the Peoples’ Democratic Party (PDP), Peter Obi’s Convoy Was Attacked In Abuja Market, Nigeria.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The answer clearly shows that the attack did not happen to Peter Obi but after he had left. The source is the official Twitter account for Peter Obi so is trustworthy.

Evidence:

Q: Was Peter Obi’s Convoy attacked in Abuja Market, Nigeria?
A: No. No, the attack happened after the departure of Peter Obi. This is confirmed by a tweet from his official Twitter account.

title: Fact Check: Peter Obi was almost killed during an attack on his convoy in Abuja Market.
text:
Claim: Peter Obi was almost killed during an attack on his convoy in Abuja Market.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Refuted by Peter Obi himself.

Evidence:

Q: When did this occur?
A: On the 9th of February, the Vice-Presidential candidate of the Peoples’ Democratic Party (PDP), Peter Obi visited the Building Materials Market at Dei-Dei on the outskirts of Abuja to interact with traders and shoppers.. 

Q: Was he attacked?
A: No. A Dubawa fact-check reveals that the supporters of the Peoples’ Democratic Party (PDP) were attacked at the Building Materials Market on the 9th of February and campaign vehicles were burnt. However, the attacks happened after the departure of Peter Obi and he was not in any danger. A tweet from his official Twitter account confirms this.

Both President Kenyatta and his deputy have argued in before the ICC where they are both charged with crimes against humanity that the constitution does not allow them to be out of the country at the same time..

Q: What were the remittances in 2018?
A: In 2018 remittances were at US$2.697 billion. Using the central bank’s exchange rate for 8 February 2019, when Ruto made the claim, this works out to KSh270.1 billion. Nearly half was from North America..

Therefore, there is conflicting evidence.

title: Fact Check: The number of people on health insurance in Kenya has increased from 3 million t...
text:
Claim: The number of people on health insurance in Kenya has increased from 3 million to 7 million in a record five years.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Based on the available data from the QA the figures appears to be slightly off and this makes the claim wrong and so it's refuted. In 2013/14 4,713,662 had health insurance, in 2017/18 it had 7,657,463 and as QA pair 3 calculates this is an increase of nearly 3 million but the initial figure in the claim is much lower than the actual statistics from 2013/14 by 1.7 million so it's not risen quite as much as the claim suggests.

Evidence:

Q: How Many Kenyans had Health Insurance in 2013 to 2014?
A: The National Hospital Insurance Fund had 4,713,662 principal members for the 2013/2014 year.. 

Q: How Many Kenyans had Health Insurance in 2017-2018?
A: The National Hospital Insurance Fund had 7,657,463  principal members for the 2017/2018 year.. 

Q: What is 7,657,463 - 4,713,662
A: 2,943,801.

title: Fact Check: Kenya built a standard-gauge railway of 600 kilometres, in the  period 2014 to 2...
text:
Claim: Kenya built a standard-gauge railway of 600 kilometres, in the  period 2014 to 2019.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: The track length is around 600km and the sources are reliable. 

Evidence:

Q: What line are Kenya building?
A: To improve its economy, Kenya is building a rail line that can carry both higher-speed trains and heavier cargo.. 

Q: What is the current route length?
A: The first phase of the standard-gauge railway (SGR) from the coastal city of Mombasa to the capital Nairobi has already been built. But several sources have recently put the length at 472 kilometres.

These include the president’s delivery unit, State House, the China Road and Bridge Corporation – the Chinese firm that built it – and the Kenya Institute for Public Policy and Research Analysis, a government think tank.

The Kenya Railways Corporation puts the “route length” at 472 km. 

Q: How long is the track length?
A: The Kenya Railways Corporation puts the “route length” at 472 km and the  “track length” at 609 km - closer to the deputy president’s figure.

The main line is 472 km and the total track built 607.4 km, the SGR office told Africa Check. The difference is because there are areas on the main line with multiple tracks. These include two main stations and seven intermediate stations..

title: Fact Check: The current Kenyan government has built a standard-gauge railway of 600 kilometr...
text:
Claim: The current Kenyan government has built a standard-gauge railway of 600 kilometres in the last five years.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: This claim is suppported. According to the QA pairs, the current Kenyan government have built a standard gauge railway which consists of a modern, efficient transport system that makes travel safe, comfortable and affordable for passengers across the country. The Office of th President of Kenya has stated that amount of track that has so far been laid is 472km. 472km is part of phase 1 of the project, implying there is more track to be laid. However, the claim states that 600km of track has been laid over the past 5 years. In the metadata provided, a spokesperson from the office of SGR stated that "the main line is 472 km and the total track built 607.4 km... the difference is because there are areas on the main line with multiple tracks. These include two main stations and seven intermediate stations." The previously stated number of 472km stated seems to be exclusive to the main train line laid, whilst the figure of 607.4km is conclusive of everything intermediate stations. Therefore, the claim is supported as, despite being 'main track' or not, 607.4km (600 kiometres in the claim) has been laid in Kenya.

Evidence:

Q: What is the Standard Gauge Railway (SGR)?
A: The Standard Gauge Railway is a modern, efficient transport system that will enable safe, comfortable travel for individuals and freight across the country and region at lower costs.. 

Q: How much of the SGR has already been built?
A: Phase 1 of the Standard Gauge Railway from Mombasa to Nairobi has seen 472km of track completed. 

Q: Has any mention been made between the amount of track laid vs the amount laid in the claim?
A: The main line is 472 km and the total track built 607.4 km, the SGR office told Africa Check. The difference is because there are areas on the main line with multiple tracks. These include two main stations and seven intermediate stations..

title: Fact Check: Kenya has built a standard-gauge railway of 600 kilometres in the last five year...
text:
Claim: Kenya has built a standard-gauge railway of 600 kilometres in the last five years.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Evidence shows that phase 1 of the Standard Gauge Railway from Mombasa to Nairobi has 472 km of track completed rather than the claimed 600 km. Hence, the claim is refuted.

Evidence:

Q: How much of Kenya's standard gauge railway had been built by 2019?
A: Phase 1 of the Standard Gauge Railway from Mombasa to Nairobi has seen 472km of track completed.

title: Fact Check: The Kenyan government has constructed 7,000 kilometres of tarmac between 2014 an...
text:
Claim: The Kenyan government has constructed 7,000 kilometres of tarmac between 2014 and 2019, while 12,000 kilometres were constructed in 50 years.

Verdict: Not Enough Evidence

Justification: Q&A 2 shows it was planned to build the 1200klm of roads between 2014 and 19 as claimed, But Q&A 3 only shows that 1919klm was build between 2014 2017 so more evidence is needed for the missing years.

Evidence:

Q: How much tarmac does Kenya have in total?
A: Kenya has a total road network of 161,451 km, according to the 2017/2018 annual public roads programme published by the Kenya Roads Board.. 

Q: How much was there when Kenyatta took office?
A: The country had 11,200 km of bitumen road in 2013 when Kenyatta took office. This is according to the Economic Survey 2018. The new administration pledged to increase this to 24,000 km of paved road in the next five years, or by 12,800 km.. 

Q: How much was built between 2013-2017?
A: But a January 2018 report by the national treasury showed that between the financial years of 2013/2014 and 2016/2017, some 1,919 km of bitumen road were built..

title: Fact Check: The railway has been in the books of our government for 30 years – it was not bu...
text:
Claim: The railway has been in the books of our government for 30 years – it was not built

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Publicly available record that the railway was in the works 30 years ago – in the 1980s or 1990s is not found.

Evidence:

Q: Is there any public record to prove that Kenya's railway project has been in the books of the government for 30 years ?
A: Kenya’s transport ministry says the railway’s journey started in 2007 while a 2009 railway masterplan study for the East Africa Community says the project was developed in 2007.

We have not found any publicly available record that the railway was in the works 30 years ago – in the 1980s or 1990s.. 

Q: What is the railway like in Kenya?
A: The Standard Gauge Railway (SGR) project is one of Kenya's Vision 2030 flagship projects that will play an important role in improving the transport system as well as strengthening cooperation among East Africa Community (EAC) Member states and promote economic development of the region.

The old meter gauge line, initially called the Uganda Railway, was built between 1896 and 1901, a time when the land had yet to acquire the name Kenya. For British colonists, it was a vast yet insignificant land that stood between them and the rich resources in Uganda. To open up Uganda, to tighten control over the "British East Africa" and to end the then notorious slave trade, the British government decided to lay a rail line to link the port of Mombasa and Uganda..

title: Fact Check: The standard gauge railway has been in the books of the Kenyan government for 30...
text:
Claim: The standard gauge railway has been in the books of the Kenyan government for 30 years but it was not built.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Based on this evidence alone, the railway is more recent.

Evidence:

Q: When are the earliest references to building a standard gauge railway in Kenya?
A: October 28 2009– Kenya and Uganda have agreed to expedite the development of an efficient railway system that will link the port of Mombasa with Kampala, Southern Sudan, Rwanda, Burundi and the Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC).
 
Speaking on Tuesday during bilateral talks at State House Nairobi, President Mwai Kibaki and Uganda’s President Yoweri Museveni directed that a Joint Ministerial Commission (JMC) be established to work on ways of developing a new standard-gauge railway line that will reduce transport costs.. 

Q: Was the planning of gauge railway was being done by the Kenyan government for 30 years ?
A: .No, the earliest reference to this project emerged during a summit of the Eastern African Community in 2004. In 2009, a regional Northern Corridor Initiative between Kenya, Uganda, and Rwanda was formed to promote a sustainable freight transport system, which would later expand to other countries in the Great Lakes Region..

title: Fact Check: Kenya has built 7000 kilometres of tarmac in the last 5 years compared to only 1...
text:
Claim: Kenya has built 7000 kilometres of tarmac in the last 5 years compared to only 12,000 constructed in the last 50 years.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: The claim seems to be supported based on the QA evidence gathered, there were 80,000km of road built between 2013 and 2018. In 2018 the length of tarmacked road increased from 6,000km to 17,600km which is 11,600km in that one year alone which exceeds the amount in the claim.

Evidence:

Q: How much tarmac has been laid in the 5 years between 2013-2018?
A: A January 2018 report by the national treasury showed that between the financial years of 2013/2014 and 2016/2017, some 1,919 km of bitumen road were built.. 

Q: How much Tarmac has been laid in the last 50 years?
A: No answer could be found.. 

Q: Did Kenya construct 7,000 kilometres of tarmac within 5 yrs by 2018 ?
A: According to the latest data, his regime has built 80,000 kilometres of roads between 2013 and 2018, taking Kenya’s road network to 246,757 kilometres.
Notably, Uhuru’s administration has increased the length of tarmacked roads by 6,000km to 17,600km in 2018. This claim is true and can be checked in the source..

title: Fact Check: The SGR railway line, currently being built in Kenya, has been in the books of t...
text:
Claim: The SGR railway line, currently being built in Kenya, has been in the books of the Kenyan government for 30 years – it was not built.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: It was developed in 2007 which is not 30 years ago.

Evidence:

Q: When was Kenya’s SGR railway project first developed?
A: The project was developed in 2007 according to a railway master plan study for the East Africa Community.. 

Q: Was the Kenyan SGR railway line currently being built, proposed in the 1980s or 1990s?
A: No answer could be found.. 

Q: When was the current Kenyan President Uhuru Kenyatta elected?
A: In 2013, Uhuru Kenyatta was elected as the 4th and current president of Kenya after being re-elected back in office in 2017..

title: Fact Check: The diaspora remittances (money sent by a person in a foreign land to their home...
text:
Claim: The diaspora remittances (money sent by a person in a foreign land to their home country) contributed upwards of KSh290 billion to the Kenya economy in 2019.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: as the claim says "Upwards of" ksh290 billion, we can rate this as false, as the number KSh270.1 billion.

Evidence:

Q: How much was made by Kenya from remittances from the diaspora in 2019
A: KSh270.1 billion. 

Q: Was the diaspora remittances  contributed KSh290 billion to the Kenya economy in 2019 ?
A: In 2018 remittances were at US$2.697 billion. Using the central bank’s exchange rate for 8 February 2019, when Ruto made the claim, this works out to KSh270.1 billion. Nearly half was from North America.
The deputy president said the amount was “upwards” of KSh290 billion, so we rate his claim is therefore false..

title: Fact Check: The railway improvements has been in the books of the Kenyan government for 30 y...
text:

Verdict: Refuted

Q: When was the Kenyan railway project first developed?
A: 2007. 

Q: which company built the railway in Kenya
A: the China Road and Bridge Corporation – the Chinese firm that built it.

title: Fact Check: Remittances in Kenya, contributed around KSh290 billion last year.
text:
Claim: Remittances in Kenya, contributed around KSh290 billion last year.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: QA pairs indicate number remitted was around 10% less than  that stated on the claim.

Evidence:

Q: What are remittances in Kenya?
A: A remittance is money sent by a person in a foreign land to his or her home country. Due to the huge sums involved, remittances are now being recognised as an important contributor to the country’s growth and development.

The Central Bank of Kenya conducts a survey on remittance inflows every month through formal channels that include commercial banks and other authorised international remittances service providers in Kenya.. 

Q: How much were the remittances in Kenya in 2018?
A: Remittances in Kenya ranged between 205,134 and 266,186 million dollars.. 

Q: How much was 266,186 million dollars equivalent to in KSh at the time of the claim?
A: 26618.6 million KSh.

title: Fact Check: Kenya have connected 6.9 million people to electricity in the last five years.
text:
Claim: Kenya have connected 6.9 million people to electricity in the last five years.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: the number is significantly lower than quoted, at only 4.4 million

Evidence:

A: 2019.. 

Q: How many people were connected to the electricity grid in Kenya in the 5 years prior to the claims date (2019)?
A: In June 2013,there were 2.33 million customers.. 

Q: how many people were connected to Kenya's power grid in 2019?
A: around 6.76 million customers were connected to the electricity grid by 30 June 2018,.

title: Fact Check: Illegal immigrants in Australia are by law entitled to a job, welfare and $70,00...
text:
Claim: Illegal immigrants in Australia are by law entitled to a job, welfare and $70,000

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Without a visa, Illegal immigrants are unable to work, have access to welfare or receive money from the government.

Evidence:

Q: In 2019, were illegal immigrants in Australia entitled to a job by law?
A: No. In 2019, the Australian Government made it clear that asylum seekers without a visa would never be settled in Australia.

Q: In 2019, were illegal immigrants in Australia entitled to welfare by law?
A: No. In 2019, the Australian Government made it clear that asylum seekers without a visa would never be settled in Australia.

Q: In 2019, were illegal immigrants in Australia entitled to a payment of $70,000 by law?
A: No. In 2019, the Australian Government made it clear that asylum seekers without a visa would never be settled in Australia.

increase of 5.2 per cent after discounting inflation. State-owned companies have been the biggest
contributors to public-sector expenditure over this period, spending R1.2 trillion in total. Municipalities and
provincial departments have also increased their infrastructure spending, contributing R554 billion and
R643 billion respectively to build schools, hospitals, clinics and other community-related infrastructure..

Q: When was the Safe (Sanitation Appropriate For Education) initiative launched in South Africa?
A: The SAFE (Sanitation Appropriate for Education) campaign, launched at a breakfast with CEOs of major companies in Pretoria on Tuesday, 14th of August 2018, has already raised R45 million from the corporate sector to fix sanitation in schools, according to a press release from the department. The department said 3,898 schools needed sanitation.. 

Q: What are the steps to be taken after launching the SAFE (Sanitation Appropriate for Education) campaign?
A: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa vowed to get rid of open pit latrines in schools across the country on Tuesday following numerous deaths, according to South Africa’s Eyewitness News.

Ramaphosa said an audit will be conducted of the country’s 25,000 schools over the next month, and then an infrastructure plan for replacing the latrines will be devised over the following three months. The government will then come up with a financing strategy for the project, with the partial help of private donors, and finally implement improved sanitation facilities, according to Eyewitness News.

Key financing partners of the Sanitation Appropriate for Education (Safe) program include the Nelson Mandela Foundation and UNICEF.

A: yes. Ramaphosa put the number at “nearly one million children” in 2018. Then in 2019,  his figure was “over 700,000”. Both figures are an underestimate.. 

Q: Is Ramaphosa's statement of "over" 700,000 technically correct, whilst being inaccurate?
A: Yes. The statement is technically correct as he stated "over" 700,000 children. But it is inaccurate as the 2017 general household survey reported that just over 2 million children under the age of four were attending a “day care centre, crèche, early childhood development centre (ECD) playgroup, nursery school or preprimary school”.

Q: How many children were in some kind of pre-school in South Africa in 2016?
A: 2,409,953 children were in some kind of pre-school in 2016. (Note: These were children who were younger than eight at the start of 2016.).

Justification: Q&A 1 shows that the figure for enrolment as between 900,000 to 1.5 million both of which are supportive of the claim of it being 'over 700000.
Q&A 1 also states the most reliable figure is 2.08 million which is also supportive of the claim of it being over 700000.

Evidence:

Q: According to experts how many children are in early childhood development facilities in South Africa in 2018?
A: Martin Gustafsson
Research on Socio-Economic Policy (ReSEP)
University of Stellenbosch  2018

The main aim of the current report is to correct what seems to be widespread
misperceptions around how many children in South Africa attend some form of ECD
institution, or pre-school in the sense of an institution below the level of a primary
school. Many available statistics point to total ECD enrolment being in the range of
900,000 to 1.5 million. In fact, Stats SA data reliably point to a figure of around 2.4
million.. 

Q: Is 2 million more than 700,000?
A: Yes. Simple maths

title: Fact Check: Since South Africa launched the initiative, 699 schools have been provided with ...
text:
Claim: Since South Africa launched the initiative, 699 schools have been provided with safe and appropriate sanitation facilities and projects, and a further 1,150 schools are either in planning, design or construction stages.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: Q&A 1 shows that a few more than claimed schools (787) have been provided with safe and appropriate sanitation facilities and projects.
Q&A 2 shows that a few less than claimed (1,062) schools were in the planning, design or construction stages
but the numbers are close and what's high in the first figure makes up for the second figure being a little low.
However Q&A 3 says the numbers are not actually verifiable so more evidence is needed to say these numbers are factual. in reference to Q&A 3's statement.

Evidence:

Q: How many schools have been provided with safe and appropriate sanitation facilitates in South Africa?
A: 787 schools “have been provided with safe, age- and grade-appropriate sanitation facilities, with the old pit latrines demolished.". 

Q: How many South Africa schools are either in planning, design or construction stages?
A: 1,062 schools were in the planning, design or construction stages. 

Q: Are these numbers verifiable?
A: No. “There is very limited publicly available data on the scope, plans and progress regarding the Safe initiative,” said Hopolang Selebalo, co-head of research for advocacy organisation Equal Education.

Ntsiki Mpulo, head of communications for civil society movement Section 27, added: “There doesn’t seem to be any concrete information available on Safe inroads since its announcement.”

title: Fact Check: For the first time in 65 years America is a net exporter of energy
text:

Evidence:

Q: How much natural gas did the US export in 2018?
A: Since exports of U.S. LNG began in 2016, over 1.3 trillion cubic feet of U.S. natural gas has been exported.. 

Q: How much oil did the US import in 2016?
A: As seen in figure 2, crude oil imports declined steadily as the United States became less reliant on foreign oil. Imports fell from 8.9 million barrels per day in September 2011 to a low of 7.1 million barrels per day in June 2014, a 20.7-percent decline. Crude oil imports remained below 7.5 million barrels per day as production slowed during the second half of 2015. Domestic production also slipped over the rest of 2015, falling to 9.2 million barrels per day by the end of the year.. 

Q: Why does the US import and export oil?
A: First, there is economics. Decisions to import or export are typically based on supply and demand for a product at that location, as well as transportation costs. Products are often both exported and imported when it makes economic sense..

title: Fact Check: Americans pay vastly more than people in other countries for the exact same drug...
text:
Claim: Americans pay vastly more than people in other countries for the exact same drugs, often made in the exact same place

Verdict: Supported

Justification: Prices in the United States are higher than those in all comparison countries
U.S. prices were 256 percent of those in the 32 comparison countries combined.

Evidence:

Q: Has there been independent research into the price of drugs around the world?
A: Yes. Including by the RAND corporation.

Q: Is the RAND corporation a reliable source?
A: Yes. 'The RAND Corporation, according to the corporate web site, is a "nonprofit institution that helps improve policy and decisionmaking through research and analysis" and maintains that pursuing its core objectives of "quality" and "objectivity" requires it to be nonpartisan.'

Q: What does the RAND corporation report say about drug prices in the USA compared to the rest of the world?
A: The United States spends more on prescription drugs on a per capita basis than most other countries do. Understanding the extent to which drug prices are higher in the United States than in other countries—after accounting for differences in the volume and mix of drugs—is useful when developing and targeting policies to address both growth in drug spending and the financial impact of prescription drugs on consumers.

Prices in the United States are higher than those in all comparison countries
U.S. prices were 256 percent of those in the 32 comparison countries combined.

In comparisons with individual countries, U.S. prices ranged from 170 percent of prices in Mexico to 779 percent of prices in Turkey.

The gap between U.S. prices and prices in other countries was larger for brand-name originator drugs.

U.S. prices were 84 percent of prices in all non-U.S. countries for unbranded generics.

U.S. prices were 190 percent of prices in other countries after adjusting U.S. prices downward to account for rebates and other discounts..

title: Fact Check: One in five people aged 16 and over are drinking more than recommended levels.
text:
Claim: One in five people aged 16 and over are drinking more than recommended levels.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: Q&A 3 shows that the figure in the claim of 1 in 5 over 16yolds drinking above recommended levels is about correct with a percentage of 21% to back this up. 

Evidence:

Q: What is the recommended drinking  levels for people aged 16 and above in the UK ?
A: The UK Chief Medical Officers considered and accepted the advice of the expert group
and agreed on 3 main recommendations:
• A weekly guideline on regular drinking;
• Advice on single episodes of drinking; and
• A guideline on pregnancy and drinking.
On regular drinking
New weekly guideline [this applies for people who drink regularly or frequently i.e. most
weeks].
The Chief Medical Officers’ guideline for both men and women is that:
• You are safest not to drink regularly more than 14 units per week, to keep health
risks from drinking alcohol to a low level.
• If you do drink as much as 14 units per week, it is best to spread this evenly over
3 days or more. If you have one or two heavy drinking sessions, you increase
your risks of death from long term illnesses and from accidents and injuries.
• The risk of developing a range of illnesses (including, for example, cancers of
the mouth, throat and breast) increases with any amount you drink on a regular
basis.
• If you wish to cut down the amount you’re drinking, a good way to help achieve
this is to have several drink-free days each week.. 

Q: What is the age limit of Alcohol consumption for people in UK ?
A: The following table, showing penalties for selling, supplying, offering to supply and hiring (as appropriate to the 
legislation) products to persons under certain ages. These penalties are in place to protect young people and a good 
reason to stop shops selling to those underage.
PRODUCT AGE RESTRICTION MAXIMUM PENALTY
Adult fireworks and sparklers (category 2 [outdoor use 
- confined areas] and category 3 [outdoor use - large 
open areas] fireworks) 
18 and over Unlimited fine and six months’ imprisonment 
Aerosol paint 16 and over £2,500 
Alcohol 18 and over Unlimited fine and forfeit of licence 
Christmas crackers 12 and over Unlimited fine and six months’ imprisonment 
Crossbows 18 and over Unlimited fine and six months’ imprisonm. 

Q: What is the recommended drinking  levels for people in the UK ?
A: The UK Chief Medical Officers considered and accepted the advice of the expert group
and agreed on 3 main recommendations:
• A weekly guideline on regular drinking;
• Advice on single episodes of drinking; and
• A guideline on pregnancy and drinking.
On regular drinking
New weekly guideline [this applies for people who drink regularly or frequently i.e. most
weeks].
The Chief Medical Officers’ guideline for both men and women is that:
• You are safest not to drink regularly more than 14 units per week, to keep health
risks from drinking alcohol to a low level.
• If you do drink as much as 14 units per week, it is best to spread this evenly over
3 days or more. If you have one or two heavy drinking sessions, you increase
your risks of death from long term illnesses and from accidents and injuries.
• The risk of developing a range of illnesses (including, for example, cancers of
the mouth, throat and breast) increases with any amount you drink on a regular
basis.
• If you wish to cut down the amount you’re drinking, a good way to help achieve
this is to have several drink-free days each week..

title: Fact Check: Kenya Ports Authority is looking to hire 140 people, aged 18 - 35, who have grad...
text:
Claim: Kenya Ports Authority is looking to hire 140 people, aged 18 - 35, who have graduated from a well recognised university between 2012 and 2018.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Fake advert

Evidence:

Q: what kind of claim is this?
A: Kazi kazi kazi....kuna kazi Poti?
eye-crossed-out
False Information
Checked by independent fact-checkers
 See Why 
No photo description available.. 

Q: Is the Kenya Ports Authority looking to hire 140 people, aged 18–35, who have graduated from a well-recognized university between 2012 and 2018?
A: No. The attention of the Kenya Ports Authority (KPA) Management has been drawn to the actions of some fraudsters who are inviting unsuspecting job seekers for employment at the Authority. The deceitful advert targeting the youth has been circulated via social media and other online platforms.

We wish to clarify that KPA has a clear recruitment policy which includes publishing of vacancies in the mainstream newspapers and on the KPA website www.kpa.co.ke. Thereafter, formal communication on interviews for shortlisted applicants is undertaken. It should also be noted that the Authority has official domain email addresses which are on our website and not the gmail address indicated in the fake advert. Further, it should be noted that all recruitment activities in KPA are devoid of any payments.

Members of the public are therefore advised to ignore the messages circulating on social media and other online platforms purporting that KPA has advertised 140 vacancies targeting diploma and degree holders. This is a hoax. We therefore advise members of the public to beware of such conmen/fraudsters and to imme- diately report any such incidents to the Authority or the nearest Police Station.
KPA is committed to best practice and the principles of transparency and equal employment opportunities to all, when such opportunities arise, as enunciated in the Constitution of Kenya.

title: Fact Check: South African footballer Ekstein resigns from Kaizer Chiefs after fight with man...

Its says the midfielder is not happy with his new contract, stalling negotiations and prompting speculation that he may sign with another club in the next season. So this claim is false..

title: Fact Check: When the Buhari administration came in, Boko Haram was holding 17 local governme...
text:

Evidence:

Q: What is the Buhari administration?
A: It refers to President Muhammadu Buhari of Nigeria. 

Q: What is boko harem?
A: The group called Jama atu Ahlis Sunna Lidda a Waati Wal Jihad, better known as Boko Haram (which roughly translates as “Western education is forbidden”), is an armed group that opposes secular authority. They oppose anything they see as being “influenced by the West” including voting and secular education.. 

Q: When did the Buhari Administration begin?
A: 2015.

title: Fact Check: Close to 40% of South Africans who need jobs are unemployed, meaning that more t...

Q: How many people were unemployed in South Africa in February 2019?
A: According to the report and based on the official definition of unemployment, 6.2 million people were unemployed at that time.. 

Q: Does the official definition of unemployment include people who are considered "discouraged work seekers"?
A: No. People who wanted to work, but did not try to find work because of a lack of jobs in their area, because they had lost hope or could not find work requiring their skills, were not counted as unemployed.. 

Q: How many people were considered discouraged work seekers?
A: 2.7 million..

Q: What amount of land did the Government have as a target to distribute?
A: 30% of this land to the previously disadvantaged by 2014. This constitutes approximately 24.5 million hectares of the said agricultural land.. 

Q: Approximately how much land has been restored to date?
A: About 30% of the 24.5m has been targeted by 2014.

Broken down as follows 
1994/95 - May 2009, amounts to 6.7m ha + 882 238ha (land redistribution: 2009 to-date) + 368 483ha (restitution: 2009 to-date), totalling 7.950 721m ha.

– Capital Expenditure (including share of

title: Fact Check: Obama declared Flint water crisis a National Emergency and never fixed it.
