A: No. Obama did not declare a "national" emergency for flint. He did sign an Emergency declaration for Michigan which covered Flint since it is in that state.

Q: Was the city of Flint in Michigan awarded funds for the water crisis?

Q: Have works already began to repair and replace the water infrastructure in Flint?
A: Overall, to date, service lines to 7,966 homes have been identified as lead and/or galvanized and have been replaced.

title: Fact Check: In Tshwane, the Democratic Alliance (DA) inherited a deficit of over R1 billion ...

Q&A 2 shows that by 2016-17 (a year later) they had turned it into a surplus of R730 million. which supports the claim fully.

Evidence:

Q: Did the Democratic Alliance (DA) inherit a deficit of over R1 billion from the African National Congress (ANC)?
A: The City of Tshwane had a R1.4 billion deficit in 2015/16.. 

Q: Did the City of Tshwane have a surplus in 2016/17?
A: In 2016–17, Tshwane had a surplus of R730 million.. 

Q: Did the African National Congress (ANC) leave behind a surplus in 2016/17?

title: Fact Check: The German press launched a massive campaign to discredit Russian and Russian la...
text:
Claim: The German press launched a massive campaign to discredit Russian and Russian language media.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: From the question and answer pair it seems that the Russians are not discredited, but the action from other countries is due to their own actions. Therefore, the label is refuted

Evidence:

Q: Has there been any evidence that the German press has tried to supress or discredit Russian language media?
A: Earlier in January, the German Association of Journalists (DJV) urged the state media regulatory authorities not to grant a broadcasting license to the channel Russia Today for its website RT Deutsch.

“Russia Today is not an information medium for us, but a propaganda instrument of the Kremlin, which tries to make politics with disinformation," said DJV Federal Chairman Frank Überall. He added that, RT "has repeatedly invented stories in the past." There should not be a broadcasting license for a propaganda station.". 

Q: Was this a campaign against Russian Media?
A: No. Following Zakharova’s press conference on January 31, DJV issued a statement saying that there was no campaign against Russian foreign media in Germany, there is only “unanimous criticism toward the methods of their work.”

The editor-in-chief of T-online.de Florian Harms, and Christian Mihr, the Managing Director of the German office of “Reporters without Borders,” an International NGO based in Paris, joined in denying the Russian allegations.

The German government also rejected Russian MFA’s accusations that German press, in cooperation with the government, are waging a campaign against Russian media. Government spokesperson Steffen Seibert said, “Those who spread such unfounded claims have little to no idea of Germany and little idea of freedom of the press. I explicitly reject such allegations.”

Q: Why are German media critic of Russia?
A: RT and Sputnik face mistrust not only in Germany, but throughout most of Europe, including Britain and France. The French government has opened an investigation into possible Russian interference during the Yellow Vest protests last year, when social-media accounts linked to Moscow spread false news published by Russia Today and Sputnik.

An earlier fact check established that Moscow used the two outlets to undermine Emmanuel Macron’s presidential election campaign in 2017.

Macron has stated openly in the presence of Russian President Vladimir Putin that “Russia Today and Sputnik were agents of influence and propaganda that spread falsehoods about me and my campaign.”

And in December 2018, UK’s media regulator Ofcom, which has launched numerous probes of RT activities, found that the Russian channel has failed to comply with Britain’s broadcasting rules, which could result in fines and ultimately revocation of its broadcast license..

title: Fact Check: Expanding Medicaid would bring 40,000 jobs to North Carolina.
text:

A: Ambulatory health care services, Hospitals, Construction, Retail & Wholesale trade, Food services & drinking places, Professional, scientific & technical services, Social assistance, State & local and all other sectors.. 

Q: What would be the potential job losses if Medicaid was not expanded into North Carolina.
A: By 2017, potential job losses would
rise to 36,000 and would continue to climb to 43,000 by 2020..

title: Fact Check: Germany owes £3.7 trillion of WWII debt.
text:
Claim: Germany owes £3.7 trillion of WWII debt.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The debts referred to in the claim as still being owed in 2019, were written off in 1990 as stated in the Q&A pairs.

Evidence:

Q: What was the total cost of damage caused to Britain by Germany in World War 2?
A: The Commission estimated damage to all properties at
£860 million at 1938 replacement cost or £1,450 million (£1.45 Billion) at 1947
values.. 

Q: What is £1.45 Billion from 1947 worth in modern day money?
A: Factoring inflation alone at a rate of 4.7% as set by bank of england over this period the total amount would be £38,287,801,729.78. 

Q: Does Germany have an outstanding debt to the UK from damages that occurred during World War 2 ?
A: No the debts were written off in 1990: In 1990, the treaty on the final settlement with respect to Germany was signed by West Germany, East Germany, the US, the UK, the Soviet Union and France. It allowed the recently reunited Germany to have full sovereignty over its internal and external affairs. The Government considers that that treaty definitively settled between the parties matters arising out of the second world war. The treaty was laid before the House for clearance under the Ponsonby rule. The Government have no plans to reopen any claim for reparations from Germany in respect of losses sustained during world war two, including for damage caused to UK cities..

title: Fact Check: More than 9 million eligible voters aren’t registered for South Africa’s 2019 el...
text:

A: Yes, more than 9 million eligible voters aren’t registered for South Africa’s 2019 elections.
While the number of registered voters in 2019 has increased to 26.7 million, the eligible population has increased to about 35.9 million.
This puts the registration rate at 74.5% in 2019.
This claim is correct..

title: Fact Check: The problem with wind is, in the United States, we’re subsidizing these wind tow...
text:
Claim: The problem with wind is, in the United States, we’re subsidizing these wind towers all over the place because wind doesn’t work — for the most part, doesn’t work without subsidy

Verdict: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

Justification: Evidence is not clear on whether subsidizing is a bad thing and whether it would be profitable if wind turbines were not subsided. Also, the U.S. also ranks first in the world for electricity generated from wind - meaning the U.S. depends heavily on wind power. 

Evidence:

Q: Does USA have wind turbines?
A: Yes. The United States ranks first in the world for electricity generated from wind, according to the Department of Energy.. 

Q: Does USA have a subsidy system for wind turbines?
A: A 2017 report by Management Information Services Inc found that non-hydro renewable energy (primarily wind and solar) benefited from $158 billion in federal subsidies, or 16% of the total energy subsidies, largely in the form of tax policy and direct federal expenditures on research and development (R&D).. 

Q: What do America's Wind Turbines cost to product a Megawatt of electricity?
A: Lazard, an investment bank, estimated in November 2018 that unsubsidized wind costs between $29-$56 per MWh and with subsidies, wind costs between $14-$47 per MWh..

title: Fact Check: Chelsea Clinton said Satanism is a religion that deserves respect.

A: No. Oh goodness gracious. We can be civil, cheerful, respectful to & friends with people who don’t share our religious beliefs. Sometimes, we even marry them. I’m a Methodist & my husband is Jewish, thank you for asking. A very happy New Year to you Rhonda!

Q: Has Chelsea Clinton ever mentioned the Church of Satan?
A: Yes. In 2017, @ChurchofSatan & I were put on a few threads together. In 2018, it’s...@Hooters. What a time to be alive Chrissy!

Q: Is the Church of Satan involved in satanism?
A: Why do Satanists worship The Devil?

We don’t. Satanists are atheists. We see the universe as being indifferent to us, and so all morals and values are subjective human constructions.

Our position is to be self-centered, with ourselves being the most important person (the “God”) of our subjective universe, so we are sometimes said to worship ourselves. Our current High Priest Gilmore calls this the step moving from being an atheist to being an “I-Theist.”

Satan to us is a symbol of pride, liberty and individualism, and it serves as an external metaphorical projection of our highest personal potential. We do not believe in Satan as a being or person..

title: Fact Check: ANC support for South African university and TVET college students from poor and...
text:

Q&A 3 does say financial aid has increased over recent years which agrees with the claim, but Q&A 3 only shows a figure for what it has increased from in 1991 (22million) not 1994 which is the claim point, so more evidence would be needed for an accurate judgment.

A: 2017/18
R14.1 billion disbursed in student financial aid.. 

Q: How much financial aid was given by the Nafas in 1994?
A: No answer could be found.. 

Q: Has financial aid for South African students increased since 1994?
A: From 1991 to 2014, the number of higher education students funded has
increased from 7 240 to 186 150, consistently showing a higher proportion
of female students (for only two years of the 24 years is this less than
50%), African students (most – 21 of 24 years – this is higher than 85%)
followed by Coloured students, then Indian and then white students
(usually between 1,7% to 3,9%).
 The funds to support these students increased from R22m in 1991 to
R6,6bn in 2014, with the most significant growth in the years from 2010 to
2014.

property taxes in Wisconsin on 11 January 2019 is $2,876.

title: Fact Check: The NHS Long Term Plan will save 500,000 lives.
text:
Claim: The NHS Long Term Plan will save 500,000 lives.

Verdict: Not Enough Evidence

Justification: While the answers support this number, the evidence is based on the assumption of the NHS England’s Chief Executive, who has written the plan, which makes it probably biased. Further independent evidence is needed to support or deny the claim.

Evidence:

Q: What is The NHS Long Term Plan?
A: The new plan focuses on what the NHS can deliver, and how. In terms of what, the aim is to shift the NHS model of care further upstream: more preventive care, closer integration of services in the community for people with chronic conditions, better coordination of urgent care to reduce demand on emergency departments, and outpatient visits reduced by a third. Improvements are promised in priority services, including mental health, maternity, and cancer. And there is a welcome emphasis on the NHS’s role in tackling health inequalities. Gaps in life expectancy in England are wide, growing, and unjust.5. 

Q: How will the NHS Long Term Plan save 500,000 lives?
A: NHS England’s Chief Executive, Simon Stevens, has written the plan at the request of the prime minister. He says it can save up to half a million lives by focusing on killer conditions and getting people to live healthier lifestyles.. 

Q: What is the breakdown of the 500,000 people saved?
A: No answer could be found..

title: Fact Check: Nigeria's capital expenditure in 2016 was N1.2 trillion and 2017 was N1.5 trilli...
text:
Claim: Nigeria's capital expenditure in 2016 was N1.2 trillion and 2017 was N1.5 trillion.

Verdict: Not Enough Evidence

Justification: It seems that the  umbers were slightly different, therefore the claim is refuted

Evidence:

Q: What was the capital expenditure component of Nigeria's spending in 2016?
A: The capital expenditure component of the spending in 2016 was only N173bn of the projected N1.58tn. However, some of the capital expenses were carried into the new fiscal year 2017 in line with the clause attached to the Appropriation act.. 

Q: What was the capital expenditure component of Nigeria's spending in 2017?
A: the Minister of Power, Works and Housing (PWH), Babatunde Raji Fashola suggest that his ministry did not complete any capital project in 2017, despite receiving the largest capital expenditure allocation across all parastatals. 

Despite the Ministry's reports, the Debt Management Office (DMO) stated that it released ₦1.2 trillion to finance capital projects in 2017. Given the size of Mr Fashola's ministry, it is improbable that they received none of these funds. The implication is that the Ministry received these funds too late in the year to execute for that calendar year.

That is highly plausible. Afterall, in December 2017, the Minister of Finance announced the Ministry released ₦750 billion for capital projects. These projects effectively become 2018 projects..

title: Fact Check: Nigerian PDP presidential candidate Atiku Abubakar claimed Nigeria has "not had ...
text:

Evidence:

Q: How many unemployed people are there in Nigeria?
A: From July to September 2017 the country’s unemployment rate increased to 18.8% from 16.2% in the previous three months.. 

Q: Have there been higher levels of unemployment in Nigeria before this?
A: In 2011, the unemployment rate was higher - at 23.9%.. 

Q: Has there been a change how unemployment figures are calculated?
A: Yes. The calculation method was changed in 2014 so comparing historical figures with current figures would be wrong.

title: Fact Check: In Nigeria the question of Almajiris’ lack of primary or basic education are all...
text:

Evidence:

Q: What are Almajiris?
A: In Nigeria, Almajiri is any child or adult who begs for assistance in the streets or from house to house. Islamic teachings strongly prohibit begging except in very special circumstances.
The majority of Almajiris in Nigeria are children from 3 to 18 years old. Community leaders say these children are totally neglected by their parents.. 

Q: Are Nigerian children entitled to a free education?
A: Yes. 2.-( 1) Every Government in Nigeria sha.ll provide free, compulsory and
Universal basic education for every child of primary and junior secondary, school age.
(2) Every parent shall ensure that his child or ward attends and completes his -
(a) primary school education; and
(b) junior secondary school education,
by endeavouring to send the child to primary and junior secondary schools.
(3) The stake-holders in education in a Local Government Area, shall ensure
that every parent or person who has the care and custody of a child performs the duty
imposed on him under section 2(2) of this Act.

Q: Who is responsible for providing primary education in Nigeria?
A: Local government councils..

title: Fact Check: Iraq and Syria have been liberated from ISIS.
text:
Claim: Iraq and Syria have been liberated from ISIS.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: n other words, declaring ISIS has been “beaten” or “defeated,” as President Trump did in December 2018, is flat-out wrong and would be worthy of Pinocchios.More recently, he has said that the United States has liberated “virtually 100 percent of ISIS in Iraq and Syria” and that the caliphate is “almost knocked out.” These assertions are closer to reality. ISIS can no longer claim it has a territorial caliphate in Iraq and Syria. It no longer controls land or operates a government.

That, however, doesn’t mean it could not resurge, as the president’s aides have made clear. In comparison with the last time the United States withdrew forces, the situation is eerily similar if not arguably worse.

Evidence:

Q: Have Iraq and Syria been ‘liberated’ from ISIS, as President Trump says?
A: In other words, declaring ISIS has been “beaten” or “defeated,” as President Trump did in December 2018, is flat-out wrong and would be worthy of Pinocchios.More recently, he has said that the United States has liberated “virtually 100 percent of ISIS in Iraq and Syria” and that the caliphate is “almost knocked out.” These assertions are closer to reality. ISIS can no longer claim it has a territorial caliphate in Iraq and Syria. It no longer controls land or operates a government.

That, however, doesn’t mean it could not resurge, as the president’s aides have made clear. In comparison with the last time the United States withdrew forces, the situation is eerily similar if not arguably worse..

We have the numbers, but we’ve got to understand our power and we’ve got to use our power,”

A: Yes. She went on to say “We have the power. We have the numbers, but we’ve got to understand our power and we’ve got to use our power,”

title: Fact Check: President Donald Trump is abusing the prescription drug Adderall.

That's according to White House physician Ronny Jackson, who released information about Trump's yearly physical, which was conducted last week, at a press conference on Tuesday..

title: Fact Check: Diabetes can be cured by consuming sprouted wheat for 2 days.

A: There is no cure for diabetes.. 

Q: Can Type 1 diabetes be cured?
A: Diabetes can't be cured. Treatment aims to keep your blood glucose levels as normal as possible and control your symptoms.. 

Q: Is there a cure for Type 2 diabetes?
A: Diabetes is a lifelong disease and there is no cure.

Some people with type 2 diabetes no longer need medicine if they lose weight and become more active..

title: Fact Check: If a fire starts in the Yale library, all the oxygen leaves the building killing...
text:

Verdict: Refuted

Q: Does Yale have a rare book library?
A: Yes. The Yale University Library comprises three central libraries—Sterling Memorial Library, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, and the Anne T. and Robert M. Bass Library

Q: Does the Beinecke Library have a fire-extinguishing system removes the air from the book stacks dooming anyone inside to a slow death by asphyxiation?
A: There is a kernal of truth to this. Instead of water sprinklers that would harm the rare books collections, a combination of halon and Inergen gases would be pumped into the stacks to stop the combustion process, and thus the spread of fire.

They do lower the percentage of oxygen, but not enough to kill anyone.. 

Q: What is Inergen?
A: Inergen is a breathable fire extinguishing agent..

title: Fact Check: the United States ranks third in murders throughout the world
text:
Claim: the United States ranks third in murders throughout the world

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The U.S. has the second-highest number of homicides, behind Brazil, even if you remove the cities of Chicago, Detroit, Washington, D.C., St. Louis, and New Orleans from the total.

Evidence:

Q: Does the United States rank third in murders throughout the world and would removing the cities of Chicago, Detroit, Washington D.C., St. Louis, and New Orleans from the total make the U.S. 189th out of 193 countries in the world in homicides?
A: No, that's not true: The U.S.has the second highest number of homicides -- behind Brazil -- but the nation's murder rate (the number of homicides for every 100,000 population) is way down the chart globally. Those five cities account for just 8 percent of total number of homicides in the U.S. annually. Removing them would not significantly change the U.S. murder rate ranking and it would still be number two in total homicides..

Mr. President, with all due respect, you are wrong.  The fires in So. Cal are urban interface fires and have NOTHING to do with forest management.  Come to SoCal and learn the facts & help the victims.   Scott Austin, Pres IAFF 809.

title: Fact Check: Georgia Gov. Brian Kemp put 53,000 registration voters on hold, 70% of whom were...
text:
Claim: Georgia Gov. Brian Kemp put 53,000 registration voters on hold, 70% of whom were Black.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: The Q&A sources give information verifying that the claim is correct.

Evidence:

Q: How many registration voters did Georgia Gov. Brian Kemp put on hold?
A: At least 53,000 voter registration applications. 

Q: How many registration votes by African Americans were put on hold?
A: 70% of votes by African Americans were put on hold.. 

Q: Why were 53,000 voter registrations on hold?
A: Kemp’s office is holding the applications because they were flagged in the state’s “exact match” process. Under this system, information on a voter application must exactly match data on file with the state’s Department of Driver Services or the Social Security Administration. If the information does not match — often due to things like a misspelled name, a middle name not being fully written out, or a missing hyphen — an application is held for additional screening and the applicant is notified and given a period to correct their information..

title: Fact Check: Samora Machel once said, if you are applauded by white people then you must know...
text:
Claim: Samora Machel once said, if you are applauded by white people then you must know that there is something wrong with you.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Seems from the 3nd QA that the claim would be out of character with Machrl. Moreover, the 2nd claim states that this was done without a prior justification. Therefore claim is refuted 

Evidence:

Q: Who is Samora Machel?
A: He is former president of South Africa’s neighbour Mozambique and leader of anti-colonial armed group Frelimo. 

Q: Is there any evidence that he said this?
A: Shivambu, the deputy president and parliamentary chief whip of the Economic Freedom Fighters (EFF) claimed that Machel used to say this, and Shivambu posted this on his twitter without sources.. 

Q: Is this in character with Machel?
A: No. It was well documented that Machel was a lifelong anti-racist and welcomed white people born in Mozambique to join in Frelimo's struggle.  He also appointed white people in his government.

title: Fact Check: Irregular expenditure by the government of South Africa’s Western Cape province ...
text:
Claim: Irregular expenditure by the government of South Africa’s Western Cape province rose from R23 million in the 2016/17 financial year to R44 million in 2017/18 – an increase of R21 million.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: The irregular expenditure increased from R23 million in 2016-2017 to R44 in 2017-2018 which is an increase of R21 million. 

Evidence:

Q: What is irregular expenditure?
A: Irregular expenditure is expenditure that was not incurred in the manner prescribed by legislation; in other words, somewhere in the process that led to the expenditure, the auditee did not comply with the applicable legislation.
Such expenditure does not necessarily mean that money had been wasted or that fraud had been committed. It is an indicator of non-compliance in the process that needs to be investigated by management to determine whether it was an unintended error, negligence or done with the intention to work against the requirements of legislation (which, for example, require that procurement should be fair, equitable, transparent, competitive and cost-effective).. 

Q: What was South Africa's Western Cape provinces irregular expenditure in 2016/17?
A: R423 Billion.. 

Q: What was South Africa's Western Cape provinces irregular expenditure in 2017/18?
A: R44 Million..

title: Fact Check: Applying toothpaste on acne spots can help reduce its size.
text:
Claim: Applying toothpaste on acne spots can help reduce its size.

Verdict: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

Justification: QA pairs conflict each other. Some state dry out skin and helps and others say cause further irritation.

Evidence:

Q: Are there ingredients in toothpaste that help reduce acne spots better than conventional treatments
A: "Toothpaste contains certain ingredients -- baking soda, hydrogen peroxide, alcohol, menthol, essential oils, triclosan -- that cause pimples to dry out,"  However, "there are no ingredients in toothpaste that make this method more effective than conventional treatments.. 

Q: What does toothpaste do to acne
A: Toothpaste irritates the skin, so some may believe that it dries out pimples, but what it really does is irritate and cause redness and peeling. 

Q: Can toothpaste be used to treat pimples?
A: An internet search turns up many quick-fixes for pimples. Here’s Dr. Khetarpal’s take on some of the most common ones.

Toothpaste. Many toothpastes contain ingredients like alcohol or baking soda that may help dry out a pimple. But, toothpaste also contains other ingredients that aren’t intended to be put directly on your face. She cautions that using toothpaste to treat a pimple could possibly irritate your skin..

title: Fact Check: Women have to be 25 years old, married, have at least one son and one daughter, ...
text:
Claim: Women have to be 25 years old, married, have at least one son and one daughter, and have her husband's consent to get a tubal ligation.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: This claim is refuted. According to the QA pair, tubal ligation is a choice made by the woman deciding on getting the treatment. The only requirements to receive this treatment is counselling as it is an irreversible form of contraception. "When appropiate" the patients partner can be counselled too. You do not need to have 2 children, married and 25 to get tubal ligation. Therefore, this claim is refuted. 

Evidence:

Q: What is the American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists recommendations to physicians about tubal ligation?
A: The Committee on Practice Bulletins-Gynecology of the American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists (ACOG) has released a practice bulletin on sterilization. “ACOG Practice Bulletin No. 46: Benefits and Risks of Sterilization” appears in the September 2003 issue of Obstetrics and Gynecology.

According to ACOG, tubal sterilization may be recommended as a safe and effective method for women who desire permanent contraception. Women should be counseled that tubal ligation is not intended to be reversible; therefore, those who do not want permanent contraception should be counseled to consider other methods of contraception.

To reduce future regret, the patient and her partner, when appropriate, should be counseled..

title: Fact Check: Mayonnaise containing starch is harmful.
text:
Claim: Mayonnaise containing starch is harmful.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The Q&A pairs confirm both that mayo contains starch, and that it is not harmful.

Evidence:

A: No. Starchy foods are our main source of carbohydrate and have an important role in a healthy diet.

Q: Does mayonnaise contain starch?
A: Generally yes although starch free mayonnaise has been developed..

title: Fact Check: Shops buy apples that are coated with wax.
text:
Claim: Shops buy apples that are coated with wax.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: Direct confirmation from a trusted source.

Evidence:

Q: Do apples naturally have a coat of wax?
A: Yes. Pick an apple off a tree, buff it a little and it will shine! That’s because the fruit is coated with a layer of natural wax that protects it from drying out and helps to prevent fungi from getting a foothold.

Q: What is an apple's natural wax made of?
A: The wax is a mixture of up to fifty different compounds, most of which fall into the chemical category known as esters. There are also alcohols like heptacosanol and malol as well as hydrocarbons such as triacontane, C30H62. This compound can also be isolated from petroleum and is sometimes applied to fruit to supplement its natural wax. In that case chemophobes kick and scream about a petroleum derivative being applied to their fruit but there is no difference between triacontane produced by an apple isolated from petroleum.. 

Q: Do shop bought apples still have their natural wax?
A: No. After apples are picked they are washed before they appear in the supermarket to remove dirt and chemical residues. This process also removes the wax. Since the waxy layer prevents moisture in the apple from escaping, its loss shortens the storage time for the fruit.

title: Fact Check: A video claiming to show “shocking secrets of the food industry” said You can ch...
text:
Claim: A video claiming to show “shocking secrets of the food industry” said You can check whether honey has been diluted with sugar syrup by washing it in water to reveal a honeycomb pattern and the honey’s genetic memory.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The evidence finds that the honeycomb pattern in honey can differ depending on the species of tree it came from. It is even very hard to tell the difference between fake and real honey. Honey also has no genetic memory and is made up of carbohydrates, proteins, amino acids, vitamins, minerals, antioxidants, and other compounds. Hence, this claim is refuted.

Evidence:

Q: Why does a honeycomb-like pattern sometimes appear when you mix honey in water?
A: University of the Sunshine Coast's Dr Peter Brooks, a chemist with extensive knowledge of the chemical composition of honey, said he would not trust results to come out of DIY tests found on the internet. "We see a lot of honeys coming through our lab … they can be anything from thin, depending on the species of tree it comes from, or it can be very thick," Dr Brooks said. "I imagine honeys we test in our labs, half of them would pass these tests and half would fail, almost randomly. "And if you get a good fake honey, one that simulates honey fairly well, you can't tell the difference by the tests they're proposing between a good fake honey and a normal honey. "Good fake honeys are made to mimic a real honey, and they're very hard to tell the difference between them sometimes. I don't think you can tell the difference on these simple tests.". 

Q: Does honey have a genetic memory?
A: No. Honey is made up of carbohydrates, proteins, amino acids, vitamins, minerals, antioxidants, and other compounds. It contains no genetic material, therefore does not have 'genetic memory'.

title: Fact Check: IF any Nigerian Bank fails to return your money within 24 hours of a failed onli...
text:
Claim: IF any Nigerian Bank fails to return your money within 24 hours of a failed online transfer, they will be fined 10,000 naira. The money goes to YOU! All you need to do is report the issue to Central Bank (cpd@cbn.gov.ng) and they will surely take it up.

Verdict: Not Enough Evidence

Justification: The 2nd Q&A pair confirms what the claim says about a fine on banks who fail to return customers funds in a set timeframe of a failed transfere, However it points out that the regulation iteelf does not say who receives the fines, so there is no way of knowing if it does go to the customer as is claimed.

Evidence:

Q: As of the date of the claim, was there a regulation in place stipulating how Nigerian financial institutions should react to failed payments?
A: A circular to all financial institutions in September 2018, directing them to reverse failed payments -- official name being Nigeria Inter-Bank Settlement System (NIBSS) Instant Payment (NIP) -- into customers’ accounts within a day, or pay a  10,000 naira ($28) fine for each item “based on complaints of sender and/ or beneficiary.. 

Q: Does official documentation state  affected customers stand in line to recieve the 10,000 naira fine for a failed online transfer?
A: No. The regulation is completely silent on where each 10,000 naira fine goes.

title: Fact Check: Sen. Ted Cruz's 2018 campaign tried to trick elderly Texans with suspicious mail...
text:
Claim: Sen. Ted Cruz's 2018 campaign tried to trick elderly Texans with suspicious mailers

Verdict: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

Justification: Q&A 1 confirms what the claim says about Ted Cruz sending mailers out, However Q&A 2 points out they were not aimed only at elderly people but elderly people did receive them too, so some cherry picking, 
Q&A 4 points out that people did think they were designed to trick people though so also confirming what the claim says about tricking elderly people, but not elderly people only so again some cherry picking.


Evidence:

Q: Was there anything controversial about any campaign letters sent out by Senator Ted Cruz in 2018?
A: Ted Cruz’s Senate re-election campaign has been sending voters in Texas a fund-raising letter in an envelope labeled “summons enclosed,” drawing criticism from some who called it misleading and raising questions about whether such a practice was legal.

Confusion arises not just from the letter itself but from the envelope it arrives in.

The fund-raising appeal comes in an envelope with the words “SUMMONS ENCLOSED — OPEN IMMEDIATELY” written across it in large capital letters. In the upper left-hand corner are three lines of text: “Official Travis County Summons, Voter Enrollment Campaign Division, Ted Cruz for Senate 2018.”. 

Q: Were the 2018 campaign letters sent out by Ted Cruz in envelopes labelled “summons enclosed”, directly targeting elderly Texans?
A: No. However the concern that elderly voters could be tricked was raised when a photo of one of the letters was posted to Twitter on Sunday by Sean Owen, a data scientist who said it arrived at his home in Austin, Tex., and was addressed to his grandmother, who lived there until she died in April.

“My grandmother was facing cognitive decline at the end of her life and I think if she’d read this she might have been deceived by it,” he said in a phone interview. “It feels shady.”

Q: Were the 2018 campaign letters sent out by Ted Cruz in envelopes labelled “summons enclosed”, illegal?
A: No. The practice is legal according to Myles Martin, a spokesman for the Federal Election Commission, who said the salient question was whether a mailing contains a disclaimer saying that it came from a political campaign. And this one did.

Aside from that, he said in an email, “the F.E.C.’s regulations don’t speak to how candidates may choose to word particular solicitations to potential contributors.”

The letter inside the envelope is more clearly part of a fund-raising effort. The Cruz campaign logo appears at the top of the letter and recipients are given the option to donate a preselected amount of money or to write in their own denominations.

The letter echoes its envelope, though, in its use of language — like “campaign summons” and “conservative affirmation” — that sounds more legal than colloquial.

title: Fact Check: Consuming a wax-coated apple can kill you.
text:
Claim: Consuming a wax-coated apple can kill you.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Q&A establish what waxes are on apples and that they are safe for consumption.
It might have been useful to ask if the wax is an allergen.

Evidence:

Q: What is the wax covering apples?
A: It’s not artificial, but a natural wax that we call “Abura-agari” in Japanese.. 

Q: Why are apples covered in wax?
A: Fruits like plums, apples, pears etc. have natural wax covering for the retainment of moisture and firmness, and slow down of the natural degradation.

But it is not possible for the farmers and the storekeepers to keep the fruits fresh and juicy for several months at a stretch. Additional food grade wax is being used for increasing the fruit’s shelf-life.. 

Q: Is the wax on Apples toxic?
A: No. It is not toxic. Apples grow with a natural wax. Pick an apple straight from the tree and it does not have that shiny supermarket lustre. However, rub a freshly picked apple with a cloth or on your thigh like a spin bowler and it will quickly shine up. Apples bound for the greengrocer and supermarket are generally washed, polished and coated in a food-grade glazing agent. Fifteen per cent of Australian apples are coated in carnauba wax made from the leaves of a tropical palm straight from the tree. Most of the other 85 per cent are coated in shellac which is made from the lac beetle. It is not made from the beetle itself but a secretion produced by the female lac beetle to protect her eggs. Another little thing vegans need to look out for. You'll find similar glazing agents on shiny confectionary. For people who are very sensitive to bitterness the wax can be perceived as a little bit bitter..

title: Fact Check: Egyptian authorities are carrying atrocious acts which results in injustice
text:
Claim: Egyptian authorities are carrying atrocious acts which results in injustice

Verdict: Supported

Justification: Evidence of atrocities and their consequences for human rights are explored by the questions. 

Evidence:

Q: What kinds of recorded atrocities have there been in Egypt under President Abdel Fattah el-Sissi?
A: Human Rights Watch wrote in its World 2020 report: “Under the guise of fighting terrorism, Egyptian authorities showed utter disregard for the rule of law. Since April 2017, President Abdel Fattah el-Sissi has maintained a nation-wide state of emergency that gives security forces unchecked powers. Security forces used torture and enforced disappearances systematically against dissidents from all backgrounds. Egypt’s use of mass trials and the death penalty has mounted, including death sentences against children and death sentences issued in military trials.”.

title: Fact Check: 80% of workers in Nike overseas factories are women
text:
Claim: 80% of workers in Nike overseas factories are women

Verdict: Supported

Justification: The answers support the figures.

Evidence:

Q: what percentage of the workforce in factories including NIKE are women?
A: Workers on the factory floor are overwhelmingly women. In developing nations, women comprise 80% of the apparel workforce. These women do tedious work for long hours, often in unsafe conditions– far from home, and for minimal wages.. 

Q: Are there more women than men working in Nike's overseas factories?
A: A CBC investigative report in October 1996 found that 25,000 workers, mostly young women, work in Vietnamese factories.. 

Q: Where are Nike's overseas factories based?
A: 75 percent of Nike’s front-line labor force is based in Vietnam, China and Indonesia, representing around 400,000 workers..

title: Fact Check: Teenage white girl to be tried as 300-pound black man in the USA.
text:
Claim: Teenage white girl to be tried as 300-pound black man in the USA.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: From the question and answer pairs it seems that the article was meant for satire, there it is not true

Evidence:

Q: Who printed the story about the teenage white girl being tried as a black man?
A: The Onion. 

Q: What sort of publication is the Onion?
A: Satire - the satirical weekly has been publishing sardonic news parodies and goofy advice columns since 1988 (the off-kilter interviews didn’t come until the early ’90s).

title: Fact Check: Muslims were filmed while attacking a Hindu Temple in Uttar Pradesh in India.
text:
Claim: Muslims were filmed while attacking a Hindu Temple in Uttar Pradesh in India.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: There's no evidence of it being Muslims that attacked the temple or of a film that shows it was Muslims 

Evidence:

Q: What have reports said about the attack?
A: Villagers who went to pray at the temple on Sunday morning found the gate shut and heard cries for help. Temple priest Vinod Sharma and sewadar Sultan were murdered in the attack.. 

Q: What has the police discovered about the incident?
A: When the rural and Karnal police broke into the temple and entered inside the temple, priest Vinod Sharma of Badnara village of Nising and Sevadar Sultan, a resident of Saharanpur in UP, were found lying dead inside. He was stabbed to death with a sharp weapon, while priest Ravindra Sharma of Bhambrehari village of Assandh, priest Ajay Sharma of Sangoha village and servant Harjinder Singh were seriously injured. His hands and feet were tied with cloth and rope. Karnal SP Surendra Singh Bhauria, DSP Virendra Saini reached the spot along with the police force. The SP has given instructions to get the matter investigated on every aspect. there, Being adjacent to the border, the Jhinjhana police also gathered information about the case.. 

Q: Have the attackers been identified?
A: Hindi news websites that reported the murders have not mentioned the identity of the suspects or even insinuated that they could be Muslims. The investigation in the case is ongoing..

title: Fact Check: The minimum wage should be £18 an hour, because in 1999 one hour’s pay at minimu...
text:
Claim: The minimum wage should be £18 an hour, because in 1999 one hour’s pay at minimum wage could buy you 72 Freddos, but in 2017 it could only buy you 30 Freddos.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: You could only buy 36 Freddos not 72 which makes the rest of the argument invalid.

Evidence:

Q: How much did Freddos cost in 1999?
A: The Freddo – that frog-shaped lump of Cadbury’s chocolate much appreciated by those who don’t want a whole Dairy Milk but wouldn’t mind a little something-or-other now you mention it – originally hit Britain’s shelves in the mid-90s, when it was priced at 10 pence.. 

Q: What was the UK minimum wage in 1999?
A: £3.60 - so you could get 36 freddos.. 

Q: How much did Freddos cost in 2017?
A: 30p..

title: Fact Check: Cyril Ramaphosa retorted to Donald Trump’s  2018 comments on land reform in Sout...
text:
Claim: Cyril Ramaphosa retorted to Donald Trump’s  2018 comments on land reform in South Africa on Twitter

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The posted tweet in reply to Donald Trump was not from Cyril Ramaphosa's twitter account 

Evidence:

Q: What was Donald Trump's original tweet in this claim?
A: "I have asked Secretary of State
@SecPompeo
to closely study the South Africa land and farm seizures and expropriations and the large scale killing of farmers. “South African Government is now seizing land from white farmers". 

Q: What was the supposed reply by President Cyril Ramaphosa?
A: I have asked @GenBheki_Cele to closely study the USA mass shootings and large killings of unarmed civilians. "USA Government is now killing unarmed African Americans". 

Q: Did this come from South Africa's president, Cyril Ramaphosa's official account?
A: No. It does not appear on their offical account and it looks like the tweet in the screenshot was taken from someone posing as Ramaphosa online. Alternatively, it’s possible that they used an online generator to produce the post.

title: Fact Check: Research carried out by an American NGO has concluded that men are likely to die...
text:
Claim: Research carried out by an American NGO has concluded that men are likely to die after being circumcised due to a medication that reacts after 10 years.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Study does not exist.

Evidence:

Q: Is there an article from Deltas Clares (The study researchers) on wikileaks
A: There is no evidence of them having published a paper concerning the claim on wikileaks. 

Q: Is there a particular drug used for circumcision
A: No answer could be found..

title: Fact Check: Iain Duncan Smith gets free transport as a financial benefit for being an MP in ...
text:
Claim: Iain Duncan Smith gets free transport as a financial benefit for being an MP in the UK House of Commons.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: The answers show that, to a degree, MPs do get subsidized or reimbursed transport for being an MP. 

Evidence:

Q: Can MP's Claim travel expenses?
A: 9.1 Travel and Subsistence claims may be made for the costs of travel, and travel-related
subsistence incurred by MP or others, which are in support of the MP's parliamentary
functions.. 

Q: What types of travel expenses can be claimed by MP's?
A: 9.2 MPs may claim for travel by public transport, private transport, taxis and hire cars.. 

Q: Is there a limit on what MP's can claim for Public transport travel costs?
A: 9.13 For journeys by public transport, MPs may buy a ticket of any class but (except where
paragraph 9.14 applies) reimbursement will be limited to the rate of an economy class ticket
available at the time of booking. In the case of air travel, ‘economy’ includes ‘flexible
economy’.

9.14 For journeys made by rail, reimbursement will be limited to the rate of an ‘anytime standard
open’ ticket for the journey prevalent at the time of the claim.

9.15 MPs travelling on sleeper train services are additionally entitled to claim for a sleeper
supplement for a single occupancy berth.

9.16 Where an MP obtains a railcard or season ticket which allows savings to be made on future
purchases of rail tickets, reimbursement of the cost of the railcard may be claimed..

title: Fact Check: Iain Duncan Smith gets free use of a gym as a financial benefit for being an MP ...
text:
Claim: Iain Duncan Smith gets free use of a gym as a financial benefit for being an MP in the UK House of Commons.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Iain Duncan Smith and other MPs do have to pay monthly fee to get access to a gym in the UK. 

Evidence:

Q: Is there a parliamentary gym?
A: Yes. The Westminster Gym.

Q: Is the Westminster Gym free to use for MP's?
A: No the monthly Cost is £25 - £35 a month depending on hours of use..

title: Fact Check: Iain Duncan Smith gets free stationery as a financial benefit for being an MP in...
text:
Claim: Iain Duncan Smith gets free stationery as a financial benefit for being an MP in the UK House of Commons.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: The UK House of Commons updated version of the Green Book grants such Expenses.

Evidence:

Q: Is stationery free for politicians in the UK?
A: IPSA will not pay claims for any of the following:
a. alcoholic drinks;
b. stationery provided by the House of Commons;
c. newsletters;
d. funding of any material, other than websites, that contains a party political logo or
emblem; or
e. personal accountancy or tax advice.. 

Q: Can politicians claim for stationery in the UK?
A: Equipment and supplies for the office or surgery - including computers, printers, faxes, photocopiers, desks, stationery, phone bills, some postage costs (in addition to AOE, MPs can also claim for a certain amount of Commons stationery and pre-paid envelopes).

title: Fact Check: Iain Duncan Smith gets free mobile phone calls as a financial benefit for being ...
text:
Claim: Iain Duncan Smith gets free mobile phone calls as a financial benefit for being an MP in the UK House of Commons.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: Permittable expense.

Evidence:

Q: Are MPs allowed to claim expenses for running constituency offices such as telephone costs
A: Yes. They are permitted to

Q: Did MP Iain Duncan Smith make claims for the telephone costs
A: Yes. He did for the years he was an MP

title: Fact Check: Iain Duncan Smith gets free accommodation as a financial benefit for being an MP...
text:
Claim: Iain Duncan Smith gets free accommodation as a financial benefit for being an MP in the UK House of Commons

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The Q&a's state that the person in the claim has their residence in London, which as Q&A 2 shows is not an area for which MP's can claim accomodation allowance, thus disagreeing with the claim showing that the MP names claims free accommodation as he is a London MP.

Evidence:

Q: What is Iain Duncan Smith's constituency?
A: Chingford and Woodford Green. 

Q: Where is Chingford and Woodford Green?
A: London. 

Q: Do MP's get free accommodation?
A: Ministerial or official residences are properties assigned to ministers by
the Prime Minister either on the grounds of security or to allow them to
better perform their official duties, including official hospitality.
Official residences available to government ministers include:
• Flats above 10 and 11 Downing Street, which are available for the
Prime Minister and Chancellor of the Exchequer;
• 1 Carlton Gardens, leased from the Crown Estate, which has been
used as the official residence for the Foreign Secretary;1
• Flats in Admiralty House;
• Hillsborough Castle and Stormont, which are available for
ministers in the Northern Ireland Office while on duty in Northern
Ireland.
In addition, three stately homes – Chequers, Dorneywood and
Chevening – are available to ministers for both official and private use.
None of these properties are owned by the Government..

title: Fact Check: Sarah Jeong the former New York Times writer says that "we need a castration lot...
text:
Claim: Sarah Jeong the former New York Times writer says that "we need a castration lottery for white men".

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Fake news/ No record of this claim being made officially.

Evidence:

Q: Is there any evidence that Jeong made this statement?
A: No. There is no evidence Jeong made the statement, and the misattributed quote appears to come from a series of fake quotes that emerged on social media after she joined The New York Times in August 2018 as an editorial board staff writer. There is, however, no record of Jeong making the statement. A search of her verified Twitter account, as well as her Facebook page, didn’t turn up any matches. An archived version of her Twitter timeline from early August 2018 shows no such tweet on July 31 of that year, and Check Your Fact also didn’t find any credible media outlets attributing the quote to her. (RELATED: Did The NYT Publish An Op-Ed Comparing Kim Yo Jong To Elizabeth Warren?)

Q: Where did this claim first appear?
A: The quote about a “castration lottery” for white people was first shared on the online message board 4chan in August 2018, around the same time a number of other fake quotes misattributed to Jeong were shared on the website, according to Snopes. One user in that 4chan thread posted a fabricated tweet that Jeong supposedly sent July 31, 2018.. 

Q: What type of website is 4Chan
A: To the uninitiated, 4chan can best be described as a bulging cyst on the ass of the internet.

title: Fact Check: One of the conflicts of interest that special counsel Robert Mueller had that pr...
text:
Claim: One of the conflicts of interest that special counsel Robert Mueller had that prevented him from conducting an impartial investigation, was that President Donald Trump interviewed Mueller to be FBI director but turned him down.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: The source links in the q&a verify that this claim is correct.

Evidence:

Q: Was special counsel Robert Mueller interviewed by President  Donald Trump in 2017 for the post of the director of the FBI?
A: President Donald Trump interviewed Robert Mueller as a potential replacement for fired FBI Director James Comey the day before he was named special counsel, a White House official said Tuesday.. 

Q: What date did special council Robert Mueller interview for the role of FBI director with President Donald Trump?
A: May 16 2017..

title: Fact Check: Flu shots are killing elderly citizens in record numbers.
text:
Claim: Flu shots are killing elderly citizens in record numbers.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The JAMA study did not support the conclusion made in the claim.

Evidence:

Q: What study is the claim linked to?
A: The 2005 JAMA study. 

Q: Did the study report an increased amount of deaths in the elderly from having the flu shot?
A: The 2005 JAMA study did not report an increased number of deaths from the flu shot in the elderly - it simply found that previous studies had overestimated the number of deaths prevented by flu shots..

title: Fact Check: Unemployment in the united states is only low because everyone has two jobs.
text:
Claim: Unemployment in the united states is only low because everyone has two jobs.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Seems that the number of people who have two jobs is in decline. Therefore the claim.aimis refuted

Evidence:

Q: What is the statistics for 2017 of Americans holding more than one job
A: 4.9 percent of workers held more than one job at the same time in 2017. 

Q: What has been the trend in the number of people holding more than one job since before 2017
A: After reaching a peak of 6.2 percent during 1995–96, the multiple jobholding rate began to recede. By the mid-2000s, the rate had declined to 5.2 percent and remained close to that level from 2006 to 2009. In 2010, the multiple jobholding rate decreased to 4.9 percent and has remained at 4.9 percent or 5.0 percent from 2010 to 2017.. 

Q: What is the relationship between the number of people working more than one job and the rate of unemployment
A: The unemployment rate is not directly tied to the number of people working more than one job.

title: Fact Check: Alison Buttligieg developed depression after witnessing the scene of a deer who ...
text:
Claim: Alison Buttligieg developed depression after witnessing the scene of a deer who sacrificed her life.

Q: Who is Alison Buttligieg?
A: A photographer.. 

Q: Did Buttigieg claim to have depression after taking a photo of a deer sacrificing its life?
A: No. She wrote on her social media that ... implications I fell into depression after I took the photo are  complete fiction

title: Fact Check: Irish Green Party Leader Eamon Ryan tweeted  Peter Tatchell was a 'green legend ...
text:
Claim: Irish Green Party Leader Eamon Ryan tweeted  Peter Tatchell was a 'green legend and tireless LGBT campaigner' at 1.13pm on June 29 2018.

Q: Has Eamon Ryan tweeted about Peter Tatchell?
A: No answer could be found.. 

Q: When was the alleged claim posted on Twitter?
A: 29 June 2018..

title: Fact Check: Donald Trump is destroying the "New World Order," says American film maker David...
text:
Claim: Donald Trump is destroying the "New World Order," says American film maker David Lynch in an interview with The Guardian in 2018.

Evidence:

Q: Did David Lynch say President Trump is destroying the "New World Order" in a 2018 interview with The Guardian?
A: There is no mention of the phrase "New World Order" in the interview with The Guardian in 2018..

title: Fact Check: Eighty-nine members of US Congress hold dual citizenship with Israel.
text:
Claim: Eighty-nine members of US Congress hold dual citizenship with Israel.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: It seems that no members hold the citizenship, therefore the claim is refuted 

Evidence:

Q: How many US Congress members have Israeli dual citizenship
A: None, as far as I know. You can find lists online, that claim that all Jewish members of the US Senate and House of Representatives have Israeli citizenship. But when you look into these claims yourself, you can’t seem to find evidence that these people actually have Israeli citizenship..

title: Fact Check: Former President Pranab Mukherjee had written in his book that Sonia Gandhi took...
text:
Claim: Former President Pranab Mukherjee had written in his book that Sonia Gandhi took umbrage over his words praising Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

Verdict: Not Enough Evidence

Justification: The question-answer pairs don't mention Sonia Gandhi. 

Evidence:

Q: Has former President Pranab Mukherjee written any books
A: Yes. Some of the titles include:, The Presidential Years, The Coalition years etc

Q: Has president Pranab ever publicly praised PM Modi
A: Yes. President Mukherjee said, “I take this opportunity to express my deep gratitude and appreciation to PM. We have acted in close co-operation.” He further talked about his relationship with Prime Minister Modi and said, “Surely there have been divergences of views but we have been able to keep divergences only to ourselves, they didn’t affect relations between President and Prime Minister.”

title: Fact Check: Two best graduating students in Ekiti State University were awarded N100 and N20...
text:
Claim: Two best graduating students in Ekiti State University were awarded N100 and N2000 respectively

Verdict: Not Enough Evidence

Justification: There doesn't seem to be any reports of students either getting these payments or not, so there is not enough evidence to confirm either way.

Evidence:

Q: Did best graduating students in Ekiti State University 2018 get financial rewards?
A: No answer could be found.. 

Q: Does Nigeria reward academic excellence?
A: Every convocation ceremony in Nigeria, there is a best graduating student but no one ever talks about them except in really rare cases but that’s not same with India, as you have seen clearly..

title: Fact Check: The MMR vaccination weakens children's brains ultimately leading to autism.
text:
Claim: The MMR vaccination weakens children's brains ultimately leading to autism.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The study in question was flawed, further studies have shown no link between MMR and autism. 

Evidence:

Q: What's the medical publication correlating between MMR vaccination and Autism in children?
A: That paper was published in the Lancet on 28 February 1998. It was retracted on 2 February 2010.2 Authored by Andrew Wakefield, John Walker-Smith, and 11 others from the Royal Free medical school, London, it reported on 12 developmentally challenged children,3 and triggered a decade long public health scare.. 

Q: Was this paper later on proven to be a fraud?
A: Yes. As the ensuing vaccine scare took off, critics quickly pointed out that the paper was a small case series with no controls, linked three common conditions, and relied on parental recall and beliefs.4 Over the following decade, epidemiological studies consistently found no evidence of a link between the MMR vaccine and autism.5 6 7 8 By the time the paper was finally retracted 12 years later,9 after forensic dissection at the General Medical Council’s (GMC) longest ever fitness to practise hearing,10 few people could deny that it was fatally flawed both scientifically and ethically.

title: Fact Check: Condoleezza Rice summed up the Democratic Party in 75 words.
text:
Claim: Condoleezza Rice summed up the Democratic Party in 75 words.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Condoleezza Rice was advocating for Republican candidates in her speeches. 

Evidence:

Q: What were the 75 words?
A: f you are taught bitterness and anger, then you will believe you are a victim. You will feel aggrieved and the twin brother of aggrievement is entitlement. So now you think you are owed something and you don’t have to work for it and now you’re on a really bad road to nowhere because there are people who will play to that sense of victimhood, aggrievement and entitlement, and you still won’t have a job.”. 

Q: Did Condoleezza Rice  say these words?
A: No. Similar words were said, "My fellow Americans, ours has never been a narrative of grievance and entitlement. We have never believed that I am doing poorly because you are doing well. We have never been jealous of one another and never envious of each other’s successes. No, no, ours has been a belief of opportunity. And it has been a constant struggle, long and hard, up and down, to try to extend the benefits of the American dream to all."

Q: were those words aimed at democratic party
A: No. it is clear that she was advocating for Republican candidates in both speeches.

title: Fact Check: There is a new initiative under the National program for Bovine Breeding and Dai...
text:
Claim: There is a new initiative under the National program for Bovine Breeding and Dairy development with an allocation of 500 crore rupees

Verdict: Supported

Justification: The new initiative is allocated Rs. 491.50 Crores.

Evidence:

Q: What is the name of the new initiative under the national program for Bovine Breeding and Dairy Development?
A: The new scheme is called the “Rashtriya Goukul Mission”. 

Q: What is the total allocation for the Rashtriya Goukul Mission in Crore Rupees?
A: The total allocation is Rs. 190 Crores for 2017-2018 and Rs. 301.50 crores for 2018-2019 giving a total of Rs. 491.50 Crores..

title: Fact Check: 20 Gokul Grams are being established and 41 Bull Mother farms will be modernized...
text:
Claim: 20 Gokul Grams are being established and 41 Bull Mother farms will be modernized.

Verdict: Not Enough Evidence

Justification: The question and answers below do not show any evidence to refute or support the claim.

Evidence:

title: Fact Check: Pradhan Mantri Surakshit Matritva Abhiyan (PMSMA) was ‘launched to ensure good h...
text:

A: According to the official website, ‘the PMSMA has been launched by the Ministry of Health & Family Welfare (MoHFW), Government of India. The program aims to provide assured, comprehensive and quality antenatal care, free of cost, universally to all pregnant women on the 9th of every month. PMSMA guarantees a minimum package of antenatal care services to women in their 2nd/3rd trimesters of pregnancy at designated government health facilities’.

As per the official website, the PMSMA envisages improvement in the quality and coverage of Antenatal Care (ANC) including diagnostics and counselling services as part of the Reproductive Maternal Neonatal Child and Adolescent Health (RMNCH+A) Strategy.

title: Fact Check: There has been a reduction in the MRP (Material requirements planning) of DAP, M...
text:
Claim: There has been a reduction in the MRP (Material requirements planning) of DAP, MOP, and complex fertilizers

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Seems that there was actually an increase in MRP, therefore the claim is refuted 

Evidence:

Q: Did the prices od DAP and MOP reduce in the years prior to this claim?
A: It is true that the prices of DAP, MOP and other complex fertilizers reduced in the year 2016 as prices had come down in the international market and this reduction was purely because of market dynamics.. 

Q: Was this reduction to the government or it's policies?
A: No. The government or its policies had very little to do with this reduction. In fact, the prices of DAP & MOP have again increased by more than 25% and 50% respectively between December 2017 & October 2018. The increase was again because of market dynamics.

Q: What was the rate of food inflation in India in 2018?

title: Fact Check: The Indian government has procured 16.24 lakh metric tonnes of pulses as of Marc...
text:

CONSUMER AFFAIRS, FOOD AND PUBLIC DISTRIBUTION

As per the data of Directorate General of Commercial Intelligence and Statistics (DGCI&S), M/o Commerce & Industry, the total imports of pulses by India during 2017-18 (upto January) is 5.33 lakh MT.

(c) : For building the dynamic buffer of upto 20 lakh MT of pulses, 16.71 lakh tonnes was procured domestically.

CONSUMER AFFAIRS, FOOD AND PUBLIC DISTRIBUTION
(SHRI C. R. CHAUDHARY)

A: According to an answer in Lok Sabha ‘the maternity benefit under PMMVY is available to the eligible beneficiaries for first living child of family. Normally, the first pregnancy of a woman exposes her to new kinds of challenges and stress factors. Hence, the scheme provides support to the mother for the safe delivery and immunization of her first child. Under the scheme Rs. 5,000  is provided to the eligible beneficiary in three installments. The eligible beneficiary also receives the remaining cash incentive as per approved norms towards maternity benefit under Janani Suraksha Yojana (JSY) after institutional delivery so that on an average, a woman gets Rs.6,000’..

title: Fact Check: In India, treatment for drug sensitive TB is provided through 4,00,000 DOT centr...

A: Approximately 397,814.

Q: Were the numbers of Treatment DOT centers the same in 2012 and 2017?

title: Fact Check: Overall inflation in India is falling: 8.48% (2014) to 4.87% (2015) to 5.47% (20...
text:
Claim: Overall inflation in India is falling: 8.48% (2014) to 4.87% (2015) to 5.47% (2016) to 2.99% (2017) to 4.58% (2018).

Verdict: Supported

Justification: The 2nd Q and A shows that the inflation has decreased so the claim is supported. The other 2 results are not related to the claim.

Evidence:

Q: Is the economy in India grew at a robust rate, with 7.4% GDP growth forecast for FY 2018-19 ?
A: As per the first advance estimates of National Income, growth in GDP during 2018-19 is estimated at 7.2%.  As per the second advance estimates of National Income, growth in GDP during 2018-19 is estimated at 7%, down from the 7.2% estimated during the first advance estimates. Hence the claim is FALSE.. 

Q: Did the inflation drop in India from 8.48% in 2014 to  4.58% in 2018 ?
A: The Year on Year (YoY) inflation in the country has been gradually decreasing (except for an abrupt rise in 2016). It reached a lowest of 1.46% in June 2017, but has been increasing ever since. Hence, the claim is TRUE. However, it is important to also keep in mind the international trends.. 

Q: Did the food inflation drop down in India from 9.19% in 2014 to 3% in 2018 ?
A: While the absolute numbers are slightly off the mark, the trend in the fall in food inflation is TRUE..

No. of Beneficiaries enrolled: 56,29,662

Total maternity benefits paid.

No. of beneficiaries paid: 46,54,956. 

Q: What is the Pradhan Mantri Matru Vandana Yojana (PMMVY)?

title: Fact Check: Pradhan Mantri Matru Vandana Yojana programme (PMMVY) provides economic support ...
text:
Claim: Pradhan Mantri Matru Vandana Yojana programme (PMMVY) provides economic support to pregnant women and lactating mothers.

Verdict: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

Justification: The answers show that it is not available to all women so the claim is cherrypicking.

Evidence:

Q: Does the PMMVY provide economic support to Pregnant women and lactating mothers?
A: Yes. The Ministry of Women and Child Development is implementing Pradhan Mantri Matru Vandana Yojana (PMMVY) with the objectives of (i) providing partial compensation for the wage loss in terms of cash incentive so that the woman can take adequate rest before and after delivery of the first child; and (ii) the cash incentive provided to improve health seeking behavior amongst the Pregnant Women & Lactating Mothers (PW&LM).

Q: Does the PMMVY offer economic support to all pregnant women and lactating mothers?
A: No. The maternity benefit, are available to a woman for the first living child of family subject to fulfillment of conditionalities. All the pregnant women and lactating mothers in regular employment with Central Government or State Governments or Public Sector Undertakings or those who are in receipt of similar benefits under any law for the time being in force, are excluded.

title: Fact Check: Bloodletting can save a stroke victim.
text:
Claim: Bloodletting can save a stroke victim.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: No, this is used for problems listed in the answer but not a stroke.

Evidence:

Q: What is a stroke
A: A stroke is a medical emergency that happens when the blood flow to your brain is interrupted. Without blood, your brain cells start to die. This can cause serious symptoms, lasting disability, and even death.. 

Q: Can blood letting be used to save a stroke victim
A: No. Bloodletting or therapeutic phlebotomy is used in blood disorders in which the removal of RBCs or serum iron is the most efficient method for managing the symptoms and complications

title: Fact Check: Slaked lime can cure over 70 diseases.
text:
Claim: Slaked lime can cure over 70 diseases.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The Q&A pairs state that what is claimed would actually be bad for health not helpful to health.

Evidence:

Q: What is slaked lime?
A: another name for calcium hydroxide, esp when made by adding water to calcium oxide. 

Q: Does slaked lime have medicinal uses?
A: It has a strong base pH and is used for many purposes, often under its more common name, slaked lime. The National Institutes of Health warns that calcium hydroxide is also toxic and can introduce serious health problems as a result of various types of exposure.. 

Q: Is it dangerous to take slaked lime internally?
A: Yes. Accidental ingestion of calcium hydroxide can cause severe throat pain, a burning sensation in the mouth, abdominal pain, vomiting, bloody stool or vomit, rapidly falling blood pressure and collapse, according to the National Institutes of Health.

title: Fact Check: Nearly 1.5 crore doses of Rotavirus vaccine launched in India in March 2016 have...
text:
Claim: Nearly 1.5 crore doses of Rotavirus vaccine launched in India in March 2016 have been administered to India's children.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: As of 2018, 1.4 crore doses had been administered to the children in India 

Evidence:

Q: What is the Rotavirus?
A: Rotavirus is a virus that causes severe diarrhea and vomiting. It affects mostly babies and young children. Diarrhea and vomiting can lead to serious dehydration (loss of body fluid). If dehydration is not treated, it can be deadly.. 

Q: When did the Indian government begin the Rotavirus vaccination roll-out?
A: 26th March 2016. 

Q: How many doses of Rotavirus vaccinations have been administered to India's children?
A: Rotavirus vaccine has been administered to about 1.41 crores children across these nine states (as on February 2018)..

title: Fact Check: Around 8 crore of India's children have been given the Measles Rubella (MR) vacc...
text:
Claim: Around 8 crore of India's children have been given the Measles Rubella (MR) vaccination, which was launched in India in February 2017.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: Answer 1 - as per the source, this is the roll out of the 2nd Phase. It does not say when vaccinations for MR were first launched. Indeed, the answer to Q3 shows this answer to be incorrect.
I think Q&A 4 is trying to reconcile 8 crore at the time of the claim (May 2018) and the stats at answer 3 in July 2018 - it fails.
However, there is sufficient evidence in the Q&As to establish that the claim is probably about right in terms of numbers and dates.

Evidence:

Q: When was the Measles Rubella (MR) vaccination, launched in India?
A: from August 2017 with the aim to eliminate measles and control rubella/congenital rubella syndrome (CRS) by 2020.. 

Q: When was the claim about administered vaccine doses made?
A: 01/05/2018. 

Q: How many doses of the vaccine in the claim had been given by 2018?
A: The Measles-Rubella campaign started from February 2017 and has been rolled out in 21 states/UTs by July, 2018, covering nearly 9.2 crore children.

title: Fact Check: Colon cancer is the third biggest cause of death around the world.
text:
Claim: Colon cancer is the third biggest cause of death around the world.

Verdict: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

Justification: There is conflicting information about whether colon cancer is the third leading cause of death worldwide. 

Evidence:

Q: How common is colon cancer?
A: 1 in 15 men and 1 in 18 women will be diagnosed with bowel cancer during their lifetime, the fourth most common cancer. 

Q: Is colon cancer a leading cause of cancer death?
A: Yes. it is the second biggest cancer killer.

Q: Is it a leading cause of death around the world?
A: No. It is not among the top 10 global causes of death according the the 2018 WHO report.

title: Fact Check: colon cancer begins in the intestine then spreads to other parts of the body
text:
Claim: colon cancer begins in the intestine then spreads to other parts of the body

Verdict: Supported

Justification: It begins in cells inside the bowel

Evidence:

Q: Where does colon cancer initially start?
A: Colon cancer usually first develops inside clumps of cells called polyps on the inner lining of the bowel.. 

Q: Does colon cancer spread to other parts of the body?
A: Advanced colon cancer can spread to other parts of the body, this is called metastasis..

title: Fact Check: Coconut oil decreases the side effects of chemotherapy
text:
Claim: Coconut oil decreases the side effects of chemotherapy

Verdict: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

Justification: The claim has cherry picked as it is a specific type of coconut oil that has to be used to be effective.

Evidence:

Q: Have any studies been done to prove this?
A: Yes. A 2014 study in Malalysia found that Virgin coconut oil reduced the symptoms related to side effects of chemotherapy.

Q: Was it just normal coconut oil that was used in the study?
A: No. It was Virgin coconut oil, not just any coconut oil.

Virgin coconut oil uses fresh coconut meat, while regular coconut oil uses copra, or coconut meat that has already been dried.

title: Fact Check: Coconut oil removes 93% of colon cancer cells

Verdict: Refuted

Evidence:

A: A University of Adelaide research that looked into the potential of lauric acid in inducing apoptosis or cell death of colon cancer cells. 

Q: Was there a mention of coconut oil and linking it to the cure of colon cancer
A: No. Coconut oil was not mentioned

title: Fact Check: Lauric acid killed more than 93% of colon cancer cells within 2 days of treatmen...

A: Lauric acid induces apoptosis (cell death) in colon cancer cells.. 

Q: Were 93% of the colon cancer cells dead within two days?
A: No answer could be found..

title: Fact Check: When coming across cancer in pork, many butchers just cut it out, and continue t...
text:
Claim: When coming across cancer in pork, many butchers just cut it out, and continue to sell to customers.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Evidence indicates regulations do not allow cancerous tumours to enter the food chain - carcasses potentially containing cancer would be put on hold if found during an inspection and then condemned and disposed if cancer was confirmed.

Evidence:

Q: Do animals we eat, get cancer?
A: Yes. Yes but cancer is largely a disease of the aging process, and animals raised for food are slaughtered while they're young

Q: Is meat with cancer dangerous?
A: No. If, by some chance, a meat product does contain cancerous cells, cooking it will kill them. And even if your steak tartare came from a cancer-afflicted cow, there's no evidence to suggest you'd suffer any ill effects.

Q: Are butchers allowed to sell meat with cancers?
A: No. Inspectors that observe potential signs of disease or things such as cancerous lesions or tumors retain the carcasses until the public health veterinarian (PHV) inspector assigned to the establishment can make final disposition of the carcass. The PHV inspector will often send samples to a laboratory for further analysis/confirmation. A carcass remains on hold as suspect until the results of pathology return from a USDA laboratory.

Cancerous lesions or tumors are not allowed to enter commerce or the food chain. If laboratory results indicate the presence of cancer within the carcass, the carcass will be marked U.S. Inspected and condemned. Once a carcass is condemned, it is denatured and disposed of so it cannot enter the food chain.

title: Fact Check: Raw manuka honey kills every bacteria scientists throw at it, including antibiot...
text:
Claim: Raw manuka honey kills every bacteria scientists throw at it, including antibiotic-resistant superbugs.

Verdict: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

Justification: The QA pairs confirm that when in direct contact it does kill the bacteria however only appears to work topically and not through ingesting for some bugs etc.

Evidence:

Q: Can Manuka honey kill every known bacteria?
A: To date, in vitro assays have found manuka honey can effectively inhibit all problematic bacterial pathogens tested. 

Q: what conclusions have been found about Manuka honey?
A: Great progress has been made recently in our understanding of therapeutic honey, yet its use in clinical medicine remains limited, even when conventional antibiotics are starting to fail. The complexity in honey, which is arguably its greatest strength in killing diverse pathogens and preventing resistance, complicates its study as many factors working together are likely to affect activity. We advocate further mechanistic studies using appropriately registered therapeutic manuka honey, in particular studies that use non-reductionist systems biology approaches, along with detailed chemical and microbiological analyses to elucidate how honey acts at the molecular, cellular and population level, how this can differ in different strains and species of microbial pathogens, and how the host cell responds. 

Q: It seems that Manuka honey is very effective on topical wounds, but is it good at killing bacteria internally?
A: Manuka may inhibit the bacteria that cause a sore (“strep”) throat or gingivitis, but the main components responsible for the antimicrobial activity won’t survive the digestion process..

title: Fact Check: Kansas City Chiefs CEO Clark Hunt said "You will stand, with your hand over your...
text:
Claim: Kansas City Chiefs CEO Clark Hunt said "You will stand, with your hand over your heart and with respect, when our country’s national anthem is being played or you will no longer be a Kansas City Chief, a coach for the Kansas City Chiefs or have any association with the Chiefs organization. I will immediately fire you, no matter who you are!"

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: No.  He said, I have heard about it. It was an internet hoax."

Evidence:

Q: Did Kansas City Chiefs CEO Clark Hunt say he would fire anyone who did not stand for the national anthem ?
A: No. He said, I have heard about it. It was an internet hoax."

Q: Has Kansas City Chiefs CEO Clark Hunt  passed down any directive requiring players to show respect during the National Anthem by not doing a gesture, kneeling or anything?
A: No. He said, ''No, I haven't, but for a couple of years now, Coach [Andy] Reid and the rest of the leadership of the team have spoked to the coaches and the team about the importance of standing during the National Anthem''

title: Fact Check: A U.S. prisoner who was sentenced to death was told they would be bitten by a de...

title: Fact Check: Garlic can kill brain cancer cells
text:
Claim: Garlic can kill brain cancer cells

Verdict: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

Justification: This was a laboratory study, and no conclusions about the effects of garlic on human health can be drawn from it.

This study did not look at the effects of eating garlic in people who have glioblastoma; it also did not look at whether eating garlic prevents people developing cancer. In addition, this study did not look at the effects of these garlic compounds on healthy human cells; therefore it is possible that these compounds also kill healthy cells.

Based on this studies findings, we shouldn’t believe that eating garlic will prevent or cure cancer.

Evidence:

Q: Have any studies been conducted on the effect of garlic on cancer cells?
A: Yes. Dr. Rohini Karandikar, a science education researcher at the Homi Bhabha Centre for Science Education (HBCSE). She explained that although many studies have been conducted regarding the effect of garlic on cancer cells, there has been no major breakthrough yet.

Q: How much garlic does someone have to consume to reduce the risk of cancer?
A: If garlic consumption does reduce the risk of cancer, the amount needed to lower risk remains unknown.. 

Q: Has there been research on whether garlic can kill tumour cells?
A: Yes. Dr Arabinda Das, and colleagues from the Medical University of South Carolina carried out this research. The study was funded in part by the National Cancer Institute and the National Institute of Neurological Disorders and Stroke. The study was published in the peer-reviewed medical journal: Cancer.

Before the vaccination register was established, vaccination coverage was assessed via an annual collection of vaccination statistics from all child health centres and from all school health services across the country..
