title: Fact Check: A Biology Experiment By 9th Grade Students Reveals A Dark Truth About Wi-Fi & Ga...
text:
Claim: A Biology Experiment By 9th Grade Students Reveals A Dark Truth About Wi-Fi & Gains The Attention Of Scientists

Verdict: Not Enough Evidence

Justification: One study is not enough. The controls were not necessarily scientific enough. 

Evidence:

Q: What happened in the experiment?
A: Some students in Denmark did a school experiment and found cress growing near wi-fi routers went brown.
Apparently the researchers (some 15-year-old schoolchildren, in a classroom experiment in Denmark), decided to run the experiment after noticing they had trouble concentrating the morning after sleeping close to their mobile phones.. 

Q: What did experts think of the experiment?
A: The suggestion by scientists interviewed about the research is that routers give out heat, and this probably dried out the cress in the rooms with the routers in, so equivalent water was not enough for them.

There have been suggestions that the light from mobile phones or tablets just before bed can disrupt sleep patterns, although again there’s not really any strong evidence for this.. 

Q: Did a biology experiment by ninth grade students reveal a "dark truth" about the dangers of Wi-Fi?
A: No, that is not clear: The study was conducted as a classroom experiment without the proper scientific controls of a professional lab experiment. The girls take 400 seeds and separated them out across 12 different trays. Six of the trays were placed in each of 2 rooms which were both kept at the same temperature.After 12 days,The cress seeds in the first room were growing well,the seeds that were placed next to the router showed no real growth at all. The scientist observed that The problem is that due to a difference in temperature of just a few degrees, it can already take a couple of days for the cress to grow to the same height.If there was indeed a difference in temperature due to the placement of the laptops, it would be likely that the WiFi group could have germinated and grown similar to the control group if it was allowed to grow on for a couple of days.Norwegian science journalist said We have published around 60 years of research in at least 1,300 peer-reviewed studies that are essentially unable to find any effect on EM radiation cells in the frequency range in question. Nothing. The World Health Organization (WHO) went through 25,000 articles on the topic published over the last 30 years without finding any evidence that such radiation can have a biological effect..

title: Fact Check: U.S. birth certificates are federal bank notes valued between $650,000 and $750,...
text:
Claim: U.S. birth certificates are federal bank notes valued between $650,000 and $750,000.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The first Q&A pair state this claim is false, with a statement saying also that birth certificates cannot be used as any sort of currency in the same way a federal bank note can be.

Evidence:

Q: Are U.S. birth certificates federal bank notes valued between $650,000 and $750,000?
A: No. Several internet blogs and videos make false claims that a United States birth certificate is a negotiable instrument (a document that promises payment) that can be used to:

Make purchases that will be charged to a “Exemption Account” (perhaps identified by your social security number or EIN), or
Request savings bonds held by the government in your name and owed to you.
The truth is, birth certificates cannot be used for purchases, nor can they be used to request savings bonds purportedly held by the government.  Also, the “Exemption Account” is a false term; these accounts are fictitious and do not exist in the Treasury system. 

There is no monetary value to a birth certificate or a social security number/EIN, and TreasuryDirect accounts must be funded by the owner (through payroll deductions or from purchasing directly from the owner's personal bank account) to have any value.

title: Fact Check: A man, Emdadur Choudhury, who burned poppies on Remembrance Day 2011 as a counte...
text:

Verdict: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

Justification: The !st and 2nd Q&A pair coroberate the part of the claim stating that the named man did commit the crime claimed but not the part about the fine which The 4th Q&A pair does state that the man in the claim was receiving state benefits but no Q&A pair state if they were used to pay the fine in the claim. And even Q&A pair 3 only states that someone 'offered' to pay the fine for him.
so information is not proved wrong but information has been cherry-picked as he likely had to pay from benefits if he was out of work.

Evidence:

Q: On Remembrance Day 2011, did a man named Emdadur Choudhury burn poppies?
A: Yes. He was found guilty of burning poppies at a protest in west London on Armistice Day.

Q: Was Emdadur Choudhury fined £50 for burning the poppies on Remembrance Day 2011?
A: Yes. Emdadur Choudhury, 26, of Spitalfields, east London, was fined £50 for offences under the Public Order Act.

Q: How did Emdadur Choudhury pay for his £50 fine?
A: The extremist told how radical Muslim cleric Anjem Choudary had offered to foot the bill.

title: Fact Check: You should just ignore a parking charge notice.
text:
Claim: You should just ignore a parking charge notice.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The evidence shows that you should not just ignore a PCN, as you may end up in court

Evidence:

Q: Is paying a parking notice fine an admission of guilt in the UK?
A: Yes. paying is seen as admitting the ticket was right

Q: Can you appeal a parking notice fine in the UK?
A: Yes. How to appeal depends on the type of parking ticket you have - check what the ticket says before you start.

Q: Should parking charge notices be ignored?
A: Ignoring official correspondence from reputable companies, such as Gemini Parking Solutions, could lead to an unnecessary and completely avoidable court cases.

Many motorists believe that parking charges levied by parking companies are illegal and can be ignored without consequence. Several high profile online forums perpetuate this by continuing to post misleading advice and suggesting that motorists who have illegally parked, tear up their fine letter, rather than deal with it responsibly. However this is simply not true. Those motorists who choose to ignore these notifications could find themselves in court..

title: Fact Check: Penalty charge notices are usually issued by the police or councils, while parki...
text:
Claim: Penalty charge notices are usually issued by the police or councils, while parking charge notices are invoices issued by private companies.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: This is true, according to the answers, parking charge notices are issued by private companies who run car parks. 

Evidence:

Q: Who issues Penalty charge notices in the UK?
A: A PCN is a penalty for contravention of parking regulations. It can be paid, contested by appeal, or contested by defending a claim for payment under the small claims track of the county court.
You won’t get a criminal record or points on your licence.
Everything from how PCNs are served, through appeal or payment, to debt recovery is laid down in regulations. PCNs are used for some moving traffic offences too, particularly in London – bus lanes, no entry, restricted turn, yellow box junction.
You may get a PCN by post, by hand or applied to your car windscreen.
You’ve got 28 days to pay or challenge.
A PCN can be up to £70 outside London, and up to £130 in London.
The penalty is usually halved if paid within 14 days.
An unpaid PCN penalty is treated as a civil debt and you could be pursued through the county court system or even get a visit from the bailiff if the debt remains unpaid. Some local authorities don’t have civil parking enforcement powers and in these areas parking is enforced by the police or police-employed traffic wardens who will issue a Fixed Penalty Notice (FPN) enforced through the criminal justice system.. 

Q: Who issues Parking charge notices in the UK?
A: A parking ticket for private land is called a Parking Charge Notice (PCN) – check your ticket for this wording.

You might get a parking ticket on private land from the owner or a company employed to manage the car park if you:

park without the owner’s permission, or
breach any parking conditions imposed by the owner. 
There may have been signs displaying the rules for using the car park. When you park on private land (like a private car park) you enter into a contract with the landowner. Any signs that clearly display rules for using the car park give you the terms of the contract. The car park owner can take steps to enforce any of these rules if broken.. 

Q: what is a penalty charge notice
A: A Penalty charge notice is a penalty for contravention of parking regulations..

title: Fact Check: Martin Lewis, the founder of Money Saving Expert, recommends ignoring parking ch...

A: If you get an unfair ticket in a private car park, don't automatically pay it. These supposed 'fines' handed out are merely invoices, often unenforceable, and so we've three routes to fight unfair tickets. 

Q: Has Martin Lewis previously confirmed that an older version of this claim does not represent his advice?
A: yes. Lewis tweeted a fake claim and pointed out that it did not represent his advice..

title: Fact Check: BJP president Amit Shah said that the days of serving biryani to terrorists are ...
text:
Claim: BJP president Amit Shah said that the days of serving biryani to terrorists are over

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The answer and source show that the claim is false so the claim is refuted.

Evidence:

Q: What event is being referred to here?
A: the BJP President was referring to a fabricated story propagated by the public prosecutor of the 26/11 trial, Ujjwal Nikam. During the trial, Nikam, who had argued on behalf of the state, had manufactured a story about Ajmal Kasab being fed biryani in jail to counter an emotional wave supposedly being created in Kasab’s favour. “Kasab neither asked for biryani nor it was served by the government. I concocted it just to break an emotional atmosphere which was taking shape in favour of Kasab during the trial of the case”, Nikam said, speaking to the media in 2015..

They tested the virus by spraying into the air by a nebuliser mimicking the coughing action of an infected person. They found that it could be detected up to a minimum of 3 hours later in the air, up to 4 hours on copper surfaces, up to 24 hours on cardboard and up to 2-3 days on plastic and stainless steel surfaces..

title: Fact Check: Casein, the main protein in milk, causes cancer.
text:

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: the second answer shows Casein isn't listed as a known carcinogen and evidence suggests that milk may protect against cancer. 

Evidence:

Q: What is casein?
A: A mixture of related phosphoproteins occurring in milk and cheese. The group is characterized as one of the most nutritive milk proteins, containing all of the common amino acids and rich in the essential ones.. 

Q: Is casein a known carcinogen?
A: It is not listed as a caronigen by IARC or NTP. 

Q: What does the Continuous Update Project say about milk studies?
A: Dairy and cancer
Observed inverse associations between intake of dairy products and colorectal cancer development have been largely attributed to their high calcium content. In addition to calcium, lactic acid-producing bacteria may also protect against colorectal cancer,

while the casein and lactose in milk may increase calcium bioavailability. Other nutrients or bioactive constituents in dairy products, such as lactoferrin, vitamin D (from fortified dairy products) or the short-chain fatty acid butyrate may also impart some protective functions against colorectal cancer, but these require much better elucidation.

The CUP Panel concluded that the evidence was generally consistent for dairy products, milk, cheese and dietary calcium, and showed a decreased risk of colorectal cancer with higher consumption..

A: In the weeks since the 57-year-old singer was found dead at his suburban Minneapolis compound, on 21 April, investigators have been looking into whether he had a prescription drug problem.

This surprised friends and family members, who said Prince avoided alcohol and drugs and maintained a healthy lifestyle.

On Thursday, however, medical examiner A Quinn Strobl released the office’s assessment of Prince’s cause of death: “self-administered fentanyl”, a powerful opioid. The office said it could not offer further comment.

In a press release, the Carver County sheriff’s office said it “continues its investigation”.

Earlier on Thursday Minneapolis Star Tribune reported that Prince died of a painkiller overdose.

The official autopsy and toxicology reports have yet to be released.

Prince was last seen alive around 8pm on 20 April, when he was dropped off by an acquaintance at Paisley Park, his sprawling compound in Chanhassen, Minnesota, his longtime hometown. Now, nearly a century later, a team of shipwreck hunters says it has finally identified the battered boat’s remains off the coast of St. Augustine, Florida, putting to bed decades of myths, ghost stories and seafaring lore that inevitably sprung up in the interim.. 

Q: When were the boat remains later identified as those of the SS Cotopaxi ship found?
A: Researchers actually unknowingly homed in on the S.S. Cotopaxi’s marine graveyard nearly 35 years ago. The site, called Bear Wreck by fishers and divers, had long been known to contain a sunken ship, but scientists had struggled to pinpoint the vessel’s identity..

title: Fact Check: The Last Post song originated on an American Civil War Battlefield.
text:
Claim: The Last Post song originated on an American Civil War Battlefield.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The answer shows that the origin of the music is from the UK so the claim is refuted.

Evidence:

Q: What is the origin of the last post
A: The Last Post is one of a number of bugle calls in military tradition which mark the phases of the day. Where ‘Reveille' signaled the start of a soldier's day, the ‘Last Post' signaled its end.
It is believed originally to have been part of a more elaborate routine, known in the British Army as ‘tattoo', that had its origins in the 17th century. During the evening, a duty officer had to do the rounds of his unit's position, checking that the sentry posts were manned, rounding up the off-duty soldiers and packing them off to their beds or billets. He would be accompanied by one or more musicians. The ‘first post' was sounded when the duty officer started his rounds and, as the party proceeded from post to post, a drum was played. The drum beats told off-duty soldiers it was time to rest. If the soldiers were staying in a town, the beats told them it was time to quit the pubs..

title: Fact Check: Garlic has proven 100 times more effective than antibiotics.
text:
Claim: Garlic has proven 100 times more effective than antibiotics.

Verdict: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

Justification: The WSU study supports the "100 times more effective" claim in relation to one bacterium but the claim is broader than that.

Evidence:

Q: What is the report on garlic being proven to be 100 times more effective than antibiotics?
A: WSU researchers recently reported that diallyl sulfide, a compound found in garlic, is 100 times more effective than the antibiotics erythromycin and ciprofloxacin in killing the toxic bacteria Campylobacter jejuni.. 

Q: How does the garlic compound diallyl sulfide kill bacteria?
A: The garlic compound diallyl sulfide is able to dissolve the biofilm and kill the cowering bacteria underneath 'Campylobacter jejuni' which is hard to kill because it produces a slimy protective biofilm that helps it repels antibiotics and stick to surfaces. 

Campylobacter jejuni is the most common cause of food poisoning in the United States. Food poisoning strikes over 2.4 million Americans each year and symptoms include stomach pains, cramping, diarrhea and fever.

Diallyl sulfide combines with a sulfur containing enzyme in the bacteria.  This changes the enzyme’s function and shuts down cell metabolism; killing bacteria better and faster than antibiotics!. 

Q: Have there been other studies investigating whether garlic has antiviral properties?
A: Yes. One, being "Garlic for the Common Cold", whose objectives are to determine whether garlic (Allium sativum) is effective for the prevention or treatment of the common cold when compared to placebo, no treatment, or other treatments.

title: Fact Check: A child in Barbados has contracted AIDS by eating a pineapple that a vendor had ...
text:
Claim: A child in Barbados has contracted AIDS by eating a pineapple that a vendor had bled upon.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Q&A pairs state that blood does pass HIV to others, but that eating food contaminated with HIV infected blood should not pass on infection. 

Evidence:

Q: Did a 10 year old Barbados boy contract aids by eating a pineapple that had the vendors blood on?
A: No answer could be found.. 

Q: How is Aids Transmitted?
A: The following are the means by which the HIV virus is spread:

Vertical transmission. HIV can be spread to babies born to, or breastfed by, mothers infected with the virus.

Sexual contact. In adults and adolescents, HIV is spread most commonly by sexual contact with an infected partner. The virus enters the body through the lining of the vagina, vulva, penis, rectum, or abraded or irritated tissues in the lining of the mouth through sexual activity.

Blood contamination. HIV may also be spread through contact with infected blood. However, due to the screening of donated blood for evidence of HIV infection, the risk of acquiring HIV from blood transfusions is extremely low.

Needles. HIV is frequently spread by sharing needles, syringes, or drug use equipment with someone who is infected with the virus. Transmission from patient to health care worker, or vice-versa, through accidental sticks with contaminated needles or other medical instruments, is rare.

No known cases of HIV/AIDS have been spread by the following:

Saliva

Sweat

Tears

Casual contact, such as sharing food utensils, towels, and bedding

Swimming pools

Telephones

Toilet seats

Biting insects (such as mosquitoes). 

Q: Can you catch Aids by eating something with an infected persons blood on it?
A: No. As per the report on Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, one cannot get HIV from consuming food handled by someone with HIV. Even if the food contained small amounts of HIV-infected blood or semen, exposure to the air, heat from cooking, and stomach acid would destroy the virus. Though it is very rare, HIV can be spread by eating food that has been pre-chewed by someone with HIV. The contamination occurs when infected blood from a caregiver’s mouth mixes with food while chewing. The only known cases are among infants.

title: Fact Check: British Parliament banned lipstick in 1770 for the fear that it had the power to...

Q: Has there ever been a ban on lipstick by the UK Parliament
A: A search of lipstick on the website, JustisOne, an extensive legal database that contains British parliamentary acts dating back to 1707. shows no result of such.

title: Fact Check: 56 girls died because of using whisper, Stayfree and other sanitary protection.
text:
Claim: 56 girls died because of using whisper, Stayfree and other sanitary protection.

Verdict: Not Enough Evidence

Justification: QA pairs make no reference to 56 girls dying or if Whisper, stayfree or other Sanitary protection companies/products have specific health risks.

Evidence:

Q: Can wearing pads for too long cause any health risks
A: Other factors that increase the risk of vaginal yeast infections include stress, washing your genitals with soap, wearing synthetic and tight clothes, sweating and using “non-breathable” panty liners or sanitary pads.. 

Q: Can wearing sanitary pads for too long lead to cancer
A: It is true that synthetic materials of the types used in some high-absorbency feminine sanitary products can trap heat and dampness, which may promote the growth of yeast and bacteria and (in rare cases) create the potential for toxic shock syndrome, but that issue is associated with the use of tampons rather than sanitary pads.

title: Fact Check: During Mike Bloomberg's  tenure, street homelessness in NYC decreased by 28%.
text:
Claim: During Mike Bloomberg's  tenure, street homelessness in NYC decreased by 28%.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: t seems the homelessness did indeed decrease, therefore the label is supported

Evidence:

Q: What was this claim based on?
A: The City of New York's Mayors Management Report 2013.. 

Q: What did The City of New York's Mayors Management Report 2013 conclude about homelessness?
A: The Homeless Outreach Population Estimate (HOPE), a yearly
census conducted by the Department of Homeless Services and its
partners, found 3,180 homeless people on the street the night the
census was conducted in January 2013, a four percent reduction
compared to Fiscal 2012. Since Fiscal 2009, the population
estimates have been up and down but relatively constant on
average. In the long-term the estimate of those living on the street in
2013 is 28 percent lower than the baseline established in 2005. By
contrast the sheltered homeless population has risen in the short term, from an average of 39,673 in FY2012 to 47,084 in FY2013,
and by 34% since Fiscal 2005. 

Q: did the coalition officer make a statement on the decreased homelessness
A: Yes. in a interview, he confirmed this claim

title: Fact Check: If an unmarked car tries to pull you over, you should dial 112 to confirm it’s a...
text:
Claim: If an unmarked car tries to pull you over, you should dial 112 to confirm it’s actually a police officer because the number provides "a direct link to state trooper info," and that "this applies in all 50 states."

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The number 112 does not provide a direct link to state trooper info. Also the number 112 may reroute to the 911 emergency services but it may not. 

Evidence:

Q: Is 112 an emergency number in the U.S?
A: No. U.S only uses “911” as its emergency contact number

Q: If dialling 112 in the U.S will a caller be transferred to the emergency services?
A: 1-1-2 is an international number.

So, 1-1-2 is indeed an emergency number- but for Europe, not America. so dialing 1-1-2 in the U.S. will get you to 9-1-1.. 

Q: What number should you call in the U.S if you feel unsafe being pulled over by an unmarked police car?
A: Call 9-1-1 if you have concerns about the person pulling you over (i.e. if they are in an unmarked car or you would like to see another officer or want to reach a safe location.).

title: Fact Check: Eating black garlic reduces the chances of developing cancer.
text:
Claim: Eating black garlic reduces the chances of developing cancer.

Verdict: Not Enough Evidence

Justification: Although black garlic may have more enhanced properties to white garlic and also contain properties to lower cholesterol and reduce the risk of cancer, there is not enough proved evidence to support the use of black garlic for health purposes on humans.

Evidence:

Q: What are the claimed health benefits of black garlic?
A: The health benefits of black garlic are almost the same as white garlic BUT the fermentation process is said to enhance even further the amazing properties of the “regular” one. In a way it can be considered a kind of super-garlic. Or, in mathematical terms, as a to square white garlic.
The compound S-allylcysteine, a natural component of fresh garlic and a derivative of the amino acid cysteine, is found in much greater concentrations in black garlic. This compound is thought to help lower cholesterol and decrease the risk of cancer.
White garlic is praised throughout the world for its anti-microbial, antibiotic and anti-fungal. All properties that are attributed to allicin. Black garlic’s S-allycysteine improves the absorption of allicin, boosting protection against infections.. 

Q: Have these health benefits been verified?
A: the majority of research on black garlic’s health benefits has been conducted on laboratory animals, so there is still a lack of scientific evidence to support the use of black garlic for health purposes on humans..

title: Fact Check: Ghana’s two dominant political parties, the New Patriotic Party (NPP) and Nation...
text:
Claim: Ghana’s two dominant political parties, the New Patriotic Party (NPP) and National Democratic Congress (NDC) are both laying claim to the Free Senior High School (SHS) programme, a social intervention project meant to improve access to education.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: This claim is refuted. President Nana Akuffo-Addo started the Free SHS Policy, not Former president John Mahama.

Evidence:

Q: Did  Former President John Mahama started the Free SHS Policy ?
A: The Free Secondary High School (Free SHS) education policy in Ghana was a government initiative launched by President Nana Akuffo-Addo in September 2017. The policy was part of Nana Addo’s campaign messages during Ghana's 2016 election period, and has become an essential part of Ghana's educational system. The policy's core themes of access, equity and equality fulfill the United Nations modified Sustainable Development Goals, where member countries amalgamate those themes in their educational systems to certify adequate learning experiences for students..

title: Fact Check: Marijuana could be making teens less intelligent.
text:
Claim: Marijuana could be making teens less intelligent.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: The answer and source show that this claim is true and the source is credible.

Evidence:

Q: Does marijuana affect adolescent intellectual development?
A: Yes. According to a 2012 study: "Neuropsychological testing was conducted at age 13 y, before initiation of cannabis use, and again at age 38 y, after a pattern of persistent cannabis use had developed.Persistent cannabis use was associated with neuropsychological decline broadly across domains of functioning, even after controlling for years of education. Informants also reported noticing more cognitive problems for persistent cannabis users. Impairment was concentrated among adolescent-onset cannabis users, with more persistent use associated with greater decline."

title: Fact Check: Section 233 of the Indian Penal Code (IPC), pertains to self-defence of the indi...
text:
Claim: Section 233 of the Indian Penal Code (IPC), pertains to self-defence of the individual and rape crimes against women in India.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Q&A 1 shows that The section of penial code shown in the claim relates to counterfeiting currency, not rape and self defence as claimed

Evidence:

Q: What is Section 233 in the Indian Penal Code?
A: Section 233 in The Indian Penal Code

233. Making or selling instrument for counterfeiting coin.—Whoever makes or mends, or performs any part of the process of making or mending, or buys, sells or disposes of, any die or instrument, for the purpose of being used, or knowing or having reason to believe that it is intended to be used, for the purpose of counterfeiting coin, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, and shall also be liable to fine..

title: Fact Check: You can get HIV/AIDS from contaminated fruit.
text:

Verdict: Refuted

which somewhat refutes the claim.
The 2nd Q&A pair state that even fruit (as claimed) that is contaminated by HIV cannot spread the virus to those who eat it, which fully refutes the claim.

Evidence:

Q: Can you get HIV from consuming food handled by someone with HIV ?
A: You can’t get HIV from consuming food handled by someone with HIV. 

Q: Can you catch HIV by eating fruit contaminated with blood by an HIV infected person?
A: You cannot get it from consuming food handled by an HIV-infected person; even if the food contained small amounts of HIV-infected blood or semen, exposure to the air, heat from cooking, and stomach acid would destroy the virus..

title: Fact Check: Mosquitoes kill 2,740 people every day.
text:

Q: How many people die from mosquito borne diseases a day?
A: 400,000 + 40,000 = 440,000
440,000/365 = 1,205

WHO estimates 1,205 per day..

title: Fact Check: 5G can suppress the immune system, thus making people more susceptible to catchi...
text:
Claim: 5G can suppress the immune system, thus making people more susceptible to catching the Coronavirus.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: research shows that 5G doesn't pose adverse health effects on public

Evidence:

Q: What are the health risks of 5G on the human body?
A: To date, and after much research performed, no adverse health effect has been causally linked with exposure to wireless technologies. Health-related conclusions are drawn from studies performed across the entire radio spectrum but, so far, only a few studies have been carried out at the frequencies to be used by 5G.

Tissue heating is the main mechanism of interaction between radiofrequency fields and the human body. Radiofrequency exposure levels from current technologies result in negligible temperature rise in the human body.

As the frequency increases, there is less penetration into the body tissues and absorption of the energy becomes more confined to the surface of the body (skin and eye). Provided that the overall exposure remains below international guidelines, no consequences for public health are anticipated.. 

Q: Does 5G reduce immunity and cause COVID-19?
A: No. Claims state 5G weakens the immune system, making it easier to contract COVID-19, or that it directly causes the virus. Simply put, research emphasizes that the belief that 5G causes or can spread COVID-19 isn’t true.

Parliamentarian Yehor Soboliev was the first official to demand the prosecutor's dismissal.

title: Fact Check: Doctors in Israel and the medical company, Gomorra, have found a “100% cure for ...

There is no cure for HIV infection..

A: Israeli company Zion Medical released a press statement claiming to have found a “potential” cure for HIV using the drug called Gammora after what it said was a 10-week trial of the drug.. 

Q: What is Bhekisisa?
A: The Bhekisisa Centre for Health Journalism is an independent media organisation that specialises in narrative, solutions journalism focusing on health and social justice issues across Africa. Our stories are distributed through News24, the Daily Maverick and the Mail & Guardian and reach policymakers, academics, activists and political leaders, often resulting in shifts in policy, setting national agendas and defining conversations.  Trained in evidence-based journalism, our reporters and editors use peer-reviewed journal studies and reliable statistics to support the narratives in our stories..

Evidence:

Q: Do you need a West African Examination Council [WAEC] certificate to become the President of Nigeria?
A: The Constitution of the Federal Republic of Nigeria 1999 states that to become the Head of State,
A person shall be qualified for election to the office of the President if –
(a) he is a citizen of Nigeria by birth;
(b) he has attained the age of thirty-five years;8
(c) he is a member of a political party and is sponsored by that political party; and
(d) he has been educated up to at least School Certificate level or its equivalent. (Sec. 131). 

Q: What is meant by certificate of education or equivalent in The Constitution of the Federal Republic of Nigeria 1999 part on head of state qualifications?
A: - service in the public or private sector in the Federation in any capacity acceptable to the Independent National Electoral Commission for a minimum of ten years 

- attendance at courses and training institutions as may be acceptable to the Independent National Electoral Commission for periods totaling up to a minimum of one year, 

- the ability to read, write, understand and communicate in the English language to the satisfaction of the Independent National Electoral Commission, 

- any other qualification acceptable by the Independent National Electoral Commission.”.

title: Fact Check: The Covid-19 spike protein which the Pfizer vaccine causes an immune response ag...
text:
Claim: The Covid-19 spike protein which the Pfizer vaccine causes an immune response against also trains the body to attack syncytin-1, a protein in the placenta, which could lead to infertility in women.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Someone has claimed that the COVID-19 vaccines are going to cause infertility because of a shared amino acid sequence in the spike protein of SARS-CoV-2 and a placental protein, which will make the immune system attack both as it can’t tell the difference. The truth? This sequence is too short for the immune system to meaningfully confuse it with placental proteins. It’s sort of like saying that you are going to be confused with a criminal because you wear a commonly sold red bracelet that was also found on the criminal. It’s not realistic. If this were true, we would also expect COVID-19 to cause early pregnancy loss a significant amount of the time. The evidence available to us does not support that this is the case. There is no reasonable basis to believe that vaccines against COVID-19/SARS-CoV-2 will affect fertility.

Evidence:

Q: Are COVID-19 Vaccines Going To Cause Infertility?
A: Someone has claimed that the COVID-19 vaccines are going to cause infertility because of a shared amino acid sequence in the spike protein of SARS-CoV-2 and a placental protein, which will make the immune system attack both as it can’t tell the difference. The truth? This sequence is too short for the immune system to meaningfully confuse it with placental proteins. It’s sort of like saying that you are going to be confused with a criminal because you wear a commonly sold red bracelet that was also found on the criminal. It’s not realistic. If this were true, we would also expect COVID-19 to cause early pregnancy loss a significant amount of the time. The evidence available to us does not support that this is the case. There is no reasonable basis to believe that vaccines against COVID-19/SARS-CoV-2 will affect fertility..

title: Fact Check: 5G technology is spreading Coronavirus.
text:

Evidence:

Q: How does Covid-19 spread?
A: COVID-19 is mainly spread through the air in drops of liquid that come from the nose and mouth of an infected person.

The drops are usually too small to see. They scatter when an infected person coughs, sneezes or talks. When the drops reach the eyes, nose or mouth of another person, the infection spreads. 

Q: How does 5G work?
A: 5G is the next generation of wireless network technology.
G networks can be built in different ways from multiple bands of wavelength spectrum (also known as radio frequencies) to carry information through the air: Low-band, mid-band, and high-band.. 

Q: Is 5G coverage available worldwide?
A: No. This poster maps 5G coverage

title: Fact Check: Drinking a glass of water before going to bed helps prevent stroke and heart att...
text:
Claim: Drinking a glass of water before going to bed helps prevent stroke and heart attacks

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The answers to questions one and two include the phrase 'eating healthy' which commonsense suggests includes drinking water, however the emphasis in the claim is on the time of day, ie 'before going to bed' with the suggestion this is better than another time. That is dealt with by the answer to question three, where the cardiovascular surgeon Dr Marc Gilinov says "there is no data to suggest 'when' you drink matters', and calls claims that suggest otherwise, 'fictitious'.

Evidence:

Q: What can prevent a heart attack?
A: However, there are things people can do to help avoid having a heart attack in the first place. These include eating healthy, being physically active, not smoking, and getting plenty of sleep.. 

Q: What can prevent a stroke?
A: The bottom line? Healthy living is the best way to delay or avoid many heart and brain diseases. This means being active and fit, eating healthy, avoiding tobacco and managing conditions that can put you at greater risk. Take charge of your health. Join Healthy for Good for tips, tools and inspiration to make changes and create healthy habits you can sustain throughout your life.. 

Q: Can drinking a glass of water before going to bed help prevent stroke and heart attacks?
A: Dr. Marc Gilinov, a cardiovascular surgeon at the Cleveland Clinic, a hospital in the US state of Ohio, examined the claim that drinking water a specific times of the day has particular health benefits. He wrote in this debunk, “There is no data to suggest that ‘when’ you drink matters.” He advised choosing water over soda, and cautioned, “Don’t schedule your drinking according to a fictitious claim that the time you drink it matters.”.

title: Fact Check: While western countries have been busy fighting the new coronavirus, internation...
text:
Claim: While western countries have been busy fighting the new coronavirus, international terrorism has stopped

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The answer and source show that there was a terrorist attack during the pandemic so the claim is refuted.

Evidence:

Q: Did terror attacks stop during the coronavirus pandemic
A: No. For example, on March 6, 2020 Islamic State attacks Kabul gathering, killing at least 32

title: Fact Check: Moon and Mars will appear to be the same size in the night sky on August 27, 202...
text:
Claim: Moon and Mars will appear to be the same size in the night sky on August 27, 2020.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The Q&As explain that this actually does not happen with the moon and mars,but only with the sun and mars. So the claim is refuted. 

Evidence:

Q: When will the Sun and Mars appear to be the same size in the night sky?
A: Mars arrives at opposition to the sun on Oct. 13 2020.. 

Q: What is the astronomical phenomenon known as opposition?
A: During opposition, Mars and the sun are on directly opposite sides of Earth. From our perspective on our spinning world, Mars rises in the east just as the sun sets in the west. Then, after staying up in the sky the entire night, Mars sets in the west just as the sun rises in the east. Since Mars and the sun appear on opposite sides of the sky, we say that Mars is in "opposition.". 

Q: Is the Moon directly involved in the astronomical phenomenon of opposition?
A: No. Only Mars and the Sun.

title: Fact Check: Student nurses of the 2017 cohort were asked to join the NHS workforce early thi...
text:
Claim: Student nurses of the 2017 cohort were asked to join the NHS workforce early this year, due to Covid-19.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: The claim is supported by the answer provided, student nurses were asked to opt-in to an arrangement whereby you move into clinical practice during this
emergency period.

Evidence:

Q: Were student nurses asked to join the NHS workforce because of Covid-19?
A: Yes. They were asked to opt-in to an arrangement whereby you move into clinical practice during this
emergency period

title: Fact Check: Stanley Johnson, father of Prime Minister Boris Johnson, wrote a novel called ‘T...
text:
Claim: Stanley Johnson, father of Prime Minister Boris Johnson, wrote a novel called ‘The Virus’ in 1982.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: 'The Virus' by Stanley Johnson was first published in 1982.

Evidence:

Q: Who is Stanley Johnson?
A: An author and a Conservative MP and Boris Johnson's dad. 

Q: Who wrote the book 'The Virus'?
A: A long out-of-print novel about a deadly virus by Stanley Johnson, the father of UK prime minister Boris Johnson, is to be reissued this summer, two weeks after it emerged that he was trying to find it a new publisher during the coronavirus pandemic.

Having been pitched to UK publishers as “an urgent, exhilarating novel” by “a tireless self-promoter”, Johnson senior’s 1982 novel The Virus has been snapped up by Black Spring..

title: Fact Check: The Covid-19 vaccine will cause infertility in younger men.
text:
Claim: The Covid-19 vaccine will cause infertility in younger men.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Reliable source and clear reference to no effect on fertility. 

Evidence:

Q: Has there been any research into covid-19 vaccines and male fertility?
A: yes, it is said  there are No Signs COVID-19 Vaccine Causes Infertility.

title: Fact Check: The cladding used on Grenfell Tower has previously been banned in the USA.
text:
Claim: The cladding used on Grenfell Tower has previously been banned in the USA.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: The answers show that the cladding was banned in  the US so the claim is supported.

Evidence:

Q: What cladding was used on Grenfell Tower?
A: Panels were made of aluminium composite material (ACM) with a polyethylene (PE) core.. 

Q: Is the cladding that was used on the Grenfell Tower banned on tall buildings in the U.S.?
A: In the United States, most jurisdictions don't allow this type of cladding for buildings higher than 40 feet. That is because they've adopted the International Building Code, which requires cladding for tall buildings to pass a rigorous test developed by the National Fire Protection Association called "NFPA 285." The purpose of the test is to ensure that installed cladding will be noncombustible.. 

Q: How tall was Grenfell Tower?
A: 220-foot-10-inch (67.30 m) tall building.

title: Fact Check: This photo shows women working for the Red Cross arriving at Normandy beach in 1...
text:
Claim: This photo shows women working for the Red Cross arriving at Normandy beach in 1944 to assist injured troops.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: According to the source link, the photograph referred to in the claim was taken seven months after the D-Day invasion at Normandy. Therefore the information inferred in the claim is incorrect. 

Evidence:

Q: Where was the photo in the claim taken?
A: The Riviera Region of Southern France.. 

Q: When was the photo in the claim captured?
A: January 15, 1945. 

Q: What is happening in the photo?
A: The photo captures a United States Coast Guard-manned barge unloading its passengers onto a beach in the Riviera Region of Southern France. These passengers – Red Cross staff – arrived ready to “carry out their duties and keep high the spirits of Yank fighting men.”.

title: Fact Check: Jacob Rothschild owns a patent to coronavirus.
text:
Claim: Jacob Rothschild owns a patent to coronavirus.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: There is no patent owned by anyone for coronavirus 

Evidence:

Q: What is coronavirus?
A: Coronavirus is not a single virus but a family of viruses which includes the common cold, SARS (the severe acute respiratory syndrome, of which there were outbreaks in 2002 and 2004) and this new coronavirus identified in people in Wuhan.. 

Q: Are there any patents for this new coronovirus?
A: There are no patents for this new coronavirus.

A patent application from 2015 does exist for a different type of coronavirus and is referred to by users in the comments to the post.. 

Q: Is this the same virus as COVID-19?
A: This patent refers to a “live attenuated” version of the avian infectious bronchitis virus (IBV). This is essentially a weakened version of the virus, patented with the aim of eventually developing it into a vaccine against the disease for birds and other animals..

title: Fact Check: A no deal Brexit means UK fishing waters are back in our control.
text:
Claim: A no deal Brexit means UK fishing waters are back in our control.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: Evidence finds that the UK fishing waters would be back under their jurisdiction and their laws. Hence, the claim is supported. 

Evidence:

Q: What happens to the fishery laws made by the EU if the UK leaves
A: Following Brexit, the UK will no longer be part of the EU Common Fisheries Policy (CFP). It will become an independent coastal state and be fully responsible for managing fisheries in the UK’s Exclusive Economic Zone (EEZ), extending 200 nautical miles (nm) from shore. 

Q: What does it mean for the EU if Brexit does not happen
A: The UK fishing waters are back under their jurisdiction and their laws.

title: Fact Check: U.S., Germany and France have no educational requirement for the office of Presi...
text:
Claim: U.S., Germany and France have no educational requirement for the office of President.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: The question-answer pairs establish the requirements for becoming President in the countries in the claim, and there is no mention of educational requirement in the answers.

Evidence:

Q: What are the requirements of becoming a president according to the US constitution?
A: No Person except a natural born Citizen, or a Citizen of the United States, at the time of the Adoption of this Constitution, shall be eligible to the Office of President; neither shall any person be eligible to that Office who shall not have attained to the Age of thirty five Years, and been fourteen Years a Resident within the United States.. 

Q: What are the requirements of becoming a president according to the German constitution?
A: The Federal President shall be elected by the Federal Convention without debate. Any German who is entitled to vote in Bundestag elections and has attained the age of forty may be elected.. 

Q: What are the requirements of becoming a president according to the French constitution?
A: the French constitution states that a candidate for a presidential election is required to:

be a French citizen;
have attained the age of 18 years;
be qualified to vote;
not be ineligible by reasons of criminal conviction or judicial decision;
and have a bank account..

title: Fact Check: A no deal Brexit means we wouldn’t have to make any more annual payments of £26 ...
text:
Claim: A no deal Brexit means we wouldn’t have to make any more annual payments of £26 billion to £32 billion.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The claim's supposition by saying 'any more' is that the current annual level of payments is between £26-£32 billion, but the current level is far less at £14.56 billion annually. The claim has overstated the existing annual commitment to the EU.

Evidence:

Q: How much did the UK pay to the EU before Brexit?
A: The direct cost to UK taxpayers, always has the rebate deducted before payment is made. Because of this, the correct figure, taking account of the rebate, was around £280 million per week. 

Q: What is the annual cost to the UK if its weekly payments are £280 million?
A: £14,560,000,000 billion. 

Q: will the UK have to make any  payments to the EU budget fund after Brexit?
A: The UK will formally leave the EU on 31 January 2020. During the remaining 11
months of 2020 the UK will pay the EU largely as if a Member
State.

title: Fact Check: University of Zimbabwe will begin serving exotic game meat from wildlife parks d...
text:
Claim: University of Zimbabwe will begin serving exotic game meat from wildlife parks due to rising prices of beef and chicken.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The second Q&A pair show the official statement from the university stating that the claim is not true so the claim is refuted.

Evidence:

Q: Where did the claim originate?
A: In a notice from The Student representative council from the university of Zimbabwe.. 

Q: Has the University addressed the claim?
A: Yes. They have issued a notice denying the claim calling it mischievous falsehood and saying they will not be offering game meat.

title: Fact Check: To self diagnose for COVID-19, hold your breath for ten seconds without coughing...
text:
Claim: To self diagnose for COVID-19, hold your breath for ten seconds without coughing, discomfort, stuffiness or tightness and this proves no fibrosis in the lungs and no infection.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The answers show credible sources that say the claim is not trustworthy advice and so the claim is refuted.

Evidence:

Q: Have any medical personnel commented on the claim?
A: The Chief Quality Officer and Chief of Infectious Diseases from the University of Maryland, Dr Faheem Younus tweeted

Most young patients with Coronavirus will be able to hold their breaths for much longer than 10 seconds. And many elderly without the virus won’t be able to do it..

title: Fact Check: In Britain, you’re allowed to wave terrorist flags
text:
Claim: In Britain, you’re allowed to wave terrorist flags

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The answer shows that is it an offence to show support to a terrorist organisation in the UK so the claim is refuted.

Evidence:

Q: What is the Britain stance on waving terrorist flag
A: The Terrorism Act 2000 says that wearing or displaying articles in public that arouse “reasonable suspicion” that the person is a supporter or member of a terrorist organisation is an offence..

title: Fact Check: Pensioners in the UK have to pay for television.
text:
Claim: Pensioners in the UK have to pay for television.

Verdict: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

Justification: The majority of pensioners have to pay for a BBC television license if they use terrestrial television. But low income pensioners are exempt.

Evidence:

Q: What is the regulation in the UK regarding TV licence for pensioners?
A: Free TV Licences are only available if you’re 75 or over and you, or your partner living at the same address, are receiving Pension Credit.. 

Q: What is Pension Credit?
A: Pension Credit gives you extra money to help with your living costs if you’re over State Pension age and on a low income.. 

Q: What counts as a pensioner?
A: For TV licenses, anyone over the age of 75 was counted for free TV licences. In 2019, it was announced that TV licences would no longer be free for all those aged over 75. Pensioners under the age of 75 have always had to pay the TV license..

title: Fact Check: Consuming certain plants will stop women from getting pregnant.
text:
Claim: Consuming certain plants will stop women from getting pregnant.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The Q&A pair show that the claim is misguided, and that the plants are not a substitute for contraception, and that the plants used to make the claim could be harmful to pregnant women.

Evidence:

Q: Are there any plants that are approved as contraceptives?
A: No. None on the NHS approved methods of contraception.

Q: Are any plants considered dangerous when used as contraceptives?
A: Yes. Several are listed by the UN.

Q: Is there a natural contraceptive?
A: Yes. Natural family planning is a type of contraception which does not rely on any contraceptives but your awareness of your fertility. Couples who use the fertility awareness method track the woman’s cycle and they only have sex on days when conception is unlikely.

title: Fact Check: 122 Muslims acquitted by Gujarat court for alleged link with SIMI were in prison...
text:
Claim: 122 Muslims acquitted by Gujarat court for alleged link with SIMI were in prison for 20 years.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: It appears that the claim is untrue, whilst the court case had a vedict which took 20 years to decide the fate of the 122 muslims, they only spent around 9 months in jail before getting bail.

Evidence:

Q: were the 122 muslims prisoned for 20 years?
A: They were not imprisoned for 20 years, none of the accused were in jail for more than 9 months.. 

Q: How long did the court take to decide the verdict for their case
A: 20 years. 

Q: Were these people in jail for 20 years while the court decided
A: According to case details, after being arrested most of the accused spent at least nine months in jail before getting bail..

title:
Fact Check: half of the GOP candidates don't live in the 9th congressional s
district of nor...
text:

No Person shall be a Representative who shall not have attained to the Age of twenty five Years, and been seven Years a Citizen of the United States, and who shall not, when elected, be an Inhabitant of that State in which he shall be chosen..

title: Fact Check: A picture shows a woman holding a protest sign saying “stop killing volcanoes to...
text:
Claim: A picture shows a woman holding a protest sign saying “stop killing volcanoes to make lava lamps”, from the People’s Vote march.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The claim is refuted as evidence shows that the protest sign had been edited. The original is from a protest in London in 2011.

Evidence:

Q: What is a lava lamp?
A: A lava lamp is a decorative lamp, invented in 1963 by British entrepreneur Edward Craven Walker, the founder of the lighting company Mathmos. It consists of a bolus of a special coloured wax mixture inside a glass vessel,. 

Q: Does the 'Lava' in a lava lamp come from a volcano?
A: No. its wax.

Q: Is there proof that the image was edited
A: Yes, the original image is from a Protest in London in 2011.

title: Fact Check: HS2 will cost £150 billion.
text:
Claim: HS2 will cost £150 billion.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The answers show that the cost should be less than what the claim says so the claim is refuted.

Evidence:

Q: What is HS2?
A: HS2 is the government’s project to build a high-speed railway from London to Manchester and Leeds, via Birmingham and the East Midlands.. 

Q: What was this estimated to cost at the time of this claim?
A: he latest estimate is that the scheme could cost £106 billion, according to an independent review of the project’s costs leaked recently to the Financial Times. The report reportedly still recommends that “on balance” the government should proceed with the railway.

Since this article was first written the leaked review has been published by the government. It says that the total cost estimate for HS2 “developed by an external consultant” was £106.6 billion in 2015 prices.. 

Q: How much did the the government say the HS2 will cost
A: The total cost of the HS2 could be up to £106.6 billion.

title: Fact Check: If you have been recently vaccinated you need to stay away from babies, young ch...
text:
Claim: If you have been recently vaccinated you need to stay away from babies, young children, pregnant women, immunocompromised people, the elderly, and terminally ill people for at least two weeks minimum.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: The first Q&A states that at most says if you are around the people in the claim that you should be vaccinated, the claim says the opposite of this.
Q&A 2 specifically says that all people should get vaccinated if they are around immunocompromised people. which is the opposite to what is claimed.


Evidence:

Q: Does the Public Health England guidelines list staying away from those with compromised immune systems, babies, children, pregnant women, and the elderly if you have been recently vaccinated?
A: No. Public Health England does, however, say "vaccination of close contacts of vulnerable people has a major benefit by reducing the risk of exposure to wild-type infection."

Q: What does the Public Health England advise on those close to immunocompromised people?
A: Public Health England advise that to minimise the risk of infection in immunosuppressed individuals for whom live vaccines are contraindicated, their close contacts should be fully immunised according to the UK schedule, as a matter of priority. Close contacts of severely immunosuppressed individuals should also be offered vaccination against varicella and influenza. This will reduce the risk of exposure of vulnerable individuals to the serious consequences of vaccine-preventable infections.. 

Q: What are Public Health England guidelines for babies, young children, the elderly and pregnant women?
A: PHE provides no guidelines or warnings on interacting with people who have recently received live vaccinations. It also says that having a pregnant household member does not mean someone shouldn’t get the routine vaccinations..

title: Fact Check: The BBC decided against broadcasting the funeral of Dame Vera Lynn live, but did...
text:
Claim: The BBC decided against broadcasting the funeral of Dame Vera Lynn live, but did broadcast the funeral of George Flyoyd in America.

Verdict: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

Justification: Parts of the public service for Lynn were broadcast.

Evidence:

Q: Was the funeral of Dame Vera Lynn public or a private ceremony
A: The singer's family held a private funeral with a full memorial service expected to take place at a later date.. 

Q: was any of dame vera Lynn's funeral broadcast on the BBC
A: Camera crews and photographers descended  as the funeral procession stopped at the crossroads in the centre of Ditchling, where the singer lived for 50 years, to allow people to pay their respects. along with servicemen and women who have come to pay their respects.. 

Q: Was the funeral of George Floyd a public or private service?
A: The BBC did cover the service but aired the incorrect photo during its broadcast.

title: Fact Check: Posting on social media such as Instagram for Blackout Tuesday dilutes feeds and...
text:
Claim: Posting on social media such as Instagram for Blackout Tuesday dilutes feeds and erases protesters’ posts burying the voices it's meant to amplify.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: It seems from the last QA that the posts are not actually causing any harm to the actually protest information. Therefore, the claim is refuted

Evidence:

Q: Were people advised to not post on social media for blackout Tuesday?
A: Note that the use of the hashtags #BlackLivesMatter or #BLM is not recommended in this case as it is reportedly overwhelming important images in the main Black Lives Matter feed and making it difficult to find other Black Lives Matter content.. 

Q: Did Instagram merge #BlackOutTuesday and #BlackLivesMatter posts?
A: No answer could be found.. 

Q: Does posting for Blackouttuesday make other protests on Instagram for BLM harder to see?
A: No. “If you edit your post to remove a hashtag, your post will no longer be shown on that hashtag page,” she said. “In some cases, it may take up to 10 minutes for the post to be removed once you edit it. If someone uses #blacklivesmatter and #blackouttuesday in their caption, the post will appear on both hashtag pages – we are not merging the pages.”

title: Fact Check: A picture post has surfaced on the internet in which Union Minister Nitin Gadkar...
text:
Claim: A picture post has surfaced on the internet in which Union Minister Nitin Gadkari has been quoted praising interim Congress President Sonia Gandhi and former President Rahul Gandhi.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: No Record of this happening and refuted by alternate fact checking site stated in QA pairs.

Evidence:

Q: Did Nitin Gadkari say Sonia Gandhi ji and Rahul Gandhi ji awere very good people, and that such people should stay in politics?
A: No. Fact checker websites have stated this is false.

Q: Did Nitin Gadkari say Sonia Gandhi ji and Rahul Gandhi ji were very good people, and that such people should stay in politics?
A: No. Fact checker websites have stated this is false.

Q: Does Nitin Gadkari's official social media profile on Facebook or Twitter mention that Sonia Gandhi ji and Rahul Gandhi ji were very good people, and that such people should stay in politics?
A: The comment is not found on Nitin Gadkari's Facebook page..

title: Fact Check: Despite pledging to meet net zero emissions by 2050, on current track the UK gov...
text:
Claim: Despite pledging to meet net zero emissions by 2050, on current track the UK government will only meet their target by 2099.

Verdict: Not Enough Evidence

Justification: Due to the slow rate of emissions, it is likely that they will not meet their target, but no direct evidence suggests this

Evidence:

Q: What does 'net zero' mean?
A: Net zero means huge declines in the use of coal, oil and gas.

This requires steps such as halting sales of new internal combustion engine passenger cars, and phasing out all unabated coal and oil power plants.. 

Q: Has the UK government pledged to become net zero?
A: Yes. The UK prime minister laid out this plan to go net zero,...
historic transitions to remove carbon from 
power, retire the internal combustion engine
from vehicles and start to phase out gas
boilers in homes. But it also that it will be done fairly by making carbon free alternatives cheaper

Q: When does the UK plan to be net zero by?
A: The UK government has a binding target to reach net zero
emissions by 2050..

title: Fact Check: Dogs can smell COVID-19 on humans.
text:
Claim: Dogs can smell COVID-19 on humans.

Verdict: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

Justification: Specially trained dogs are being Trained and trials are being performed however the claim implies all dogs can smell covid-19.

Evidence:

Q: Can sniffer dogs be used to detect Covid-19?
A: Yes. Around the world, canines are being trained to detect the whiff of COVID-19 infections.

Q: Where have Covid 19 sniffer dogs been trialled?
A: Helsinki, Finland. 

Q: Are sniffer dogs being used to detect Covid-19?
A: There is variation in how well individual dogs perform, trial groups need to boost their sample sizes before the wider scientific community can evaluate how useful the dogs might be..

title: Fact Check: Ewedu can cure cancer.
text:
Claim: Ewedu can cure cancer.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Not a cure but prevention as per QA pair.

Evidence:

Q: What is ewedu?
A: Ewedu leaf (Jute Leaf) is a  green, leafy vegetable. 

Q: What health benefits does ewedu have?
A: Polyphenolic compounds found with anti-tumour potential from ewodu. 

Q: Do polyphenolic compounds kill cancer?
A: Polyphenols may prevent carcinogenesis by affecting the molecular events in the initiation, promotion, and progression stages.

title: Fact Check: A no deal Brexit means we would have free trade with the world.
text:
Claim: A no deal Brexit means we would have free trade with the world.

Verdict: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

Justification: Whilst the UK could freely trade with the world, it would still be subject to other countries import /export agreements.

Evidence:

Q: What does free trade mean?
A: Free trade is a trade policy that does not restrict imports or exports. It can also be understood as the free market idea applied to international trade.. 

Q: How would a no deal Brexit affect the UK's trade agreements?
A: Trade agreements that the UK is part of as an EU member state will no longer apply if there’s a no-deal Brexit.

The UK government is working on new agreements to replace EU trade agreements after Brexit.. 

Q: How much would the UK have to pay if there was a no deal Brexit?
A: With no deal, it’s uncertain how much of that we’d have to pay, if anything..

title: Fact Check: A Facebook post claims that a no deal Brexit would mean no more uncontrolled imm...
text:
Claim: A Facebook post claims that a no deal Brexit would mean no more uncontrolled immigration.

Verdict: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

Justification: The UK already controlled immigration prior to Brexit because it was not a member of the Schengen passport-free zone (part of the Schengen agreement requires the 26 signatories to agree not to conduct border checks among themselves), whereas the UK would check passports. If the UK left the EU, they would just have "more" control over their borders.

Evidence:

Q: In what way would the UK have control over immigration if it left the EU with a no deal?
A: As a non member of the European Union, the UK would no longer be obliged to follow EU rules on freedom of movement within the member states.. 

Q: What control would the UK have over EU immigration if a withdrawal agreement is passed?
A: If UK Prime Minister Theresa May's draft withdrawal agreement was passed the government would end the free movement of people between the UK and EU after the end of the transition period.. 

Q: What would the main difference be from a United Kingdom border that was no longer part of the European Union?
A: As a non member of the European Union, the UK would no longer be obliged to follow EU rules on freedom of movement within the member states..

title: Fact Check: As Mayor, Sadiq Khan produced a report to say that the Fire Services did not nee...
text:
Claim: As Mayor, Sadiq Khan produced a report to say that the Fire Services did not need further funding.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: Sadiq khan did say the fire services did not need further funding 

Evidence:

Q: Did Mayor Sadiq Khan carry out a review of the London Fire Brigade?
A: Yes. In August 2016 Sadiq appointed Anthony Mayer to carry out a full and independent review of the London Fire Brigade

Q: What did Anthony Mayer's 2016 report on the London Fire Brigade conclude about funding?
A: The report recommended that the budget should not be increased, but that there should be no further reduction either.. 

Q: So did Sadiq Khan recommend that the fire brigades budget in London is not increased?
A: Yes. This is correct. The published report said the London fire brigade "coped well" with the funding reductions. and that the budget should not be increased.

title: Fact Check: Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison stands alone during the 2019 G7 Leaders...
text:
Claim: Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison stands alone during the 2019 G7 Leaders’ Summit in France

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: QA pair confirms image is altered/photoshopped.

Evidence:

Q: Which social media sites had photo posted of Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison purporting to show him standing isolated during the 2019 G7 Leaders’ Summit in France.
A: The post was shared on Facebook and Twitter on August 26, 2019.. 

Q: Who is Australian's The Chaser?
A: The Chaser was founded in 1999 as a fortnightly satirical newspaper. 

Q: What was the source of the original photograph?
A: The image appears to have been taken from video when Morisson and other world leaders stood together for a photo at the G7 summit on August 25, 2019..

title: Fact Check: Kenyans working at Mara North private wildlife park have been made to carry whit...
text:
Claim: Kenyans working at Mara North private wildlife park have been made to carry white tourists in sedan chairs depicting modern 'slavery'

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: This is a well paid service usually taken up by people with disabilities or mobility issues as mentioned in the QA pairs.

Evidence:

Q: Was the image in question shot at the Mara North Conservancy in Kenya?
A: No. It was taken at Bwindi Impenetrable National Park in Uganda where this has been offered to frail or disabled tourists .

Q: Are the porters paid for their work?
A: The porters were paid $300 (£194.31). This was a good fee for the porters and I could tell they they were pleased with the fee as they don’t usually earn that sort of money.

Tourists do not take up Porter Services for the sake of it as the service is expensive and the walking makes the gorilla experience more enjoyable.. 

Q: Who is likely to take up this porter service?
A: The porter service is more likely to be taken up by tourists with disabilities whose life dream is to see the gorillas or the very elderly most especially the baby boomers with deep pockets  and the ability to pay $600 (£388.61) for a day’s gorilla trekking experience..

title: Fact Check: Suicide is the cause of death for around 3,000 people per day.
text:
Claim: Suicide is the cause of death for around 3,000 people per day.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Based on numbers in QA pairs the amount confirmed is around 1/3rd less.

Evidence:

Q: How many people die by suicide each year?
A: More than 700 000 people die due to suicide every year.. 

Q: What is 700,000 divided by 365?
A: 1,917.

title: Fact Check: Using the air conditioning (AC) in a vehicle consumes more fuel.
text:
Claim: Using the air conditioning (AC) in a vehicle consumes more fuel.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: Using the AC does consume more fuel, but also it is more fuel efficient than opening windows at high speeds. but this is still confirmed

Evidence:

Q: How can the use of air conditioning (AC) in a vehicle reduce fuel consumption?
A: Running your car's air conditioning is the main contributor to reduced fuel economy in hot weather. Its effect depends on a number of factors, such as the outside temperature, humidity, and intensity of the sun. Under very hot conditions, AC use can reduce a conventional vehicle's fuel economy by more than 25%, particularly on short trips.1,2,3 The AC's effect on hybrids, plug-in hybrids, and electric vehicles (EVs) can be even larger on a percentage basis.2. 

Q: How does vehicle air conditioning (AC) work?
A: ... the air conditioning system uses the following parts:

Compressor — compresses the refrigerant into a fluid, so the liquid refrigerant flows through a line to the condenser.
Condenser — removes the heat from the refrigerant and pushes it along to the expansion valve or orifice tube.
Expansion valve or orifice tube — returns the refrigerant to its original gaseous state and moves it to the receiver/drier or accumulator.
Receiver/drier or accumulator — removes moisture from the refrigerant and transfers it to the evaporator.
Evaporator — pulls heat from the air passing through its core and transfers it into the refrigerant, resulting in cold air flowing beyond the evaporator.. 

Q: Can using a vehicle's air conditioning (AC) be fuel-efficient?
A: Yes. According to the EPA, using your car’s AC can be more efficient while driving at highway speeds than having the windows open. Open windows elevate aerodynamic drag, causing the engine to work harder and burn more fuel.

title: Fact Check: The BMA advises that without immigrants “many NHS services would struggle to pro...
text:
Claim: The BMA advises that without immigrants “many NHS services would struggle to provide effective care”.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: According to the evidence, 14% of clinical staff and 26% of doctors are foreign nationals. Hence, the claim is supported.

Evidence:

Q: Where did the British Medical Association say this?
A: This quote was reported by the Guardian in 2014. 

Q: Has the BMA made more recent comments about this?
A: Yes. December 2018
“Freedom of movement has allowed the thousands of staff from Europe – from doctors, nurses and care workers to hospital porters and cleaners – to come to the UK and provide valuable service in our NHS, and today’s plans to restrict immigration could be potentially devastating to patient care and the wider health and social care sector."

title: Fact Check: The Wuhan coronavirus is a more virulent version of the normal cold.
text:
Claim: The Wuhan coronavirus is a more virulent version of the normal cold.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: The covid virus is from the same family of viruses as the common cold As is shown in Q&A 1, 
Q&A 4 agrees with claim as it shows the covid virus is more contagious, as well as needing other medications to fight it over the common cold so claim of covid being more virulent is correct.

Evidence:

Q: Is Coronavirus the same as a common cold?
A: Coronaviruses form a large family of viruses that can cause a range of illnesses. They include the common cold as well as more serious diseases such as SARS (severe acute respiratory syndrome), MERS (Middle East respiratory syndrome) and, more recently, COVID-19.. 

Q: What is the Wuhan Coronavirus?
A: Covid-19 is a respiratory illness caused by the strain of coronavirus that first emerged in December 2019 in Wuhan, China. This strain of coronavirus hadn’t been seen in humans before.. 

Q: What is the common cold?
A: Colds are caused by many different viruses, but most commonly a rhinovirus or a coronavirus. A cold only affects your upper respiratory tract (your nose and throat), not your lungs. Because of this a cold is often referred to as a "head cold". Colds usually aren't serious..

title: Fact Check: In the UK in 2020 there were 48,000 illegal immigrants staying in 4/5 star hotel...
text:
Claim: In the UK in 2020 there were 48,000 illegal immigrants staying in 4/5 star hotels.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: 48,000 is the total number of asylum seekers, only 2,800 were house in temporary accommodation including hotels and there was no confirming what type of hotel. 

Evidence:

Q: How many asylum seekers were in  the UK in 2020?
A: A National Audit Office (NAO) report in July found that 48,000 asylum seekers were being provided with accommodation by the government in March 2020.. 

Q: How many asylum seekers in the UK in 2020 were housed in 4 or 5 star hotels?
A: In July 2020 an average of 2,800 asylum seekers were housed in temporary initial accommodation which included hotels. The NAO report does not describe the quality of the hotels being used..

title: Fact Check: 5G wrecks immune systems and that is why people in Wuhan are suffering with this...
text:
Claim: 5G wrecks immune systems and that is why people in Wuhan are suffering with this illness.

Verdict: Refuted

Justification: Q&A 2 points out that 5g radio waves are non-ionising, meaning they don’t damage cells in the way x-rays, gamma rays and uv does, so unlikely to damage a body's immune system as claimed.
Q&A 1 shows there is no evidence to support the claim either.
With Q&a 2 saying Public Health England has said that there’s no “convincing evidence” that exposure below International Commission on Non-Ionizing Radiation guidelines can cause adverse health effects. These guidelines go up to 300GHz, whereas the maximum for 5G will probably only be in the tens of GHz.

Evidence:

Q: Is there any evidence that 5g is harmful to humans?
A: there is no evidence that 5G is harmful to humans. 5G is the next generation of wireless network technology, following on from 4G. Like 4G, 3G and 2G before it, 5G mobile data is transmitted over radio waves—a small part of the whole electromagnetic spectrum (which includes microwaves, visible light and X-rays).. 

Q: Are the radio waves transmitted by 5g damaging to the body?
A: These radio waves are non-ionising, meaning they don’t damage the DNA inside cells, as X-rays, gamma rays and UV rays are able to do. 5G, although at slightly higher frequencies than previous networks, is still in this radio part of the electromagnetic spectrum.

Public Health England has said that there’s no “convincing evidence” that exposure below International Commission on Non-Ionizing Radiation guidelines can cause adverse health effects. These guidelines go up to 300GHz, whereas the maximum for 5G will probably only be in the tens of GHz.

There is no evidence that 5G can damage the immune system.. 

Q: Is there evidence, that 5G damages the human system?
A: There is no evidence that 5G can damage the immune system..

title: Fact Check: Bollywood star Shah Rukh Khan has slammed the Modi-government for not paying eno...
text:
Claim: Bollywood star Shah Rukh Khan has slammed the Modi-government for not paying enough attention to Rohingya Muslims.

title: Fact Check: Drinking one glass of water before bed prevents heart attacks.
text:
Claim: Drinking one glass of water before bed prevents heart attacks.

Verdict: Supported

Justification: According to source provided it is medically proven that drinking water before bed has alot of Health benefits 

Evidence:

Q: is there any data that drinking water before bed is better than drinking it at any other time?
A: No. Dr. Marc Gilinov, a cardiovascular surgeon at the Cleveland Clinic, a hospital in the US state of Ohio, examined the claim that drinking water a specific times of the day has particular health benefits. He wrote in this debunk, “There is no data to suggest that ‘when’ you drink matters.” He advised choosing water over soda, and cautioned, “Don’t schedule your drinking according to a fictitious claim that the time you drink it matters.”

Q: Is there evidence that drinking a high water intake will reduce the risk of heart attacks?
A: Yes. This large study of Californians published in 2002 found that high daily water intake (5 or more glasses) resulted in lower risk for fatal coronary heart disease than for people who had low daily water intake (2 or fewer glasses). The study did not record what time of day people were drinking the water.

Q: Is drinking water generally good for heart health?
A: Yes. A study in the American Journal of Medical Epidemiology found that participants who drink five or more glasses of plain water per day have a lower risk for fatal coronary heart disease,

title: Fact Check: A no deal Brexit means no more ECJ or ECHR.
text:
Claim: A no deal Brexit means no more ECJ or ECHR.

Verdict: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

Justification: the answers show The UK will continue to be a member of the European Court of Human Rights after Brexit because its jurisdiction has nothing to do with the EU, but the UK would lose access to the european court of justice. so this is conflicting information. 

Evidence:

Q: Would a no deal Brexit remove the jurisdiction of the European Court of Justice?
A: Yes. The European Communities Act 1972 was the piece of legislation that brought the UK into the Europe Union: it gives EU law supremacy over UK national law.

A large amount of EU law effective in the UK currently relies on the 1972 Act.

The Act is repealed by the EU Withdrawal Act 2018

Q: What is the European Court of Human Rights?
A: The European Court of Human Rights, judicial organ of the Council of Europe,
examines applications from individuals, but also inter-State applications, lodged by
a State against another State party to the Convention. Currently 47 countries have
undertaken to secure fundamental rights and freedoms, not only to their nationals
but to everyone, even non-Europeans, within their jurisdiction.. 

Q: What is the Council of Europe?
A: The Council of Europe (CoE) is a pan-European organisation of 46 member states, including all 27 member states of the European Union. The United Kingdom was one of the founding members. Set up shortly after the end of the Second World War, the CoE’s core mission is to promote human rights, democracy and the rule of law across the continent..

title: Fact Check: Matt Hancock owns the company responsible for supplying the NHS.
text:
Claim: Matt Hancock owns the company responsible for supplying the NHS.

Verdict: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking

Justification: it seems as if the SCCL company is owned by the secretary of state which is currently matt hancock, but he personally does not own it, just his position affords him ownership

Evidence:

Q: Who manages the NHS supply chain?
A: Supply Chain Coordination Limited (SCCL) is a company Registered in England and Wales, with company number 10881715, to act as the management function of the NHS Supply Chain.. 

Q: Who owns SCCL?
A: The company is wholly owned by the Secretary of State for Health and Social Care who provides direction to the Company through his appointed director on the Board and by a letter of entrustment.. 

Q: When was this claim made?
A: 21/04/2020.

title: Fact Check: £1 billion was given to 13 companies for PPE but no PPE has been supplied.
text:
Claim: £1 billion was given to 13 companies for PPE but no PPE has been supplied.

Verdict: Not Enough Evidence

Evidence:

Q: How much was given by the UK government to companies for the purchase of PPEs
A: £1 billion. 

Q: Where any of the contracts delivered
A: Chief Operating Officer of Ayanda Capitol Ltd said that their contract was successfully fulfilled.. 

Q: Which country does the claim refer to?
A: United Kingdom..
